The Pre-Production copies of Colossal and Colossal Moats & Barbicans have arrived at the Werehouse! This week we will be examining their components very closely, looking for any aesthetic and gameplay issues. When the PPC of the base game arrives, we will begin playtesting to make sure everything looks ready (currently still in transit). If we see any errors or quality issues, we will let our manufacturer know to begin fixing them, BUT if we don't, then production is a GO!

Happy Monday Builders!

campaign.story:
The year 2020 is over! With that, let us celebrate with a little tongue-in-cheek spookiness and a brand-new season of The Dice Tower! Please join us as we raise funds to continue our coverage of board games and the wonderful people who play them.
We are a group of gamers dedicated to growing and promoting the board game hobby and those who enjoy it. Tom Vasel, Zee Garcia, Roy Cannaday, Mike Dilisio, and many others produce weekly videos covering hundreds of different games both new and classic. Additionally, Eric Summerer, Suzanne Sheldon, Mandi Hutchinson, and Tom produce a weekly podcast all about games and the people who play them.
But that's not all! We also provide you with news, variety shows (such as Board Game Breakfast), a series of popular "Top Ten" videos, shopping guides, and more! All of this can be found at our website - www.dicetower.com.
Our show gets a majority of its funding from our Kickstarter campaign each year. We have seven full-time employees and four part-time employees. Like so many of you, we had various plans last year which were disrupted.  We pivoted into a ton of live coverage instead.  This year our goals are to:
 Continue to produce regular live content on a set schedule 
Increase interaction with our listeners
 Continue to increase the quality of our current YouTube shows 
 Produce more top ten lists with special guests 
 Upgrade our equipment 
You might notice that these are very similar to our goals in 2020, and that's because I want to focus even more on the quality of our streaming.  The Winter Spectacular was something we worked hard on, and we believe we can bring ALL of our content up to that level.  In this campaign, we have a myriad of cool rewards but we hope that your main goal in supporting this campaign is keeping the Dice Tower on the air.
We are dedicated to keeping the show and our videos free for download and viewing, and we appreciate you helping us in reaching that goal.  We ask you to consider giving above and beyond the cost of the rewards to maximize what we can do this year!
PLAY

Going beyond our goal will allow us to do more for you on the channel!  Here are some of our stretch goals!

We have a pile of wonderful rewards to send out to you as a gift for backing our campaign.  We know the value of these rewards does not come close to the amount you are donating to the show but they are simply a small "thank you" gift that we are sending as a token of our appreciation.  We also ask that you look at them that way - to donate money to the show is the main goal of this campaign.
The following promos each have their own pledge level, but also can be added to a regular pledge.  Simply add the amount to your pledge and you can choose which ones you want at the end of the campaign.  Realize that some add-ons will accrue more international shipping at the end of the campaign.
There will also be some add-ons that are only added on in the pledge manager.  These will include (but are not limited to) promos from last year, and more!
We can only fit in a limited number of these rewards, so they are unlikely to be available in the pledge manager after the Kickstarter.
Each Thursday, we do a live show of Boardgame Breakfast!  Want to show us up in the trivia section?  Backers will show up live in one of our Thursday Breakfasts for the game show section!
Want your own Dice person?  Tina will draw you (based on a picture you send in) in the color die of your choice.  This is for non-commercial use, although the Dice Person may show up in a future Dice Tower video!

PLAY

A set of four (4) custom card trays.  These will hold at least 45 sleeved (American sized) cards and 60 unsleeved cards. Design isn't final - they will be clear plastic (same material as our component bins).  You will be able to push down on the cards to easily pull out the top card.  
A custom monster for use in both King of Tokyo and King of New York!
 A new scenario designed for Gloomhaven: Jaws of the Lion!  This will be sent out as a .pdf, and will use a map already included in the book, with a different story and set up.
Two sheets with ten different stickers - showing off our new Dice Monsters!
Five component bins - an awesome way to hold pieces both during gameplay AND storage.
If you missed our Rising Sun promo pack from our 2019 campaign, it's also here! 
Get one of our five new Dice Monster Pins! (choose which one after the campaign)
Pair of "double six" dice.  These are twelve-sided dice that roll very well, and have "1-6" printed on them twice.  The colors this year will be orange with black pips. (not currently shown)
Pair of custom blue-green six-sided dice that glow in the dark! (different than currently shown)
Get a set of ten Dice Monster Meeples to use in your games (two each of five). Artwork may change for final product.
Tired of using rubber bands to hold your boxes closed when traveling?  These high quality bands with a Dice Tower logo (will be in blue) do an amazing job at keeping the box closed.   Available in large size (games like Blood Rage, Ticket to Ride) and medium size (games like Carcassonne, Castles of Burgundy).  Five box bands per set.
Get a pouch in which to keep your dice! (Dimensions - 200x150 mm)   
Get a game tote to carry your games around! (Dimensions - 38x34x25 cm).  We are doing the same bag as last year, due to the amazingly great quality!
Get a small plushie Dice Puppy.  This lovable boy is based on Tom's new dog, Fuzzy.
Get a set of six rubber (neoprene) coasters.
A boxed 1000 piece puzzle, measuring 70 cm x 50 cm.  Will be almost the entire playmat in the picture.
We have a limited deck of Bicycle-made playing cards, designed by Zee Garcia, and using Tina Bongorno's art!   This set will be available this year only.
Tina also created custom art for Werewolf cards! This is a thirty card deck, fully playable on its own, but the backs are the same as Ultimate Werewolf from Bezier Games, so you can mix and match.  Tom's favorite roles are included, as well as one or two new ones!
Get our new 2021 Playmat!  (Dimensions - 23.75" x 14")   
Get our larger new 2021 Playmat!  (Dimensions - 25" x 20").  This mat also comes with stitched edges!
Get a pair of aluminum dice; some of the nicest dice we've ever seen!  Dice will be the same color, randomly chosen.  These are the same dice from our previous campaigns with some new colors. 
Tom will give you a verbal shout-out of thanks on two (maybe more!) of our video shows this year! 
The whole Vasel family and Dice Tower staff will sign and send you a Christmas card or birthday card.  Includes stickers!
Get one of our custom Dice Towers with new artwork for 2021!   There are four different dice towers.
One of the Dice Tower peeps will record you a short voicemail to use on your phone. (no commercial use, please).   You can choose from Tom, Zee, Eric, Roy, Mike, and possibly others from the show!
The gang at Dice Tower HQ will record a video for you or a friend.  Videos are a few minutes long and we'll do a congratulations, birth announcement, or whatever you want!  We need two months notice and will send the video to you a week before you need it.  
EVERY backer will get a digital smartphone wallpaper sent after the Backer Kit closes  by Katia Howatson from Board Game Art Creations!  It's a 3D meeple made up of smaller game pieces!
 Thanks to all our sponsoring publishers!
Check out our promo packs below!  And this might not be all!  We might add more to the packs, so keep an eye on our updates!  Many of the promos are still being worked on, so we'll also be adding artwork of the promos as we get it.  Publishers, if you want to be involved, contact us!

updates.update_userinfo: State of the Kickstarter: Pledge Manager starting this week, shipping information, video series, and new promos!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!  A lot of information in this post, so let's jump right in!

We will be using Game Found as our pledge manager this year, and we plan to launch that this week!   You will be getting an email invitation to Game Found in the next ten days that will give you instructions on how to complete your pledge.  Everything you pledged for will be in your "cart", although you'll have the opportunity to add other things if you want to.
Once you get the invitation, I ask that if you can to complete it as quickly as possible.  This helps us know how many physical items to produce, and allows us to do time sensitive stuff in the correct time frame.

What else can we say at this point other thank a heartfelt thank you!?
We had such a fun, entertaining closing show that it wiped me out yesterday!  Sorry for the slight delay in posting here.

But now it's time to go to work!  Watch Board Game Breakfast this morning for an idea on how the year is going to go, with new shows, new ideas, and more!

updates.update_userinfo: Well, that's that. But there's more! ZEE (or someone) is WRONG.
updates.update_content:
So we've reached the final stretch goal, and we are amazed!

But there's more!  It's NOT the final stretch goal!

Last year, we did a fun series.  Roy, Mike, and Zee did a video called "Top 10 Games Tom is Wrong About"

Well, I am surprised that we've gotten to another stretch goal.  Huzzah and hooray!
A few things as we go to the final hours of the campaign.
We've added some card holders to the project!  This is something I've wanted for a long time - a container that holds cards in the box but also can be used during the game!

updates.update_userinfo: More Stretch Goals! The final push!
updates.update_content:
So we are in the final stretch of the Kickstarter.  As always, we super thankful for your support!
And we are in the process of getting our new shows planned out and ready to post during this year!

A few more stretch goals are on the horizon - a behind the scenes look at what happens at the Dice Tower, and more top 50s!

updates.update_userinfo: Two more stretch goals, playmat, EU shipping, and more!
updates.update_content:
Just a quick update to let everyone know what's going on.

- We hit two more stretch goals!  Dan & Cora will be doing their top 100, which we are all excited to see, and we're already working on plans for our publisher video series.  Anyone got a good name for this show?
- We got pictures of the large sized playmat with stitching!  Check it out!

Due to VERY popular demand, the puzzle is now 1000 pieces, and a larger size 70mm x 50mm.
I can't do both a 500 and 1000, but the feedback was strong enough that we changed it to the more popular one.
The pledge amount is unchanged.

First of all, a big thank you to everyone!  We hit yet another stretch goal, and we're just thrilled about how things are going so far.  We're also hard at work getting our top 100 games of all time ready, launching one week from today!
I've added a few more double card packs (Werewolf + playing cards) for those who want them, but the big news is a puzzle!
We're getting a 52 by 38 cm puzzle (2mm thickness) of the playmat picture!  This will come in a box, and once you build it, make a nice centerpiece for your wall!  We're adding a separate pledge for anyone who wants it, but you can also add it to your existing pledges for $25.

campaign.story:
Mint Bid is a refreshingly light auction game for 1 to 6 players with easy-to-learn rules, lightning-fast setup, and exciting social gameplay, all in 30 minutes!

The game's compact size makes it easy to put in your pocket and take anywhere. Couple that with its simple rules and setup, and Mint Bid is like carrying a party in your pocket!


Bid Promo Pack #1: Additional AIs
This promo pack includes 2 new AIs! If the additional 2 Player Variant stretch goal is met, these AI cards will also include both a single player and a two player variant.
Bid Promo Pack #2: Hidden Agendas
The Hidden Agenda Promo Pack introduces an entirely new variant into the game. Each player will receive one of nine Hidden Agendas which will grant them bonus points at the end of the game. The Hidden Agendas add an interesting layer of strategy on top of the base game.
Add Ons
The best way to receive past Mint Series games (or additional copies of Mint Bid) is by choosing the pledge level that contains the total number of games you would like to receive. If you need more than five tins, pledge in the 'All In' tier then add $10 for each additional tin you would like to purchase. These additional tins will be added in the pledge manager as an add ons. 
To include an add-on, after you pledge, click on the blue "manage my pledge" button. On the next page, you will see your current pledge total. Add the amount of the add-on you want to the current amount, and hit "confirm". Once the campaign has completed, we will gather more information as necessary.
For example, if you choose the reward tier, "Bid for the Best" to receive one (1) copy of Mint Bid but would like to Add On both Promo Packs, please adjust your pledge to $17. 
Promo Packs do not impact shipping costs, but adding additional tins may cause your shipping cost to increase (please see the Shipping section below!)
One of the best parts of Mint Bid is that setup is quick and simple: just shuffle the cards, lay out as many as you need, keep your mints and auctioneer token handy, and you're done!
PLAY


Victory in Mint Bid is simple to understand: whoever has the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins!  
Getting the most Victory Points isn't always so simple, though. Since all Victory Points are shared between pairs of players, players must strategically win auctions, place locations, and utilize the Location's special actions to ensure victory. 

 Tantrum House 
 Glory Houndd
  Before You Play 
 Unfiltered Gamer 
Countries Excluded: We are no longer able to ship to Brazil, Russia, Mexico, South America, South Africa or the Middle East due to high postage prices, lengthy delivery times, and lost parcels. If you live in one of these areas, we recommend you use a USA address and have the game forwarded to you via a relative/friend or postage forwarding company. 
We are working with warehouses globally to bring customs-friendly shipping to all major markets. With the low price of our games, the mailing should be well under the threshold for most fees, but there are always cases where that is a concern so we are doing our best to make shipping super affordable for everyone!

Click to read more about this community quest.
Seek vindication after a life of greed and treachery in this strategic fantasy euro board game. Behold the lofty game descriptors: high-strategy, tableau building, resource management, area control, action selection, modular board, and variable player powers.
Thrown overboard for a life of wretchedness, you're left to die in the icy black sea. Just before vanishing into endless darkness, you wash ashore a hostile island ruins where you are revived by a traveler. As you open your eyes to your bizarre new home, you find that something better, something stronger has awakened inside you.
Manage your personal attributes wisely and call on your conviction as you leverage your influence to gain companions, control locations, acquire mysterious relics, bash horrific monsters and (if it’s your style) snuggle some seriously exotic pets in the ultimate goal of mastering heroic attributes — and regaining your lost honor before the end of the epoch is triggered! 
Click to view rulebook in English, French, German, and Spanish


Click to view the worldwide shipping matrix.
What's Orange Nebula?
Good question. Instead of the snarky answer, we'll give you the truth (usually you'd get both). We’re a team of creative professionals bringing passion projects to life in the worlds of design and modern culture, with the goal of inspiring people (including ourselves) to think bigger and unlock deeper creativity.
We want the worlds we build and the things we make to incite action, to lower personal barriers, to invite conversation, to be more targeted, and less limiting.
Fueled by passion and committed to follow through, we’re building a community yearning to do the same.


This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

campaign.story:
What others say about it
I really love this little game! - Tyler Crumrine, playtest.me
This is a great little game that I think I will enjoy for many years to come. - Jim Cohen, whatboardgame.com

What is the game about?
Rise: A tale of kingdoms is a competitive game. You step up as the new ruler of your kingdom. Everything seems quiet at the beginning. You want to be a good ruler and do your best for your kingdom.  But you are surrounded by neighbors, and each of them wants to be the most powerful king in the region. They attack you, try to rob you by unfair trades, and crush your kingdom down. You need to fight back or your kingdom will fall down ingloriously.
Each player controls a kingdom which is represented by the state of four resources - Influence, Wealth, Citizens, Military. The goal is really simple - either develop all your resources to their maximum or destroy your opponents by decreasing one of their resources below the minimum. But they are trying to do exactly the same.
The main mechanic is around collecting and playing the right cards at the right moment, complete successful trades with the other players, and prepare your defense wisely. Sounds simple enough, right?
There are several advanced rules which can be mixed up together and play the game the way you like it. There's also a special section about role-playing which can be included as well if you feel so.

Gameplay
The players take turns in which they can perform one action:
develop the resources of their kingdom
attack one opponent and harm their resources
trade with an opponent
do nothing and draw a card
They can play a combination of up to 4 cards. The more cards played the greater the effect of the cards is. However, each development or attack can be blocked by any other player.
Trading is tricky. It can either help you collect the cards you need or you can be looted by your opponents.
The aim of the game is to become the king of the most powerful kingdom. So you need to increase all your resources to the maximum or slay your opponents by lowering one of their resources below the minimum.
Gameplay

Advanced rules
There are six advanced rules which can be mixed with the core game:
 Leader – include Jokers to help you build card combinations.
 Change in seasons – the weather can sometimes be unpredictable and either helps your kingdom or put it to test.
 Act of God – once in a while you experience an event so strong that you can’t blame anybody but the gods. Their will can bless you or crush you down.
 Time shift – the deck you play with never runs out of cards until there’s one clear winner.
 Kingdom party – bring up to four players to the table.
 Tell the story – describe what happens with your kingdom during each turn. This one is for the role-playing fans.

  How does it stand from the crowd?
Rise: A tale of kingdoms uses something which probably we all have at home – a deck of standard playing cards. The cards offer incredibly high replay value and unlimited possibilities. What the game does is to translate a deck of standard playing cards into a board game. There are only two assets you need – a scoreboard for each player and a table to translate the cards. The rest is left for your imagination.
The core idea of the game is to present you with something so simple that you don’t need to wait to be manufactured, delivered to your door, or even printed(if you don’t have a printer you can literally draw what you need in 5 minutes on a piece of paper and reuse it for all your games). The game finds a balance between simplicity and challenge. Each game is different than the previous one and the setup takes less than a minute.

Who is this game suitable for?
Rise: A tale of kingdoms is a game that can attract any player. It can be played by 2-4 players. The sessions are between 5-30 minutes. The game has the benefits of the games with standard playing cards – high replay value and super easy setup. You can start a session immediately after the previous one. Probably it’s not a game that you will spend a whole weekend with your friends. But it’s a game that you can play every day on and on. The advanced rules can add a unique taste to each game. You can use none, any, or all of them and play the game the way you like it.
Don’t forget the optional role-playing. Then tell the story of your kingdom and how it went through days of glory and how it slayed the opponent’s armies.

The idea
I created this game during the long periods of staying at home during 2020 (you all know what I’m talking about). I was bored and I wanted to have a game which is simple and I can play with my wife in short sessions. I’ve got inspired by the role-playing zine Beak, Feather, & Bone. It presented me with the idea of using standard playing cards mixed with board game elements. It just opened a whole new world for me.
Event though Rise: A tale of kingdoms is not a complicated game, it took significantly more time to develop it than I expected. I was naive to think that it’s something which can be done in a weekend. Actually, it took me several months (of course I was doing that in my free time). But I really like what I did in the end. I hope you’ll like it, too.
Rewards
There are 3 options for the bakers. All of them are digital pdf files(no physical copies):
Core - the core rules and mechanics of the game. Black and white, no fancy format and no images
Advanced - same as Core, but including all advanced rules
Premium - same as Advanced, but a colorful beautifully formatted copy including images and fancy playing board
Comparison between the black&white and the colorful copy
Resource board
Comparison between a page of the rules

Delivery
The game is done. It went through proofreading, test playing, editing, and reviews. All rewards will be delivered immediately upon campaign completion to your email. There's no waiting for delivery to your door and no delivery costs.

Stretch goals?
There are no stretch goals. Everything is done and everybody is already paid. That's including proofreading, editing, and rights for using images(for the Premium version).

Presented by littlepomgames.com

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every campaign comes with its own challenges. We are confident that you will get a game that you’ll be proud to play AND will proudly display on your game shelf.

The art and mechanics for Creature Comforts are nearly complete. Once this campaign ends we will tie up loose ends and submit print files.

It is always possible that delays occur while a game is coming to fruition. This can happen for various reasons such as manufacturing issues, freight delays, and even importing the games to the various regions of the world, as we have recently experienced during this global pandemic. Although we have budgeted 11 months to bring this game to your doorstep, please know that these delays can change our timeline at various stages. Therefore our timeline is only an estimate. We are working to meet our goal to fulfill the game by the end of December 2021.

We will be using fulfillment partners from around the world so that we can ensure a fast and smooth operation. We have worked with all of these partners many times before, so we are optimistic that everything will go as planned. We have full faith that your games will be delivered to you safe and in a timely fashion.

A note on our track record:

 • Successful and timely fulfillment of 6 projects over 5 years (between KTBG and Burnt Island Games, our sibling company), including the following games: Foodfighters, Problem Picnic, Haunt the House, Endeavor: Age of Sail, Wreck Raiders, and In the Hall of the Mountain King. Unfortunately the Endeavor: Age of Expansion campaign and Fossilis were both briefly delayed due to Covid-19. We found ourselves just entering into our fulfillment phase when the world shut down. Although the fulfillment didn't go exactly as planned, we have been open and honest about the process, updating backers often.

We want you to know that:
 • we have received wide praise for production quality and gameplay development, as quality products is of the utmost importance to us. 
• our designer and artists come to Creature Comforts with many years of experience.
• customer service is key to creating a positive backer experience. We are here for you!

OUR REFUND POLICY

We will refund your pledge within 7 days of the campaign’s end, including all fees associated with the campaign. After that period, we will refund your pledge, no questions asked, minus all of the fees associated with the Kickstarter, payment processing, and our pledge manager. These fees cannot be recovered from Kickstarter/our pledge manager after two weeks of the campaign ending. This project is in CAD, therefore, refunds will be processed in CAD.

We want you to be happy! We promise to keep you in the loop every step of the way. If you have any questions, send us a direct message, email us at service@kidstablebg.com or simply comment on the campaign. We will get back to you as soon as we can.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

Your pledge must be confirmed within 8 weeks of our pledge manager email to you. If you do not confirm your pledge at this time, you agree that KTBG has fulfilled its obligation to you, and your pledge will become a donation. After the 8-week window, it might still be possible to get your game shipped, based on availability. It is so difficult for us to confirm shipping to different regions of the world when our numbers are in constant flux.

It is the backer's responsibility to provide us with the correct shipping address and to ensure it is deliverable by typical methods of shipping. Unfortunately we do not ship to PO Boxes. Backers who have provided an expired address, or incorrect addresses will be charged shipping a second time to get their game to them. There is always the possibility of a refund, although the Kickstarter and pledge manager fees are non-refundable.

We reserve the right to sell our games, for the purpose of keeping our company going, at any point through the production and fulfilment process. We always endeavour to get our games to you on time and before they go to retail.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We produce high quality products that have been proven to last. Your game will stay intact for years to come.
Reusability and recyclability
Because our games are made with incredibly high quality materials, they will last a very long time. We expect our games to be reused over and over. But at times, game shelves need to evolve. Please hand this game down to a friend, sell it on the secondary market, or donate it to a cause that is near and dear to your heart.
Sustainable materials
We choose to use fulfillment partners from all over the world. Rest assured that your game will come from the closest region to you. The less fuel we use to get your game there, the better we feel about sending it to you.
Something else
KTBG has made a commitment to create the smallest possible carbon footprint we can. We are committed to making the most of this by using a factory that promotes efficiency when printing, only producing materials that are necessary for this game, fulfilling games from your region, and replacing only parts that are absolutely necessary for a complete and flawless game. We don't include rules in multiple languages, instead we ask you to use our digital downloads. We ask that if you need replacement parts, you consider whether or not that part is necessity to make your game play experience a good one.

campaign.story:
The Transcontinental is a medium-weight Euro boardgame about the Development of the Canadian transcontinental railway. It features worker-placement and pickup-and-deliver gameplay. Its innovative mechanics won the 2019 Canadian Game Design Award and have gotten rave reviews.
To learn more about the gameplay, read the rulebook here. 
Or, watch a runthrough here: 
Want to play a digital version right now on Tabletop Simulator? We've got a great scripted version of it here.
For more on the solo mode, click here. 






The following stretch goals are for the Founders and Conductors pledges only: 








I'm Glen Dresser, and Wheelhouse Games is the company I created to bring together my interest in game design, illustration, and publishing. As a designer, I've won Canadian Game Design Award, and the Saltcon Ion Award. I've got a varied background, from graphic design to technical writing to literary fiction to shipping and logistics. I'm really excited to bring all of those skillsets together with my love of game design, through publishing what I hope will be the first of many titles for Wheelhouse Games. 
I grew up in a family that loved trains, history, and the Canadian landscape, all of which have found their way into this game. When not designing, illustrating, or playing board games, I spend my time with my creative and talented wife and son,  both of whom are a constant source of inspiration to me. 

Videography / 3D Animations: 
Joseph McDaid is dedicated to all things gaming. When not making videos and animations for board games, he is usually online in a video game with his friends. He's a board game designer himself and helped with playtesting of The Transcontinental. He also loves to 3D print and paint miniatures, most of which can be found on his Instagram @paintman_journeying.

Tabletop Simulator Adaptation
Pedro Feijao is a Mathematician turned Computer Scientist turned Bioinformatician, with a passion for video and board games. Originally from Brazil, after living in Germany for a while he settled in Vancouver, with his wife and 10-year-old son. Now working on a DNA-based Cancer diagnostics company called Canexia Health. In his spare time, he likes to play board games with my family, play basketball and program TTS mods for great board games!
While there's a long way to go with the project still, I want to take a moment to thank all the people who have helped me get this far, from playtesters to enthusiastic fans. From people who played the game at virtual conventions this year, to people who have followed along on my newsletter. 
But there are a few people I want to take an extra moment to give a shout-out to. 
The Calgary playtesting community! Everyone who (pre-pandemic times) would come down to Sentry Box for playtesting nights and lend their time to playtesting The Transcontinental. But in particular, Paul Saxberg, Orin Bishop, Keith Donaldson, and Joseph McDaid (who also put together the trailer video here), put in countless hours and sessions on this game. I couldn't have done it without all their input. 
During this pandemic time, I've also helped out tremendously by having an online game design group to not only playtest but to act as a sounding board for ideas and to keep me accountable: Mark Yuasa of Test Coast Games, Marc Bennett, and Russel Fleming.
A special shoutout as well to Chris Ewington, who, in addition to playtesting, helped out with working through some of the logistics of the Kickstarter campaign. 
Thanks to Pedro Feijao for rescuing me from doing my own Tabletop Simulator scripting, and doing such a fantastic job with it. 
And lastly my wife and son, for their support and inspiration. I consider myself fortunate to live in a home with so much creativity.

I'm really happy with the level of detail on the metal train, and the wood components look and feel great, especially the telegrams! Now I'll be working on getting all of the punchboard and paper components finalized. The Chinese New Year season means that most manufacturing will be on pause until March. When it starts back up, I plan to have the print material ready to go. So in short, all manufacturing is still on schedule!

Hey everyone, I just wanted to give a quick update because the pledge manager was supposed to launch this week, but it's not quite ready yet. I'm working with the fine folks at Backerkit to get everything set up behind the scenes, and I expect to have it open this coming week. 
The one delay is going to be for UK backers to access the pledge manager, as I still haven't gotten my UK VAT number yet. I imagine that with Brexit coming into effect this month, it's probably the worst time to be trying to get a VAT number. However, right now this is only a delay regarding the pledge manager access, and is not going to cause a delay in fulfillment.

I had originally intended to have the metal train and the wood markers as the final two stretch goals (wood and metal are such appropriate final ingredients for a railway game!), but when it looked like there'd be room for at least one more, I went back to my notes from throughout the four years of development of the game to see if I could find anything else that would be a great add, and these tiles made sense for reasons I'll explain below.

campaign.story:
Hello Kickstarter. Meet, 
Small, Fun, and Functional!
Noise Machine is a super-duper teeny tiny wireless Midi Controller that doesn't compromise functionality for portability.
The main idea of Noise Machine was to create a portable instrument that had the same functionality as a keyboard in a package that you could easily take with you. Something fun to play, compact and functional that could accompany you on the bus, out for a walk, on a road trip, in a tree, you name it! Noise Machine works by wirelessly connecting to software on your smartphone, laptop, or PC/MAC. Consisting of 12 buttons, a knob, and a slider, Noise Machine allows you to choose from 12 different midi channels and offers 3 different modes of use...  All in a case that's smaller than your wallet!
  Noise Machine was inspired by the need to have a tactile instrument outside of the studio without limitations!

Special Offer,
Recieve 7 Free Sample Packs from Pyro Audios Library for all New & Existing backers! ✨
All you have to do is back, and you'll get a download code on Friday December 4th for 500+ samples that you can experiment with Noise Machine!
- - -
"Pyro Audio is proud to offer a powerfully inspiring collection of sounds for backers of the Noise Machine ultra-portable wireless MIDI controller. This bundle features 7 sound packs, over 500 sounds spanning 600+ MB of percussion content you can use on any DAW or beat-making platform. Over a $35 USD value, it's a free download reward for backers of the Noise Machine Kickstarter campaign."
More Details available here:  https://pyroaudio.com/products/noise-machine 

This is Noise Machine: Artist Review. A first impressions video by @iameumonik. Eumonik is a YouTube influencer (and friend) with a passion for expressing himself through the power of music. This 12 minute long Youtube video will include demo's, general information, and an original "first look" you'll have of Noise Machine in someones hands. Plus, more surprises! 😉


The Hardware, 
General
Consisting of 12 buttons, a midi expression knob, and a slider, Noise Machine packs a lot of punch in an insanely small size! Utilizing ultra low latency BLE MIDI and entirely self contained, Noise Machine offers 100% wireless freedom to connect to major DAWs on a variety of different devices!
12 Buttons 
Noise Machine comes equipped with 12 quiet, comfortable, and tactile buttons that will make you find any excuse to start mashing & making NOISE wherever you are!
MIDI Expression Knob
Noise Machines MIDI Expression Knob controls modulation by default, however you can reprogram it to do whatever you like! Cutoffs, filters, or even something as simple as volume. Twist away!
Octave Slider
Utilize Noise Machines Octave Slider to explore 7 different octaves across 12 notes in default mode. Stay in one octave, or jump between a few to open up even more possibilities!
Noise Machine comes equipped with 3 integrated midi modes to choose from out of the box! Consisting of DEFAULT MODE, SPLIT MODE & LOOP MODE. 

DEFAULT
Default mode turns the 12 buttons included with Noise Machine into the 12 octaves of music theory (C, C#, D, D#, E, F, F#, G, G#, A, A#, B). 
The octave of the 12 notes can be changed with the octave slider, allowing 7 different octaves to be enabled on the fly.
The midi expression knob is set to modulation by default, but can be changed via software to control any Midi CC information.

SPLIT MODE & LOOP MODE
SPLIT MODE,
Split Mode is very similar to default mode. The key difference? The first 6 buttons are hooked to channel 1 and the last 6 buttons are hooked to channel 2. This change in layout allows you to play two different instruments at the same time, completely seperate from each other!

LOOP MODE,
Our take on a midi sequencer. Loop mode allows you to play any sequence of notes and have them played back to you at varying BPM (controlled by the midi CC knob).
The Octave Slider turns into a Midi Expression Slider while the loop is being played, letting you modulate the loop in real time!
Loop Mode lets you add up to 16 notes/pauses and is perfect for a live environment.

The Nitty Gritty,
Uses form of low latency BLE MIDI (7.5 ms - 10 ms latency).
Chargeable via USB TYPE C, with charging indicator.
Compatible with IOS, ANDROID, PC, MAC and synthesizers through MAC/PC Software.
Power, Connect, and Channel LED's.
Open Sourced -- Through Arduino IDE.
Dimensions*: 54.3 x 60.3 x 11.4.
* in Millimeters...yes! Millimeters 😮

Sick of the studio? Crave the fresh air to kickstart your creativity as a musician?
Noise Machines extremely compact design, simple interface, and fun to use layout make it possible to "Make Music Anywhere & Everywhere".
Designed to be ultra portable, enjoy creating music on-the-go without compromising functionality. Simple, affordable, and hassle-free, Noise Machine is the ultimate solution for making music on the go!
BLINDING LIGHTS by THE WEEKND
ROSES BY ST JHN
 1. COLOUR OPTIONS
STRETCH GOAL: $100,000 CDN (~$75,000 USD)
If we reach our initial stretch goal of $100,000 CDN, we will unlock the possibility of multiple colours 🤯🎨

2. MIDI PORT ATTACHMENT
STRETCH GOAL: $150,000 CDN (~$110,000 USD)
You've asked and we've responded! If we reach $150,000 CDN we will unlock a physical midi port attachment to clip on Noise Machine. (For all you gear heads out there 😉)
 3. APPLICATION
 STRETCH GOAL: $200,000 CDN (~$150,000 USD)
This is the big one 😳 Lets make Noise Machine seamless and more user friendly. If we hit $200,000 CDN we will unlock an application that includes the ability to reassign notes, the functions of the slider and knob, as well as other cool features that are in development (sampler, educational tools, tutorials, etc).

How it all began,
Founded by two brothers residing from Ontario, Canada. Both with a passion and common vision to spearhead the portable revolution of the music hardware industry.
Noise Machine has always been a labour of love.
Since the beginning we knew its purpose was special. The idea of having a portable midi machine that you could create, engage, and bring with you anywhere was the spark to the eventual creation of Noise Machine itself.
Getting this far was not easy...
The countless hours spent hunched over our desks tinkering, building, and coding are testaments to how passionate we are about this project.
We went through six or seven different prototypes in the year and a half that elapsed from the first conceived thought of Noise Machine. These prototypes varied in size, functionality, and features (some were pretty wacky...), all of which culminated in the Noise Machine that you see today!
  Noise Machine was unveiled back in May of 2020. In September of 2020 THIS.IS.NOISE Inc was founded as a vessel to carry Noise Machine towards its Kickstarter goal.

Why THIS.IS.NOISE Inc exists,
Ultimately, we come from a world of tangled wires, complex ecosystems, and bulky hardware. We realized that sometimes it's nice to have a break from that world and be able to simply, effectively, and creatively convey our musical abilities... not confined to one space.
We hope to pass on this feeling of creative freedom to our fans, and hear all the amazing things they can create wherever they may be.

Noise Machine will be shipped worldwide,
Shipping will be charged after the campaign, where you can also confirm your rewards, address, and choose any add-ons. 
Please note, that our prices do not include local taxes, duties, etc. that will be subject to the laws and regulations of each individual country/area. 
What is the shipping costs?
Shipping costs will be paid separately closer to the date of the shipping on our e-commerce platform. Due to the coronavirus, shipping prices are uncertain as of right now, so we cannot predict the exact cost in regards to shipping.
We currently expect the prices to be between$10-50 depending on the shipping area. We will do our best to streamline the shipping process, so you get the lowest prices and fastest delivery times!

A HUGE thanks to our community, fans, and supporters who submitted art, graphic design, and video art during our call to action back in September. 🙌
We've attached the community fan art gallery below with props to the talented creators... You guys rock! ✊

We'd like to take a second to thank everyone that has decided to join us on this exciting journey! 
Whether you have just joined us for the first time, or you've been with us since the start, we have a deep appreciation for you helping us bring the music industry into the Portable Revolution... Thank you!
There are also a few people we'd like to thank directly, to whom we know we could not be where we are today without them.
Thank you to John Ergen for making the music in our campaign video (which WAS indeed made using a Noise Machine!). Check out more of his impressive discography on Soundcloud!
Thank you to AttackonBash for dancing/acting in our campaign video, your rap and dance routine is something that deserves the limelight.... Check him out on Spotify!
Thank you to Nathan Fleet for his excellent videographer skills in the campaign video. Check out more of his stuff on Vimeo!
Thank you to Jayden Travis for modelling, acting, and being a huge help throughout the creation of Noise Machine and THIS.IS.NOISE Inc. Check out his solo project "Flower Couch" on Spotify!
Thank you to Eumonik for his stellar YouTube video showcasing Noise Machine in all its glory! Check out his YouTube channel for more awesome content!
And finally, Thank You to our Team and those who worked closely to make Noise Machine into what it is today! Without you, the Noise would never have reached our communities ears.

The biggest risks and challenges Noise Machine faces in its journey are similar to that of any start up company. However, THIS.IS.NOISE Inc. is dedicated to deliver and exceed your expectations throughout the process of manufacturing, packaging, and shipping out our product.

Our strict policy of having an open and honest representation with our customers and as a company is our highest priority.

Allocating a time frame for getting Kickstarter units manufactured and subsequently sent out is arguably the biggest obstacle we are excited to overcome. campaign.story:
Welcome to The Mariana Trench, a solo or 2 player pocket sized game that plays in 10-15 minutes. Your objective as a deep-sea researcher is to guide your sub through fathoms of water, descending to the Trench floor, to find mysterious and amazing sea creatures.
Will you become a renowned research scientist, or will you fall victim to the creatures that lurk beneath the surface?
INTRODUCTION
The goal of The Mariana Trench is to score the most research points by researching deep-sea creatures and the floor of the trench. The game is played in alternating turns until your submarines run out of oxygen. 
MOVEMENT
Movement from one card to the next represents a distance of 1000 Fathoms. At launch your sub can move up to 2000 fathoms (2 cards) on your turn. 
COLLECTING RESEARCH AND UPGRADES
When researching the water column, reveal the (research) card next to your sub. Each card displays a deep-sea creature and a submarine upgrade. 
You may:
• Collect the deep-sea creature, or
• Upgrade your Submarine
If you do not collect the creature or upgrade your sub then leave the card face-up, where either player may collect it on a future turn.
If you have hold capacity you may tuck the research card under your sub (to the right), so that the class and size of the creature shows.
If you do not collect the sea creature then you can upgrade your sub. Tuck the card under your sub (to the left) so that the upgrade is showing. You cannot take the same upgrade twice.
Your sub starts with a small hold, which can carry one small creature. To collect large creatures you must upgrade your hold first.  

THE TRENCH FLOOR
Each time your sub reaches the trench floor you can conduct valuable scientific research. Take 1 research token from the supply and place it on your submarine. Your sub can only carry one research token at a time. The token is offloaded as soon as you surface beside the research vessel.  Research tokens are worth 2RP at the end of the game.
RETURNING TO THE RESEARCH SHIP
When your sub surfaces, all the creatures and tokens are offloaded to the research vessel. At the end of the game points are scored for different sets of creatures
And there is more….
OK, so we have the game, the expansion, and the play mat, we have a few awesome stretch goals to come too…. But what else?
Over the past three years I have been hugely fortunate to work in the board game industry, I’ve had games published, I’ve worked as an illustrator and designer on many fantastic and exciting games. 
But now is the time, the time for me to develop the games I’d like to play, the games I think you would like, games I'm passionate about which I'm itching to throw my creativity and time into. By backing this project, you are giving me the opportunity to exclusively make the absolute best games I can for you.
With two more amazing games in the pipeline for next year, I am massively excited for the future, I've got some amazing stuff to share. So, it’s not all about buying this game, it’s about investing in creative freedom and being part of an exciting journey and some amazing new games.
Tris Rossin.
Owner of Bright Light Games.

This is one of over a dozen game publishing projects I've been involved with, I've designed games from concept to production ready art and my work has been used in numerous successful Kickstarters, many of these are now are retail level productions. We have our manufacturing connections in place for when this funds. All the artwork for the core game and expansion are in place and all that's left are some tweaks and changes to make sure it's absolutely the best game possible.

We currently have a couple of distributors who have a proven track record on delivering large and complex Kickstarters.

As with all projects, there may be hurdles to overcome, at this point we've done everything to mitigate those and I'm confident we'll deliver a top-tier product as soon as possible.

Finally, we have links to people in the industry who have been here before, these people are onboard for advice and mentoring through this project.

campaign.story:
*NOTE* our backing tiers currently state they are US only, this an error that we're in the process of fixing! You can back from anywhere in the world at any tier
The House Doesn't Always Win - Front Cover (Design by @minus_tom)
What is The House Doesn't Always Win?
Reclaim your lands, bring down oppressors, topple empires...
The House Doesn't Always Win is a zero-prep, tabletop role playing game about those who have been left with nothing fighting against those that hold everything. It runs entirely on a standard deck of playing cards and a single 10-sided die, can be run in any setting or theme and uses a unique, poker-like system to drive its game-play. The House Doesn't Always Win will transform your deck of cards into a high stakes game of pushing your luck and fighting against your oppressors. Sessions are full of heist-like plans gone awry, fragile allegiances between allies around the table beginning to crack under pressure, and constant morbid curiosity for exactly what card is currently sitting on top of the deck.
A completely unique set of mechanics designed from the ground up to fit your characters' struggles... 
The House Doesn't Always Win is built on a unique set of mechanics that bring your deck of cards to life. The diamonds are your targets, those you need to destroy to remake the world in your favour. The Kings, Queens, and Jacks are your characters, those fighting to change what keeps them down. Everything else is all the influence, allies, favours, equipment, and luck you've managed to scrape together to attempt this paradigm shift. Once the game starts, it's not just how the cards are dealt, but how you play them that will ultimately decide your fate. 
Defy the odds or die trying in a world where the slightest mistake can cost you everything...
What you're attempting is not going to be easy, in fact, it's an enormous gamble, but if you liked the odds you wouldn't be here in the first place. The House Doesn't Always Win is a game of high tensions and situations that exist on a knife-edge - where failure is always avoidable but takes no prisoners. The odds are always changing as cards are discarded and removed from the deck and with everyone sharing the deck between them, every action is important, not just your own.
A spade, heart and club come together to burn down the heraldry of their oppressors. (Art by @riotbones)
How does it play?
Fast setup and easy to understand rules remove the barriers between the players and the game...
The House Doesn't Always Win strips away the need for pages and pages of rules that most games require you to learn without sacrificing interesting moment to moment decisions. Suitable for advanced TTRPG players looking for something different as well as new players looking for a fast and easy to learn system - It's fast to pick up and set up and is infinitely repayable in whatever setting you choose, suitable for quick and deadly one-shots or multi-session narratively linked campaigns. 
A series of interlocking mechanics, all hiding within a simple deck of cards...
Everything in The House Doesn't Always Win will have you keeping your attention on the deck of cards in the centre of the table:
The diamonds are removed from the deck at the start and all the picture cards of that suit will represent the targets you'll need to take down in your campaign; the head of the snake must be removed to kill the constricting body. 
Numbered diamond cards are laid out on the table and represent important pieces of information, contacts, and assets that the diamonds covet; find and claim them during play to manipulate the odds in your favour. 
Character creation is as simple as choosing a card to play as; Jack, Queens, and Kings all have their own unique powers and your chosen suit will aid you in challenges to come and inform how your character plays.
Attempt risky and dangerous actions by drawing from the deck one card at a time, looking to draw a certain amount of cards in one of three suits. Draw too many of the wrong suit and you risk going bust and losing every card you've drawn for the rest of the game, permanently weakening your chances and possibly even removing characters from play. 
An innovative 'folding' mechanic allows you to pull away from potentially devastating actions when the risk becomes too great - swapping boring, single chance dice rolls for a nail-biting, push-your-luck, extended draw that could see glory or tragedy with every card taken from the deck. Actions have consequences, not just in the narrative, but in the mechanics themselves. 
The House Doesn't Always Win feels like...
A hitman level run by a croupier, a high stakes game of poker mixed with Russian roulette, classic heist movies, David taking down Goliath, putting everything on black, knowing you stand to gain or lose everything, knowing you have no other choice. 
You'll shout in triumph and cry out in agony from merely turning over a card. Your characters will suffer hardships and if they're lucky, narrowly escape with their lives, but should they succeed against all odds; their names will go down in history.
A spade looks ahead at the gauntlet that awaits them before the King of Diamond's tower. (Art from @Riotbones)
Watch It Played!
Want to watch a game in motion and learn the rules at the same time? Don't worry, we've got you covered. Below is a 2 hour let's play featuring Game Designer Michael 'Wheels' Whelan running the game and players Zoe Delahunty-Light, Grimsevers, and Xalavier Nelson Jr. 
Stretch Goals and Contributors
Our funding goal will bring The House Doesn't Always win into existence as a ready to play rule-book with fantastic design and all the components needed for a standard session, but with your support it can be so much more: 
£3500 - Custom character sheets and a campaign tracker in the beautiful playing card style of the book.
£4500 - 3 pre-made campaign scenarios written by Michael 'Wheels' Whelan in different themes and settings. Ready to play, straight out of the book.
£5500 - A guide to writing your own scenarios to play with your group, or share with others, included in every copy of the book.
 £6500 - A new suite of illustrations from the wonderful Riotbones, the artist behind the two pieces embedded in the page above. Riotbones is an art student from the Philippines who freelances on the side and works in editorial illustration.
£8000 - A pre-made scenario from Johnny Chiodini: Board game journalist, TTRPG designer, and GM for the Oxventures actual play series.
THEME: Attack and dethrone God himself.
£9500 - A pre-made scenario from Xalavier Nelson Jr.: Xalavier is a narrative director, game developer, and writer, working in games, comics, and beyond! You might know him from his work on Hypnospace Outlaw, SkateBIRD, An Airport for Aliens Currently Run by Dogs.
THEME: He sees you when you're sleeping, he knows when you're awake, and he's running a brutal oligarchy built on slave labor and cannibalism: you're going to take down Santa Claus.
£11,000 - a pre-made scenario from Spenser Starke: ENNIE Nominated Tabletop Game Designer behind Icarus and Alice is Missing.
THEME: Set sail as swashbuckling pirates on the open seas as you fight back against the tyranny of the Red King!
£12,500 - An art injection from Evangeline Gallagher: A freelance illustrator from Baltimore whose work can be found on https://evangelinegallagher.com. Their beautiful art and unique style has been sought out by all sorts of clients including ProPublica, the Guardian, and the New Republic!
 £14,000 - A pre-made scenario from Zoe Delahunty-Light: Twitch streamer, video game journalist, and co-designer of Would You Search Through The Lonely Earth For Me?
THEME: Usurp the rulers of your own ancient family in a dilapidated, gothic manor.
 £16,000 - An art injection from Ulla: A graphic design student and freelance illustrator based in Indonesia who injects all their art with gorgeous bursts of colour and texture.
 £18,000 - A pre-made scenario from Brandon O'Brien: A game designer, science fiction writer and poet from Trinidad and Tobago. You can find some of their game work at https://therisingtithes.itch.io/
 THEME: Try your best to survive high school as you and your misfit friends stand off against the power-hungry student council.
 £20,000 - An art injection from Sirocco: A non-binary illustrator from the Philippines who specialises in lovingly detailed, tapestry-like illustrations.
 £22,500 - A pre-made scenario from Viditya Voleti: An interactive artist and game designer! He specializes in worldbuilding, GMless, and tactile play that explores the facets of what games are and what play is in as many forms and mediums as he finds!
THEME: You were forged to win them their war and enforce their rule, but now, bleeding on the battlefield, the weapons rise up again their wielders
 £25,000 - An art injection from Lilit Belgarian: A concept artist and worldbuilder working in games and animation! Lilit is a huge fan of tabletop gaming and creates stunning tarot-card-like illustrations. 
 £27,500 - A pre-made scenario from Dominique Dickey: A writer, editor, and consultant working in RPGs and fiction out of Baltimore. Their most recent project, TRIAL (a narrative courtroom RPG about race and the criminal justice system) can be found at domsdickey.itch.io
THEME: Survive a holiday party gone terribly wrong at your grandmother's cottage in the woods
 £30,000 - An art injection from Mazoni: Also know as Doodleskelly, they mostly draw weird and wonderful creatures and environments, as mysterious as the artist themself
 £32,500 - A pre-made scenario from Jamila Nedjadi: A TTRPG creator under the name of Sword Queen Games. They believe in the power and magic of creative play and their game BALIKBAYAN: Returning Home was nominated for the IGDN Indie Groundbreaker Award for best setting.
 THEME: [coming soon!]
 £35,000 - An art injection from Waveglox: A freelance illustrator and comic artist from Russia with a panache for bright colours and bold designs. 
Where the Money is Going
The initial backing goal is broken down as follows. These are estimations, and the prices will fluctuate depending on the scale of the project -
Kickstarter fees ~£180
Campaign Manager ~£100
Initial book design ~£400
Custom card design ~£350
Editor/sensitivity reader ~£115
Shipping Printing & Unforeseen costs ~£850

Whilst I've been playing, writing about, and designing games for a very long time, this is definitely the largest project I've ever worked on, and the first time I've ever gone to Kickstarter! There's always inherent problems with physical objects including shipping and printing mishaps but with Jordan's solid background of quality products shipped I'm confident we can meet them head on. 

Costs can sometimes fluctuate and leave you a lot less well funded than you thought you were if you aren't careful, that's why we're making sure there's breathing room in all of our financials to prepare for the worst and why I'm working with an accountant/financial advisor to make sure everything is adding up at all times.

campaign.story:
Sons of Faeriell is a strategic eurogame, with asymmetric player powers and multiple endings.

Guiding your tribe of Weybits in the pursuit of their goals and helping the Great Guardians in need, you will face the menace of Corruption, which is endangering the whole land. It’s only a matter of time until the allure of Corruption becomes unstoppable, in all its devastating effects.

Strategic choices will be crucial for the destiny of Faeriell and for your Tribe of Weybits. Will you cooperate with other players or part ways?
These are photorealistic renders. Please take into consideration that the final product may differ.
For an extended and detailed explanation of the rules, check this video:
Watch below an English Playthrough of the game:
Inspired by the lush nature of Faeriell, we will involve our supporters in the Tree-Nation project, aimed to reforest areas of the world in need. The Tree-Nation Add-on gives us the opportunity to plant new trees and see how our efforts will improve the environment. Everyone involved will be able to see how much the CO2 levels will decrease in the new forest region.
  By choosing the Tree-Nation Add-On, you will receive a certificate that proves your contribution for planting a tree, with its geo-localization. Our partner, Tree-Nation, will provide additional information about the results of the overall project. Let's plant a forest together!
Sons of Faeriell is Dice Tower's Peek of the Week!
Cooperation against Corruption 
Doom is the inevitable outcome of Corruption, and its rise during the game represents a threat to all players. If they don't team up and direct their choices to constrain Corruption, they all risk to lose together against the game. Corruption Events are specific situations in which a player has to decide whether to intervene for the sake of the group, or put their individual goals before everything else.
Controlled randomness 
Game events happen during the production phases, which are resolved at every player’s turn. First, the active player decides which regions or areas will produce, then they have to draw a limited number of tokens from a bag, to determine the status of the Great Guardians in that turn. At every draft, the probability of certain events to happen narrows further and further and players are able to adjust their strategy accordingly.
Asymmetric characters abilities and development
Weybits are characters guided by players, represented by highly detailed miniatures. Putting on their Tribe Masks, each Weybit becomes a specific Hero with asymmetric starting abilities, related to the color of each resource. Heroes can level up and acquire new Perks of different kinds, which grant all sorts of additional powers and combo triggers.
Alternate phase resolution 
Every phase of the game offers many possible courses of action in a short span of playing time, allowing players to perform tactical moves with high flexibility. This removes the problem of downtime between the players' turns. Moreover, the phases are resolved in the order chosen by each player at every turn, causing difficulties to the opponents in full competitive mode, or following the interests of the group for cooperative purposes.
Corruption Sower 
Players can aim to different winning conditions, thanks to a mechanic designed to prevent runaway leader or stall situations. The Corruption Sower is a new kind of character that enters in play as a consequence of the player’s choices, which flips the competitive side of the game to a run to make all other players lose to the Doom.
In the verdant regions of Faeriell, the Great Guardians were living peacefully since the dawn of time, protecting the balance of nature with their majestic presence.

When the first Weybit explorers started to appear and decided to settle, it was a joyful surprise. The Great Guardians observed with interest how quickly these tiny and industrious humanoids learned to live in harmony with the environment. An alliance was forged, and it turned out to be a blessing, for the harsh times that were about to come.
  Lately, the Weybits are getting greedy and competitive like never before, and most of them don’t even know why. In this unsettling scenario, a new menace is rising and some are already whispering its name, calling it Corruption. This luring shadow is causing plants, animals and even the Great Guardians to suffer devastating effects, and patches of darkness are devouring the bright colors of nature all over Faeriell.
  Weybits are the only inhabitants of Faeriell able to constrain Corruption, though they are also the most likely to fall for its bait. Weybit Tribes are encouraging their most talented Heroes to prove themselves, help the Great Guardians in need and give a hope to the lush land they just started to call home. 
The Essence of Faeriell is a force that pervades all life, from the smaller grain of sand to the majestic Great Guardians. Each environment is tuned to a different domain of the Essence, and Weybits have learned to retrieve inspiration and resources from the land to express their extraordinary abilities to their fullest.
The gigantic and peaceful Great Guardians are as ancient as the land itself. They are an emanation of the essence of Faeriell, one with the nature they protect. 

Throughout years of spontaneous friendship and mutual curiosity, Weybits have learned a lot about these incredible creatures, so much that they are the only ones able to help them against Corruption.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our eighth Kickstarter campaign, during these years we’ve gained the expertise and know-how to confidently produce high quality games the way we envision them.
Nonetheless we’ve also learned production, quality control and shipping are delicate phases that can bring unexpected issues that may take some time to solve. For this reason the delivery date, October 2021, is an estimate. While we will do everything in our power to meet this date or even anticipate it, we are aware that slight delays are possible for reasons outside of our control. Also, exact delivery dates could vary depending on where you live.
If you have any question, concern or issue write to support@tabula.games and we will be happy to assist you.
By pledging for this project you accept the following terms:
General Terms:
- This is not a pre-order and the final product may be subject to changes and improvements from what is presented here to ensure smoother production and logistics. This includes every aspect of the game, from miniature design to artworks and layouts.
- We will only answer to support requests from our backers. If you got the game somewhere else (reseller, friend, group pledge, etc.) you will have to contact us through them.
- After 30 days from the delivery date to your door, we will not accept complaints related to the game box contents of this campaign (missing components, damaged components, etc.).
- After 6 months from the shipment date, we will not accept complaints related to the shipment of items of this campaign (damaged package, lost or missing contents, etc.).
- After 12 months from the shipment date, we will not accept any complaints related to this campaign.
Refunds:
- An order can be canceled and fully refunded before the end of the campaign by clicking on the applicable button on Kickstarter.
After the end of the campaign, the order can still be canceled within 14 days by sending us an email with your cancellation request. Please note that in this case the refund will not include the processing costs and Kickstarter fees, which will be deducted from your total. Apart from the cases specified here, the order is considered valid and is not refundable.
Shipping:
- It’s ultimately your responsibility to respond to our post-campaign survey to claim your rewards and to give us information about your shipping address and add-on choices. If you ignore our Last Call notification for more than 4 weeks we will consider your pledge a donation and we won’t be able to ship you a reward.
- One week after our Address Lockdown notification we will lock all your address and forward all delivery information to our fulfillment partners and this mean we will be unable to make any kind of change to your address. If you think your address might change during the delivery period we advise you to have the game shipped at another address you trust (friend, relative, workplace, etc.).
- If the game fails to arrive because of your mistake (wrong address, recipient absent, failure to pick up at courier/postal warehouse, etc.), any additional shipping/warehousing cost for us to re-send/re-deliver your game will be your responsibility. This also includes the costs associated with returning the game. If after investigation it becomes clear that the error was on our part, we will resend your package at our expense.
- If the package is lost, destroyed or damaged, the carrier will be held solely responsible. Any customer claim to the carrier needs to be made at the time of delivery, not later. If the package seems damaged, please ask the postal carrier to make you a receipt "accepted with reserve".
- Please note that we will not reship any game without first investigating what happened to the first shipment.
- If your game arrives with missing or damaged components, provide us with proof and we will substitute them once we have verified the damage.

Pledge $40 now to be a part of The Calliope Game Night Extravaganza! retailer program and receive your full margin plus 4 additional points for your support.  You will also have an opportunity to fill out your order with other Calliope titles at the same margin; FFA $350 (destination USA). Retailer orders will be shipped with all other Kickstarter orders prior to standard distribution. Your final order and payment will not be finalized until the games are ready to ship.  A Thrilling And Unique Adventure
The Calliope Game Night Extravaganza! is a Kickstarter project like no other. Three card games for one low price. Allegory is a bidding set collection game of storytelling and lore for 2-6 players, where winning a round may gain you a card, but it means losing your chips.  Enchanted Plumes is a dazzlingly beautiful card game for 2-6 players of crafting peacock plumes and managing your hand of feathers.  Mass Transit is a captivating and quick cooperative card game of building bus, ferry, and train routes and getting commuters home, which can be played solo or up to 6 players.  During this campaign, you can get an instant game night collection of three games that will inspire fun times and create memories.  And for only $40, it's like getting a game for FREE!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any venture, there are risks... those that are seen, and those that are unseen. The biggest foreseeable risks we currently face are COVID delays, manufacturing in China, and shipping issues from China to our warehouse here in the US.

Each of these risks is greatly minimized with Calliope Games. Our factories have been with us for many years. They know how we work and the quality we expect. In addition, our freight forwarder and fulfillment teams are world class and have over 30 years of expertise to rely upon. If any issues arise, we will know of them far in advance and will be able to overcome them.

New tariffs may influence costs as well. Typically these are 10%-25% of our total manufacturing cost. Should tariffs affect prices, these will be reflected in the post-campaign shipping and fulfillment cost; this may also include factors caused by Brexit.

As far as the unseen risks... we know they are there and we have built a safety margin into our costs of goods sold to prepare us for the unforeseen. To date we've published more than 20 games under the Calliope brand, many with a good number of reprints, and we have overcome all major production issues in providing our players quality entertainment experiences.

Risks and challenges
All images used in this Kickstarter are subject to change and may represent unfinished or non-final art or design. All card counts are approximate and are subject to change. All card and component names are subject to change. All packaging is subject to change and is not finalized. Rules are subject to change.

There are always risks associated with manufacturing and logistics, especially when working with international partners. Problems can delay or otherwise impact our ability to meet our commitments to our backers.

These issues include (but are not limited to):

* Production delays
* Shipping delays

The estimated delivery date is June 2021, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Due to the logistics of international shipping in this unpredictable time, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize these risks as much as possible, and we are happy to refund pledges if for some reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

At your request we can give you a full refund within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that we will subtract Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from Kickstarter after 14 days). Those fees usually equal 8% of the total pledge.

Refunds will be processed through Kickstarter and will be applied to whatever payment method you provided to Kickstarter. In the event that is impossible we will work with you to arrange a refund through other channels.

Once we have shipped your Reward our refund policy will depend on the circumstances and will be at our discretion.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed. We are not responsible for changes in the rate of foreign exchange.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you agree to conduct all public interactions via Kickstarter's communications channels with this project and our team and other backers in a positive manner. We want the communications channels for this campaign to be a friendly, positive place for our community to gather and discuss the campaign, ask questions, and provide input.

Sly Game Design (henceforth referred to as SGD) reserves the right to cancel any pledge (with a full refund) at any time, for any reason. If your pledge is cancelled while the campaign is ongoing you agree not to re-pledge either under your original account or under any other account you control. Violations of this policy will be reported to Kickstarter.

Minor cosmetic damage to the box or other packaging can occur during shipping. SGD makes reasonable efforts to ensure that the shipping containers it uses are suitable for the safe delivery of rewards. If you believe that your reward has suffered more than minor cosmetic damage please contact us immediately. Keep all packaging including outer cartons for our inspection. SGD will at its sole discretion determine if the damage constitutes other than minor cosmetic damage and/or was the result of insufficient packaging.

If we ship to the address that you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is returned to us as undeliverable you will pay the full cost to ship the Reward again to a revised address.

If we ship the Reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is delivered to that address but you are unable to receive it, or you have moved and are no longer the occupant of that address and cannot otherwise retrieve the package, or if the package is lost or stolen after delivery, and you wish to have the order fulfilled again you will pay the full cost to ship the order to a revised address plus the amount of the original Reward.

If we ship the Reward to the address you provided in our Pledge Manager and the package is held in customs or by any other government agency, our ability to help may be limited. You may be required to contact your customs agency or government and arrange for the package to be cleared and released at your expense. We are not responsible for refunds or re-shipments for packages held by customs or a government agency.

In all cases you acknowledge that quantities are limited and SGD may not be able to ship all or part of your order more than once.

Other than as noted elsewhere in these terms & conditions, if any part of your order cannot be fulfilled for any reason SGD will provide you with a pro-rated refund for that portion of your order.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
The game mechanics in Bivouac are low-impact, allowing for component longevity. Cards do not need to be shuffled often, which should allow them to withstand the test of time even without card sleeves. We have chosen to include a score track on the player boards as opposed to a paper score pad that would produce more waste and need to be replaced.
Sustainable materials
We avoid plastic components where we can in favor of wood, paper, or cardboard. We plan to use a manufacturer that uses cardboard with the highest possible percentage of recycled material in order to save resources and reduce energy usage.
Environmentally friendly factories
We plan to use a manufacturer that offers FSC certification, ensuring that our wood-based game components come from responsibly managed forests. This manufacturer also uses colors and coatings that are all water-based and non-toxic.

The Final Stretch
Hi Friends!
We are pleased to announce that all Bivouac art files have been completed and approved for production. This means that we are still proceeding on schedule. Current production dates are set for July 12th-16th and the shipping process will begin in the following weeks. We will be partnering with Quartermaster Logistics to handle world-wide fulfillment.
Pre-order Store

April Progress Report
Hi Friends!
Thank you for your continued patience as we finalize all the details for Bivouac. We continue to work behind the scenes with Ludo Fact Germany to make sure all of the art files are in the right formats and ready for printing.

Behind the Scenes
Hi everyone! We hope this update finds you safe and well.
In an effort to not bog down your inboxes, we have chosen to send an update just once a month until fulfillment is complete. If there are significant changes that need to be communicated immediately, we will certainly break from that pattern to keep you in the loop.
Bivouac is Going Green!

Time to Confirm Your Order Details
Hello backers!
Kickstarter has confirmed the transfer of our campaign funds and we have sent out the pledge manager invites via BackerKit. Thank you to those of you who have already confirmed your order!

Thank You!
Wow. What a month it has been. We cannot express our gratitude enough. As a new small business, we literally could not have produced Bivouac without you. You have given us the funds we need and we are excited to bring Bivouac to your table. In addition, you even unlocked the upgraded resource tokens in the final hours!
What's Next?

Diversity Update
Hello friends! 
As many of you are aware, the Staff Member cards that are a part of Bivouac were designed in the likeness of backers from a specific reward level in our original campaign. One of the unintended consequences of offering this option as a reward was that the cards did not end up representing a very wide variety of ethnicities. Many of you have commented about that fact. Since this campaign began, we have been thinking about how we can address this issue without going back on the promises we made to previous backers.
