updates.update_content:
Greetings, Dear Tribe Members!
We hope you are all having a great summer! Please forgive us for the shortness of this update, but this is because we are still in the PPC process. Although it’s a demanding process and there is a lot of work involved, there isn’t much in the way of news to share with you as we continue to work hard!

Greetings, Dear Tribe Members!
The day has come, and we are excited to tell you that yesterday we shared all of the core files with our manufacturer (except from the solo rulebook). For this reason, this update will be brief since we spent most of our time finalizing and passing the assets of the game to our manufacturer. Over the next couple of days we will make sure that the files are approved. Additionally, during the following weeks we will work hard in order to finalize and deliver the rest of the assets (modules-expansions). Once we are done, a custom copy will be produced and sent to us for proofing. Having said that, we are happy to inform you that we are still on track for our initial plan of a December delivery.

Greetings, Tribe Members!
We are here, working non stop, every day, 24/7 ! :)

FINALIZING
We are currently facing the busiest and most demanding period of the project, working hard to finalize all of its assets.

campaign.story:
PLAY



PLAY





Hello everyone ... My name is Marsio Salcuni, and I am a lover of Music, Physics and Magnetism, and one day, I got the idea of combining these three things in my own way! ... And I must admit that it didn't go badly ... That idea gave me the opportunity to build my first X-PICK, and start having fun experimenting and playing ... As you can see from the videos, however, I started to understand that it was much more important than just having fun ... Starting to know how to use it, I discovered that it is a set of everything a guitarist or bassist should have always with him ... All enclosed in a little gem! ...
I apologize for the guitar or Bass performances, but in my defense, I delight more in singing, and this strengthens my desire to see my X-PICK in the hands of REAL GUITARISTS or BASS PLAYERS, to see the thousand other facets that they are able to discover (moreover because each of you has different instruments, amplifiers, settings, etc ... and being Magnetic Fields, they will always be different, with different results, different sounds etc ...)
Each of you will contribute to the growth of the X-Pick's capabilities, and yours! Because you will have 1000 more ways to MAKE MUSIC!


The X-PICK has a size of 24 mm x 25 mm.
It has a thickness of 4 mm and has a well-defined tip, but with a very wide angle, such as to facilitate simple picking or normal fast picking.
The DESIGN, combined with the type of MAGNETIZATION, never creates problems of too much attraction towards the strings ... The maximum magnetic degree, is poured only on the faces of the magnet as Physics teaches us, and strong enough, but calculated, on the back of the X-Pick to use magnetic field modulation techniques! ... It is obvious, for example, that the bass strings suffer more attraction, given their thickness, but this in no way prevents the fast and precise picking, as you have seen from the videos because you can take advantage also of a Magnetic Trick, to improve Normal Picking and Fast Picking:
Exactly at the tip, at the union between the North and South magnetic fields, there is no attraction with the iron strings, but an imperceptible, but decisive repulsive force is felt, which facilitates the Picking, as if the string were thrown.
The reason is that the iron atoms of the string, being close to both polarities almost simultaneously (i.e. picking) do not have time to reorient themselves for the attraction, and combined with the fact that the power of magnetism always focuses on the faces of a magnet, I opted for axial magnetization that collides the opposite magnetic fields, right in the tip, and I created this kind of magnetism game to facilitate and speed up the movement of the pick ...
The rear corners are cut in order to facilitate the use of some particular techniques, and ensure the right degree of magnetism in the interaction between magnetic fields with the Pickups.
It has very smooth lateral surfaces to slide on the strings like a slide would and the back is the one that has the most magnetic degree, because it is the widest, suitable for all the innovative techniques that require magnetic field modulations of the pick-ups of the instruments
The direction of magnetization of the pick is AXIAL, in such a way as to adapt to any type of polarity of the pick ups on the market:

POLARITY (with a compass):
PLAY

MAGNETIC FIELDS (with iron powder):
PLAY

So, when you hold the X-Pick in your hand, it will be a normal pick size for you, while the PickUps of the instrument, thanks to the high degree of magnetism N52 of the Neodymium, they will see the equivalent of a magnetic soccer ball moving over them.
And this will give you a lot of leeway in the distance with which to interact on the pick ups, adjust the Gain, the Tones and the Volume of the amplifier, to have a personalized sound so in detail, that you will be truly amazed! ...



ROUND PLASTIC CASE, TO PROTECT THE X-PICK AND ALWAYS CARRY IT WITH YOU !!
CASE TO SHOW IT IN ALL ITS SPLENDOR AT YOUR HOME, 
WHERE YOU PLAY WITH YOUR BAND, 
OR IN THE SHOWCASE OF YOUR SHOP, 
OR FOR A PHANTASMAGORIC GIFT TO GIVE TO A MUSICIAN !!
 IT IS COMPOSED BY: 
- A WOODEN BOX,
- VELVET BEARING E
- NON-SLIP MAGNET,
WHICH ALLOWS THE X-PICK TO REMAIN ERECTED FOR EXPOSURE, IN FRONT OF THE LOGO THAT IS ALSO PRESENT INSIDE ...
- AND IN ADDITION WITH THE CHOICE "EXPO" YOU WILL ALSO HAVE THE "TACTICAL" CASE TO PROTECT THE X-PICK AND TAKE IT WITH YOU ...
Ps. The X-Pick packages may vary a little, but only BETTER than those shown! Because if I find them more beautiful and in recyclable material, if I can have the logo engraved on the box directly, at a decent cost, I want my customers and my planet to be happier and happier!


And therefore, describing what happens, when I bring the X-Pick closer and away from the pick up of the instrument, there is a field modulation of the electromagnetic coils, with consequent change of shape, direction and intensity of the magnetic field between the X-Pick and the pick ups, to produce a different sound than usual ...
Using the X-Pick, you can change - IN REAL TIME - THE POSITION, THE SHAPE, THE POWER, THE INTENSITY, etc ... of the PICK UP, which will have their fixed magnetic field, modulated by a magnetic brother who moves on them!
AS IF YOU CREATED A DIFFERENT PICK UP FOR EVERY PICK POSITION, ADAPTABLE TO EVERY KIND OF NEED ...



PLECTRUM:
New approach in the use of the Pick, with the use of the Magnetic Trick explained above, to improve control and speed up the Pick;


BODY & CRISTALLINITY OF SOUND:
Crystallinity and Body of Sound thanks to this innovative material, the Neodymium, which makes it seem to ALWAYS PLAY WITH NEW STRINGS!


SLIDE:
A Wonderfull Slide, again thanks to Neodymium, which guarantees a Great Sustain! ... but also under another aspect: Finally you will use the Slide with the right hand in an agile way, leaving the left free to put chords, managing to act even only on the single note !! ...


PICK – TAPPING or "TAPPICK":
The Pick that will allow you to give a brilliant and perfect note just to contact, without having to press the string on the fret like a Viking, like with normal picks! In fact, it makes the notes shine even where there is no guitar fretboard, so much that you will use it for magnificent and wild tapping, where no one has gone before!


BRUSHES EFFECT:
Sound produced only by the magnetic fields, bringing the pick closer to the Pick Up, and making them pass the strings, one by one or all together to create the rolls;


MAGNETIC FIELDS DELAY:
Delay of any kind of sound you want; Just one touch on the note or chords, like the classic pedalboards, and then you have Total Control over the Delay ... You'll be able to slow down or speed up the delay, accentuate it, change the sound in real time ... A simple delay pedal, to do this, IT SHOULD READ IN YOUR MIND!


POWER & ETERNAL SUSTAIN or ELECTRIC VIOLIN:
Only sliding on the string gently, with the back or side of the X-Pick; HOW MANY TIMES HAVE YOU HOPED THAT YOUR BENDING WILL LAST IN ETERNAL GARY MOORE STYLE ???? ... NOW YOU CAN DO IT TOO !!! ALSO RECOMMENDED FOR LESS EXPENSIVE AND PERFORMING GUITARS !!
OCTAVER:
Just slipping on the string with the back of the pick, adds more than an octave to the traditional guitar fretboard with a bright and powerful sound!


HYPER PICKING:
THE TECHNIQUE BORN WITH THE X-PICK, that will allow you to play without touching the strings, and to interact only through magnetic fields! In this case the change in polarity of the magnetic field acts (Attraction/Repulsion), because the movement of the pick is right - left with respect to the string ...


MAGNETIC FIELDS TREMOLO:
OTHER X-PICK TECHNIQUE, which differs from Hyper Picking, because the movement of the Pick with respect to the strings is up and down, that is, close to and away from the string quickly ... In this case there is Compression of Magnetic Fields (Only Repulsion) ... TECHNIQUE THAT FINALLY WILL MAKES TREMOLO POSSIBLE EVEN ON LEVER-LESS GUITARS!


REVERSE / ROTARY:
Technique that thanks to the magnetic fields, will gives us the possibility of having these effects even without a pedal board ... And then ... How many times have you brought the effects pedals to an evening of the band, to use them in a single song?


 EPIC ATTACK: "THE GOD OF ROCK" 
Versatile and Innovative Pick Attack thanks to Neodymium, and speaking personally, it is one of the most exciting things this little treasure will makes with your support!


ULTRA MAGNETIC CONVENIENCE:
You will be able to magnetically attach your X-Pick wherever you want thanks to the high magnetic degree: to an iron necklace, a bracelet, a belt, a ring, near any small iron part or small part of the same guitar as I did in the video , and speed up your changes from accompaniment to solo! ...


MANY EFFECTS TO BE DISCOVERED:
In addition to the one shown above, and that you could see from the videos, you must keep in mind that the combinations of use of the X-Pick are infinite ... I am talking about the all different instruments we have, and therefore with different magnetic fields, completely new results , or used together with different pedals, amplifiers of various brands and powers, and I could go on forever as you well know… SO IT'S A NEW WORLD TO BE COMPLETELY DISCOVERED BY EACH OF YOU !!!


ATTACH OBJECTS WHERE YOU WANT:
Hang a sheet on the refrigerator, Hang a screwdriver or hammer, Hang up the cell phone, ...


LEARN SCIENCE OF MAGNETISM:
With a Magnet so strong, it will be easier to learn the rules of magnetism at school, at home, anywhere ...


MAGNETIZE OBJECTS:
Such as Screwdrivers, screws, Knives, paper clips, etc .






Now, let's get to the description of the object; this magnetic pick is made with material named Neodymium, from the category of rare earth permanent magnets, is chemically composed with NdFeB (Neodymium-Iron-Boron) and will have a coating that can be of different types ...
Let's do some clarity ... Why are neodymium magnets so strong?
Neodymium magnets are often referred to as super magnets. They are, compared to ferrite, much more attractive. Some of them are six hundred times their weight. Energy density is expressed in kilo joules per cubic meter (kJ / m3). To illustrate the difference between ferrite and neodymium magnets, there is a numerical example: ferrite magnets usually have an energy density of around 30 kJ / m3. Neodymium magnets, on the other hand, have a maximum energy density almost 20 times higher, i.e. around 500 kJ / m3. Most of these are not used in the private sector, but are preferred in industry or similar work areas. The reason for their enormous adhesive power is in the chemical compound and crystal structure. This has great anisotropy and extremely high coercive field strengths. This summary table is only demonstrative, but it is very close to the actual one of our Magnetic Pick:
COATING OF THE MAGNETS IN GENERAL AND THE ONE CHOSEN FOR THE X-PICK
The surfaces must be sealed with a protective layer. For this step, the material must be thoroughly clean and dry. There are many different magnetic coatings for the production of neodymium magnets. The most commonly used coating is a Ni-Cu-Ni coating, that is, a nickel-copper-nickel composition. Other possible coatings are:
Gold plating (Ni-Cu-Ni-Au) Chromium (Ni-Cu-Ni-Cr) Copper (Ni-Cu)Zinc (Zn)
Epoxy resin (Ni-Cu-Ni- Epoxy)
... and I chose Epoxy Resin so as to give more grip in contact with the fingers ...
… as well as for protection from wear …


I tried to make the X-Pick by myself, like the ones you see in the videos… I made them all by hand with the cutter; but there is a problem ... If magnets reach a critical heat point, they lose a lot of their magnetism, and with the cutter or any other tool, that point is far surpassed! ... And it is for this reason that I am collaborating with a magnet manufacturers, to have my custom patent (pending) made ... It is the only way for the moment, at least until I can afford to open a business independently ...
Unfortunately, this company need a substantial amount of X-PICK to give me an advantageous quote, for various reasons:
The first is the cost of the material, the more it is, the less they pay for it too;
The Second is for all instruments and processes for magnetization to grade N52;
The third and most expensive is the mold created specifically for this patent (pending); of which they asked me to contribute with the cost of the realization, because the company cannot use it for any other purpose ... 
In fact, the products that I will ship, will be produced with:
MAGNETIC CERTIFICATION,
ALL THE SAME AND PERFECT, THANKS TO THE MOLD OF MY PATENT (Pending),
WITH A COATING AGAINST WEAR, AND TO IMPROVE THE GRIP BETWEEN THE FINGERS,
WITHOUT THE MINIMAL DEFECT OR IMPERFECTION!
But all this has a cost, namely the amount of the loan, structured to fall within the minimum order possible to make this company accept to make the aforementioned mold for my X-PICK.
I am doing my best to make my little dream come true but I would need some of your help ... 
And to thank you, I show you the birth of the X-Pick!
PLAY



On a technical level:
When you'll playing with the X-Pick, you will not hear those annoying hums due to too high gain or too open tones or exaggerated volumes ... This happens because the X-Pick, being made of ferrous material and magnetic, in contact with the strings, IMPROVE THE GROUNDING SYSTEM OF THE INSTRUMENT, closing better the mass that makes the usual turn in your body only from the left hand; a round of Grounding that is usually stopped by the normal picks of non-conducting material ...
Demostration:
PLAY

Also, again in relation to grounding, IT HELPS TO CONTROL AND DISSIPATE THE EDGE CURRENTS that accumulate from time to time on strings, making you even get shocked! And I bet you all know what I'm talking about! ...

And then on a philosophical level:
And for this I have to go a little personal ... Well, I'm one of those who sweated with work and the few savings his GIBSON LES PAUL STUDIO, and this desire to have it, created a bond ... let's say I'm one of those who believe that every instrument has a SOUL, a CONSCIENCE, and an OPINION to express… And when I play, I speak to her! SHE TALK TO ME! ...
So why not give maximum voice to this essence? ...
LET YOUR GUITAR OR BASS EXPRESS, IN NEW WAYS, WITH SOUNDS THAT HAVE NEVER HEARD OR PRODUCED, WITH NEW TECHNIQUES ... NEW VIBRATIONS !! ...
MY GUITAR WILL ALWAYS BE GRATEFUL FOR THE X-PICK ... IT FEELS ...

Ah, I just wanted to show you who I am ... 
Pleased to meet you ...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As I said before, I managed to create my first X-Pick by myself, but with consequent loss of magnetism ... In fact, to work the so-called permanent rare earth magnets with high magnetic potential, you need a lot of machinery, expensive machinery, that only a company already started and that does only this can have.

I do not have the presumption of wanting to open a magnet company immediately, but simply to collaborate with one of these companies, so that they develop a special mold of my patent and provide to magnetization and coating. By proceeding in this way, I will be able to start creating a way forward, because Rome wasn't built in a day! And I tell you as an Italian! That's it! … 

Things start small, and if you've read this far, I'm sure you'll help me take a small step !! I'll thank you forever!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Well, the design of this object, in terms of shape, is structured not only for functionality, but also to be looked at, so even if you don't use it as a pick, it's a gem that makes its effect on display, to last in eternal ...
Reusability and recyclability
Speaking at the material level, it is made of neodymium, a powerful magnet, which can be exploited for a thousand other uses even if it breaks and which maintains its magnetic charge for hundreds of years ... You could pass it on, from father to son for at least 5 generations !! ... An X-PICK IS FOREVER !!!
Sustainable materials
If I have a wider choice of X-Pick packaging, I would like to opt for recycled plastic, always with the round shape of the tactical packaging, and highly sustainable wood, always maintaining this great style of shape ... 

'Cause guys, the Planet really needs it, and if I can do something for mother earth in a small way, I do it more than willingly !!

Hello to all dear Musicians,
the company we collaborate with to create the X-Pick Patent, has taken another little time for the processing of the picks, because as we said the shape is difficult to achieve; in fact, they told us that the only thing that is slowing them down is the realization of the Magnet Tip, because there is no such thing, and therefore they too are inventing a method to make it as sharp, but resistant as possible. updates.update_userinfo: WITH 4 X-PICKS, THE NEW "ALL BLACK" VERSION IS FREE!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone ... We are releasing this update following some requests from many kind backers here on KickStarter and Indiegogo, who have placed multiple orders ...

campaign.story:
Raid is a card game where you build longboats with Viking warrior cards, attack and destroy enemy longboats and deal Raid damage to their village. The game is quick to learn and each round takes about 20 minutes to play for 2—4 players, ages 14 and up.
The team behind Raid also publishes another Kickstarter darling—Beasts of Balance.
In Raid, you take control of a Norse God and draft/draw warriors to your clan. The goal is to build longboats from your warriors, destroy the other player's longboats, and finally raid the other player by sending your warriors to their village. The player with the least amount of Raid damage at the end of the game wins. To further help you defeat your enemies, you can use the God and Rune powers available to you. Go forth and conquer Midgard!
PLAY




This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

Production

Hello Viking Warriors!
While we're all waiting for the delivery of Raid this summer, we have some exciting news to share about another one of our games.
As some of you may know (and others may not), the Modern Games team acquired the hit game Beasts of Balance last April. We have been huge fans of BoB since the early days and are excited to carry this brilliant game forward into the future.

updates.update_userinfo: The Gods in all their Glory!
updates.update_content:
Hello Viking Warriors!!
We've been hard at work with the factory to ensure Raid is the very best it can be when it arrives on your doorstep this summer (currently targeting May/June for deliveries). In fact, since the campaign ended, we decided to upgrade all of the cards from 300gsm Bluecore to 310gsm Ivorycore. This upgrade will apply to all backers, across all versions!
We have also finalized illustrations for all of the God cards which was an unlocked stretch goal during the campaign. Like the rest of the Raid art, they are beautiful.

Hey Viking Warriors!
It's been a minute since our last update, but we've been hard at work prepping and testing the Raid BackerKit survey and illustrating the God cards (Stretch Goal) + prepping all the art for delivery to the factory. More on the latter soon!
In the next day or so, you’ll receive an email from us with a special link to your BackerKit survey. It’s important to respond to your survey as quickly as you can since we need this information to fulfill your rewards.

updates.update_userinfo: We did it, you did it!
updates.update_content:
To the nearly 2500 of you who backed Raid, shared it with friends and family and chatted with us over the past few weeks, thank you, thank you, thank you! We are deeply humbled by your support and kind words.
Now the real work begins as we shift fully into production and fulfillment mode. The good news, we've done this before. This isn't our first rodeo as we've designed and shipped products worldwide. We are currently shipping our other game, Beasts of Balance and its myriad of expansions, across North America and the EU on a daily basis and we will lean into our manufacturing and logistics processes to ensure Raid delivery runs smoothly as well.

updates.update_userinfo: Raid is a game that was designed to travel, while traveling the world
updates.update_content:
Hello Viking Warriors!
To say the Modern Games team loves traveling would be an understatement.
Founders, Justin & Amanda, took their then 2 years old daughter, Zoe, on a multi-country, six week trip through Europe as Justin embarked on the 1500-mile Virgin Strive Challenge in 2016.

Hello! My name is Brennen Peters, the lead game designer on Raid for Modern Games. I wanted to use the Dev Diary as a place to share interesting points about the decisions we made during the creation of the game and also interesting tidbits about how to play well against your enemies!
When to raid, when not to raid
In this first chapter I wanted to talk about the main mechanic that makes Raid special: The trade off mechanic between when to keep a warrior on your longboats and when to send them as raid damage.

Justin & Amanda (two founders of Modern Games) and their daughters + pups had to evacuate their home due to a wildfire in Southern California last Monday. It was dicey for a while and there were hotspots just feet from their home, but the firefighters did a great job and managed to save all the homes and buildings in the area.

campaign.story:
Evolutionary on-screen color grading plugin for Adobe Premiere Pro and DaVinci Resolve on Windows.   

View Press Kit
See what others are saying about Cinema Grade from around the world.
Make changes and corrections directly in the viewer with the industries' only point-and-click grading. More vibrant videos are only a few clicks away.
Matching is so easy! Cinema Grade guides you every step of the way from fixing and matching multiple shots together to applying a final look.
Choose from over 90 look presets based on Hollywood films and organized into categories based on the needs of the story.
Cinema Grade is simple for beginners and powerful for experts.  
Pledge a reward level that suits your needs and shows your level of commitment to the project. 
(Limited quantity for some rewards.)
PLAY



Compare features between different versions at a glance.
 You’re trying to finish a project and make it look awesome. But you’ve got problems. Exposure and white balance is off, shots don’t match and worst of all… the footage just looks boring. We’ve all been there.
But hey you got this… you open up the color tools:
And... 

So what do you do?  You sift through YouTube watching tutorials... then maybe try slapping on a LUT.
You make some progress with the LUT, but then come to find out that shots still don’t match.  
Frustrated you take a break to play with the cat... then only later you realize you've wasted half the day arguing with some random friend of a friend on Facebook.
Does that sound familiar?

Well I'm here to tell you it's NOT your fault. The current grading tools on the market are still based on concepts from the 90's! But it doesn't have to be like this...
There is a better way!
Two years ago Cinema Grade makes its debut and Mac users rejoice!
It's made life easier for filmmakers and has helped them create more beautiful looking videos.
But until now, if you use Windows, you have felt left out...
You have asked us to bring Cinema Grade to Windows, so we are asking you to back us in turning it into a reality. 
Get the same popular features that over 19,000 Mac users rave about.
User-friendly and intuitive, even those new to video software can use it and experts can grade faster.
See blown out highlights and crushed shadows visually.  Just click and drag to fix.
Matching shots is easy in the side-by-side view.  Just copy corrections and tweak.
Grade 3X faster and finish projects on time with step-by-step optimized workflow.
Choose the right look for your project by seeing previews instead of as a list of LUTs. 
Apply the same color palette of your favorite look or film on your project.
Apply auto match corrections if you incorporate Xrite Color Checker Video on shoots.
Just simply drop Cinema Grade onto your clips as an effect. Grade inside Cinema Grade. When finished click "Apply" to apply the results back in your editor.
The Big Picture.
A Closer Look.
Brief explainer video walking you through how it works in your software.
PLAY

Spend less time feeling frustrated with confusing controls and more time creating looks that stand out!
Ten years ago I struggled with an idea. Why aren’t the software tools for color grading easier?
My name is Denver Riddle and I like puppies and warm baths...
Holland in the background where Cinema Grade was born
Just kidding, but seriously, I have a passion for filmmaking and crafting the best looking images that enhance the story.
I feel that color is a big part of achieving this.
Because of my own struggles with color grading early on in my career, I set out to create a roadmap for others in Color Grading Central.
Color grading education and software solutions
But that question continued to linger, "Why isn't there an easier way?" Seeing the limitations in the current software I set out to do something about it.
Early prototype of Cinema Grade in 2017
With a great team of developers we succeeded in creating the most intuitive grading tool on the Mac with Cinema Grade in 2018.
Over the past two years we have been bombarded with people asking for a Windows version.
But in order to bring that idea to life and ensure we can support the demand we need your help.
We are a small team and this will be a new project outside of our Mac development.
If you are willing to support this project we are committed to not resting until we are able to deliver a Windows version of Cinema Grade.
The team is in place and I invite you to be apart of making this evolutionary grading tool available to filmmakers worldwide.

What you can expect for timeline and releases.  We are anxious to get it to you as early as possible but want to make sure we get it right.
Meet the team lead behind making the project a success!
I’ve worn many creative hats over the years. I’ve been a graphic designer, an editor, a vfx artist, a colorist. I fell in love with color grading long before it became accessible to most of us. I might have contributed a tiny bit to their democratization by creating a few plugins for Adobe Premiere Pro that you might actually be using, such as Vignette and Feathered Crop. Some of you might know me from my blog CreativeImpatience.com.
I’ve also been a software engineer, especially for the past four years, when I was designing and developing backend pipelines, data processing solutions and various APIs. A few of you might have seen one of the first CEP panel extensions to Adobe Premiere Pro that I wrote for That Studio, which allowed you to browse, purchase and manage various media assets. I’ve also collaborated with companies such as Filmstro, Zaxwerks, ChyronHego.
Making your workflows simpler and saving you time in post-production is what brings me the most joy and satisfaction. Cinema Grade is a unique product which makes grading accessible to most, and yet goes way beyond just slapping LUTs on your footage. Being able to work on it, first bringing you the up to date Metal version (soon, really soon), and then leading the effort to port it to Windows, has been both an honor and a dream come true.
When I’m not sitting behind the screen, I love traveling, visiting new places and meeting new people.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have an established track record of delivering software products on the Mac side. We do deliver.

That said, due to the nature of the differing technologies between Mac vs PC, Cinema Grade will require a significant rewrite. At the moment only a small portion of its code is cross-platform compatible. We will certainly keep the heart of what make Cinema Grade so awesome - it's overall architecture and algorithms - but leaving Apple sandbox certainly poses a challenge.

On the plus side having an actual finished product (Mac version) as opposed to only going off of a prototype will give us a significant advantage and head start. We have already gained insights into how to work with multiple GPU frameworks during our recent work of porting Cinema Grade to Metal.

Our top priority is to ensure the Windows version provides the same or at least a comparable user experience as the Mac version. It is no small feat to achieve. We have recently researched and identified technologies that can be used to reach this goal, but we need time to familiarize ourselves with them and make sure that we use them to their greatest potential, which always takes time.

Because our development team is small, there is the question of resources. There is always the possibility of personnel changes but if this should happen we are prepared to work night and day until any vacancies are filled.

Additionally it's impossible to predict the actual demand for Cinema Grade on Windows and the realities of business are that this is the main factor that will drive our development efforts. However, the more demand there is, the more developers we can hire in the long run which means we can pursue a more aggressive roadmap of future features.

Lastly we will do our very best to deliver on our projected deadline but as with ALL software development, especially this complex, delivery dates can and do tend to slip (look up Hofstadter's law on Wikipedia). So it's good to be aware of it, hope for the best, but be prepared if the stars do not align, you might need to wait for the final product a bit longer than expected. Our goal is to provide you with tools that work, not tools that crash.

If you are not adverse to trying out new things and like living on the edge, we provide rewards that will give access to beta, so you will be able to see the software being built, and perhaps have some influence on its final shape, but please do not expect to be able to run it without glitches in a production environment until it's released.

Risk Reversal: In the event the project doesn't succeed (absolute worst case scenario) we are prepared to first offer backers a reward in the form of educational training products from the Color Grading Central website at an equal to or greater value pledged. If backer requests refund we are obliged to provide a FULL refund of their pledge.

campaign.story:
In this post-apocalyptic tile stacking strategy game, mutant bees - one of the few surviving species - must feed on enriched uranium to produce honey. Bees with higher radiation exposure are more productive and valuable to the colony. Use your tiles to build honeycombs, increase your bees’ radioactive levels and maximize the number of points you earn to win the crown. 


Players position one of their tiles on the board, keeping within the hive’s pattern. The tiles may be placed in any direction or position.
When players cannot cover any more spaces on the board, the game continues ON TOP of the tiles already in play. There are some simple tile placement rules that everyone must follow.
When all possible moves are exhausted, players mark each of their uncovered bees with a radioactive ring and the round ends.
Players remove all their tiles from the board, keeping the rings acquired on the corresponding tiles, and start a new round.
Players accumulate points during each round when a player’s bees get covered by an opponent’s tile and at the end of the game, by adding up the value of the rings acquired on their bees.
The end of the game is triggered when one or more bees have earned enough radioactive rings to receive radioactive markers and emerge as mutant queens. The players then finish the current round and score points. 
When the final points are scored, the player with the most points  wins the game.

We are confident that our game will do great and are ready for large scale production. That said, and given that this is our first Kickstarter campaign, we developed a conservative budget that allows us to deliver a minimum of 100 game sets.
We calculated this budget based on the Full Edition pledge of $48, which totals $4,800 for 100 units. We set our minimum goal at $5,000 to account for the fees to be charged by Kickstarter and the payment processing provider. In addition to manufacturing - and in the context of the economic downturn caused by the COVID-19 pandemic - this campaign will help fund the salaries of our designers and production staff in Colombia.
We have developed prototypes of the game board and individual pieces. In doing so, we have already addressed critical questions about production, how game pieces fit into each other, their final look and feel, etc. Based on our experience developing these prototypes, we are confident in our ability to ramp up production once we have access to the necessary funds.
We will handle shipping costs through a pledge manager (Gamefound) and they will be charged to our backers after the campaign ends. Please refer to the image above for shipping costs and reach out to us if you have any specific questions regarding shipping.
Radioactive Bees is the brainchild of Jose Luis Navas, a Colombian game designer who has 20 years of experience in advertising, manufacturing and game design. Ruben Ocampo is a Chicago-based innovator and entrepreneur, who has 20 years of experience in product development and business strategy. We met during our university years, when we were pursuing our degree in Industrial Design. We are avid gamers, and our passion is to design games that are fun but also require strategic thinking.
Jose Luis is the creator of the 2009 Mensa Select winning game Stratum (a Family Games Inc. brand). Building on the original idea behind this game, Jose Luis was inspired by beehive patterns in the development of Radioactive Bees. In addition to the element of verticality used in Stratum, Radioactive Bees features new elements, such as the radioactive rings, that add complexity and excitement to the game.
Under normal circumstances production should be completed in 4 months. However, given the current state of affairs and the delays created in worldwide manufacturing systems, we are being conservative on our production and delivery timelines. Below is our timeline of key milestones, from pre-launch promotion through fulfillment.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have over 20 years of experience in design, advertising and manufacturing. None of the production requires special materials, machining or methods, and we are confident in our ability to manufacture and ship the game once the project is funded.

Under normal circumstances we foresee production being completed in 4 months. However, given the current state of affairs and the delays created in worldwide manufacturing systems, we are being conservative on our production and delivery timelines.

Our main risk would the ability to ship worldwide if the challenges that the COVID-19 pandemic are placing on worldwide logistics continue to be in place. However, we are hopeful that by our target delivery date of June 2021 things will be much better.

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We are committed to using durable materials and great design so our gamers value our products and want to take good care for them. We encourage buyers to give away games they no longer play so others can enjoy them rather than throw them away or let them collect dust. And we commit to using our social media channels to collaborate with players to take back games and give them a new home so they are not discarded.
Reusability and recyclability
We are committed to...
- Using recyclable materials to make all our pieces. None of the pieces will combine different materials or be assembled in ways that can't be taken apart for reuse or recycle.
- Reusing production refuse materials to eliminate production waste.
- Taking back games and finding them a new home so they don't end up in landfill.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Indie Boards and Cards has experience in over 50 Kickstarter projects. Our previous success and the assistance and guidance of the experts we are working with will enable us to also deliver this project on time. We have every confidence that Crack the Code will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Indie Boards and Cards will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

EXPECTATIONS
We try to represent what will be included in the project rewards to the best of our ability. While we try to manage the expectations accurately, your expectations may vary and may not reflect what the rewards for this project will include. As an example, we may show a golden miniature - that miniature may be golden in color but it would be a false expectation if you thought that you were going to receive a miniature made of gold. If you asked us, "Is that miniature made of gold?" - we would tell you that it isn't made of gold and you could decide whether pledging was still worth it to you. So we set the expectations as best as possible, but we can't control your expectations - if there is something that you absolutely can't live without and will regret backing this project because it didn't include that one special thing - ask before the project is over. In the long run, this will help us have aligned expectations and make sure that you are satisfied with your rewards when they arrive.

REFUND POLICY
We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds 14 days after the close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS
We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS
If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY
Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello backers! It’s time for the update you’ve all been waiting for. We’re about to give you some updates about your pledges shipping out to you. We’re excited for everyone to get their games to the table so you can have a fun summer!
Regional Updates
North American containers have arrived at our US fulfillment center! Shipments will start going out to US backers shortly. Please be patient if you don’t see your tracking notification right away. Our fulfillment teams are going as fast as they can. Our Canadian backers will have to wait just a bit longer as the US fulfillment center sends the Canadian units north this week- and once the Canadian team has their games they will be sending out to Canadian backers.

Backers! We’re closing in on the moment you’ve all been waiting for - when the fulfillment center gives you that tracking number and the anticipation builds for it to arrive at your door in time for game night! As a reminder, in order for us to both successfully reach that moment you must complete your survey!
Things are coming along quicker than we expected, so this is a quick reminder; the CrowdOx pledge manager closes tomorrow 6/4! This will help us start sending out your games as soon as they show up in the fulfillment centers.
Missing/Damaged Items

Just a real short update - all the games are now on board ships that are steaming towards their fulfillment centers.  With everything going on in supply chain world we weren't sure that this important step would actually happen, but it has.  We'll take all the positive news we can these days!

While we aren't yet ready to say that shipments to you will start sooner than we predicted in our last update - we want to take all the steps we can to make sure we are ready to start sending rewards just as soon as they arrive in our fulfillment centers.  We've cleared the way by reserving time slots with our fulfilment partners so that can happen.  But we need your addresses to get final shipment files.

Hello hackers,
Thank you for your patience. We’ve been hard at work tying up some logistics and shipping stuff. We’re closing in on the end of this campaign and we’ve come a long way, but that doesn’t mean we’re done! There are still a few steps between now and you getting your games.
Over the last few weeks there have been significant delays finding usable containers and space on ships needed to get your games to our fulfillment centers. These are similar to the issues we saw with other projects in February. When we saw a better response from our shipping partners in March, it made us confident that the problem wouldn’t affect us in April or May. But these issues now appear to be cyclical - containers going out in March leaves a shortage in April and May.  And we are seeing for the first time that ships scheduled to leave on a date are being held in the outgoing port because the destination port is congested.

Hackers,

This update is a brief one because all we have to say is; we’re nearing the end! Thank you for your patience.
Printing has been completed. The error that caused our delay has been addressed and we have completed this step in our journey. That means we are marginally ahead of the schedule we set in the last update, but there are still challenges that we are facing with continue global delays in shipping. So while we continue to make progress, the end goal of getting games to you is roughly the same as our last update.

We’re in. We’ve put together a dossier for your perusal. It contains a slightly modified timeline for shipping. Check it out below:
Games ready for pick up: April 26th
Games picked up from the factory: May 10th
Containers arrive at ports: Begins end of May (US/CAN) and will continue through mid-June (EU).
Games arrive at fulfillment centers begins the First week of June through the end of June.

Hello, everyone!

Production is complete! The timeline has shifted slightly, so we wanted to make sure you had the latest.

As you all probably have heard by now, the impact of COVID-19 on the industry in large part has been delays across the board, and they are continuing here in the new year. Additionally, China has been experiencing power outages as factories work extended hours and now a spike in their COVID cases, all of which affects things further. Finally, we are dealing with a severe shortage of containers and space to get containers on ships. These delays, unfortunately, are impacting our original timeline.

campaign.story:
It's five minutes in the future and we've just made first contact. In Xenolanguage, you are a group of scientists tasked with deciphering an alien language. As you uncover meaning, you begin to see the world differently.
A role-playing game to uncover an alien language through a custom channeling board.
Hello from Thorny Games ✨,the award-winning studio that brought you Dialect: A Game about Language and How it  Dies and Sign: A Game about Being Understood. We live for tabletop games that tell epic stories using innovative mechanics. We’re thrilled to share our latest project with you: Xenolanguage.
Xenolanguage is a tabletop role-playing game about first contact with alien life, messy human relationships and what happens when they mix together.  At its core, you explore your pivotal relationships with others on the mission as you uncover meaning in an alien language. The game gives a nod to soulful sci-fi media like Arrival, Story of Your Life and Contact, but tells its own story. It’s a game for 2-4 players in 3-4 hours.
In Xenolangauge, you play as a group of people bound together through a shared past with unsettled questions. Your task is to understand why the aliens have come and what they are trying to tell us. You will soon discover the key to understanding lies in your memories together.
Play centers on The Platform: a custom channeling board of mysterious origin. Players all touch a planchette-like lens and channel over alien symbols as they receive and interpret messages.  As the game unfolds, players will progressively discover meanings for the symbols on the board, grapple with what they learn, and see how it changes them. There are no easy answers here; only unsettling possibilities and the choices you make when faced with the true unknown. 
Xenolanguage uses a modular channeling board of alien symbols and a custom soundtrack to immerse players in the experience of first contact. Symbols are removable and chosen at the start of each game allowing for surprise and replayabity; every session is unique. Includes art by Jason McPhillips and sound design by A Shell in the Pit (Untitled Goose Game, Wandersong) and Eduardo Ortiz Frau (Gorogoa, The Stanley Parable).
Your connections with fellow players drive the game. In Xenolanguage, you will explore who you turn to in moments of doubt and in moments of discovery, what lies beneath your shared memories, and how the bonds of a relationship change under the light of first contact.
In Xenolanguage, you play to fuse the human and the alien together and see how it changes you. The game focuses on three things:
A mysterious platform now sits outside a craft that just landed on Earth. You play as scientists tasked with interpreting an alien language that is transmitted through the Platform. At the start of the game, players define their character based on card prompts including archetypes and their role on the mission.
You create relationships that connect your character to others in the game. Every relationship has a push and a pull — the tension that draws you together and apart. That means that all members of the mission have deep personal ties together.
Your connections drive the game. 

You will play at the Platform, a channeling board covered in alien symbols which you’ll use to communicate with the alien visitors. At the beginning of the game, much is unknown, but as play unfolds you will be led to interpret what they are saying and why they are here.
Two players channel with a prototype board and lens
You will discover meaning through your memories. Beneath every symbol is a private prompt which awakens a memory between characters. You will play out a flashback together and then use the memory to put meaning to a concept that you don’t have easy words for, but that hints at something both human and alien.
All of these memories are rooted in the relationships defined at the start of the game. In this way, your understanding of your past and the semantics of the alien language seep together. Each of these concepts are tied to a particular alien symbol on the board, which you will later use to interpret their message during contact.
Some examples from past games include "secrets kept by the people closest to you", "the veil between perception and reality" and "anxiety of losing joy".
We have been playtesting Xenolanguage far and wide for years. At major gaming conventions from New York, to Indianapolis and Seattle, with friends and strangers, at house cons and online meet-ups. At a beautiful micro-con we co-organized in Olympia, WA. Even once in a Michigan snowstorm. It's been a blast!
Here's a taste of play in action using our digital module.
Here are a few publicly-accessible play reports, interviews and other places we've spoken:
The Vintage RPG Podcast
Ludology Episode: Words at Play
Because Language Podcast: Deep dive into Xenolanguage
Our interview with the RPG Academy
Play Report by Super November Games
Word Play: Language is a treasure box of game design majesty
Developing 'Artifacts of Play' for your Tabletop Games


The theme of first contact is just electric. It scratches at all the big questions and reveals the strange, ridiculous and profound bits of ourselves, too. We have become obsessed with all the angles you can explore in a first contact story. So much so, we want others in on this, too.
Games to Bind Us is a play anthology about first contact with alien life, featuring short stories by a tremendous slate of writers including Hugo and Nebula award winners, along with original games by fantastic designers who push the genre forward. The anthology will showcase beautiful original artwork by Dadu Shin and layout/lettering by Brennen Reece. The cover art imagines what playing cat’s cradle, that oldest of human games, might be like with alien visitors. We’re thrilled by the idea of spotlighting short fiction and story games together that pivot off the same theme of “playful takes on first contact”.


It’s not every project that has such a tremendous slate of contributors. Backing here is your opportunity to get your hands on one of the very first copies of Games to Bind Us - hot off the presses. You'll also get an exclusive first look behind the scenes during development.



At Thorny Games, we live for games that tell epic stories through one of our most intimate tools: language. Our previous games have been meticulously crafted and well-received, garnering multiple Game of the Year titles. Xenolanguage is our latest obsession. The First Contact Play Anthology is a beautiful evolution. We’re sharing them both with you now through this Kickstarter.
Thorny Games is the work of Kathryn Hymes and Hakan Seyalıoğlu.
Kathryn specializes in teaching robots about human language so we can all be friends some day (in other words, a computational linguist). Sometimes she likes to play her fiddle like a drum. Hakan helps computers keep secrets and crack codes (a genuine cryptographer). He really enjoys breakfast. In the past, they both did a lot of math. In the present, they play games, design games and spread the good word about RPG.
Also part of Thorny Games are paradoxical kittens, Banach & Tarski.

Jason McPhillips (Art for Xenolangauge). Symbolist painter Jason E. McPhillips creates enigmatic images inspired by the intersection of myth, perception, and scientific theory. His vibe is an incredible fit for the project, and we're so excited to have him on board. See more of Jason's work here.
Dadu Shin (Art for Games to Bind Us). An atmospheric and versatile artist, Dadu’s art draws a beautiful line between the human and the alien in the play anthology. See more of Dadu’s work here.
Brennen Reece (Layout). Having brought some of the most evocative storygames in recent memory to print - Night Witches, Harlem Unbound, and The Clay That Woke - Brennen’s skills are peerless and we're thrilled to have him on this project. See more of his work here.
Karen Twelves (Editing). Karen is the author of Improv for Gamers published by Evil Hat Production and if you read any amount of indie tabletop, you've probably read Karen's work far more often than you realize. We're thrilled to be working together again. See more of Karen's work here.
Anthology Contributors. A tremendous group of people. They are consummate authors, designers, activists, academics, and humans. Thank you for lending your talents to this project.
With special thanks to Simon Chrisman for the alien hammered dulcimer sonata featured in the video, Sean Gelbaugh for camera work, Aron Hommer for frame design, Eduardo Altarriba for animation, and the LEGIONS of playtesters who have played Xenolanguage across its evolution.

campaign.story:
Please help Dr Finn's Games publish a new expansion pack for The Little Flower Shop and reprint some older promotional packs for this light and breezy card drafting card game. In The Little Flower Shop, you create a beautiful display in your flower shop window.  Before describing the promotional packs available in this campaign, I'll tell you a little about the base game. 
The Little Flower Shop is a simple game to learn, especially if you are already familiar with "pick and pass" card drafting games. Despite its ease of play, you must make a surprising number of interesting decisions.  And, by the end, you'll have a pretty flower shop window to admire.
The game lasts 3 rounds. Players begin each round with 7 cards, they choose 1 to keep and play, then pass the remaining cards to another player.  From the received 6 cards, they choose another and pass the rest. Play continues in this fashion until all cards have been used and a new round begins. The cards include vases, flowers, hanging baskets, money, and orders. The primary goal is to find flowers and vases that match and to earn money to buy and hang baskets. The player who best maximizes their shop window earns the most flower power  and thereby wins the game.
In this campaign, there are 4 different promo packs available: Employee Pack, Potpourri Pack, Mini-Pack, and Flower-Filler Pack. All the promo packs available here are compatible with each other and may be mixed and matched to your liking. 

5th Player Pack Add-On
The game is for 1-4 players, but you can add $12 for a 5th player pack (if you're in the U.S.).  It contains an additional player board, 3 starting vase cards, and additional cards to add to the deck.  If you are outside the U.S., please contact me directly for it, but the shipping alone would likely be more than $20.  The pack itself is $8 + shipping.
Send your employee to the warehouse to grab what you need for your window display! The Employee Pack is a brand new expansion  containing 10 "employee" cards and 2 rule cards. At the start of the game, remove 10 random shop cards and replace them with the 10 employee cards.  With the 10 removed cards, flip 4 of them to make the "warehouse." At the end of each round, players who kept employee cards during the round can now discard them to take a card from the warehouse (and flip a new one to replace the chosen one).  If multiple players have employee cards, they take turns in order on the cards - so watch out that someone else doesn't take the card you were eyeing!
The number 1 employee card
The Potpourri Pack adds an interesting twist with the simple addition of 12 potpourri cards.  At the start of the game, each player receives 3 potpourri cards.  Using the same drafting mechanic as the base game, players pick a card and pass, then pick another and pass.  After the second pass, each player has 3 potpourri cards, which provide opportunities to earn money or increase their flower power.

Some potpourri cards give you specific goals to gain a benefit.  For example, one card says: If you hang 3 baskets during the game, score 1 additional flower power.  Other cards give you a special power, such as: Discard 2 cards and draw 2 cards.
Potpourri cards
The Potpourri Pack is essentially an advanced variant to the base game. Since The Little Flower Shop is best categorized as a "gateway" game (i.e., a good introduction to strategy board games for non-gamers), this variant pack is a perfect next step to introduce more strategic thinking, without overwhelming new gamers.  Of course, The Little Flower Shop is also a fun diversion for those who prefer heavier games, but want a quick gaming experience requiring some interesting decisions.
Important note: the rulebook is provided only in PDF form.
The Mini-Pack is a 4-card expansion that includes 4 copies of the same card (i.e., the "surprise" card). The surprise cards are shuffled into  the shop card deck and mat be pick as normal. Whenever you take a surprise card, you discard it and draw a random card, which you keep and play in its place.
mini-pack

NOTE:  Although the Mini-Pack cards are manufactured by the same manufacturer, there may be some slight differences in card texture and colors, since it is a different print run.  For gameplay, this really should not make a huge difference. A discerning eye might be able to see that one of these cards is in a hand, but because all the cards are continually passed, it's does not have any real strategic impact. Also, just remember this is a light and fun game!
The Flower-Filler Pack was offered during the original campaign for The Little Flower Shop. The pack has 8 cards: 4 flower bonus cards, 3 filler bonus cards, plus 1 rules card.  At the game's start, a bonus card of each type is flipped showing the popular flower and filler for the game. Players score bonus flower power for displaying the popular flowers and fillers in their windows. 
Flower-filler pack
None of the packs have proper packaging.  They are mailed together in a protective plastic sleeve (similar to a baseball card protector), so they are not loose. For the packs, then,  you are receiving just the cards with no packaging.
The Little Flower Shop has received very positive reviews from well-established game reviewers, as seen below.
All items will be shipped from the U.S.  Packs are mailed through U.S. postal service first class mail, while the Little Flower Shop games will be through Amazon. 

For those outside the U.S. - I apologize that the base game is not available to you;  the shipping charges are just too high.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Please read carefully before backing this project.

NO PLEDGE MANAGER
Dr. Finn will not be using a pledge manager for this campaign. All information will be collected through the Kickstarter surveys after the campaign and a system for payment for late add-ons may be created through Dr. Finn's Games' website.

PRODUCTION RISKS
Game manufacturing and publishing contains a number of risks. For this project, the greatest risks follow from the fact that the packs will be manufactured in China and shipped to the U.S. The most serious threats in this regard concern quality control over the manufacturing and delivery delays. Dr. Finn's can mitigate both of these concerns. First, I will be using a manufacturer who has produced great results on projects in the past. Second, I have successfully completed almost all of my Kickstarter campaigns right on time or even early (only 1 project was a few weeks late). If any delays do unexpectedly occur, backers will be notified promptly.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS
If you receive any rewards that are missing items, please contact me at doctorfinns@gmail.com and replacements will be promptly shipped. If the item arrives damaged, you'll receive replacements for whatever is damaged. Please send along a picture, as I may be able to get reimbursed from the shipper. For the past few projects (after switching manufacturers and shipping companies), we've had a very low defect rate (less than 1%).

REFUNDS
Refunds are not given, unless there is a failure to deliver the items you've requested. However, if you are completely unsatisfied with any game, please contact me and we can discuss it.

DELIVERY DATE
Unlike many Kickstarter campaigns, Dr. Finn's Games has a great track record of being on time. Of course, unexpected things happen and there is chance that the game will not be shipped on time. I will keep you updated if the unexpected happens.

UNDELIVERED ITEMS
If you provide an incorrect address or fail to update your address and a shipment is returned, it is your responsibility to pay for the re-shipment. If the items are lost as a result, you would also need to pay for the items.

SHIPPING
Please read the shipping section in the campaign page.

UPDATES
After this campaign you may receive updates on Dr. Finn's Games' other projects. However, such updates will be infrequent.

By backing this project, you acknowledge and accept the risks and challenges just stated.

Thanks! Dr. Finn's Games

FedEx Freight has had them for over a week, but they did not have the freight trucks (because the packs are with a pallet of other games) available for residential delivery until tomorrow.  They are packaged together, so each pack must be manually separated, which will take a couple of weeks. Then, they need to be put into envelopes (also a manual process).  I believe they should start being mailed out in about 2 weeks.  For those outside the US, note that all packs are coming from the US in the mail.

Hi, all,
I wish this update was to give you good news, but the news is  worse than I had anticipated.  After speaking with the freight forwarder, the port of Los Angeles is insanely congested and the container holding the games and the card packs is buried in a stack of containers.  I was told it might not move for 30 days.  This would mean delivery to you in May, if all else goes well.

Hi all,
A quick update on the shipping of the Little Flower Shop promo pack. Unfortunately, COVID has been causing serious delays in all aspects of freight transportation, so my 2021 line of games is stuck in a container in California awaiting to be loaded on the train. It's been sitting there for a week.  My freight forwarder is having a difficult time finding out when it will be loaded.  Sorry for the delay, but this year, as you might expect, is just not normal.

Hello backers of the Little Flower Shop employee pack,

A quick update on the shipping situation.  U.S. ports are really overloaded and it is causing some delays.  As of now, the ship carrying the promo packs is set to arrive in California on Feb 2.  However, this may be delayed.  From there, it is going on a train to Chicago, then on a truck to Michigan, then on another truck to me.  We are still probably about 6-8 weeks from the packs arriving to me.  From there, it will then be about 2-3 weeks of preparing and mailing the packs.    The original delivery date was supposed to be in February, but I think it will be March.  To be sure, this will be only the second time I've had a late Kickstarter out of 20+ campaigns.  Given the COVID situation, I probably should have given an extra cushion.

campaign.story:
Meet TUSHÉ, the modern wet wipe technology. Sophisticated, simple to use, sustainable, and more sanitary than dry toilet paper – we are upgrading your bathroom experience. With its premium engineered components and modern minimalist appearance, TUSHÉ is a product for anyone and everyone. The result is a refreshing, hygienic experience that can be used inside the comfort of your home.
TUSHÉ is truly the best solution for wet wipes. Our touchless technology dispenses a luxurious foam onto your toilet paper, giving you an eco-friendly, natural, and flushable way to clean your tushie. Developed for the healthy, hygiene-conscious, and eco-responsible lifestyle, TUSHÉ increases personal cleanliness and reduce the environmental burden of outdated wet wipes.    
We have reinvented the wet wipe into something that is more sustainable and hygienic for you as well as our planet. It is our mission to positively impact the environment while also enhancing people’s lifestyles.
What's wrong with using a wet wipe?
Most wet wipes are made of Polyester, a form of plastic that sheds fibers as it slowly degrades into smaller particles, polluting our land, rivers, and oceans. 
Other wet wipes are made from "regenerated cellulose," which includes materials like Tencel, Viscos, Rayo, and Lyocell. While these products are marketed as "eco-friendly," the truth is that we still don't fully understand how these processed materials do or don't biodegrade in the natural environment.
All wet wipes are made of cloth-like materials, compared to toilet paper they are significantly thicker. Toilet paper will quickly breaks down in your septic system which means it won't be left in landfills or enter our oceans. 
WE CAN DO BETTER! WE ARE CHANGING OUR BOTTLES:
Our mission is to reduce plastic waste by eliminating single-use plastic wet wipes. Due to the large minimum order quantities, we are financially limited as a small business to pursue more eco-friendly options for our packaging. While our bottles are 100% recyclable plastic, our next step will be developing and transitioning to more innovative, environmentally-friendly alternatives. 
Stop flushing your money down the toilet!
Looking at the graph above, we are wiping out the competition in all categories. There is no other wet wipe on the market that is eco-friendly, natural, flushable, and offers more bang for your buck than TUSHÉ.
Every starter kit includes a dispenser, cleansing foam, wall attachment, and USB charging cable. After the campaign ends, you'll receive a survey that allows you to add more bottles of our cleansing foam to your order.  
MORE COLORS, NO PROBLEM!
WE HAVE REACHED OUR STRETCH GOAL. You will have the option to choose between two colors: pearl white or charcoal grey. In the future, we hope to expand our dispenser variations to meet all of your diverse aesthetic needs.


Our TUSHÉ dispensers are designed to be compact and versatile. Dispensers can be placed anywhere in the bathroom of your choosing. Our favorite location? Right next to the toilet paper for easier access. 

 Our estimate for standard shipping charges is based on the expected volume of our campaign and is subject to change depending on the final result. These charges may also change if you add more products during the survey process such as extra bottles of cleansing foam. We want to keep this process as simple, transparent, and accurate as possible.
Customs, Duty, and VAT charges: in some cases, international backers will be required to pay additional fees. As these are beyond our control, it will be the backer's responsibility to cover these fees once they have received the selected reward. Any questions regarding this additional charge should be addressed directly with the backer's customs office.


At TUSHÉ, we are a team of dreamers and entrepreneurs focused on making the world a better place. Our mission is to reduce and replace single-use plastic wet wipes. We can sh*t on wet wipes but it doesn't mean that they should be sh*tting on our planet! With your help, we can wipe the world clean! Touché ;)


For the last two years, our team has worked to bring you the perfect TUSHÉ. Our goal was to deliver a simple design that is visually appealing in any bathroom. We are so appreciative of our incredible production team for their help throughout the entire process. In addition to avoiding any harmful ingredients, we have implemented countless butt-wiping tests to ensure that our formula is 100% safe for daily use. We are excited to share TUSHÉ to the world and replace the outdated wet wipe FOREVER!

Can you perform under pressure and compete with the other artists to be the first to finish your scheme?"

Swatch is a tabletop game for 1-4 players. Players draft cards that collect and trade colour tokens to make swatch (colour) cards and create their colour scheme. The first player to complete their scheme with the least colour tokens left is the winner!

About Minerva Tabletop Games
Minerva is a one-man operation in Croydon, South London, ran by me, Scott James. I have a degree in Design and work full time in Marketing which allows me to cover all bases required to bring projects such as Swatch to life. I previously worked as Social Media Manager for miniature wargaming company Hawk Wargames and as a Partner with East Street Games developing Robot Royale and Mob Sitters, before designing Swatch at the beginning of 2019. I hope to publish other designers' work under the Minerva brand as well as my own, depending on Swatch's success.
Swatch began as a design challenge I set myself for Uncon 2019 in Kent, which quickly took on the colour mixing theme due to my background. I have since taken it to further Uncon events as well as exhibiting at Tabletop Scotland, Dragonmeet, Handycon and Airecon. Originally called CMYPlay, Swatch has been playtested extensively at Playtest UK events including the regular sessions I run at The Ludoquist in Croydon. I designed a game I wanted to play, a perfectionist's challenge/nightmare (depending on how you see it) that plays in under an hour but with a complexity dependant on how efficient I wanted to be, scratching that eurogame itch.

campaign.story:
Photos by Small Fries Games
Meet Mikro and Chip. Back in the 80s they were brand new and exciting to their tech nerd fans. Now they find themselves in a dusty old box. No one has use for their archaic technology, but they will also never throw them away.
 We can all take a lesson from Mikro and Chip who instead of letting their fate get them down have invented games to play together using their own memory stacks. Rather than worrying about the future they while away their hours playing games and entertaining each other, they’d love to play their favourite game with you - Mini Memory Mischief.
This Kickstarter campaign is to fund "Mini Memory Mischief" the sweet, retro, quite nerdy little mint tin game. It's 2 player and takes about 10-15 minutes to play. In the game players are trying to get letters in alphabetical order on their memory stack. It’s not as easy as it sounds though! The other player can take their chance causing 'mischief' with your stack.
This game is not strictly a 'memory game' - memory is the theme of the game as it is played on Mikro and Chip's internal memory stacks. The game includes dice for luck, player choices using your heart action tokens for strategy, and despite not being a specific memory game does have mechanics that test your own memory (not just the digital kind) and cute little components that fit well in their tiny mint tin home. You can take the game with you as it fits nice and neatly in your pocket.
You have a memory stack, an action board and a shield to keep prying (or even peeking) eyes off of your letters. Your goal is to get as many letters in alphabetical order on your memory stack as possible. Push letters you want, pop letters you don’t want. Easy, right? But there’s more, the letters you have are random, some actions are blocked each turn and your opponent can also cause mischief by pushing and popping on your stack. If you take the chance to peek at their letters you can use them as if they were your own, so long as you can remember what you’ve seen.
What’s Mini about Mini Memory Mischief?
The game and its components are very little and all fit in this mint tin, which then fits in your pocket. Being so small you might think it would be fiddly but it’s been tested by some of the clumsiest people I know and it still plays well. Here’s a good idea of the scale next to a card from Tri To Win (which are the size of standard poker cards).
Since the components are super small to fit in their mint tin home this game is not suitable for small children and as I'll be putting the games together at home, they will not be lab tested so the label on the game will say it's for ages 14+.

What about the Memory part?
There are two sides to the ‘memory’ of the game. The game itself is played on memory stacks (see nerdy details below for more on this). You will also need to use your own memory for the game; whenever you ‘peek’ at your opponent’s letters you’re allowed to use their letters as if they were your own, but only if you can remember what you have seen.

What’s all this about mischief?
For added fun, using the mischief action in the game means you can push unwanted letters onto your opponent’s stack or pop off the last letter they pushed. Be tactical and use this to your advantage.
Full Instructions
Mini Memory Mischief is super nerdy but you don’t have to be a nerd to love it. However, for those of you who would like to know more detail: Mini Memory Mischief uses a Last In First Out (LIFO) memory stack of 8 bytes, counting from 0-7 (as all counting in computing is started at 0). Each letter or char is one byte stored in each memory location. The ‘push’, ‘pop’ and ‘peek’ actions are all operators that you can use on a memory stack. ‘Mischief’ however was entirely invented to make the game more fun and to allow for more player interaction.
In a standard game of Mini Memory Mischief, the dice and heart action token colours will be a random selection. If you would like to choose which colours the two dice and two action tokens will be there is a reward tier for a custom game of Mini Memory Mischief.

I watch my cat Captain very closely with it, as I worry that he'll bite off one of the dots. It isn't weighted evenly to be used as a real die either. Atikin Games is an indie tabletop games publisher and very much a one woman show. It's just me, Nikita, hi! All the game design, art, writing, etc for my games is done by me. I'm very proud of my work and love the board gaming community and being a part of it.

I run The Indie Tabletop Newsletter which is full of news from other indie designers and is released once a month. And I regularly host #boardgamerslift's over on Twitter on a Sunday.

There are some very important additions to my team for whom Atikin Games wouldn't be the same without:

There's Captain; he's the Atikin Games mascot and even has his own page on the website. He's a wonderful mascot and a great therapy cat for when times are tough. He's also very good at testing the durability of a game.

My husband is always my first play tester, and then another close family friend helps as well so that I can iron out any possible problems and strengthen the game before play testing with a larger audience.
So far I’ve created 3 games, and I love them all. If you’ve read this far you’ve probably heard enough about Mini Memory Mischief for now so here are the others.
Photos by Small Fries Games
Tri To Win – is a triathlon themed card game that I funded on Kickstarter back in February this year. It’s for 2-6 players and tonnes of fun for friends and family. You build up the skills of your athletes whilst building the race course together and then racing on essentially the board game you’ve just built out of cards.
Small Fries Games Review
Amazon Reviews
Boardgamegeek Reviews

Malum Hortus – is currently in development and already has a fan base all of its own. It’s a much bigger board game with a horror theme and some wonderful artwork. It’s a 1-4 player co-operative game, you play as nymphs trapped in and trying to escape an evil garden that’s beautiful by day and dreadful at night. I hope to be able to kickstart it next year.

Better Packaging, Epic Sleeves.   Welcome to Season 3!  If you haven't heard of us, check out the amazing reviews, feedback and testimonials HERE.  We have now had over 2,000 backers from more than 30 countries and their feedback speaks for itself.  We have improved packaging and all new sleeve sizes by popular request.
