campaign.story:
YOU WILL CHOOSE YOUR EDITION WHEN I SEND THE SURVEY MID JUNE 2020 (English/German/Spanish)
As a Free Captain of the Rim you roam the far reaches of space as a trader and mercenary. Secretly though, you are an agent of the Intergalactic Council sent on a clandestine mission to explore planets infiltrated by three alien races known as The Red Hegemony who plan to invade the peaceful worlds of Intergalactic Alliance. 
Find all their world-shattering Super Weapons, using your Combat Skills, Diplomacy, and Super Science, and stop them before it is too late!
Pulp Invasion is a game designed by Todd Sanders for 1–2 players that lasts 30 minutes.
For Italian backers, please click below to be linked to our Italian partner. 
Pour la version FR, il faut cliquer sur le lien suivant, c'est Philibertnet qui s'en occupe bien évidemment ! 
Pulp Invasion is the second game in the "Pulp" series. We managed to obtain the rights to use an amazing array of 75 pulp magazine covers, so that we can dress this game in the period apparel that it deserves.
Galaxy/Astonishing magazines covers
The game is played in a series of rounds. The core mechanism is a bag builder (like a deck building game but with cubes) Each round has two phases:
 Encounter: During this phase you will explore several planets, meet Guardforces, Agents and Events. You need to resolve each card with only 2 Actions - Engage or Evade. Both actions are necessary to removes cubes from the bag you do not want, and draw the cubes you need at the end of the Encounter Phase.
 Planet Search: Now that you have scoured the planets from its dangerous inhabitants, you have the opportunity to find a Super Weapon by drawing cubes from the bag. The better you have played during the Encounter phase, the more chance you will have the find the Super Weapons needed to win the game.
In Pulp Invasion, you play a Captain with a crack crew and ship! The base game contains 6 captains which are a gauge of replayability!
The dice in Pulp Invasion are resource trackers, tracking the special actions of your ship and its crew. SO they are never rolled. We decided to make them embossed with white icons. 

3 races of Aliens are preparing to invade the peaceful worlds of the Intergalactic Alliance. They are already infiltrated everywhere and will influence the actions you take when you set foot on the different planets. Hurry and discover the Super Weapons in order to thwart their demonic plans ...

Because Todd Sanders, the designer is an unstoppable fountain when he starts designing, we decided to release the Pulp Invasion X1 expansion at the same time: More adventurers to explore the new planets with and new Alien allies to beat, plus the 2 Player variant...


You can download the English rules HERE , the French rules ICI, and the Spanish rules HERE
English rules of the extension HERE,  règles en FR de l'extension HERE and the Spanish rules of the extension HERE. 

 The replayability of the game is immense and comes from several factors:
the Abilities of the 6 Captains of the base game coupledwith the choice of Action dice with special icons.
the order of appearance of the Aliens who will influence one of the 3 Encounter decks.
the order of the Encounter cards in each deck allows you to vary the Engage and Evade Strengths of those begns you encounter.
The understanding of the Super Weapons also influences the game.
The level of difficulty of the game you choose during setup.
the order of appearance of the Planets to explore and the Location cards will allow you, the Captain, to never play two games in a row with the same path in the Intergalactic Universe ...
And if all that was not enough for you, because I know that it is not enough for you, the X1 extension cards add more!
As a big fan of Pulp magazines, the stunning illustrations give a unique look to the Pulp Invasion game, as we dive into the Golden Age of Science Fiction. The talent of the illustrators of the time is highlighted thanks as we travel from planet to planet (and never in the same direction), in order to discover, how to use and understand the far futuristic Super Weapons!
Encounter card
The bag seeker mechanism is dusted with the very simple choice of only 2 perfectly balanced actions, each having an advantage and a disadvantage.
The management of your special abilities as a space adventurer is crucial. The basic game contains 6 Captains with a varied combinations of actions.
Captain card
The original 5 embossed dice (6 with the extension X1) used as an action tracker make the games strategically controllable.
The choice of difficulty levels in the game help you familiarize you with the actions.
We'd love for you to try Pulp Detective Invasion before you back the campaign! The game has been implemented on Tabletopia, and you can play for free here:
The game is balanced as it is. Adding more stretch goals is dangerous and increases the production time, making it unpredictable at the end.
The box already has all the components required to play the game, and they are the best quality possible. Moreover, more SGs multiply the number of mistakes during the fulfillment process, and they prevent us from perfectly planning the shipping costs of the game. Nobody likes mistakes.
More Captains, or More Aliens and Planet cards would be awesome to add though...
AVStudioGames PLUS represents the games I like, with a strong theme and gorgeous graphics.
Pulp Invasion is very different from Pulp Detective, but still in the Pulp Universe. It will be the second game in the series: Both games are more accessible than the games I tend to design and usually release under the AVSG label. But we are a single-man company and my games are not distributed by major distributors. I don't use Kickstarter as a pre-order platform; I use Kickstarter to fund my games.
If you pledge now, you help me to fund the game, which won't exist without your assistance.
You will choose the version you want when I send the survey to collect the shipping address, easy!
Todd Sanders lives in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where he works as a graphic designer, publisher and furniture maker. He has a great renown as a solo board game designer and is also a friend! 
I have designed and developed several boardgames during the last 10 years such like - Clinic Deluxe Edition, Tramways, Small City, Card City XL, Town Center - and many expansions for these games.
Being an unconditional fan of Pulp Magazines, I was immediately hooked by Todd's game. The graphics remind me of my collection of books and magazines from this golden age of Science Fiction!
Like our past campaigns for games such as Pulp Detective, Tramways, the Tramways Expansions, Card City XL, we have respected the delivery time, and in some case, boxes were even delivered earlier than expected (depending on how complex production of the game has been).
We expect the game to be ready for December, the embossed dice are the most complex part of the components to produce, and samples of them are already in process.
Please read the table to know the exact shipping costs that will be charge during the payment process: no surprise !
All pledges can be refunded in full up to 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign.
If you apply for a refund more than 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter, we will only be able to refund 80% of your pledge. The difference is the amount of the unrecoverable fees paid to process your order through both Kickstarter and our partners.
Once we have started to process and pack your order, refunds may no longer be available.

campaign.story:
Series One from The Magic Puzzle Company is a set of three new 1,000-piece jigsaw puzzles with original art and a magical surprise at the end.
We set out to create the most entertaining jigsaw puzzle you’ve ever done by combining the traditional jigsaw puzzle experience with ideas from the worlds of tabletop games and magic.
We commissioned incredible, original art from independent artists, designed from the very beginning to be used in a jigsaw puzzle
We designed a surprise ending using techniques from optical illusions and magic that adds an extra experience to the end of the puzzle
Each puzzle has over 50 easter eggs to find as you solve (and they come with a guide to help)
Each puzzle is 28" x 21", and has 1000 pieces. That's about 4% larger than the normal size of a 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle.
We imported the highest-quality puzzle cardboard in the world (1.9mm Eska "blue" stock) from the Netherlands and invented some new printing techniques so the pieces snap together and stay snapped
These puzzles have been extensively playtested to make the experience as smooth and engaging as possible from the moment you open the box to the moment you place the last piece of the last segment
When you're done with the puzzle, everything can be reset and all of the secret compartments close back up with velcro so you can share the puzzle with a friend or solve it again later.
No puzzle dust!!
Puzzle Art
Most puzzles start with stock art of some trees or cats or something. We wanted each of our puzzles to make a fantastic, tiny world. And we wanted the art to tell a story as you solve it. So we worked closely with independent artists like Sarah Becan, Boya Sun, and Felicia Chiao to create beautiful one-of-a-kind puzzle images loaded with tiny details, story quirks, and easter eggs.
"The Happy Isles" by Sarah Becan
"The Mystic Maze" by Boya Sun
"The Sunny City" by Felicia Chiao
Custom Dielines
To make the magical ending work right, we had to customize the shape of every single piece in all three puzzles. While we were at it, we also made sure that the individual puzzle-piece shapes highlighted the cool art details instead of cutting them in half.
Jigsaw puzzles start as one big piece of cardboard, and then a specially designed cutting tool called a die comes down like a stamp and slices it into a thousand pieces.
The die for the "Happy Isles" puzzle
Usually, the tolerance for that slice is about 3mm. But to pull off the magical ending in our Series One puzzles, we needed a 0.5mm tolerance. Nobody had done that before, so we had to work closely with our puzzle factory create new quality-control and die-cutting techniques to make it happen. Some of the roughly 3,000 blades that make up our dies actually had to be precise to within 0.1mm — 30 times more precise than a regular puzzle. 
An excerpt from Simon’s briefing for the puzzle factory
 One of the nice side effects of making a more precise die and using super high-quality puzzle cardboard is the pieces click together in a really satisfying way and stay together even if you need to move the puzzle.  
 Magical Surprise 
It’s always exciting to pick up a new puzzle with an image you like and then open the box and start putting together the corners and edges. But after a while, you get to the part of the puzzle where you need to assemble 400 pieces of blurry sky. And then when the puzzle's about 75% done, that feeling of “what am I doing with my time” creeps in. Eventually the last piece finally goes in and the puzzle is over. We’ve always found that part a little anticlimactic.
So we came up with a whole new way for a puzzle to end. When you place the last piece of what you thought was the end of the puzzle, you unlock a whole new part of the experience — a final act that includes both a magical illusion and a completion to the puzzle's narrative. We playtested these puzzles hundreds of times with people all over the world to figure out how to make this special ending as clear and engaging as possible, and we hope you're going to love it.

campaign.story:
Blinks is the world's first smart tabletop game system. 1,135 backers brought it to life on Kickstarter in 2018. We've now shipped over 15,000 Blinks games, sold out at every major convention, and now we're back with more games!
clips of just 6 of the games taking tabletop to the next level
We've curated the top 6 games from our community of game designers. All six knocked our socks off! These designers harnessed the technology to create truly original games. You'll put your reflexes to the test, battle with your wits, and ambush your best friends.
After 6 years of development, Blinks are finally ready for you!   
 What previous Kickstarter backers are saying
“They are absolutely amazing! My brother is hooked on puzzle 101 and since i have 12 blinks i can have two people do two puzzles, it has been a fantastic experience, kids and adults all love them, thanks again i really couldn't be happier. PS- Flic Flop is a riot!" - Leonard R.
“Got my set over the weekend and we haven’t stopped playing. Really addictive games and my kids love them. Thanks for all the great games” - Tim B.
"Blinks is a definite winner." - Tina Roth-Eisenberg 
Each Blink is a game piece and a game cartridge
Can teach other Blinks how to play
There is no limit to the number of Blinks you can play with
Blinks stow in a little Sushi Roll carry case, Yum!
Darkball
by Che-Wei Wang  
Darkball is a first of its kind game in which players put their timing to the test against a speedy disappearing ball and each other. Darkball rewards accuracy, reaction times, as well as creativity. As the pieces are rearranged, the ball can travel in any direction, and down any path with no limits to the number of players or ways it can be played. 



Paintbrush
by Carol Mertz and Mary McKenzie
Paintbrush is a deeply strategic game with pieces act as both brush and canvas. Players take turns rearranging the dynamic pieces to spread their color onto as many blank canvasses as they can. Simple mechanics mean the game can be picked up easily, but the strategic depth allows for repeated play and the possibility of mastery. 



Group Therapy 
by Brett Taylor
Separate the introverts. Cluster the extroverts.
Can't we all just get along?! It's your job to get these Blinks what they need most: extroverts want neighbors, introverts need their space.  It's a focused frenzy for one or many!


Reactor
by Aaron Santiago and Spencer Kee  
Reactor is an intense and competitive contest where each player must react to the alarms of the reactor core before their opponents by buzzing in before anyone else.  Reactor takes inspiration from competitive fighting games, and distills them down to an intense contest of reflexes and concentration.


RAID
by Mark Mayer and Justin Baker
RAID places you in command of a viking horde, competing with other players to grab as much territory as you can. It's an intense game of strategy and prediction, as each player secretly inputs orders into the AI-powered Blinks game pieces, then watches as skirmishes play out in real time.



Pirates & Lasers
by Theo Johnson, Ian Cummins, Priscilla McGann, and Michael Cooper 
Pirates & Lasers is a strategic struggle between ghost pirates and incompetent laser-wielding tourists. Keep the ship sailing as long as you can while lasers tear your ship asunder, managing resources and preventing damage to critical areas.

Growing Game Library
You are backing much more than just the latest 6 games. We've produced 14 others others in the Core and Expansion Sets. These games have been to all of the major game conventions, and were labeled the top 10 games at E3 in 2019, then subsequently sold out until now!
Core Set
Fracture is a new kind of territory control game where players fracture and rebuild the entire board on each turn. From a simple set of rules emerge surprisingly complex strategies.
Berry – Blue. Red. Yellow. Make all Blinks one color on your turn or be the first to score 10 points and you win. This unique strategy game favors the clever and punishes the greedy.
Bomb Brigade is a tense, high-stakes game of chance where players must rely on their quick reflexes and courage to survive. There is really only one rule: don’t blow up.
Puzzle101 – INFINITE PUZZLE FUN Challenge yourself or work with friends to solve an endless supply of self-generating puzzles! A terrific way to break from your screen and improve your spatial reasoning skills.
Wham! – DEFEND THE GARDEN  Set up your garden in any size and shape, then defend it from pesky moles who are up to no good. How long can you keep the increasingly aggressive pests at bay? Show them who's garden it really is
Mortals – BATTLE ZOMBIES & THE CLOCK Be the final survivor in this post-apocalyptic action game. On a dying planet, two teams battle the clock, stealing time from each other. It’s the final countdown... and watch out for the Zombies!
Expansion Set
Astro - FRENZIED SPACE RACE An asteroid field rich with rare space ore awaits you. Can you collect enough to fill your cargo hold before your competition does? This action-packed space adventure will get your jets going.
FlicFlop - It's shuffleboard from the future! Flick your Blinks across the table to score points, and take advantage of your opponent's mistakes to further your lead. You'll need accuracy, timing, and finesse to win this kinetic tabletop game.
Speed Racer - GO GO GO Your car is speeding down the road to nowhere. You’ve got to keep building as fast and furiously as you can, or you’re headed for a dead end. How long can you last in this endurance challenge?
Honey - HIVE'S A'BUZZIN This idle puzzle game challenges you to create the most optimum hive for your bees. The right combination of flowers, worker bees, and broods will keep the hive buzzing and the queen happy.
ZenFlow - RELAX Sometimes you need to relax and bliss out at your desk. Be mesmerized by swirling colors and patterns as Blinks share their happiness. Witness emergent behaviors and find your zen.
Widgets - UPGRADE YOUR GAME NIGHT  The Blink becomes your favorite new game accessory! Light up your game night, whether for Blinks games or not. Need to roll dice, but don't have the space? Use the dice widget. Settle the score with a coin flip. Spin your own wheel of fortune. You could even use these widgets to invent your own game!  We've created 3 unique games with use widgets: Takeway Dice, Spinomino, Flip Bet 
Let's make this easy! Blinks come in packs of 6 games, the more Blinks you have, the more games you can play... Also more Blinks makes each game bigger and better. As of this Kickstarter, there are now 3 sets to choose from, no need to choose now, you'll get to select which sets you are getting in the pledge manager after the campaign.  

Shipping Fees
To simplify the fulfillment process, all shipping fees will be collected in BackerKit. We know you'll want to add lots of goodies after the Kickstarter campaign and this way we can simply calculate one shipping fee. Note that customs may apply for some destinations. 
Retailers
We love brick and mortar game stores and want to help you make Blinks a part of your magic circle. Lock in discount pricing for Kickstarter by pledging at any level on the campaign and gaining access to the pledge manager.
Blinks Game Mats
A number of the Blinks games have matching game mats that can be ordered following the campaign as well. They keep your Blinks in mint condition and we were surprised to see just how much they add to the gameplay.
Custom art game mats designed by the game designers, available in our pledge manager and for order after the campaign
Make Your Own Games
All tiers can purchase Developer Tools offered after the Kickstarter and in the pledge manager.  Blinks is open-source software and hardware and we are dedicated to a strong developer community. In fact, that's how all 6 of the Community Set games were made. 
Want to learn to code? This is a great way to get started and one of the most supportive communities of developers ever. Blinks are based on the ubiquitous Arduino platform, and has you saying Hello World in 15 minutes. Developer and consumer Blinks are exactly the same hardware.
Share your love for Blinks with friends and family by sharing the link and text below or write your own.  We wouldn't be here without you and it's awesome to have you with us.

The only thing cooler than Blinks themselves is the team and community behind them. Blinks is a product of curiosity, exploration and excitement from the design, tech, and gaming communities. From workshops at Maker Faires to game jams with Playcrafting, IndieCade, and the NYU Game Center, lots of people have been brought together by Blinks.
Kickstarter Video by Tom Caswell
And More...
Nick Bentley, Luis Rodriguez, Diana Peterson, Lingyi Rose, Justin Lamb, Nick Soni, Winston Struye, Shiyun Liu, Justin Ha, Kris Atanasoski, Junege Hong, Armin Minassian, David Khananov, Pedro Benitez, Andrew Saldivar, Xiao Yang Feng, Bill Cowles, Sophie Lefebvre, Celia Pearce, Em Lazer-Walker
 While at the MIT Media Lab in the Playful Systems group, I was researching emergent behavior, complex systems, and cooperation. I was simulating natural systems such as swarm behavior like a flock of birds, ant colonies, or fireflies and forest fires. I designed little hexagonal tiles that could think for themselves, respond to touch, and communicate with each other.
My fellow lab mates asked if they could design games for the platform. I agreed to a short game jam session and in under 3 hours, we had designed the first game for Blinks, Fracture. It went on to be a finalist at IndieCade. This is how it all began.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've run 4 successful Kickstarter campaigns and delivered above and beyond on each and every one. Our last campaign for Blinks was by far the most ambitious, with everything built from the ground up, and I can proudly say, the hardest part is behind us. We have the world's best toy manufacturer producing our parts and a supply chain that has been through thick and thin. We've built to tolerances that simply put, look beautiful and feel great. And most importantly, we are adding slack so that we can scale quickly. It probably means more to hear from one of our previous backers so feel free to read the hundreds of comments on our previous campaigns, here is one I think captures it nicely:

"Got mine in California and you guys knocked it out of the park with this product!! From package to product to overall experience, this is truly one of those rare cases where a maker can out-Apple Apple by giving more attention to detail than any large company can."

"Thank you Jonathan & Move38 Team for this piece of great product. Thanks to you I will still believe that Kickstarter projects can be achievable. You all made a really good job!!!" 

In short, this product is already designed and tested and now it only gets cooler because the new games are new software, and while I would typically not be caught dead saying "software is easy," I will say, I think at this point, it is much easier than the hills we've climbed to bring a new and unusual game system into the world.

From a small group of incredibly dedicated people, working with some of the most talented people I've ever met, we achieve a lot, do it with transparency and would love to have you join us.

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Blinks have been designed to be cherished as beautiful design objects to be held in the hand. They come with a protective carrying case or "Sushi Roll" that keeps you from losing your Blinks in addition to keeping them in great condition. The games are designed to last until the end of time, just like traditional board games before them, but far sturdier than paper or cardboard.
Reusability and recyclability
Beyond the bullet-proof materials that create the durable enclosure for Blinks, they are open-source and reprogrammable. Blinks can be used to play the games they know and games that haven't even been invented yet. Tired of Blinks being Blinks? No prob, you can use the Arduino IDE to turn your Blinks into your very own smart device.
Sustainable materials
Blinks packaging is made entirely of biodegradable materials, specifically paper pulp and paper products instead of the all too common plastic inserts or blister packaging.

updates.update_content:
Hello Chai family! 😃
Hope everyone has been enjoying the lovely weather and some 🎲 games lately! We’ve been playing Welcome To Las Vegas, Burgle Bros., and Railroad Ink. We were also excited to celebrate 🌍 International Tea Day 🍵 yesterday on Friday, May 21! As Connie is avoiding caffeine right now with our baby on the way, we opted for a 🫖 teapot full of “Forever Nuts” (almonds, apples, beetroot and more) from DavidsTEA, which paired wonderfully with some 🍰 cheesecake.

Greetings Chai Community!
Just writing a quick update from our last one a couple week ago as there were some April 30 dates included. Hope everyone is doing great, and enjoying some games too—we've been playing Carcassonne, Targi, and the classic 🐫 Through the Desert.  Hope you've had a good past few weeks! 😃 Thank you for your patience as we finalize all of the fulfillment on our end.

Greetings Chai Community!
Hope you've had a good past few weeks! 😃 Thank you for your patience as we finalize all of the fulfillment on our end. Please rest assured that everyone will receive their copies and any replacement pieces needed just like we successfully delivered our 1st campaign. ☕️ Chai is something that we're super proud of and although we've had some delays we will make sure each of you receive what you’ve pledged for 🙏.

Greetings Chai Community!
Hope you've had a great past few weeks! 😃  Just a quick update on our end here regarding fulfillment, our new app, and other ways to connect!

Greetings Chai Community!
We hope you have been doing well over the past month since the last update, and you rung in the New Year with hope and optimism! We've been drinking lots of tea ☕️, working on fulfillment, and wishing we could game with friends in person! 😃  We're really hoping it's safe enough to attend our booths at GenCon, Origins, and Essen this year.
Truly, thank you for your patience as fulfillment dates and windows have been changing, with new information coming in literally each day before we could finally confirm things with each warehouse and agency. Without further ado, here's the 🥳

Happy December, Chai Fam! 😃
Hope everyone’s December has been going well, and that you have a warm, 🎄festive season these next few weeks. Connie just finished teaching her Grade 4 class for the term yesterday, and Dan’s been putting in some late nights finalizing factory and logistic details to get everything mailed out.
Our sincere apologies for the delay in getting this update out—we had some delays in the wooden ☕️ , leading to Dan and his dad painting and recutting over 8000 individual wooden tiles. We had initially made some communications errors on our end with the factory too, but they're literally just printing the rulebooks now to package games up to ship. To be honest, Dan’s pretty burnt out, but Christmas is here and we’re very much excited that we’ve gone over all the details, released new rulebooks (see below! 😍), and just have to update addresses as we near the finish line of the campaign. 🥳 Woot-woot!

Evening, Communi-tea! 🚀
Happy Halloween 🎃 & All Saints' Eve! As we're writing this update, we're munching on some candies while sippin' some peach ginger tea ☕️.

Woohoo Communi-tea, we have liftoff! 🚀
After a few Skype calls with Gamefound, we've been able to successfully launch the pledge manager this afternoon! 😍

Happy August ☕️ Chai Communi-tea! ❤️
We hope you've had a great summer so far! We've been super busy working on shipping as manufacturing finishes in the next few weeks so that games can be packaged and put on boats! 🥳 
To whet your tea appetite, many thanks to Brandon and Katy who made this playthrough video! Thanks for being such a wonderful voice in the community 😃.

campaign.story:
Ohsnap is a powerful grip, stand, and magnet wrapped inside a super-thin frame, now compatible with snapcharge: our magnetic wireless charger!
It makes life with your phone happy, productive, and care-free without the ugly bulk. Ohsnap works for all phones and finger sizes, and is easily adhered to the back of your phone in less than 20 seconds.

Secure, one-handed gripping is quick and easy with the ohsnap grip. Just slide your finger through the loop! It’s there when you need it,  and not when you don’t.


 Ohsnap transforms into a multi-angle stand, so whether you’re on facetime with a friend or taking a break to watch some YouTube, this handy kickstand has you covered.
3-angle kickstand for comfortable streaming, anywhere



Ohsnap is magnetic, so now multitasking is easier than ever. Gym equipment, fridges, car mounts and more… it sticks to them like magic!



The ohsnap grip has worked with every wireless charger on which it's been tested, but we cannot guarantee compatibility with all wireless chargers. For 100% confidence in compatibility, opt for our magnetic wireless charger, snapcharge.

Not only did we take the phone grip to the next level, but we also added to it with the first ever magnetic wireless charger, Snapcharge. Snapcharge uses the Qi charging standard which works with almost all devices including wireless charging enabled phones, Airpods, and more.
With snapcharge, you can pick up and use your phone without interrupting the charging process! :)
Snapcharge sticks to your magnetic car mount for a quick and easy charge, on the go.
 In-depth look at snapcharge:
 While snapcharge works with every phone that has wireless charging capabilities, we cannot guarantee wireless charging compatible with all cases.
PLAY



We meticulously engineered the grip to be incredibly thin, at only 3mm.
Won’t get caught on your pants!

It also fully rotates, so you can get the best possible angle that works for your unique gripping style.
 The ohsnap grip is designed with ultra-strength, tear-resistant silicone that is guaranteed to last millions of cycles.  
PLAY

No matter what happens, your ohsnap grip is backed by our forever ohsnap guarantee.
If your ohsnap grip gets damaged or broken, we will replace it for free, no matter what.
Within 1 year: Free replacement, we cover shipping! After 1 year: Free replacement, just cover shipping! Exchanges & Returns Within 30 Days: No questions asked, exchange or refund upon return, just cover shipping and handling.



Installing ohsnap on your phone is simple and easy. In 3 steps, ohsnap is attached securely and you're ready to go.
           Snapstand: $1,000,000 Stretch Goal!
Introducing snapstand, the magnetic mounting stand for convenient viewing & multitasking!
Effortless mounting with snapstand means no more picking up your phone to check notifications or send a quick text. It’s awesome at home or work!
How it works:
PLAY

It’s been meticulously engineered to work seamlessly with the ohsnap grip and/or snapcharge, so it’ll be the perfect add-on to your pledge. Increase your pledge amount by an additional $20 today to secure your snapstand when the campaign crosses $1M!
 We're building an ecosystem of products with the phone grip at its center. This is just the start....
So come along and join us by backing us on Kickstarter today!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Like any new product development, there are risks to our schedule. We feel however that we built this risk into our published time table, and that what is estimated here is realistic. The prototypes we have are extremely high fidelity and already work up to our standards, without having to rely on hypotheticals of tooled parts. I've been developing products for over 12 years and whenever this can be accomplished, it substantially reduces the risk of the mass produced version of the product. All the processes, materials, and standards we are using are well known and understood.

That said, sometimes complete unknowns can occur outside of our control. Things like global pandemics for example. But even in these current challenging conditions, we are in good shape to deliver this product on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

It's not too late. Click the image above to head to our website and pre-order the game.
PRE-ORDER LINK: https://buttonshygames.com/products/food-chain-island
On this forgotten island in a tiny corner of the ocean the animals are hungry! Your goal is to influence the wildlife - and arrange their meals - so there is only one animal left!
Food Chain Island is the next Button Shy Wallet Game, and the first in what we are calling our simply solo series. These are games that are one player only, light on rules, and big on replayability.  
Let's get into what makes Food Chain Island so awesome!
Start by shuffling the cards and making a 4X4 grid island of animals with the sea animals off to the side.  
On a turn, you must move one land animal one space in one of the four cardinal directions so it’s placed over another animal that is 1-3 numbers lower in value. In this way, you can move the ‘8’ animal over a 7, 6 or 5. 
When you do this, place the card on top of the lower card. This how an animal eats another animal.
When cards are stacked on one another, they are considered to be the number on the top. The stack of cards now moves as one.
When you move a card to eat another, you activate the ability on the card that just ate another. This special effect is mandatory and must be applied. In some cases, the ability will benefit you, and in others it will make the game harder.
The sea animals are there to help you out. At any time you may discard a sea animal and perform its special ability. Once a sea animal is used, it is discarded. 
The game ends when only one animal remains or if you are unable to eat an adjacent animal. 
If you only have one animal left, congratulations! You are an Ecological Expert.
If you have two animals left, nice job! You are an Accidental Matchmaker.
If you have three animals left, you just made it through! You are still an Island Intern. 
Otherwise, if you have 4+ animals, you have lost the game and need to keep trying.
Further Challenges
To make the game more difficult, randomly remove one or both of the sea animals. In addition, you can explore these alternate card layouts.
You can print and play the game today! The black and white version, along with unedited prototype rules is available at PNP Arcade.
LINK: https://www.pnparcade.com/products/food-chain-island-kickstarter-preview
For a complete playthrough, check out Matt Upton's video below: 
More to come as we update this image. :)
Also available here is Food Chain Island: Tough Skies, a three card expansion that will make your games just a little more challenging. At the beginning of the game, shuffle and place one card face-up into the play area. Do not use the others. During the game, you must activate, resolve and discard the air animal. The air animal must be resolved before the end of the game. For an additional challenge, use 2 or all 3 air animals.

In previous campaigns we created expansion material and used it as stretch goals. Since 2018, we've just given it away from the start.  So no worries on whether we'll hit it or not, you are getting bonus content if you pledge here. The free expansion for this campaign is Friendly Waters, a 3 card expansion of additional sea animals to help you along the way. You can shuffle these in with the sea animals in the base game, then draw 2 for a normal difficulty, and draw less for an additional challenge.
We have a whole bunch of games in our library.
If you want to add more games to your order, you can do one of two things:
US Backers only - to order games that ship now - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0520impatient" to get 15% off of your order. Your website order will ship now, as long as you don't  order any pre-order items, otherwise the entire order will ship as soon as everything comes in. As always, if you reach $25.00, you will also  receive free shipping.
US Backers only - to order games that ship along with your rewards - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0520us" to get free shipping  on your extra games. These games will all ship together with your  Kickstarter rewards.
International Backers only - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and   place an order using the coupon code "0520international" to get free shipping on your extra game(s). Note: The limit on this offer is 3 wallet games (and up to 3 expansions) total, including anything that you order at Kickstarter. Anything above 3 wallet games (and 3 expansions) will end up bumping into the next shipping tier, which can be as much as  $10 on international orders. These games will all ship together with your Kickstarter rewards.
A few notable games available in our library are Tussie Mussie, Sprawlopolis and Circle The Wagons.
Scott Almes is best known for the Tiny Epic series by Gamelyn Games. He's gone even bigger with Heroes of Land, Air and Sea and this time he's going even smaller. We first met in 2012 when Scott designed a game for our Storyteller Cards, and we've been looking for a chance to work together since.
Annie Wilkinson was born in Saskatchewan, Canada in 1966 to a family that encouraged artistic pursuits of all kinds -  including writing, drawing, photography and  music. This is our first time working together and it was a wonderful experience. I couldn't imagine a more perfect style for the game. More of Annie's work can be seen at http://www.advocate-art.com/annie-wilkinson
Graphic Design by Jason Greeno
Rules Editing by Michael Lee
We have an awesome following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club.
It's a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames,  promo cards, expansion content, and Kickstarter discounts.... every month. Supporters will receive from $1, $2, $5 to $10 off of EVERY WALLET GAME THAT WE MAKE. (See the $1 level, that's where the members back the projects).
Our 2020 $5 packages include an episode of Personal Space, a solo game that has multiplayer interactions. It's part roll and write, part campaign, part digital, part real life, part fantasy. There are stickers and everyone receives some unique cards and unique combinations of cards. It's launching very soon, and it's our most ambitious project yet and it will emerge throughout the year.
It also includes Trolling For Trouble by Mike Mullins. In your first month you'll get the 6 card starter kit and then each month after you'll receive a card to expand the game. Trolling For Trouble is a 3+ player bluffing and negotiation game where you play the monsters luring the heroes into battle.
Our $10 packages include all of the above and something extra. Generally it's a tiny game (up to 9 cards), or some expansion / promo cards for our existing games. We have a Sprawlopolis expansion coming in the next few months, and we're working on many more.
And our $20 package includes all of the above and a copy of the featured wallet game (or the wallet game of your choice). The featured wallet games also come with any expansion material that is given away in the Kickstarter campaigns (like the solo expansion here).
If that sounds cool to you, check out the Board Game of the Month Club on Patreon!
http://www.patreon.com/buttonshy
Thank you for checking out Food Chain Island!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With our method of publishing and using multiple manufacturers, there's always a chance that one part of the game could come in with an error, leading to delays. We've been able to minimize these errors in recent years, but they can happen from time to time. We've also upped our staff internally to make sure we can hit intended deadlines.

With COVID-19 some of our suppliers have been delayed, so we've been allowing additional time in our estimations and setting up backup suppliers as well. Our staff is also minimized at this time, so we are allowing additional time for a smaller staff to assemble and ship games. 

Our two unfulfilled projects are moving along according to our updated schedule. Our Universal Rule: Singularity is starting to arrive here and is on track as planned. Our Skulls of Sedlec campaign is still a month away from fulfillment, but is on track as planned.

updates.update_userinfo: Getting closer to fulfillment and very close to PNP
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Just a quick status update here. We expect to receive the cards in about a week. From there, we have a few heavy weeks of separating cards and then assembling games, but as long as all goes well we should still have the first packages out before the end of August. This will go into September, but how long? That's still to be determined. I'd say that the first two weeks is a safe bet.

Hey everyone, we're starting to see the "backer requested an update" notification pop up, so it's time to let everyone know that everything is moving forward as planned and there's nothing here to say or show yet. Hahaha. But I'll say and show a little more than that to make this worth the notification that you received. :) 
Our deadline for the cards to go to the printer is Friday, and we are working our way through them. 16/18 base game cards are done and proofed here, and will go to Scott for final proofing by tomorrow. By tonight we'll be done the final 2 and all of the expansion cards. Then we move onto the rules layout. It looks like everything will be done for a very late July print and play file, and a very late August fulfillment. As of right now I don't see anything getting in the way of either and if so, I'll let everyone know.
Hello everyone! We just wanted to come in and say THANK YOU all! Thank you for helping us make Food Chain Island, as well as kicking off our Simply Solo line.

updates.update_userinfo: Shutting up, sitting down, and avoiding the neighborhood fox
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! It's been quite a week for Food Chain Island. We started off with one of our largest funded first days for Button Shy, and in the end, this seems like it will be our third highest funded game on Kickstarter! 
What's funny is that it's third behind Sprawlopolis and Tussie Mussie, which are the other two games that make up our Instant Collection here. It's going to make a great trio. :)
This is also a big start to our Simply Solo line. We'll make sure to keep everyone in the loop about our next game in the line (Ugly Gryphon Inn) as well as the games that will follow. I can't wait to share more on these.

Wow, this campaign really took off. We launched exactly 48 hours ago, and here we are almost 900 backers later. That's a very healthy number for little old Button Shy, and we're happy to see where we'll go from here. Thank you all for joining us! 
Now if you'll join in our celebratory "Kickstarter is funded" meal...

Take a look at all of the rewards we have to offer and learn how your support will help us to keep creating the high-energy, family-friendly, top-quality board game media that you've come to expect from Tantrum House. campaign.story:
The dreaded Black Death has descended upon the town of Bristol. You are racing down the streets, desperate to escape into the safety of the countryside. If your cart is the first out of town you and your cart-mates win! Or do you? Some villagers on your cart may secretly already have the plague. If you leave town with a plagued villager on your cart, you will catch the plague and lose! What will you do to make sure that doesn’t happen? And who will you trust (or betray) along the way? 
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes.
 Thank you to all of our backers for an incredible campaign!
If you missed the campaign you can make a late pledge here until fall 2020.
Backers can view project updates for information about delivery and add-ons.
Please visit our website or Facebook for the latest information on Bristol 1350.
We are excited to offer a Deluxe edition of the game! Depending on later demand, this Deluxe edition may be exclusive to Kickstarter, and at most it will be in rare distribution or only available at conventions. Beyond the core Standard edition of the game (+9 extra Kickstarter characters + stretch goals) the Deluxe edition includes: 
The 6 Deluxe coins to scale.
Every Kickstarter backer of Bristol 1350 (Standard or Deluxe) will receive 9 extra character cards in a special foil pack to add to their core copy of the game (for 18 total characters!) These characters will not be available after Kickstarter and are our way of saying thank you. We will reveal a new character every few days in the section below!    


We have upgraded every single component in the game with the space available in the box. Each upgrade represents our dedication to making high-quality and high-performing games at an affordable price. While we hope to include most of the upgrades listed above in future editions, they are only guaranteed for this first Kickstarter Standard and Deluxe printing of the game.   
The level of textural detail on the book, front and back, is kind of mouthwatering.
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction (lying & backstabbing) and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes. The game is enjoyable at all player counts, with lower counts leaning towards strategy and higher counts leaning towards social deduction, lying, and trust.
In the game each player begins in one of the three carts behind the starting line. Your goal is to be on the first cart to escape from the town. However, if anyone on your cart has the plague when you finish, everyone on that cart dies of the plague! Play continues until an all-healthy cart crosses or until everyone has the plague.   
You can view the full rules and print and play at this link. Note that the rulebook design is still underway, and if you want to play the print and play you'll need to construct your own dice and carts.
You can play for free online with Tabletop Simulator or with Tabletopia. 
As they become available, translations of the rulebook will be available on our website. We currently have translations available in French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, and Greek. 
Some of the intriguing mechanics are discussed by The Board Game Critic in this video. 
A full playthrough of a 5-player game can be seen at this link. 
A full playthrough of a 1-player game can be seen at this link. 
Bristol 1350 is Volume 4 in the Dark Cities Series! Each Volume is a stand-alone game that comes in the same sized faux book box, focuses on a particular city and year, and includes a dark or mysterious element in its game play. Each game accommodates at least 2-9 players. 
Games in the Dark Cities Series have already sold over 150,000 copies and are now played around the world! We're already hard at work on Volume 5, and we will continue expanding the series. We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with the Dark Cities Series! Each of these games is available in certain reward levels and as add-ons.
You can add an unlimited number of copies of any games in the Dark Cities Series to your pledge! Just add the amounts listed above and after the campaign you'll select which extra games you'd like to be added to your order based on how much extra money you pledged. If you have any questions, please see the FAQ section, post a comment, or shoot us a message.

We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our first game, Salem, back in 2015. Those backers are the ones that allowed us to quit our day jobs and make games full time. We've had more great experiences with the launch of Tortuga 1667 and Deadwood 1876. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community is incredible. We consider each Kickstarter backer to be a close ally in our game-making endeavors and we'll do everything we can to protect your trust in us.
Our thoughts are with those around the world suffering from Covid-19. We have been planning and preparing for this launch for over two years, but it has coincidentally lined up with the pandemic that our world now faces. We considered delaying the project but after a lot of thought and encouragement from our community we ultimately decided to launch. As with all our games, part of this game's purpose is to educate about the history of the world. Bristol 1350 explores the history of the worst pandemic our world has ever faced: the Black Death. The people of 1350 faced huge challenges, and today those challenges are perhaps more relatable than ever. We will be donating $3,000 from our own pockets to Action Against Hunger to assist in getting food and medicine for those most in need. campaign.story:
Island Siege was first released in 2014. We sold out quickly, and then got busy putting out other games. Well, here it is again. Jump in fast and tell your friends because this project only lasts a short time!
Coin Count Update
With the increasing number of metal Campaign Coins that we're giving away, here's a table to help you determine what you're getting with the total funding amount of $30,000: 
I'll try to keep this updated through the project's end, each time we pass a $1K threshold.
What is Island Siege?
 Number of Players: 1-4
 Play Time: 12 minutes per player
 Ages: 14+
Island Siege is a card game of colonization in the West Indies. Players build forts using stones from their supply, then move colonists to forts to populate them. Colonists in turn construct buildings and ships, which then house the colonists. Buildings provide players with special abilities, while ships are sent to lay siege to the opponent’s forts.
The goal is for players to get all of their colonists into play on their forts, buildings and ships. Be careful, though, whenever a fort is destroyed by an opponent’s fleet all of the colonists on that fort and its buildings are returned to the player's imperial board to start again! Alternately, players may win by earning 20 gold from constructing buildings and ships. Winning requires a keen balance of building and laying an Island Siege!
You can download the not-quite-finished rules here. You can get solo rules here, and Captains expansion rules from here!
If you're more the video-watching sort, here's an Island Siege preview that includes how to play Island Siege, by the Board Game Mechanic.
Here's what players have said about the first edition of Island Siege.
Purge Review of Island Siege 1st Edition
Top Two-Player Game - The Board Game Captain!
Lynn, Ales and The Board Game Captain ran through their top ten 2-player games, and the Captain called Island Siege his favorite! (That's a fancy title page!) The Island Siege part starts at around 31:30.
 Customer Reviews
 The anniversary edition of Island Siege contains
 Engraved dice - No more stickers! The Anniversary Edition will contain engraved resin dice. Also, one of the dice will be a different color to indicate it is only used when enough colonists have been moved off of the imperial board.
 Two sets of  Kickstarter-exclusive metal Campaign Coins (26 total)! These metal coins will only be part of the Kickstarter experience. The retail version of the game will include cardboard punch board coins. EDIT: Stretch goals have unlocked extra coins, and more coins get unlocked each time we cross a $1K funding boundary!
 Components and rules for up to four players! The original two-player game included red and yellow colonists. The Anniversary Edition also includes green and blue colonists as well as additional coins, cubes and other components necessary for four players.
 Deluxe two-layer player imperial boards. The new imperial boards includes an island with a quarry to store accumulated stones and a port to dock your ship. The boards will be printed on a thick cardboard. Indentations keep pieces from shifting.
 Ramparts and Coquina expansions from original. The original Island Siege Kickstarter featured two expansions that weren't available in the retail version of the game. Ramparts adds 24 new forts, buildings and ships, while Coquina introduces soft pink coquina stones and cards that make forts much harder to eliminate.
 Solo rules and components. Dan has created new rules for playing Island Siege against the Ghost Captain!
 Stretch goals! Including 20 extra Captains cards and rules, 2 extra boards and rules for the Monuments expansion, and even more deluxe Campaign Coins!
Coquina, Ramparts and the Ghost Captain
Three expansions are included with the base pledge. These aren't stretch goals - they are included in the base pledge!
Coquina
The Coquina expansion is included in the base Island Siege game pledge level. There are six new cards - 3 forts, 2 buildings and a ship card. It also contains 5 new stones - all of them pink to represent the soft coquina stones that compressed and gave way around cannonballs shot from ships instead of shattering. Since there are not  pink dice faces in Island Siege, these stones can only be removed by a second wave attack.  
Ramparts
The Ramparts expansion from the original print run is also included with the base Island Siege game pledge. Ramparts includes 24 additional forts, buildings and ships.
Ghost Captain Solo Rules
The Ghost Captain rules allow for the game to be played solo. Can you best the Ghost Captain?!
To add any of these items, just increase the pledge amount by the cost of the item(s) you wish to add. If you are not pledging for the base game, then you can use the Add-Ons Only pledge level to pledge just the add-on amount. 
Shipping is one flat rate to your location. Add as many items as you want and the shipping rate won't change!
Extra Island Siege Games: $29
To add extra copies of Island Siege, just add another $29 to your pledge. 
Coin Set (13 coins): $10
The base pledge will come with two sets of these super-high quality coins (26 coins in total) but if you want more then just add them to your pledge! Edit: More coins are being unlocked with stretch goals through the end of the project!
Dice:  $10
Do you already have the Island Siege first edition but want to upgrade the dice? Or maybe you're getting the game but want to have a set of dice for each player!
These are the same dice as will ship in the base version of the game - etched, with a different color symbol on each face. The three base attack dice will be one color, while the bonus dice (used when the first level of the imperial board is clear) is darker, as a reminder that not all of the dice should be rolled by default.
APE works with companies around the world to do game fulfillment.
You will be notified of the shipping to your area when you select a pledge. 
Note: Adding items to your pledge does not change the shipping rate. You will be charged the same shipping rate for ordering a copy of the base game as you would for ordering two copies, or six copies, add-ons, etc.!
We put Island Siege on Tabletopia so that you can play online and still practice social distancing.
 Design: Dan Manfredini
 Art: Jared Blando
 Cover Art: Jim Maxwell
 Layout: Daniel Solis and Kevin Hill
 Publisher: Kevin Brusky and APE Games
Dan Manfredini, Designer
Dan Manfredini is a game designer from Round Rock, Texas. He has designed games such as Senshi, Far Space Foundry, Venture Forth and several others. He loves designing and developing games and is excited to bring this edition of Island Siege to life. When he's not designing, he loves playing games with his wife and two sons. @GameDesignerDan 
Jared Blando, Artist
Jared Blando is a professional freelance cartographer and conceptual artist who works in the RPG, book, and gaming industry. Though he is best known for his RPG fantasy maps, he is also prominent in the board-game and publishing industry. He has a penchant for historical works and miniature gaming, as well as petting cats and watching Star Trek. If you get a chance, check out his website his Patreon or his How to Draw RPG Maps book series: World Maps and RPG Cities!

Mark Gerrits is passionate about games. He loves playing games, and for over a decade, he's loved designing games. In 2017, his highest ranked game on BGG was released—Mini Rails. 
With Mini Rails, Mark condensed the often complex, time-consuming, and calculation-intensive train game, into a highly approachable game time of 60 minutes. Mini Rails scratched the itch of a heavy train game but without sacrificing any depth of play. Gamers loved it.
Mini Express is the next game in the Mark Gerrits Train Series. In Mini Express, Mark Gerrits once again explores the design space of cube rail train games. Cube rail games take an abstract approach to track building, which eliminates issues of track junction tiles or drawing tracks. Once again, players take only one of two choices on their turn: lay track or buy shares. Mini Express not only continues the minimalist spirit of Mini Rails but also brings players a richer gaming experience through clever map design.
Established in 2011, Moaideas Game Design is one of the leading board game publishers in Taiwan. We are a small but focused team of experienced professionals that thrive for excellence in game design, game development, art illustration, graphic design, and manufacturing quality of our games.

campaign.story:
There's still a couple of days left to back us... and one more exciting Stretch Goal to unlock!
"A game where you can feel that everyone is a suspect until the last card has been drawn!" GABRIEL F (Backer) 
"Just the right amount of tension, strategy and tonnes of fun" ROXXI B (Backer)
Stop the Train! is a social deduction adventure for 4-6 players.
It's late November, 1942. The 19:05 to Paris is armed with a bomb and hurtling towards its destination threatening civilian destruction. On board, the passengers include a Resistance Conspirator, an Mi6 agent and a Prisoner of War on the run. To avert disaster, they have only one hope: an emergency meeting to identify the Saboteur, throw him off and Stop the Train!
 15 lengths/curves of track
1 Card deck base & Speedometer
1 Train Counter
66 Effect Cards (that change the speedometer)
10 Character Cards
10 Character Reference cards
36 Intervention Cards (that grant special powers)
18 Voting Cards (to facilitate a secret ballot)
1 Gameplay Guide
2 Order of Play Cards
2 Permits to Travel
1 Current Player Token
1 Rail Speed Record  
Now you're on board, let's tell you how the game works. Stop the Train is a  semi-cooperative, social deduction board game. After a quick set up and the allocation of characters, players discover their two missions:
Mission 1: Stop the Train!
Mission 2: A character-specific objective
To win, your character will need to complete both missions. But! There's a saboteur in your midst hellbent on crashing the train, trying to secretly speed the train up at every turn without raising suspicion. The players must put their social deduction skills to the test by collectively identifying the Saboteur to regain control of the train. 
Here's the catch - the actions you take to achieve your second mission may implicate you as the Saboteur. If you're not careful, you'll find yourself wrongly accused as players vote who to throw off the train. On the flip side, if you're suspicions are correct and the Saboteur is ousted, then just maybe you'll be able to hit the brakes and Stop the Train!
Take a closer look at the passengers on board: 
 The game play is simple to pick up and rewarding to replay. For each turn, players:
Draw 3 Effect Cards and discard 1
Pass the remaining 2 to the next player
...who chooses to play 1 and discard the other
The played card affects the Speedometer
The train speeds ahead! 
Sounds simple? The players also encounter game events as they speed towards their fate: 
A choice of routes - at the Signal Box, all players must vote between three routes: the Viaduct, the Scenic Route and the Fast Track. The final decision will heavily impact how quickly the train hits Paris. Will you risk a quick route to complete your own mission?  
Emergency Meeting - Whichever route you choose, the train will cross a bridge in the final stages. Here's your chance to call an Emergency Meeting to identify the Saboteur and throw them off the train! 
But not everything is as it seems here... there's an Mi6 agent who wants him alive. Stacked with dramatic interventions, no one knows the outcome of the meeting. It is possible the Engineer might lock the doors so no one is thrown off or the accused may attempt to drag another passenger off the train with them.
Identifying the real Saboteur dramatically increases the chance of pulling the train to a halt in time... but if they are still on board, a crash looks ever more likely!
Interventions - not everything will go your way, but you will have two Intervention Cards up your sleeve. Perhaps you will speed past the signal box and dictate the route or maybe put a gun to someone's head and control the Speedometer or... save an innocent passenger from eviction by pulling them back on the train! 
Tunnels - in the darkness of the tunnels, you can steal a Permit to Travel. If you have a Permit to Travel, you don't need to achieve your second mission. Whilst you're cooperating with the other passengers to slow the train, you might need the pluck to steal their permit. But be careful, they might steal it back from you! 
End of the Game
The train stops either when the Effect Cards are exhausted or when the train crashes into Paris station.  
If the players can stop the train before the end of the 40km track with their personal mission complete or a permit to travel, they win. If there's a collision at the station, the bomb explodes and the Saboteur wins.

Stop the Train! is a bit of a departure from our usual games. Up until now, we have been known for creating live escape adventures for teams of up to 7 players, immersing them in the 1940's with a mission to save themselves, or greater still, save Britain. 
Escape Plan's games are highly ranked by industry experts: Escape the Review, TLEM and we are well regarded on TripAdvisor with 94% of our guests giving us a 5-star review. We've been operating since 2015 and put simply we love to create entertaining experiences.
The Battle for Britain, Escape Plan

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
FIRST KICKSTARTER PROJECT 

We're new to the board game category and with that comes a lot of new learnings. Thankfully, we have many years experience in running successful games in a parallel industry: escape rooms. There's a lot of transferred knowledge we bring with us. Whilst we are reaching a new audience for board games, we do have an established following of gamers and marketing experience in the team to extend our reach. 

PRODUCTION VALUE

Our default is to always aspire to the highest quality available; the challenge is that this needs balancing with affordability. We're asking for backing for a new project and are aiming for a price point that is attractive to supporters without compromising on component quality. We're working with industry experts to find this balance.

MANUFACTURING & SHIPPING

As with any large volume order, there is an inherent risk of delay to project delivery. Experience shows us to manage this risk best, we need to work with reputable suppliers who have a track record of delivery high quality projects to an agreed timescale. The COVID-19 outbreak presents many unknowns and may delay the production a little, but happily, we are sourcing from European suppliers so we are unlikely to see significant delays. We have had their assurances that the impact is minimal at this time. 

We have developed the product as far as possible (manufactured prototypes; fully tested game play; artwork design signed off; marketing plan devised) prior to manufacture. Therefore, we do not foresee any delays from our end. We're excited by the prospect of Kickstarter support bringing this game to market.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
We are working with eco-conscious European suppliers that have a green promise. It is intended that we will make the product fully from recyclable materials to avoid any landfill increase.
Sustainable materials
Cardboard: the paper industry is very energy-intensive, however most of the required energy can be produced in-house via renewable energy sources such as wind and solar. We will seek out the cardboard with the highest possible percentage of recycled material saving resources and consuming the least energy. Where wooden pieces are used (minimal), sustainable forestry will supply. We aspire to avoid plastic.
Environmentally friendly factories
We insist on working with a factory that has an eco-conscious policy that invest in renewable energy and use local/regional sources to avoid unnecessary long distance haulage.

Tiny Epic Pirates is a 45 minute, 1-4 player game of high-seas adventure, utilizing a variable RONDEL action system and action combo-ing!
Every player's Rondel is unique, every game!
In Tiny Epic Pirates you take control of a Pirate ship with the goal of burying vast amounts of wealth on secret island hideaways.
Each turn, you move your Captain Token around your ship’s action wheel, selecting which action to perform...
It isn't just other pirates standing in your way of burying treasures! The Royal Navy has their eye on you and the more notorious you become, the more eager they are to stopping your exploits. 
An encounter with the Navy will surely slow your progress, so you best be avoiding them. To do so, you're going to need a good ship and a great crew!
There's a lot of scallywags out there looking for adventure! So assembling your crew won't be very hard, but pulling together a winning crew... that's a different story.
Your crew will play a major role in Tiny Epic Pirates. Each crew member brings different advantages to battle and to the actions you'll take. 
The dice listed at the top of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent what number you'll need to roll to score a hit on another ship! Having multiples of a single number can result in lots of damage, but spreading your numbers out can result in more consistent results. The choice is yours!
The icons listed at the bottom of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent bonus actions that can chain together for epic turns! If the first icon matches your chosen action, you'll get to take the action of the second icon for free.
In addition to your crew, you'll have your reputation and your exploits. As you prove yourself in battle, your legend will grow and so will your ability to command your ship.
Winning battles against other pirates, and against notable merchants, will increase your Legend Level. Each new level offers immediate benefits, as well as increases to your ship's movement and the number of dice you roll in battle.
But enough talk, you're no landlubber. You can learn more about Tiny Epic Pirates by engaging with us in the comments, watching the videos below, or by downloading the rulebook below.

Deluxe Content: Crimson Silver Mini Expansion
The Crimson Silver Mini Expansion introduces new Floating Fortresses and Silver as a new resource!
Players are able to visit the Floating Fortresses as they move around the board and perform upgraded versions of Trade, Plunder, and Crew Up. Players may also lay siege to these Fortresses for additional rewards. But beware, the Floating Fortresses have a contract with the Royal Navy and if any Pirates show their dirty face around there, the Navy will be on their tail!
Even with the threat of the Navy though, the precious Silver these markets are known for is simply too alluring to avoid. A lot of blood as been spilled over this Silver. So much that it's known around these seas as Crimson Silver.

In Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak, rumors of the unthinkable are spreading quickly around the islands. Rumors of dead pirates returning to the sea... aboard an ominous ghost ship helmed by the legendary pirate Amdiak...
Several new game elements are added to play including cursed gold, a ghost ship that haunts the players as they try to steal the cursed gold, ancient relics, haunted map cards and even skeleton crew!
Players gain cursed gold by stealing it from the ghost ship and attacking other pirates who possess it. Cursed gold can be traded for an ancient relic said to hold ashes of Amdiak. Bury this relic and break the Curse of Amdiak!

Do you dare to set sail on ghostly waters?

Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Pirates to game tables around the world!
