campaign.story:
Hi, we're board game designers James Ernest and Mike Selinker. In 2010, we published Lords of Vegas, a high energy casino-building game. It cemented itself as one of the best games we've ever made, and a favorite of such series as Tabletop, Shut Up & Sit Down, and The Dice Tower. Our 2014 hard-to-find expansion Up! enabled more strategic casino-building and added pieces for more players. But since then, we haven't been able to bring anything new to the game's legions of fans.
Until today, that is. Last month, we regained the rights to Lords of Vegas. After five years in the hopper, we're publishing the long-awaited expansion Underworld, filled with mobsters and shady dealers. We're bringing out a 10th Anniversary Boss Bundle, a lush mobster briefcase stocked with poker chips, a felt-lined tray, player piece upgrades, and gambling dice. We're making a 15th anniversary edition of our book Dealer's Choice: The Complete Handbook of Saturday Night Poker. And you can get the previously released versions of the base set and Up! here. We want to reward our fans for supporting our game all these years.
If you've never heard of the game, you might want to know... 
The base set, Up!, and a theory of what the Underworld box might look like.

Lords of Vegas is a city-building eurogame in which players are casino moguls turning the desert of Nevada into something even nastier. The game starts in 1940, when Las Vegas is merely cheap motels and one-room poker houses. Of course, you bulldoze them. Over the next few decades, you construct glittering meccas of gambling and debauchery. You can build, remodel, reorganize, and sprawl your casinos along the Strip. Should you come up a few million short in your plans for world domination, take those dollars to a competitor's casino and roll the dice on a gambling spree. Here's what it looks like in play.
The game comes with a beautiful board of the Vegas Strip, illustrated by the masterful Franz Vohwinkel. It has 48 casino tiles, 55 cards, 40 player markers, and loads of paper money—and, oh yeah, 48 dice. Yes, we made a eurogame with 48 dice. 
Here's Mike to explain how it works.
And here's Quinns of Shut Up & Sit Down walking you through it.
With the strongly recommended expansion Up!, your casinos build skyward, gaining you  more wealth and power. This expands the game to 2-6 players using the base set and Up! The expansion has 48 riser tiles for elevating your casinos, 20 player markers, even more money, and 24 more dice, bringing the total to a spine-rattling 72 dice. If you have a copy of the base set but have never gotten your hands on Up!, please take this opportunity to do so. You'll never play the game the same way again.  
The Underworld expansion is a brand new set of characters, events, and properties to enhance your game with that seedy-side-of-Vegas feeling. See below for that. 
Here are some nice people saying nice things about Lords of Vegas:
"Lords of Vegas is the perfect simulation of the reality of gambling in Vegas, only sometimes you win."—Wil Wheaton, Tabletop 
"Lords of Vegas is the economic warfare game that we find ourselves recommending the most. The reason that no one should play Monopoly. Ever."—Shut Up & Sit Down 
"I have not seen this level of intensity. It goes back and forth fighting over these (casinos). One of the best games of the year."—Tom Vasel, The Dice Tower (both Vasel's and Eric Summerer's top 10 of 2010)  
"Buy the game. Now. Do it! I'm the Lord of Vegas."—Storm of Paul & Storm, alongside the luminaries Matt Lees, Emma Larkins, Peter Adkison, Matt Forbeck,  Aubrey Cello, Patrick Hillier, and Ignacy Trzewiczek
Cover design for the Underworld box, illustrated by Fastner & Larson.

Underworld is the Lords of Vegas expansion we've been wanting to make for a decade. Ever since the game came out, people have said, "This is great, but where's the seedy underbelly of Vegas?" We've got it for you in Underworld. Faster than you can say "Those are Terry Benedict's casinos!" you'll be deep in the muck with mobsters, thieves, grifters, and, worst of all, accountants. Here's Mike with the lowdown.
This expansion comes with a new Underworld board by Franz. It depicts downtown Las Vegas, the current site of the Fremont Street Experience, north of the main board's Vegas Strip. This is a work in progress. 
Underworld board by Franz Vohwinkel. Image not final.
Underworld contains 52 cards, all lovingly illustrated by the talented Nate Taylor. Here's how they work. At the start of every turn, you flip out a new Underworld card onto the Underworld board. You then gain a new action called Acquire, which allows you to spend money to buy a single Underworld card. Some give you points in different ways, while others give you money over time. Others provide powers that you can use to alter your gameplay. One card might make sprawling easier, while another gives you more opportunities to gamble every turn. Eventually, who and what you have in your Underworld cards can drastically change your board position by the game's end.
Playtest versions shown. Images not final.
Right now, if you own Lords of Vegas, you can help us perfect this expansion. We've created a print and play with rules and cards, which you can download by going to this page and clicking on the button marked Lords of Vegas Underworld Print and Play. Once you've played with it, go to our feedback form and tell us what you think!
Each copy of Underworld comes with two promo cards: Time Share and The Big Score. (See below for how to get our charity promo card, Vegas Shutdown.)
Underworld is the expansion we've wanted to make for over half a decade. With your help, we can finally introduce the mob to Lords of Vegas.
The Boss Bundle is inside your very own mobster briefcase. Image not final.
For diehard Lords of Vegas fans, the 10th Anniversary Boss Bundle is the option you want. It's a mobster briefcase box with places to hold the components from the base game, Up!, and Underworld. Check it out. 
Prototype of the Boss Bundle briefcase box. Image not final.

When you pull this game off your shelf, we want you to feel like a casino magnate. The briefcase box is 320 mm x 320 mm (fits nicely into a Kallax shelf) but feels weighty and substantial. There's a leather-like exterior, a felt interior, and a removable felt-lined tray with snug spaces for each player's components. It's the box we always wanted Lords of Vegas to be in.
Prototype of the Boss Bundle briefcase box interior, with the felt-lined tray pulled out. Image not final.
The tray is dark wood with a felt-lined interior. There are separate compartments for the casino tiles, Up! risers, property and Underworld cards, and poker chips. The scoring markers, dice, and parking lot markers fit into the recess between the tray and the briefcase wall. The rulebook, base set board, and Underworld board set into the top.
Prototype of the poker chips. Image and quantities of each denomination are not final.
Fans have asked for poker chips for years. The Boss Bundle'spoker chipsare still in design, but these are some initial concepts. We plan to include 20 each of $1 million, $2 million, $5 million, $10 million, and $25 million chips. The chips we like are high-density plastic with a metal chip inside making them 11.5 grams similar to a clay chip, but more durable. (Poker chips are also available as an add-on for $55 a set.)
Prototypes and designs for the bags, gambling dice, player pawns, and cars in the player upgrade kit. Nothing here is final.
The Boss Bundle also comes with a player upgrade kit. We'll include 60 wooden cars (of a different shape for each player) to use in place of the markers for parking lots. We are including a deluxe version of the scoring tokens, possibly airplanes so you can vroom around on the scoring track like it's a runway at McCarran Airport. The player pack will come with six velvet drawstring bags, one for each player. It will also contain a pair of larger casino gambling dice. (The player upgrade kit is also available as an add-on for $45 a set.)
Digital prototype of the Vegas Playmat. Image not final.
The Boss Bundle will also come with a Vegas playmat. This is a 24x28" neoprene playmat which features both the base set board (The Strip) and the Underworld board (Downtown Vegas). The playmat comes with the Boss Bundle, but is too big to fit in the briefcase box. (The Vegas playmat is also available as an add-on for $40.)
Since all people who get the Boss Bundle should have all three boxes, we've added to the bundle a unified rulebook that incorporates the rules of base, Up!, and Underworld.  (The unified rulebook is also available as an add-on for $5.)
The 10th Anniversary Boss Bundle comes with a copy of the base set, Up!, Underworld, and Dealer's Choice. Or, if you already own the base set and Up!, you can get it without those at the Boss Bundle (New Stuff Only) level. You can also buy most of these items as add-ons. See below for details on how that works.
If you want something really unique, check The Big Score Bundle with You In It. That gets you illustrated into one of our promo cards like The Big Score. You or someone you really like will become a Lords of Vegas denizen forever. We'll send you 10 of your promo card so you can leave your calling card when you next rob the Strip blind. 
The Dealer's Choice cover from 2005. Phil's drawing a new one for the 15th anniversary edition.
In 2005, we joined with our buddy Phil Foglio, whom you might know from the Hugo Award-winning graphic novel series Girl Genius, to write and illustrate the definitive book on dealer's choice poker. We called it Dealer's Choice: The Complete Handbook of Saturday Night Poker. After it went out of print, we were often begged for copies. So we decided to get the rights to that book back too. We're excited to offer a brand new 15th anniversary edition of Dealer's Choice, complete with a new cover. This new edition will be a staple at every poker night you attend.
The Dealer's Choice softcover contains the rules to 200 poker games, including old favorites like Omaha and Chicago, and bizarre new constructions like Demolition Man, Black Jack Shellacque, Frankenstein, and Night Baseball of the Living Dead. Plus we've added a bunch of additional games courtesy of our columns in Bluff Magazine. The book also features valuable tips for how to host a poker night, how to design your own games, and how to talk like a poker player. Every copy of the book comes with a PDF and an ebook. It's cool. 
 Here's a handy table of what's included in each reward level.   
We also have a $1 level for those who just want access to our PledgeManager after the campaign. We know times are tough, so if you are stressing right now about finances, you can just pledge a dollar and we'll let you upgrade later. 
You can also buy many of the elements of the Boss Bundle as add-ons, using the prices in this chart.

Each backer who receives physical goods will pay the actual cost of shipping their rewards. Final shipping rates and costs will be loaded into our PledgeManager, and you will pay for your shipping via the PledgeManager as well.  We'll charge backers as close to our actual shipping costs for their shipping address as we can for each order. Lone Shark is not making any profit on shipping and handling. Including add-ons in your order will increase shipping costs. See below for our current shipping estimates, based on shipping out of our fulfillment sites of Florida, England, and Australia. (And yes, those "Rest of World" numbers are horrible. If you're from those places, we're really sorry about that,) 
Again, these are estimates. You'll be charged exactly what it costs us to get it to your location, wherever that is. 
We are game designers. James founded Cheapass Games and the head crustacean at Crab Fragment Labs. His games include Kill Doctor Lucky, Tak: A Beautiful Game, Button Men, Pairs, and Unexploded Cow. Mike is the lead developer and/or designer of Betrayal at House on the Hill, the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, Apocrypha, The Ninth World, Risk Godstorm, and Thornwatch, as well as the author of The Maze of Games, The Kobold Guide to Board Game Design, and Puzzlecraft. Mike and James co-founded Lone Shark Games, and together designed Pirates of the Spanish Main, Unspeakable Words, Fightball, Gloria Mundi, 12 Days, and many other games, and recently collaborated together with the Brothers Chaps on Trogdor!! The Board Game.
Lone Shark Games is a Seattle board game and puzzle company that has made such Kickstarter-fueled games and books as The Maze of Games, Apocrypha, The Ninth World, Thornwatch, and Puzzlecraft. We also are responsible for the design of Betrayal at House on the Hill: Widow's Walk and the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game. You can get all our stuff at our webstore.
We're joined by some great artists on Lords of Vegas. Franz Vohwinkel does our boards; he's known for his work on Magic: The Gathering, Dungeons & Dragons, Dominion, and boardgames like Ra and Princes of Florence. Steve Fastner and Rich Larson did the covers for our base set and Up!, and are famous for their comic and pinup art. Nate Taylor is illustrating the Underworld cards; you may know him from his collaborations with Pat Rothfuss, especially The Princess and Mr. Whiffle. 
This is a strange time to be asking for money for a game. Here's some things we know.
1. It's the 10th anniversary of this game, and that only comes around once.
2. We don't know when things will get better. The economy could rev back up quickly, or things could get worse. We just can't know.
3. We can't print the game without help.
So, encouraged by lots of fans on BoardGameGeek, we decided to go ahead with the campaign. Still, most of our opportunities to promote the campaign—conventions, magazines, Twitch play around a table—are not available to us right now. We could use your help. Please share this post as much as you can with people who like games. You can also put this badge on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Kickstarter icon.
We also want to give back to the Las Vegas community, which was open when we shot our videos. So we're making a promo card called Vegas Shutdown (named in honor of our other favorite Vegas board game, Henry Stern's Vegas Showdown). Since it's a charity thing, and Kickstarter doesn't do charity campaigns, you can't buy it here. But if you pledge for a physical reward in this campaign, you'll have the first opportunity to get copies of the promo card for an additional $5 each in our PledgeManager. Every charity promo card purchased will help Three Square Food Bank take care of workers affected by the shutdown of the casino industry. Here's the card.
That's our reasons for doing this now. Once you're done taking care of your needs for yourself, your family, and your community, if you decide you like the game and would like to contribute, we'd really appreciate it. Thanks, and we hope to see you playing Lords of Vegas around a game table soon.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Needless to say, we're concerned about the coronavirus pandemic's effect on the production and shipping of this campaign. 

We're acquiring inventory of the last printing of the base set and Up! from Asmodee. We're making new editions of Underworld and Dealer's Choice for this project, and we don't anticipate any manufacturing problems with those. Underworld is being printed by the same printer who printed the base set and Up! They're in the United States, which costs more but avoids problems with tariffs and shipping from China. We expect that our factory and warehouses will be open by the time these need to go to those steps, but of course we cannot know for sure. We are committed to getting the games to our backers whatever difficulties arise in the next few months.

The 10th Anniversary boss boxes are considerably more complex. We've set the shipping date on those for Christmas, but our experience with these types of projects on Thornwatch, Tak, and Apocrypha leads us to be careful about specific dates, given some instability in the supply channel now. We are planning to ship these editions separately from the games themselves, so if you pledge for a Boss Bundle, you'll get your games and books at the same time everyone else does. We'll keep you in the know as the Boss Bundle is developed. Thanks in advance.

POOP HISTORY - Rock, Paper, Nareshole.
Narsehole is a water powered tiny butt shower (bidet), attachment for your existing toilet with a dual nozzle spray and pressure control for a maximum clean.  Never have an itchy or irritated butthole again from improper cleaning with toilet paper.  
Yes there’s other bidet attachements out there, but we spent hundreds of hours watering our butts to fine tune the angle, stream and pressure of the Narsehole for your tender areas.   
If Your Butt Could Talk -  ”Imagine a life where im never irritated. You rarely see me, but you can feel me when I’m upset.  Please start using water, it’ll make me happy and when I’m happy, you’re happy.” 
 How does Narsehole connect? It attaches in-between the seat and bowl and connects to the fresh water supply coming out of the wall via an included hose splitter.

 Perfect for any occasion: You can activate the individual nozzles for the starfish or the clam, or both nozzle sprays at the same time for the dreaded diarrhea days. Trust us, all sprays are not created equal, we spent hundreds of research hours watering our butts to fine tune the Narsehole’s stream in order to take the best possible care of your tender areas! We’re four dudes that used water to clean our butts for the first time in our mid 30’s. It was amazing, faster, more efficient and it left us feeling clean and fresh! We were shocked.

Which combination will you choose?

 AdapTableTop "ATT", a lifted modular system for boardgames, wargames and RPGs.
Like you, who are reading these lines, we too are fanatics of board games and role-playing games, and we know how difficult it is, sometimes, adapting the space available and play comfortably. We did some searches, and we found an article on a website that suggested some solutions to improve the gaming experience with professional tables, in this way, we came across an amateur project that inspired us to develop AdapTableTop "ATT". We intended to make a device that had the same concept but could be more versatile. 
Since that, several products have been released on the market that allows users to improve the gaming experience, from professional wooden tables to additional accessories, and they are all good solutions. With our project, we wanted to focus on the features that we believe are fundamental to our experience as players and developers to offer a product that can help many other players to have fewer limitations due to their playable space. These are the key points on which we have worked: more surface, customizable, stable, easy to use, and transport.

We faced many problems during the development of the project. We managed to fix them and we are happy to have inserted all the features that we consider essential and unique to ensure everyone can enjoy their boardgames and RPGs in the best possible way and, above all, in any circumstance.
The honeycomb under the "ATT" modules allows the legs and stabilizers to interlock in any position. So we asked ourselves: why not make the technical data of the joints "open source" so that anyone can personalize his AdapTableTop with any 3D printer? And so we did! Together with any bundle, we will send to you as a Kickstarter exclusive, a file with the technical data of the honeycomb system. Gamestart will also unlock during the campaign a series of "ready to print" accessories. The ".stl" file (compatible with any 3D printer software) will be downloadable during the post-campaign phase.
How would you like to customize your AdapTableTop?

The first feature we focused on is the ease of assembling and disassembling "ATT", without using metal parts or screws to ensure the safety of younger children and giving the product the best flexibility of use without having to spend too much time in the setup.
You no longer have to adapt to the space available to play. Now you can create a new surface and choose to mount each leg and each "ATT" module wherever you prefer, according to your needs. You can also decide to split it or to use only one of the six available modules to make it suitable for even the smallest tables. Each module is 30 x 30cm (11,8 x 11,8 inch).
With "ATT" you can change the legs height during the assembly phase: you can choose between 8 and 12 cm (3,1 and 4,7 inch). If we had not entered this feature, Some of the players would have had visual problems and then be forced to get up often to understand what to do during the game session. We don't want your favorite game to be stressful too. You can use the different heights of "ATT" to create environments with different levels in a wargame or RPG scenario.
Reliable, stable and monolithic: 3 features to prevent the gaming experience from being ruined by an accidental gesture. The interlocking method we have chosen consists in the use of legs equipped with four pins each; they block the planks and ensure the stability of the structure. The legs can be inserted anywhere thanks to the lower part of the table made up of a continuous beehive grid. The shape difference between table hexagonal hollow area and the four-round pins of each leg allows stability and rapidity in assembly. It is undoubtedly better to invest more time in playing than to waste time assembling a device, risking to make this phase boring.
The thickness of the top ABS plastic allows the table to maintain up to 9kg of material on it and to guarantee this weight, our crash test reached 12kg.
You can play any game or wargame with metal scenery, but we do not recommend playing Twister!
Prototype: standard edition - black color
Stability, in any situation: is the essential point. It was not enough for us that, during use, it was monolithic but we wanted it to be like this even on the move, with your games or puzzles on it and with the certainty of not having any problem. How many of you happened to have to move while you were playing or doing a puzzle? You can do it without any problem and no risk. Thanks to the "DYNAMIC STABILITY ADAPTERS" to be inserted under the modules, any accidental release is prevented, bringing "ATT" to a higher standard of stability.
"ATT" is a multi-surface solution that can also be used outside the playful context, thanks to its complete modularity. Do you, therefore, want a color matching your decor? It will be possible to choose from more than one color and we managed to insert six! Glossy Silver is the primary color. Gold, red, blue, black, and green are the five exclusive Kickstarter colors with a matt finish.
It will be available with a rigid and compact case to facilitate its transport when you go to use it outside your home. 
Create two separate zones with AdapTableTop to take advantage of each type of game.

Risks and challenges
This is our 6th Kickstarter campaign, previous projects have been supported and delivered successfully or are about to be delivered.
We believe that constantly informing and supporting our backers in every phase of the project (presentation - production - shipping - customer support) is the best form of respect.
This is our philosophy.

Aware that there may be delays that do not depend on us but on production in China or the customs, we considered delivery time by Christmas 2020. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

The mission is to present products of the highest quality and that can improve your gaming experiences, giving you hours of fun.

All components will be produced in China and will respect the best quality standards that we always guarantee for our products.
To follow our latest news or information, please visit our website:

WWW.GAMESTARTEDIZIONI.COM

REFUND POLICY

We can repay within 10 days of the end of the campaign, including taxes.
If we started packing for shipping (usually 3 to 5 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refund is possible.
This project is financed in EUR and any refund paid will be in EUR for the exact amount received in EUR, excluding any applicable fees based on the current currency.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the crowdfunding campaign was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 6 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 6 week window has elapsed. campaign.story:
Railroad Ink Challenge is a quick playing roll and write game for 1 to 4 players from the creators of the critically acclaimed Railroad Ink. Grab a board and a dry-erase marker and get ready to reach networking nirvana! Roll the dice and draw the routes to connect the exits around your board. Expand your network with railways, highways and stations to collect points, but you will be penalised for any open connections, so plan carefully!
A game of Railroad Ink Challenge is played over 7 rounds. The goal is to connect as many Exits to each other as possible by drawing Routes that can create Networks. The more Exits you connect to the same Network, the more points it will be worth. Bonus points can be earned for your Longest Railway, your Longest Highway, and by drawing on the Central Spaces of your Board.
Roll the dice!
Draw the routes!
Connect the exits!
Further bonus points can be obtained by achieving the all-new Goals, but beware: the players who achieve them faster get greater rewards, so you’ll have to keep an eye on what your opponents are doing and try to complete the Goals before they do. A different set of Goals will be available each time, so no game will be the same.
But wait, there’s more! Draw unprecedented, mind-bending route configurations thanks to the new dice! Connect special structures to your network to trigger new effects: factories allow you to duplicate a die, villages give bonus points if they are close to a station, universities unlock extra special routes... use these effects wisely and you’ll score big!
There are even new expansions! Create placid forest landscapes in the Lush Green Edition, or use oases to protect your cacti from the arid desert climate in the Shining Yellow Edition! Each expansion also comes with its own goals to fulfill before your opponents, for an even greater challenge.
The new core rules included in Railroad Ink Challenge are not compatible with the classic Railroad Ink components: the boards and the basic Route dice are different, so you can't seamlessly mix the two versions. You need the new boards and Route dice to play with the new core rules.
However, the expansions are 100% compatible back and forth between the classic Railroad Ink and the new Railroad Ink Challenge:
you can play Railroad Ink Challenge by using any of the old expansions (River dice, Lake dice, Lava dice, or Meteor dice) with the new boards and Route dice 
you can play the classic Railroad Ink by using any of the new expansions (Forest dice, Desert dice, or any other that will be introduced during this campaign) with the old boards and Route dice 
Stretch goals are a staple of Kickstarter campaigns, and they are usually tied to reaching a certain funding level. We’ve been gradually moving away from this concept during our previous campaigns, and we want to continue this trend.
To unlock stretch goals for Railroad Ink Challenge, you will have to join "Challenges" by playing a special games of Railroad Ink Challenge and submitting your score: depending on the amount of submissions we will receive, and the scores achieved by the community, you will unlock Points, unlocking more stretch goals! The currently open challenge is Challenge #11 (click here for more details). You can also help us to unlock it faster by sharing this facebook post.
You can submit your score for with the form at the link below. 
Click on this image to submit your score!
We will gradually reveal additional Stretch Goals, Challenges, and Fan Boost Prizes during the campaign, so watch this space! 
Submit your score and/or share our facebook post to unlock the Underground Expansion!
We need your support to bring Railroad Ink Challenge to reality. Let's do this together!
You can help us make the game better for everyone. Collecting funds in advance will allow us to enhance the final quality and content of the game.
Many addons and stretch goals will be Kickstarter Exclusives that won't be available later in distribution. It's now or never!
Get more value of what you pledge and a competitive discounted and tracked shipping rate.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our fifth Kickstarter campaign, but we have a much longer production experience. We are an established board game publisher, and we already brought to market several other products, like the original Railroad Ink, Potion Explosion, Alone, The King’s Dilemma, Similo, Dragon Castle, and many more.

The development of the core rules of Railroad Ink Challenge is already complete; we already have the production quote for all core components and add-ons, and an agreement with our manufacturer. This should make the production process quick and straightforward. However, when you produce anything in China, unexpected events may always lead to delays with production, shipping or customs. We already took several steps that will help us minimize any of these, though.

To reduce shipping problems, we will use fulfillment companies, which is the best option when you have a large number of orders to ship in a short period of time.

Finally, we will always be transparent and openly communicating with backers. We will be updating you on a regular basis and we will be present during the whole process to answer any questions and read every comment.

The estimated delivery date of Railroad Ink Challenge is December 2020, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. We'll do our best to minimize this as much as possible.

campaign.story:
"My husband and I would like to open a mini-golf business and we  would like to hire someone to design us a course. We have asked several  designers like you to propose us something, so whomever designs the best  one is hired!"
Minigolf Designer is a competitive free form puzzle board game for 1 to 5 players that plays in 60 to 90 minutes (around 20 minutes per players).
An example of Hole made out of tiles
In Minigolf Designer, players will compete to collect tiles representing sections of mini golf holes, and arrange them the way they want to form a 9 holes miniature golf course. However, in the end the players will gain more or less victory points depending on certain aspects of their mini golf course, and also depending on the number of people drawn on their mini golf layout.
One of the three Rulers used to present the tiles and hold the turn order
Tiles are proposed to the players ordered from the least to the most valuable tile (depending on the number of victory points that the tile provides), but this order becomes also the player's next turn order.
The game is simple and plays fast, as players do only one thing during their turn: pick a tile and place it on their mini golf design. After placing around 40 tiles, their mini golf course is complete and players can score them to declare the winner.
Example of a complete mini golf course that a player can create during the game
Minigolf Designer delivers a quite new player experience to board game lovers, mostly due to its free form aspect. The fact that you can create any design gives this feeling of freedom. You can actually play just by following your artistic creativity!
But it's not a purely artistic random placement of pieces either. The puzzle aspect comes from the challenge to assemble the tiles in a way that satisfies a bunch of preferences. However, there is no unique solution; with the 256 tiles present in the box, you can build millions of miniature golf courses!
Competitive players will also enjoy the game by trying to satisfy as much design constraints as they can, if not all (which is possible). There are 7 design aspects that could give you victory points, but none of them are mandatory. Therefore, both kids, casual players and competitive players can enjoy the game but in different ways.
"I personally like to play minigolf, and I always enjoy to discover the various obstacles every time I try a new minigolf. This was the triggering idea for this game. I thought the guys who design real miniature golf courses may have a lot of fun just to invent new obstacles and try to fit all the holes on the available space, in a logical manner. So I designed my game around this idea, and now we can all experience the same fun." - Alban Nanty (designer of this game)
Since this is our first publication, we do not have a network of retailers to get Minigolf Designer to a wider audience, which means this may be your best chance to get the game!
Please note that the final appearance of the game components may differ from the images above.
The mini golf tiles are 4 cm (1.6 inches) wide. The cards are in poker format (around 6 x 9 cm i.e. 3.54 x 2.36 inches). The game box will be 29.7 x 29.7 x 9 cm (11.7 x 11.7 x 3.54 inches). The estimated weight of the box is 2.150 Kg (4.7 pounds) (with complete punch boards).
Here is a video where Alban presents the game components (in their prototype version) while explaining the rules:
As you can see the turn is very fast. Players will need between 36 to 40 tiles to complete their design, which means the players will play around 40 turns before the end of the game.
The tiles are presented to the players on a ruler (with one more tile than the number of players), but they are sorted according to their number printed on the back. When a player pick a tile, she leaves her pawn at the same place. The order of the pawns on the ruler becomes the next turn order.
Therefore, the more victory points the tile you pick has, the more likely you will play last in the next turn, leaving you with less choice in the next turn. On the contrary, if you pick a boring tile, or even if you pass in front of everyone, you will be the first player to choose a tile in the next turn.
Family Version
The above explanation is the basic mode, suitable for kids, family and casual players. This is probably the version you will play for the first time, to get familiarized with the game.
Advanced Version
The game also comes with extra wooden disks and cards, to play a more competitive version of the game. In this version, the players follow the exact same rules as the family version, but at the beginning of the game (and later during the game), players will have a chance to bet secretly on which aspect of their mini golf design they will more focus on. At the end of the game, the players can gain extra victory points, if they are actually better than the other players for the aspect(s) that they chose. However, this is risky, because if they are not the best, they will lose points.
Solo mode
The rule book contains also some rule adaptations to play solo. In solo mode, the player don't need the Rulers, but still draw 2 tiles during each turn, for choosing one. They can pass, meaning not choosing one of the two tiles, but that makes them lose victory points.

You don't need to assign victory points to your cards, we will do it according to the difficulty of the cards, and we will balance it with the other cards

campaign.story:
Clinic Deluxe Edition / KliniK Ausgabe Deluxe
You will choose your edition during the survey
COVID-19 Rules book is in English, German, French, Spanish, Italian, Korean and Chinese. Components language independent.
 This a very special campaign for me. 
I was married to a nurse and Clinic, the board game, has been massively inspired by the discussions I had with my wife when she comes home from work. 
When I released Clinic Deluxe Edition in 2019, I never thought, or WE never thought, that a giant pandemic would hit the planet.
 And I am now feeling strange about having my game on the table, all around the world, with gamers thematically trying to fight against different diseases based on abstract colors of white, yellow, orange and red. I feel as if I should do more, but what can I do to help the world's medical staff who are suffering in this war against a virus of which we know very little...
That's why I have designed a new cooperative variant called - COVID-19 Pandemic - in order to help the world in finding a vaccine in a near future. 
1 x new Propagation tile
100 x COVID-19 tokens
1 x Syringe tile
a rules booklet in 7 languages! + Portuguese and Greek in pdf
YES ... Clinic Deluxe Edition has become a cooperative game in this small expansion.
With this variant, players are now playing together. They choose a level of difficulty based on the current knowledge of COVID-19:
a degree of Contagion for the virus
a level of Lockdown of the population
The combined choices influence the arrivals of Patients and the development of the virus inside the players' clinic buildings.
All the players are taking decisions together, hiring the best doctors and building the best services to have the fewest deceased, and the most saved, patients at the end.
The major change is that the Doctors, the Nurses and the Orderlies can get infected, and you need to also treat them with safe Doctors. The non-infected staff will become scarcer and scarcer during the game...
You can download the English rules, as well as versions in French, Spanish, Italian, German, Korean, and Chinese (coming soon...)
Components are language independent, so you just need the rules that will be added in the Vaccine Reward in your preferred language!
Please note that the rules are still in balancing phase 
You are welcome to play Clinic Deluxe Edition with or without the COVID-19 Pandemic variant on Tabletopia.
Click on the image to be linked to our previous Clinic Deluxe Edition campaign.
5€: This is the level for the retailers, please contact me at avstudiogames@gmail.com, you will have a discount of 5€ on your order.

FUNDS WILL NOT BE TAKEN FROM THE PROCEEDS OF THIS CAMPAIGN.
The COVID-19 Pandemic expansion will be printed in 7 languages to reach the most backers possible. For each backer, we will donate 10€ to either the Insitut Pasteur in France or the Salk Institute for Biological Studies in the US to help fund vaccine research for COVID-19!

Alban Viard is a mathematics teacher. He lives in Beaune, a small city in Burgundy, France. He has designed and developed several boardgames during the last 8 years such as Tramways, Small City, CliniC, Card City XL, Town Center and many expansions for these games. He loves stacking everything and is always impressed by the 3rd dimension.
Ian O’Toole is an Irish illustrator, graphic designer and gamer working out of Perth in Western Australia. He has over fifteen years’ experience working in many creative fields,  producing illustration, design and 3D animation for a broad selection of industries. Ian has created the artwork for such notable boardgames as Lisboa,The Gallerist, Vinhos Deluxe, Escape Plan and more recently Age of Steam and on Mars in April 2019. Ian works in a wide variety of styles and particularly enjoys drawing from design trends throughout history. Ian works from his home in Perth, where he lives with his wife, two children and dog.
Nathan Morse has edited, translated, and/or written the rules for more than 300 published games, including The Gallerist, Troyes, Lisboa, Vinhos, Kanban, King of Tokyo, Bruxelles 1893, Madeira, Deus, Ginkgopolis, Magic Maze, The Big Book of Madness, Black Angel, Tramways, and Small City. He has a particular hunger for games with emergent complexity, and lots of player agency. Nathan is also obsessed with creating what he calls “holistic summaries” of games and their expansions, which integrate all the rules into a single stream of color-coded instructions; simply skip those you’re not using. He has played and taught more than two thousand different games, and is thrilled to share the joy of a good game with you!
Todd Sanders lives in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where he works as a graphic designer, publisher and furniture maker. He has great renown as a solo board game designer. Many of his games have already been published, and in the past three years Ludicreations funded KS campaigns for his card games IUNU, They Who Were 8, and Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden. Other games should come later this year... I have heard good things about Pulp Invasion, a second, stand-alone game in the Pulp Universe with a sci-fi theme...
Many people have worked during the last 5 years on this project. Todd has made a great map to sum up and to locate people around the world.

campaign.story:
PLAY

Why Are We Doing This? 
We’re four dudes that used water to clean our butts for the first time in our mid 30’s. It was amazing, faster, more efficient and it left us feeling clean and fresh! We were shocked and felt lied to our entire lives. Wondering why all of our heads were filled with the same false narratives — they’re some strange French thing only women use, the butt of a foot cleaning joke from a movie or that they’re big, bulky and an entirely separate unit from your toilet. 
After a month of using water to clean our butts our lives were better off — no more swampy butts, no more dingleberries, no more sore butthole days from wiping over and over again. We became filled with a righteous indignation to try to tell others/red pill all the toilet paper users out there.  
Our goal was simple - Create the most simplistic, non-electric, water powered, easiest to install butt-shower ever! Then pair that with the most badass marketing plan designed to breakdown the walls erected by society, cute bears and big TP business!!  
I know this takes some trust, we were you once too, but now we’re your future you, and your future you is telling you to take the leap of faith...we all know in our hearts that water is better at cleaning than paper. Close your eyes, listen to your clean, itch free future butt whispering “back this project, take care of your old friend downstairs, I know you rarely see me, but you can feel me when I’m upset. This decision will make me happy for the rest of my life and when I’m happy, you’re happy.”   

Q&A
1. How does Narsehole connect? It attaches in-between the seat and bowl and connects to the fresh water supply coming out of the wall via an included hose splitter. 
2. What types of toilets can Narsehole attach to? Almost any toilet. Everything is included in the box to connect to the common household toilet. 
3. How do I use the Narsehole? Poop, play on your phone for a while to make sure it’s all out, turn the direction knob to the “starfish” and the water pressure knob to desired spray, go back to playing on your phone while moving your butt around a little bit to be thorough, turn water off, pat dry with a few squares of toilet paper or hand towel, and you’re done. 
4. Is it sanitary for multiple people to use the same Narsehole? Yes. Narsehole is designed to be clean and hygienic with a self-cleaning, auto-retracting nozzle and full-length nozzle guard. i.e. it’s a million times more sanitary then using toilet paper. 
 5. What’s the “Clam” for? If you happen to find yourself in ownership of a vagina on your frontside…set the directional knob to the “Clam”, turn the water on low:) Water is an effective way to remove bacteria and prevent UTIs. 
6. Does the Narsehole require electricity? Nope. It’s powered entirely by your fresh water supply. This also makes it easier to install. 
7. What is the temperature of the water? It’s cool/room temperature water. It’s kinda like splashing your face with water in the morning...a nice little wake me up:)
8. What’s the difference between the Narsehole and the less expensive options on Amazon?  
Fast Facts: the cheaper ones have one nozzle (not worth your time) and 90% of dual nozzles are $70-$150.
Not convinced yet? Here’s the deal: We tested all the (direct from china) Amazon models and the truth is, you get what you pay for — if you’re used to boxed wine, you’ll still think it’s good — but the Narsehole is for people who like that fine wine! We’re not judging, but ask yourself, which person are you?  
Why the Narsehole is the fine wine of butt showers:
1 - Spray Nirvana: The Narsehole has a perfect spray stream with separate nozzles and pressure controls for both the starfish and the clam. Trust us, all sprays are not created equal, we spent hundreds of research hours watering our butts to fine tune the Narsehole’s stream in order to take the best possible care of your tender areas! Wanna roll the dice and save five bucks on Amazon? You’re risking getting either a small and pointy spray (ouchie!) or the super soaker that gets your entire bathing suit region wet (might as well just hop in the shower).
2 - Double Trouble: You can activate both nozzle sprays at the same time for the dreaded diarrhea days. campaign.story:
All add-ons will be available in the pledge manager after the campaign. However, we appreciate greatly if you can indicate what you are interested in by adding the cost for the add-ons to your pledge or selecting one of the predefined reward tiers.
Your job as Curator is to expand the museum and its collection. With help from your employees you will build new wings and collect objects to put on display in the museum.
Museum expanding with new wings, objects and visitors.
The employees are represented by five chips that are used to determine what different actions you may take in the game. Select your action from the face up chips, flip the chip over to show you have used it. This will reveal a different action on the other side which you can use at a later time. 
Selecting the archaeologist's action, leaves you without it on the next turn
On the other hand, if you ever have two of the same action available on your turn you may choose to double up. This means that on a single turn you can flip two chips and do double the amount of work. 
You can flip two chips with identical symbols to do a double action!
During play you acquire loan contracts for famous objects, like 'the dice tower of a Roman soldier' or 'the skull of the neanderthal man', from other museums. To score the points for these objects you need to complete a tetris like puzzle of color and space matching.
When you have build the shape and filled it, the contract is completed.
When the game ends only one museum will stand as the victor and take home the 'Museum of the Year Award'.
Shipping details and costs for the project will be handled in the pledge manager after the project ends. Refer to the table below for our estimated shipping costs.
We offer local pickup from our partner stores. Currently we partner with the following stores, but we are reaching out to more stores so we will keep updating this list.

This project is US, EU, Canada & Australia friendly, this means you won't have to worry about customs if you live in any of these regions, we will ship from within your region.
Because of irregular mail delivery we do not ship to the following countries: Russia, Syria, Afghanistan, Ukraine, Khazakstan, Yemen, Saudi Arabia & North Korea.
Currently there is a lot of uncertainty in the world. Brexit and the COVID-19 pandemic have created a situation where it is impossible to tell what the future will hold. This affects everyone in different ways and, of course, it will affect this project as well. 
For this campaign we have added more time to our delivery date as we may need room if manufacturing is delayed by some unforeseen event. 
As for Brexit we will try our best to make sure that backers can avoid unnecessary customs charges. However due to things that are out of our control, there is a slight risk that the current rules may change in an unfavorable way, that could lead to increased costs for UK backers. We are monitoring this situation and will make sure to keep backers informed about any changes.
How has it been working on Curators? 
Its has been a blast! The game really took off when Pablo and Tove introduced tetris-shaped tiles and the secret contracts. Since then there have been some small but important changes that we all contributed to.
What part of Curators are you most proud of? 
The action selection mechanic feels fresh and encourages you to plan ahead, but doesn't necessarily punish you for not doing it. Making the game suitable for both casual players and those who really like to play strategically.
Tell us more about why you want to create board games?
Creating games has been a great way for me to find a creative outlet. Doing it together with fantastic individuals like the Curators team makes the experience even more fun!
What makes Curators a great game?
I think the way we have connected mechanics, story and art to the game play is strong, this makes Curators a great gateway+ game.
How has it been working on Curators?
It has been an exciting adventure and I have learned so much. It has been fun to see the game evolve from some simple hand sketches to a finished professional product. It has also been fun to work together with such talented people.
What makes Curators a great game?
I love optimizing the flipping mechanic and the mental puzzle of the game the most.
How has it been working on Curators? 
It's been great to work with Worldshapers on the project! It was a fun challenge to work on the project because the theme was not as whimsical as my usual stuff.
What was it like developing the art for the components?
As components in board games are quite small it was challenging to make everything read well from an art perspective. I think the final result came out really well and I'm looking forward to seeing the game in print.
How has it been working on Curators? 
It was both really fun and challenging! Working with Worldshapers has really pushed me out of my comfort zone and made me learn a lot about about my own creative process.
What was the most fun thing about developing the cover?
The best part of working with the cover was to experiment with new ways for me to render it nicely. I had a great time figuring out how to approach the piece!
 How has it been working on Curators? 
Working on Curators has been a great experience. Since it was my first larger project, I finally got to put all I've learned about graphic design to good use.
What was the most fun part of developing the rule book?
The most fun part of developing the rule book was noticing how well it worked during the test sessions. Seeing something you've made being used, understood and even praised by others is a powerful experience.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have previously released other games so we know what we are doing. That beings said there are always risks with any project. 

When you back one of our projects, you are placing your trust in us and, therefore, we want to be as transparent as possible with what risks you take in doing so.

UNCERTAIN WORLD

Currently there is a lot of uncertainty in the world. During the year both Brexit and the Corona pandemic have created a situation where it is impossible to tell what the future will hold. This affects every one in different ways and of course it will affect this project as well. 

For this campaign the current uncertainty means we have added more time to our delivery date as we may need room if manufacturing is delayed due to the outbreak. 

As for Brexit we will try our best to make sure that games sent to UK backers will be sent from within the UK. However due to things that are out of our control, there is a risk that games will be shipped from the EU. In this case UK backers will need to be aware that they may have to pay additional postage or tax to be able to pick up their games. If this happens we will of course inform you before sending any games.

PRODUCTION RISKS

We will do our best to ensure a high quality product. However some things are out of our control.

In printing, there is always a risk of items differing from what was initially intended. This means that some items might not look exactly as displayed above. If you are not satisfied with your product let us know why and we will handle it on a case by case basis. 

MISSING OR DAMAGED ITEMS

When creating a game with multiple pieces, there is always the risk that some pieces go missing. If, after you receive your order, you find that there are items missing or something is damaged, let us know.

If the game arrives damaged, please take a few photos and send them our way.

DELIVERY

Our current plan for delivery is April 2021. We want your order to be delivered in time, but bad stuff can happen and even the best plans get delayed. Manufacturer errors, weather conditions, and custom hold ups are a few reasons a delay could happen. If this happens you can trust that we will let you know what is going on and how it affects your delivery.

DELIVERY ADDRESS

When this campaign is over, we will request you to complete a survey in which you can select where you would like us to ship your order. As the shipping date is not set in stone, please give us an address that will not change in the months around delivery. (For instance if you are moving, send the package to a friend or a relative's address instead.)

If you live at a military base, it is sometimes complicated to send packages to your location. Make sure to provide an address where the package can be shipped.

If a package is not delivered and the guidelines above have not been followed or if the wrong address has been given to us by a backer, the backer may have to pay any extra shipping cost if they want to receive their rewards.

BY PLEDGING TO THIS CAMPAIGN, YOU ATTEST THAT YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTOOD, AND ACCEPTED THE RISKS STATED IN THIS SECTION.

We hope you understand that, Worldshapers, will do our best to mitigate the risks mentioned above. If something unfortunate happens, please bear with us and be patient. We will do our best to sort it out.

Thank you,
Worldshapers

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We design our games to be fun and usable for a long time, this means we take replayability seriously. All our games are created with the intent of having them played as much as possible.
Reusability and recyclability
We try to minimize our use of non recyclable materials. For the components of this product we are using exclusively cardboard and paper.
Sustainable materials
We always try to minimize our use of plastic, in favor of paper, in our products. 

For this product we have talked to our manufacturing team and we will hopefully be trying a new packing technique that should allow us to remove external shrinkwrapping of our games. This means the only plastic in the game will be the wrapping for the playing cards and zip lock bags.

Apart from the above all the paper & cardboard in the product will come from certified sustainable forestry. This means we are effectively replanting almost 70 trees.
Environmentally friendly factories
When choosing a factory we consider quality and durability, shipping distance and what certifications our manufacturers have as well as price. It's important for us that our manufacturers strive to get better and we try our best to push them in the right direction. The manufacturer we have chosen for Curators uses the SEDEX framework to evaluate their supply chain, which means we trust that they are managing theirs responsibly.
Sustainable Distribution
We will try to optimize our shipping routes by sending games directly from the factory to fulfillment centers. We also provide several pickup locations, to reduce last mile emissions during delivery. 

For games that we deliver on our own we will use recycled paper as much as possible.

For this product we will be CO2 compensating for the emissions created by our transportation of the product, by replanting trees.

Hi, we should have written to you guys a while ago but things have been truly hectic both in our lives and with fulfilment since we received the games. Let us just summarize that shipping is messy. 
So to the actual update. Since we spoke last all games for EU, ROW & Sweden have been sent out. All pickup locations have received games except for the ones in the US. It would be great if those of you in these regions who have received the games could confirm this on kickstarter. If you think we missed something, feel free to contact us via kickstarter messages.

Hi, hope all of you are well. Deliveries across Europe is underway and we see things pop up in our feed on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook from various places. Your posts are making us very happy so please keep it up. To make it easier for us to find you use the hashtag #curatorsbg or #curatorsboardgame.

Solo missions
For those of you interested in playing solo missions we have made a registration form so you kan keep track of what actions you take. You can download it here.

Local pickups

Hi everyone. We want to give you a quick update on how delivery is going, since many of you are asking.

First and fore most we want to ask everyone to have a bit of patients. We know we are a bit late but we are trying our best to deliver as quickly as possible. 

Sweden

Some of you have started to receive the games, even though this is what you have all been waiting for we don't think it should be the end. We want to know that you received it well and what you think about the game. 

Please consider doing the following once you receive the game:
Mark it as received on Kickstarter - So we know that you have it.

Those of you who are picking up their games at Dragon's lair, Seriebörsen, Nexus or SF-bokhandeln in Sweden should have received an email with instructions on how to pickup their games.

Also we received some images of the game from Hanna today. Enjoy!

Today was a big day! We have received the games for Swedish fulfilment & Local pickups at our HQ (Apartment). Everything went pretty quick as we had help from some great friends of ours. 

When we first got the call about the delivery we expected the truck to be able to unload the pallets but apparently it's something we should have asked for before loading. Therefore we had to Scramble to find a forklift with a driver with one days notice. Thankfully it all worked out.

As previously communicated, May 15th was the last date to change your delivery address. We have seen a few changes so we allowed a few days more. 

However, today we are so close to fulfilment that we have to extract the address data from Gamefound to send to the fulfilment companies. Therefore, any changes you make in Gamefound from now on won't be forwarded to the fulfilment companies.

Today the games are being assembled at the factory in the Netherlands. The shipments to fulfillment will be ready for pickup in the Netherlands on Friday. We are fulfilling your orders from three different places. Orders from Sweden and local pickups in Europe will be fulfilled by us from our address in Linköping. Orders from the US, Canada and Mexico will be fulfilled by Fun again Logistics. Orders from Europe and Remaining countries will be fullfilled by Surfin' meeple in France. 
We expect the shipments to Sweden to reach backers quite soon and soon after that games will reach backers in Europe. US, Canada and Mexico will have to wait a bit longer than the rest due to the ocean freight times being a lot longer.  We suspect it may be as much as two months from now until US backers get their games.

Hi everyone!
A few of you requested an update and so we thought we would write you all a short update on the current status. On our end there is not a lot happening at this time.  The chips have been produced and are already in storage in the fulfilment centers. We have organised all the data we need for fulfilment and we are now only waiting for the manufacturing of the games. Assembly should happen between 20th and 25th of May. After that the distributors and fulfilment centers will pick the games up directly at our warehouse and transport them to the fulfilment centres in Europe and the US for the Swedish games we will fulfil those on our own.  We suspect Swedish games will arrive first, then EU games and after that US games.

Hi everyone! We just wanted to let you know that it seems like we will have further delays. I guess Megan was right when she said we may have jinxed our selves, when we hoped for no further delays. 
The reason for the delay is that a shipment of FSC paper was apparently stalled. We really want to make sure we keep our environment commitment so we will have to wait for it.  
The new assembly date is week 20 (17-23 of May). It's possible that there could be further delays but we promise we will start shipping the games as soon as the assembly is completed.

Risks and challenges
This is our 5th Kickstarter campaign, and we are confident we can deliver a smooth experience and a great game with your help! That being said, delays and issues are always possible when you manufacture a game overseas, especially in a state of the world such as this, but we are taking every necessary step to minimize those effects on our production timeline:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Indie Boards and Cards has experience in over 50 Kickstarter projects. Our previous success and the assistance and guidance of the experts we are working with will enable us to also deliver this project on time. We have every confidence that Kodama Forest will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Indie Boards and Cards will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY
We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds 14 days after the close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS 
We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS 
If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY 
Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

campaign.story:
You are one of the doctors that were just hired for the brand-new, cutting-edge Medical Center. Alongside your colleagues, you have to cooperate well to admit, diagnose and treat various patients who need your help. Combine your strengths and treat efficiently the patients arriving at hospital, but be careful, because mistakes can be of the highest value in Rush MD!

Rush M.D. is an innovative, real-time, cooperative board game that simulates the challenging and high-pressure nature of medical professions. A worker placement mechanism, using hourglasses as workers allows, but also limits, players to perform a multitude of actions. Each player handles 1 Doctor hourglass running around the hospital, admitting patients, providing immediate medical care, performing different kinds of exams as well as surgeries.
Rush M.D. was introduced through its Kickstarter campaign on July 2019 and was firstly launched in Essen Spiel '19. The game has received praise from customers and board game reviewers for its thematic adaptation of a hospital environment into a board game, being fun and engaging and requiring good communication among teammates, as well as strategy, observational and dexterity skills. However, there was obviously room for improvement in the aspects of difficulty, variability and replayability, as well as a need for more thematic ideas and more modes that could be adapted into the game. 
 We are very excited to present you the Rush M.D. - ICU expansion!
You and your fellow doctors have been working tirelessly treating patients all this time and you have helped your new Medical Center to acquire a good reputation and expand more!
But now, with the Medical Center opening an Intensive Care Unit and 4 new Examination Clinics, the pressure is even higher for the doctors to work together in order to save lives and treat everyone quickly but also efficiently. Can you live up to the challenge?
 Rush M.D. – ICU is an expansion to the real-time, cooperative, worker placement game Rush M.D.! It introduces the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) board, where you will be required to perform electrocardiograms (ECGs), defibrillation and administer pump-infused drugs (PIDs) quickly and efficiently to save lives of critically ill or severely wounded patients! It also adds a new Medical Examinations board with 4 new thematic, dexterity mini-games to offer more choices for your game. In Rush M.D. you will also find brand new ICU patients as well as new Hospitalized patients, new objectives, and more! 
Get ready to push your limits to save lives! Can you handle the pressure of ICU doctors?!
Here is a preview video of Rush M.D. – ICU by Eleni - Cardboard Rhino:
 Follow the campaign and discover all that Rush M.D. – ICU has to offer!

campaign.story:
It's a simple problem that is extremely common in our hobby, so common that I think most everyone just overlooks it.  We've made a simple solution!
Board Game Clips holding together Formula D
Have you ever been playing your favorite multi-board board game and someone knocks one of the boards out of place? Or you just can't get them lined up perfectly during setup? This can be extremely frustrating! These little clips will solve these issues and are designed specifically for board games! 
  How Board Game Clips Work
Board Game Clips are a simple, affordable solution to a simple issue.
They will snugly and temporarily clip together two boards or keep seams in boards closed with very minimal intrusion into the play surface and without noticeably marking or scuffing your board.
Board Game Clip helping to keep Terraforming Mars board completely flush!
 
        These fit nearly all board games such as Cyclades, Formula D, Zombicide, War of the Ring; Or any other board with thickness from 1.75mm to 2.5mm. These have rounded edges so they won't scratch your boards and are created with a continuous bead of 3d printed filament on each layer so that they are very durable and will hold their shape and tension for many hundreds or thousands of clips and unclips. I will also ship an extra clip with each order just in case one does break!
Our clips have been engineered to remain usable for thousands of clips and un-clips! PLA plastic is created from corn, cassava, sugarcane or sugar beet pulp.
 
        While not quite big or strong enough to straighten badly warped boards, these will solve the issue of slightly warped boards! Simply put them at the seams of the boards to keep things flatter!
  Rewards and Add-ons
 Base Pledge Levels 
There are 3 base pledge levels:  Personal, Large, and Collection.  Early in the campaign, I realized this product was very popular and I found a way to provide less expensive shipping to much of the world so I created the OUTSIDE USA pledge levels for international backers, please use those if you are not in the USA.  All of the pledge levels include an equal number of the two standard variations of straight 2mm clips.
Board Game Clips helping a slightly warped Twilight Struggle board and keeping together War of the Ring! Also a shot of 8 clips you will get with a personal size order.
The narrow variation have a little more "bite" in their grip and don't intrude into the playing surface quite as much, the wider version won't squeeze your board quite as tightly but has a larger compression area, both provide roughly the same result and I find myself using both equally in different situations.  These clips are made for boards 1.8mm - 2.7mm thick and work great for nearly all games!
    Add-ons
Straight 2mm clips won't work for every game or in every situation obviously, so we have also developed some additional "special" clips which are available by over-pledging (adding additional money to your base pledge).  At the end of the Kickstarter campaign, I will be emailing everyone a backer survey where I will ask how many of each type of additional clip you over-pledged for.  Below is the cost of adding special clips to your order.  The cost per clip varies based on which pledge level you backed.
If you want to purchase any of these special clips, please follow the below instructions:
1- Use the chart below to determine how much additional money to add to your pledge.
2- Update your pledge to include this additional amount.
3- When the campaign ends I will send everyone a reward survey, this will include questions asking how many (and what type of) special clips you purchased.  Please answer these and we will send out the correct amounts to you!  You can ask to receive any of the special clips in any combination you choose.
Below are descriptions of all of the special clips available for addition to your pledge.  All of these clips have been designed with the same principles in mind of functionality, durability, ease of use, flexible application, and leaving as little impact on your boards as possible!
    90° Corner Clip
90° Corner Clip holding together Game of Thrones the board game and it's expansion pieces.
By far the most requested special clip has been corner clips.  As you can see in the picture above from "A game of Thrones" these clips will come in handy in MANY different situations, it's so nice to have things stay put and look cohesive throughout the entire play session!  These clips will work for boards of 1.75mm - 2.25mm which covers almost anything you can throw at them!
    120° Hex Tile Clip  (2.5mm)
One of the hottest new games out right now is "Rallyman GT" it's a great game but wow are those hex tiles difficult to play on!  I've created these 120 degree clips specifically for this purpose!  Any other game that uses hexagonal tiles with 2.25mm- 2.75mm thickness will work great with this also, if you have another game in mind please let me know, I would love to hear about it!
120° clips holding together Rallyman GT!
    3mm Straight Clip
With all the high-level productions being put out by publishers lately, many games are coming with dual-layered boards, most of these dual-layered boards are 3mm thick in total, these clips will hold these together and keep things in place.  These will work on any board from 2.8mm - 3.25mm thick.  I've heard from a backer that Barrage could benefit from these.
Testing the 3mm straight clips on a typical dual-layered board.
    1.5mm Straight Clip
Some games just don't measure up!  Ok... maybe that's harsh, but plenty of great games have slightly thinner than "standard" boards.  Any board that is 1.35mm-1.8mm will probably benefit greatly from these clips, as these are the types of boards that warp easiest.
    120° Hex Tile Clip  (2mm)
Same as the 120° 2.5mm clips, but for games that use hex tiles that are 2mm in thickness.  I don't have any examples but I'm assuming they exist!  =)
Below is a segment from "Crowdsurfing" on The Dice Tower; I sent Tom our clips and the guys discuss the product and the campaign.
 A Sample of Games and Which Clips to use:
  Thank you!
Thank you to everyone who has made this project such a big success and please do not hesitate to ask any questions or voice any concerns you may have.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, thank you again so much for your patience!  I just have a quick update for everyone.  I'm very happy to say that over the weekend we have finally finished shipping out all of the orders that had no exceptions with them.  We are about four months later than expected, but very excited to be at this important milestone towards completing fulfillment.  Most everyone has their clips now and I'm so happy to hear from everyone, on a near-daily basis, how they are using and enjoying them.  Thank you all!

We are now circling back to address all of the orders that had problems in their backer survey and respond to all the emails that have been piling up over the last few weeks that we've missed.

Hi all!  I hope everyone is doing great and everyone who has their clips are enjoying them.  I'm so happy whenever I see a note from someone saying how their Board Game Clips have improved their gaming experience.
We are nearing the end of fulfillment, albeit quite a bit later than anticipated.  Currently, we are finishing up the last 70 USA collection size orders, we hope to have these completed by the end of next week.  We are then going to complete the international collection size orders which look like they will be finished by the end of September, or very close to it.  I apologize for the delays, we are nearly there though!

Thank you to everyone for your continued patience.  I wanted to get everyone the latest information on our shipping progress.  
personal and large orders outside of the USA are seeing very large delays in some cases.  Many people may notice their package shows as "delivered" in the USA, this is simply a sorting facility that the post office uses for our package classification.  After this point, it seems that most packages have been going completely dark with tracking but they are eventually getting delivered.  I spoke with the postmaster at our post office regarding this, he says that he has seen delays of over 3 months in some cases.  This is due to the fact that there are basically no flights from the USA to Europe currently, so there are very few planes for mail and packages to get on to.  They are making their way over, but it is a MUCH slower process than normal and some packages just get physically buried under the backlog of things waiting to get onto overseas transportation for months at a time.  For this reason, I won't be investigating individual international packages for many months to come.  Many people have already contacted me individually with these concerns, I've told them this same information and the package has shown up for them.  So I'm asking international customers to please be patient, your package will more than likely arrive, and if it doesn't, we will address it together later this year.  This is just the reality of the current shipping situation with the pandemic and is obviously completely out of my control.

I just logged in here to collect the next batch of orders and noticed there are a LOT of people who have received their orders and are enjoying their clips which are awesome!!  However, there are also a lot of comments asking for the status of their orders, and I really need to be packing orders not answering people individually.  So I wanted to try and hopefully clear up some of the questions and let everyone know where we are with shipping:
Completed Orders
