Welcome, adventurers!
Here to Slay is a 2-6 player turn-based role-playing competitive strategic fantasy card game.
In this game, you’ll assemble a full party of heroes to slay dangerous monsters while working to avoid the sabotage of your foes. The game also includes items you can equip to your heroes, 1V1 challenge cards, and roll modifiers to tip the odds in your favor.
The first player to slay three monsters or assemble a full party wins the game!
As part of this project, we created exclusive and collectible items that you won't get anywhere else as a thank you for supporting us on Kickstarter. These items will not be available online or in retail stores at a later date.
PLAY

In Here to Slay, you'll start with a Party Leader and work to assemble a team of Heroes to take on savage Monsters. The first person to successfully slay three monsters, or build a full party with six classes, wins the game!
Every player gets to choose a party leader character to represent them throughout the game. Each party leader card has a class and a skill that gives you an edge over your opponents. Whether you enjoy fighters, bards, wizards, or thieves, you'll find a party leader that's right for your play style - but choose wisely, because you only get one party leader for the whole game!
Your heroes are brave adventurers, ready to attack monsters and go head to head with your foes! The game includes over 40 unique heroes. Each hero card has a class and an effect, and each hero’s effect has a roll requirement. In order to use a hero’s effect, you must roll two dice and score equal to or higher than that effect’s roll requirement. 
Everyone wants to be a hero, but are you brave enough to face off against these monsters? If you successfully slay three monsters, you win the game, but attacking a monster may come at a price! In order to slay that monster, you must roll two dice and score equal to or higher than that monster’s roll requirement. 
Be warned: Each monster has a roll range in which they’ll fight back, and if you score within that range, your party might be in grave danger...
Item cards are enchanted weapons and objects that can be equipped to your heroes to bestow them with special advantages and skills. Most items give beneficial effects and are meant to be equipped to heroes in your own party, but a handful of items, called cursed items, can be equipped to enemy heroes to give them disadvantages. 
What would this world be without a little magic and mayhem? Magic cards are powerful spells with a one-time effect. Some magic cards can give you great advantages, while others are designed to set your opponents back.
Don't like what your opponent just played? Throw down a challenge! Challenge cards can be played instantly to try to stop another player from playing a hero, item, or magic card. Playing a challenge card initiates a 1V1 challenge in which you and another player both have to roll the dice. If they win the challenge, they still get to play their card, but if you win the challenge, you get to send their card directly to the discard pile!
Only fools rely solely on luck. In this game, you can keep a modifier card up your sleeve (or, well, in your hand) to make sure the odds always tip in your favor. Modifier cards add or subtract from the final total of any dice roll. Whether you need to recover from a low roll or sabotage the high roll of an opponent, modifier cards can be a handy tool when luck doesn't seem to be on your side.  
Here is a quick reference of the tiers (click to see the full spreadsheet): 
We use BackerKit to handle all add-ons. Two weeks after the campaign ends, we send out a BackerKit survey, and you can select add-ons (and enter your shipping information). US backers can purchase add-ons with no additional shipping charges, and backers anywhere else in the world will be charged just a flat $5 (for any number of items you want).
Because Here to Slay has a strong role-playing element, we wanted to include a way for you to bring your own character to the table. So as part of this project, we launched a party leader customizer that you can use to instantly create your own character using artwork that we’ve provided, or even upload your own.
You can also see characters that other members of the community have built - and the best part is, any custom party leader card that you create is fully playable in the game!
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind some of the best Kickstarter launches with 1,400+ successful Kickstarter projects and over $500M raised in total. They've been an amazing partner on this campaign and helped us grow our community! 
When our team first started working on Unstable Unicorns three years ago, we weren't really sure what to expect. We were huge fans of games, and some of us had even dabbled in designing games before, but we had never undertaken a large-scale project and seen it through to completion. The response was more than we could've ever expected, and it forever changed our work and our lives.
For the past few years, our team’s mission has been to design highly interactive games that are worth playing over and over. We want our games to bring people together, to help players express themselves, and ultimately to make the world a better place. We learn so much from every project, and each piece of feedback we get helps shape the future of what we create. 
The response we received on Here to Slay is nothing short of extraordinary. Your support means everything to us. We hope you enjoy what we create, and we will continue striving to delight you every single day.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we are confident in the preparations we have taken for this campaign, we would be naive to assume that no risks or challenges lie ahead. With each new project we’ve launched, we’ve come across new problems to solve, and we expect Here to Slay to present its own unique risks and challenges that we’ll have to overcome.

There are certain parts of the process we can’t control. For example, sometimes packages get lost in shipping or held up in customs. That said, for each of these potential issues that we’ve identified, we are working on risk mitigation strategies (such as keeping buffer inventory and building extra time into our timelines for international orders). We really appreciate your patience with us as we’ve learned and grown through the last few campaigns, and we feel super confident going into this new project that we have set ourselves up for success!

campaign.story:
Get the ultimate version of the award winning original Star Realms Deckbuilding Game and it's expansions! 
The Nova Collection contains everything you need for 1-6 players!
This entire set is Kickstarter Exclusive. Unlike normal Star Realms products, it will not be available in distribution. If you want this awesome collection, back now! 
Game Play
Star Realms is a fast-paced game of space battles that combines the fun of a deckbuilding game with the interactivity of Trading Card Game-style combat. As you play, you make use of Trade to acquire new Ships and Bases from the cards being turned face up in the Trade Row. 
You use the Ships and Bases you acquire to either generate more Trade, or to generate Combat to attack your opponent and their Bases. When you reduce your opponent’s score (called Authority) to zero, you win! Battle your friends or team up to play cooperatively against the game! 
Check out this game playthrough with Wil Wheaton:
Cards
The Nova Collection features beautiful foil versions of every card from Promo Pack 1, the Gambit Set, Crisis: Bases and Battleships, Crisis: Events, Crisis: Heroes, Crisis: Fleets and Fortresses, the Cosmic Gambit Set and the Star Realms Base set with 6 starting decks and extra Explorers. 
Foil card rough test prints. Not representative of final quality.
Score Dials
Score Dial Featuring Star Empire Artwork
This set features six beautiful score dials to track your Authority. Track 0-99 Authority on the front side, and if you are gaining tons of Authority, you can flip your score dial to the back to track 100-199 authority!
Game Board
You'll rule the galaxy in style on this high-quality 14 inch by 24 inch linen finish game board! It has spots for your Explorers, Trade Row, Trade Deck and Scrap Heap and is perfect for games with 1-6 players.
Dividers
These dividers keep your personal decks, explorers, trade deck cards and gambits organized, making game set up a snap! 
Challenge Board
This Challenge board transforms Star Realms from a player vs player game to a solo or cooperative game. Play on your own or team up with your friends to take on the Nemesis Beast or the Pirates of the Dark Star! 
The Box
Box Dimensions 15” x 13” x 4”
All this comes in a big, high quality box with space to sort everything, including all the cards with or without sleeves.
Every component slots nicely into place inside the box. Keep your cards organized with the dividers and held snugly in place with the foam block. 
Add-Ons
To order an add-on, just increase your pledge by the appropriate amount. You will be able to specify exactly which add-ons you are getting using the pledge manager after this Kickstarter campaign ends.
Enough Star Realms sleeves for the entire Deluxe Nova Collection with plenty to spare.
Note: These Add-Ons are NOT foil cards.
 The Star Realms Universe 
In the far future, the traditional governing bodies of the human race have been replaced with corporate leadership. Earth and its surrounding colonies are ruled by a group of corporations called the Trade Federation. The Federation’s policies are focused around trade and growth, but especially on profit and prosperity for those at the top of the corporate ladder. While they prefer to deal with other star realms using trade and diplomacy, they have a large defense branch dedicated to protecting the Federation’s trade and other interests.
The Trade Federation specializes in generating large amounts of Trade and in gaining Authority (increasing your score).
These mysterious creatures are the first alien life forms encountered by the human race. Most of the initial encounters consisted of human colonies being completely obliterated. On the few occasions that a Blob ship has been recovered somewhat intact, the only biological remains found inside have consisted of a gelatinous mass, thus leading to the moniker, “The Blobs.” While for several years all encounters between humanity and the Blobs have been extremely violent, there is currently some limited trade between various Blob factions and some of the more-daring human traders.
The Star Empire consists primarily of former colonies of the Trade Federation. These colonies were on the outer edges of the Federation. Not only did they feel used by the corporations, but they felt the Federation failed to give them adequate protection from the Blobs. As a result, one ambitious colonial governor was able to unite several colonies into an independent empire under his control, one with a strong military, both for warding off the Blobs and for discouraging the Federation from trying to reclaim their lost colonies.
The Star Empire is a combat-oriented faction that draws many cards and makes the opponent discard cards.
A cluster of industrial mining worlds were completely cut off from the Trade Federation by the Blobs. With the threat of annihilation by the Blobs always looming and no contact with the rest of human space, these worlds were forced to take drastic measures. Soon a cult of technology arose, focused on using advanced technology, robotics and computerization to create strong defenses and a powerful military that belied their relatively small population. Since their leaders believed their salvation lay in technology, technology soon became their god and their religion.
The Machine Cult gains most of its power from being able to remove undesirable cards from your deck and from having a large number of Bases designed to defend your Authority from attack.
Space is home to epic events and cosmic phenomena. Even the mightiest of starships seem insignificant in the face of Supernovas and Black Holes.
Events are a new type of card for your Trade Deck. Each Event card has a potentially game changing effect as soon as the card enters the Trade Row. After it has its effect, it immediately gets replaced with the next card in the Trade Deck.
Heroes are forged in times of crisis when the fate of empires can turn on the actions of a single individual.
Heroes are a new type of card for your Trade Deck. When you acquire a Hero, it goes directly into play instead of into your discard pile. Then the Hero awaits your command to rally their allies and give your turn a boost.
In the battle for space supremacy, a great admiral can be worth an entire fleet of ships. Just when your enemy thinks the battle is in their grasp, one final gambit can turn agonizing defeat into glorious victory.
Players agree on a number of gambits, and each start with that many face down in play. On any of your turns you may reveal and use a gambit for a powerful effect. 
Gambits can also be used to even the odds for players of varying skill levels. If you're a lot better at the game than your friend, but want a close match, just give them a couple extra gambits at the beginning of the game.  
Videos and Reviews
There are many videos and reviews of Star Realms online. Here are a few:
Project Notes
Shipping
We will be shipping to backers directly from fulfillment centers in The US, EU, Canada, Australia, and Asia.
Our goal is to get product to our backers as soon as possible. When product arrives at one of our fulfillment centers, we will begin the process of shipping to backers in that region without waiting for product to arrive at other hubs. This means that backers in some regions may receive product before backers in others.
IMPORTANT - For this Kickstarter you will be charged shipping separately after this Kickstarter concludes. This will be done via the Pledge Manager, which will be sent out spring 2020. What you are charged for shipping will be based on our actual cost to get your rewards to you from your region's fulfillment center.
Here is an estimate of shipping cost by region. Keep in mind, this is just an estimate and cost will increase with add-ons.

Unfortunately, we don't ship to Afghanistan, Brazil, Kazakhstan, Russia, or Ukraine.
Kickstarter Exclusives
These are exclusive items for Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only. Kickstarter exclusives may eventually be remade with new art and/or language for general sale.
The Kickstarter Exclusive version will be forever identifiable by its original art and/or language.
Nothing is final until it is printed.

campaign.story:
The coolest game to ever hit the planet first appeared some 38 years ago, featuring an electronic tower that lit up, played music, and somehow ran an epic fantasy adventure game with its state-of-the-art technological wizardry. That game was Dark Tower. We want to bring you that same sense of awe and wonder, pushing the boundaries of what a board game can actually do. After 3 years of painstaking work by a team of two dozen designers, engineers, and artists, we are thrilled to present to you a game with echoes of that long-gone wonder but ultimately unlike any game you've ever experienced.
Return to Dark Tower is a game for 1 to 4 heroes who undertake epic quests, fight fearsome foes, and test their mettle against the looming darkness of the titular tower. Now featuring both cooperative and competitive play. Designed by Rob Daviau and Isaac Childres -- designers of the two highest rated games of all time on Board Game Geek -- along with Noah Cohen, Brian Neff, and Justin D. Jacobson, the streamlined rules offer players difficult choices about when to advance their objective, gather resources, deal with threats, or level up.
Each player controls a unique hero with their own starting inventory and special abilities. Along the way you gain helpful items, powerful virtues, and trusty companions to help you achieve your goal: Find a way into the Tower and defeat a powerful adversary.
Figuring out the best way to utilize all of these assets is the key to victory. The game actively works to stop you, responding to your decisions and taking advantage of your missteps. Foes, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, will stalk your hero and assault your buildings.
Our innovative combat system leverages the power of the processor. Within the app, select virtual "cards" from each foe's unique deck, revealing the potential consequences of the fight. Then, use your hero's advantages to modify those results. Will you mitigate losses across the board, or focus on one to gain valuable resources for your effort.
Looming over the board, the Tower itself is the greatest menace you'll face. Each turn, you drop a skull in, representing the threat of corruption. You decide where emerging skulls are placed, making those buildings less useful. At times the Tower itself springs to life, releasing trapped skulls in a single wave or revealing glyphs that sap your will.
The path to victory is fraught with peril. Battles and events can give your hero corruption. If you don't cleanse skulls from the buildings to keep them in check, the supply quickly dwindles.  
Tarry too long and face the risk of having all of the seals of the Tower break. Corruption, skulls, and time: Any one of these pitfalls can spell defeat.
Return to Dark Tower constantly presents new challenges. The adversary within the tower, the plan to access the tower, and the suite of foes you will face can mix and match in thousands of combinations. Play the same array over again or try something completely new.
For complete information on how to play, you can download the draft rulebook: 
Or check out this live playthrough we'll be doing on the Dice Tower:
We've also arranged for a how-to-play video by Rodney Smith of Watch It Played! at the time of release. 
Created by a world-class team of designers and engineers led by Tim Burrell-Saward, an expert in technology-augmented games, the Tower itself is a game component without equal. From its very foundation, it's been devised to play an integral role in the game. Using a collection of magical-yet-reliable technologies, it generates game moments that simply wouldn't be possible without it. The Tower literally and figuratively dominates the table, drawing upon all of these powers to foil you. You will grow to curse its name.
Learn more about the intense tower development and prototyping process in Tim's designer diary.
The game itself is rich and satisfying. But we have a few additional items in this campaign to upgrade your play experience even further.
For those of you new to Kickstarter, an "add-on" is something that's not included with a regular pledge. If you're interested in getting the neoprene board or any other add-on we might add to the campaign, it's really simple. You have two options:
You can manually add the amount of the add-on to your existing pledge. (For the mat, it's $45 including shipping.) If you have already backed and you go to the top of the campaign page, you'll see a button in the top right that says "Manage your pledge". Click on it and it will take to you a "Change your pledge". Then you can click on the "Change your pledge" button. Then, in the box with your "Pledge amount" you can manually add the cost of the add-on to your pledge. Click "Continue" and your good to go. (NOTE: You can also use this method if you want to upgrade from the Charge the Tower to the Azkol's Fortune level.)
You can add any add-ons in BackerKit (our pledge manager) after the Kickstarter campaign is over. I'll talk more about how pledge managers work as we get closer to the end of the campaign, but it might help to think of it as an online store where you "spend" the money you pledged in the Kickstarter campaign and where you can add new items too, like the neoprene board.
The Alliances expansion offers new rules and components to add further depth and variety to the game. It includes two new heroes, who can be used in any game. The Archwright fortifies buildings to protect the kingdoms; the Haunted Recluse dabbles in forbidden lore to powerful effect. Influence is a new resource that can be used to form alliances with powerful guilds or to thwart the capricious whims of the nobles. It also features new treasures and allies with more intricate abilities for experienced gamers.
The Dark Horde box contains stunning sculpts by Punga Miniatures of all the foes in the game. These figures bring the foes to life. (Keep checking back here as we unlock new foes and show off new sculpts.)
 The Coffers box replaces the cardboard resource tokens from the game and the Alliances expansion with top-quality, heat-transfer plastic tokens that have a great feel and durability.
 This 50mm diameter and 5mm thick metal coin signifies the active player. If you signed up for notification before the campaign launched, you will receive this for free if you back the kickstarter and get at least one copy of the game.
Seriously, folks. This mat is huge and heavy. It's about 80% larger area than the game board. This makes the spaces larger as well of course, which can be a boon if you're playing with the miniature foes from Dark Horde. A real specialty item for those who want to play an epic game on an epic stage.
 Check out this rendered example of a gold foil art print:
Give all your cards a little extra protection. This add on includes enough high-quality sleeves to cover the cards in Return to Dark Tower and the Alliances expansion. 110 standard card sleeves and 85 mini sleeves (plus some extras for lost or broken sleeves). Most sleeves will have a custom print, but some standard sized sleeves will be completely clear to accommodate the double-sided cards.



Part of the fun of Kickstarter is achieving new heights and unlocking those sweet stretch goals. We've already packed a ton of content into the game, but we'll manage to find a way to get even more goodies in there. So let's break those seals!

At PAX Unplugged, we were able to run a number of tabletop media folks through the game. These opinions were freely given and provided without compensation. Here's what they had to say:
We know you'll love Return to Dark Tower. But you might be wondering why you should back now. There are four main reasons:
 You can get what you want. The game itself is not exclusive to Kickstarter. We do have a retailer pledge in the campaign, so there are stores who will have the game when it fulfills. However, we are still unsure if we will be able to sell the game into retail distribution, and the add-ons are particularly unlikely to be available widely if at all. Backing is the one way to make sure you get what you want.
 You'll get the game early. Even if the game does ultimately go into retail distribution, we promise to hold the retail street date for at least 90 days after fulfillment is completed. As a thank you for backing, we want to make sure our backers get the first chance to play.
 You'll get the game cheaper. As you can see above, you will pledge less than the suggested retail price. While it is true that some online retailers often sell games for below the regular price, that's less likely in this case. If the game ends up not going into retail distribution, aggressive discount merchants won't have access to it. Even if it does, the discount is likely not be much better than what we're offering in the campaign.
 You get to be a backer. Being a backer means being part of a community. You'll get to speak up on decisions we make during the campaign and share ideas with other backers. Most importantly, you'll help make this game become a reality. Some publishers have taken to using Kickstarter as a pre-order system. That is very much not the case with Return to Dark Tower. We simply could not make the game without the success of this campaign. You'll be a part of that success and part of unlocking stretch goals to make the game even better.
If this is your first Kickstarter, welcome! It's easier than it looks, and being a part of the community can be a lot of fun! You can download this PDF file to learn the ins-and-outs of being a backer:

We are once again using Quartermaster Logistics to oversee the fulfillment process. They have an extremely efficient system, quality packaging, tracking information, and their customer service is second to none. We have key fulfillment partners within each shipping region and will freight the games directly to them, so there will be no surprise charges, such as customs fees or VAT, to the US, EU, Canada, Australia, and China.
Please use the chart below to calculate your shipping fees. Due to an error in setting up the Kickstarter page, some countries are charged at the time of pledge, while others will be charged in the pledge manager after the campaign. You will also be charged additional shipping if you order add-ons or multiple copies and at similar rates.


We cannot ship to PO Boxes or to the following countries: Afghanistan, Burma (Myanmar), Cuba, Iran, Kazakhstan, North Korea, Russia, Sudan, Syria, and Ukraine.
We are also thrilled to be using BackerKit again. They are a "pledge manager", a third-party service that lets us manage our orders and fulfillment. This service starts after the Kickstarter campaign is over. You'll be able to add items to your pledge at that time. If you are unsure about what items you want to get during the Kickstarter campaign, you can back at the "Map to BackerKit" level. This will qualify you as a backer for any backer-related goodies and will give you access to the pledge manager to fill out your order later.
RETAILERS
We have a special pledge tier for verified brick-and-mortar stores: For Bazaar Proprietors Only. You pledge only $50 during the campaign. In the pledge manager, you will finalize your order. However, you will not have to pay the remaining balance due until the games are ready to ship. Please click here for detailed information and terms.

Restoration Games was founded in 2016 by Justin D. Jacobson and Rob Daviau on a shared love of all those great board games they played when they were kids. We are dedicated to restoring these games to their rightful glory,  bringing the fun we had to a new generation of gamers.
SPREAD THE WORD
A Kickstarter campaign is only as strong as its backers. You will help push this project to be the best it can be. We greatly appreciate anything you can do to let people know about this campaign, whether it's posting to your social media accounts, sending emails to your friends, or letting a co-worker know about us.
If you haven't joined the game's facebook group, go do it. We've got a great group of fans, talking about the game, and it's a good place to go to ask questions.

updates.update_userinfo: Titanic Update: Revised Fulfillment Timeline and a Bunch of Other Stuff
updates.update_content:
Lots and lots of stuff to talk about. Everything is picking up the pace as we finalize manufacturing. To keep this update from getting too long, I'm going to update you all on the fulfillment timeline and then do some quick hits about a number of other things. Let's get to it!
Fulfillment Timeline

updates.update_userinfo: Guest Update: An APP-etizer with Tim Burrell-Saward (and Live Playthrough Next Week!)
updates.update_content: One critical part of the game we haven't shown much of is the companion app. In fact, our app developer, Porcelain Fortress, headed by the inimitable Björn Elíeser Jónsson, has been working non-stop for more than two years on it. And we're finally ready for you all to have an early look. I tapped Tim Burrell-Saward, our project manager and lead engineer, to do a deep dive on the app's heroic journey to date. As with all of these updates, keep in mind that we are still refining and will continue to refine until the game gets into your hands and beyond. Everything here is still "in progress". Specifically, a lot of the text has not even had an editing pass. Let me make this extra-clear:

updates.update_userinfo: Final Engineering Prototype and Detailed Plastic Photos
updates.update_content:
As some of you might have seen, the team received a slew of FEPs this past week. "FEP" stands for "final engineering prototype". Sometimes also referred to as a "mass-production copy", it's the first full "game" comprising all of the final files intended to be used for mass production. It's one last check to find any last little problem before we hit the big red button that says: spend a million dollars and make 25,000 copies of this game.
I have to say, it's an extremely rewarding milestone. This is a project that I've been working on for three years. To open a box and see an actual playable game, is pretty amazing. But it's also a bit tense. It's a major checkpoint, where you're likely to run into issues that need addressing. You're just hoping that they're all manageable.

updates.update_userinfo: Call for Playtesters and a Look at the Hero Minis
updates.update_content:
We continue to make steady progress in the production process. All of the print materials have been locked down. Plastic production by Panda is underway. I've got a sweet photo of those hero minis for you in a minute.
But first, I'm putting out a call for playtesters. With the print materials locked down, we're looking to refine the data in the app to further balance the game and make it more fun. These playtests will be done in Tabletop Simulator (on Steam) and (unlike prior playtests) will use the actual app (with a built-in Tower simulator). We know some of you signed up for and did some playtesting for us last year. But circumstances can change -- especially during current events these days. So, even if you signed up before, if you're still interested in testing, please sign up again. To playtest, you will need access to Tabletop Simulator and an Android or iOS device to run the app. You would be able to playtest remotely, but it would be easier if you have a group that can get together in person to share the app device.

updates.update_userinfo: * IMPORTANT: Mobile Devices Survey - PLEASE FILL OUT *
updates.update_content: Listen, some updates are less exciting than others. Although I don't have anything sexy to show off, this is a very important update. The app infrastructure is nearly built. We'll then be moving into testing (and data editing). It would be extremely helpful to know what devices you all are planning on using to play the final game. This will help us make sure that the final version of the app is thoroughly tested for those devices. We'll have a deep dive update on the app with lots of gorgeous screen shots, but in the mean time, please go to this link, preferably with your device in hand, and complete this very brief, 4-question survey: MOBILE DEVICES SURVEY LINK

As I've mentioned, I'm planning on doing more, shorter updates on a regular basis, punctuated by longer, more in-depth updates when something important happens. Today, I've got a quickie.
As you know, we are in the very final stages of the Tower engineering before we sign off and manufacturing begins. Even then, they'll need to test the Towers to make sure they're working. That's easy for the other components: are the cards printed correctly, do the minis look good, etc. But how do you test an electronic Tower?

In this update, I'm going to show off the insert for the game (with a good look at the current state of the box as well). Basically, an unboxing in jpgs instead of video. It's a lot like an onion: multiple layers, and it'll make you cry (cause it's so beautiful). At the end of the update, I'll bring everyone up to speed on the general state of the project and where we are with various other parts of the game. So, if inserts don't tickle your toes, you can jump straight to the end.
Before we get into it, the usual caveats: This is 99% final, but that means it's 1% not final, which basically means things can still change. Not likely but possible. This goes doubly for the box render and the stuff rendered in the insert, like the punchboard and rules and such. Without further ado, let's start at the top.

updates.update_userinfo: A Closer Look at the Competitive Game
updates.update_content: For this update, I'll be showing off a bit more of the competitive game. As most of you know, the original game from 1982 was a competitive game. Players raced to defeat the brigands in the Tower. The first one to do it won the game. Early on in our development, we decided to make our restored version cooperative. We think it's more thematic appropriately and mechanically. But we knew some folks would like to be able to play competitively like in the original. We continued to work on it even as we entered the Kickstarter and finally announced we were doing it way back in Update #11.

updates.update_userinfo: Let's Check Out the Box Bottom
updates.update_content:
As we move into this next stage of production, my plan is to post smaller, more regular updates and start showing off some stuff you all haven't seen or that has been updated since the campaign. Today, we're going to take a quick look at the box bottom.
First thing to mention is that it's not really the box bottom at all. The box will, of course, have a bottom, but this ain't it. Bigger picture, we know that you all have paid a lot of money to get this game. Granted, most of the expense is in that beautiful electronic Tower that will sit in the middle of the table. But we want to make sure the rest of the game meets that high bar. Traditionally, a box bottom serves as a marketing piece to attract the eye of someone browsing at the store, and it also has a number of legal requirements, like safety icons and copyright notices. Fine and necessary, but not pretty to look at. So we made the decision to have the traditional box bottom turn into a separate slip sheet that is placed over the box bottom and held into place by the shrinkwrap. When you open the shrink, you can toss the sheet. This meets our needs for the store shelf, but allows you to have a beautiful game box on your shelf at home.

updates.update_userinfo: Guest Update: Checking in on the Tower with Tim Burrell-Saward
updates.update_content:
I know folks like to get a closer look at the manufacturing process, and there's no one better to fill us in than Tim Burrell-Saward, our project manager and lead engineer.
Before we jump in, Board Game Geek's annual "Most Anticipated" list is underway. Nominations are open for games you're looking forward to this year. If you're willing and able, we'd appreciate your support for our nomination. All you have to do is click here and click the green thumb under the box cover. Thanks!

May 10, 2019 marked the 150th anniversary of the completion of the Transcontinental Railroad. This epic undertaking connected the United States from coast to coast for the first time. Now is your chance to make history!
In Pacific Rails Inc, players are the Presidents of their own Railway Company, with a contract to build a railroad from one side of the board to the other.
Well-known for his work on the games Brass, Nocturion, and more, professional illustrator and game artist Damien Mammoliti joined the Vesuvius Media Team to create the stunning artwork of Pacific Rails Inc. From the box cover all the way to the game board, the artwork is highly-detailed and beautifully  crafted.
 Pacific Rails is language independent. The game's components have no text. As such, with just the rulebook you will be able to play the game in all supported languages.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
PLEASE READ THIS SECTION CAREFULLY BEFORE PLEDGING TO THIS CAMPAIGN.

PRODUCTION RISKS

Even though we do our best to ensure a quality product and a timely production, there is always the risk of delays. Supplier shortage, holiday traffic and weather conditions are just a few of the reasons a production could be delayed. Vesuvius Media Ltd should not be held responsible for delays caused by third parties. In addition, some of the items shown might differ from the final product due to supplier/manufacturer error.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS

When dealing with a large number of orders, there is always a chance that errors will occur. If after you receive your order, you find that there are items missing, please contact us at support [at] vesuviusmedia.com and we will send you the missing items as soon as possible.

If your package arrives damaged, please take a few photos of all damaged items and email them to us at support [at] vesuviusmedia.com. We will send you replacements for the damaged items as soon as possible. 

DELIVERY DATE

Our current estimation for delivery is September 2020. We want your orders to be delivered on time as much as you do; however, history has shown that despite the best laid plans there is always a chance of delay.

UNDELIVERED ITEMS

If a package is not delivered due to a backer's fault (wrong address given, backer didn't claim the delivered package from their post office, etc), the backer may be requested to pay additional shipping fees for the item to be sent out again.

BACKER RESPONSIBILITY

It is your responsibility to check the Kickstarter campaign's updates and the private messages we send you. If a backer does not complete the Pledge Manager in time, then the shipping rates to send you the game at a later time will be a lot higher (because they will not be part of the mass shipping process). If the game can not be delivered because you did not fill out your shipping information and more than 6 months have passed after the deadline, there is a chance we will not be able to deliver you the game. At that point, you will not be entitled to a refund. 

DELIVERY ADDRESS

After this campaign, you will be requested to complete a survey through which you can let us know which items you have ordered as well as where you would like us to ship your order. Keep in mind that your order may be shipped sooner or later than the estimated delivery date. Please give us an address that will surely not change (If for example you think that you may be moving to a new house around May, please give us the address of a friend or relative to ensure a successful delivery).

SHIPPING

Please read the Shipping section above.

ORDER FULFILLMENT

Please note that your order may be delivered in multiple packages. This is done due to weight limitations for group shipments. Even though the items you ordered will be shipped at the same time, there is always a chance they will arrive to you several days apart. This may occur due to each country's postal service sort-and-dispatch system.

UPDATES

Through this campaign you may receive updates about Vesuvius Media's other upcoming projects. Such updates will be rare.

You will also receive notifications about future projects. These notification will also be very rare and it will be very easy for you to opt-out with on click.

BY PLACING A PLEDGE ON THIS CAMPAIGN, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTAND AND ACCEPT THE RISKS & CHALLENGES STATED IN THIS SECTION.

Thank you very much,

Vesuvius Media Ltd.

campaign.story:
For more than four centuries scholars have argued over the identity of the mysterious Dark Lady of William Shakespeare’s sonnets. In Black Sonata, you will find yourself in Shakespeare’s London, circa 1600, in pursuit of the shadowy Lady. Can you finally solve English literature’s greatest mystery? Or will the Dark Lady elude you too?
Black Sonata: The Fair Youth expansion adds new tools and challenges to the base game. Each expansion can be played separately or in combination with any other.
 The Fair Youth expansion adds an additional deduction task to the game: you must discover where in London the Fair Youth is hiding.
 The Rendezvous challenges you to discover which of the seven landscape features acted as a meeting place for Shakespeare and his Dark Lady.
 The Rival Poet adds a second pawn that stalks the streets and interacts with the player via simple movement rules
 Waypoints and Traces gives you two tools to mark and track the Dark Lady's location at a particular point in the stealth deck.
And The Darker Ladies replace the clue cards in the base game, giving each Dark Lady a new set of characteristics and presenting a slightly harder deduction challenge.

Fair Youth: US/EU = $3, Rest of World = $4
Black Sonata: US/EU = $5, Rest of World = $10
Black Sonata + Fair Youth: US/EU = $7, Rest of World = $13
Note: Additional copies can be added to your pledge free of charge! Just add the appropriate amount to your pledge per additional copy of Black Sonata and/or The Fair Youth Expansion.
For our Canadian backers, all pledges will ship from within Canada.  For our EU backers, all pledges will be fulfilled from the EU. For backers in the rest of the world, pledges will be shipped from China either directly to you or through a local partner. This, combined with the small size & small price point, allows us to offer affordable shipping to everyone across the globe.
It would be an honor to have Black Sonata & The Fair Youth Expansion on the shelves of retail stores! Please back our campaign at the base pledge level and email us at orders@sideroomgames.com. We’ll get back to you shortly to hammer out the details.
By day, John Kean is a mild mannered ecologist working to save the world from damaging bugs and diseases. By night he mostly sleeps. And in between he enjoys playing games, making music, juggling, mountaineering, trashy crime fiction and long walks on the beach with his family. Sometimes all at once. He doesn't like Brussels sprouts, but pretends to in front of his children.
Dustin has been playing board & card games since he was beating his family at Pitch back in junior high. He's a highly trained Microsoft Office Engineer. He was also able to trick his wife, Christa, into marrying him and their 3 kids are too cute for their own good.
In the daytime Michael is a Software developer but at night he’s a gamer. He first started playing video games when his parents got him his very own NES for Christmas, and the rest was history. Some of his best memories as a kid was playing Chrono Trigger and Earthbound. The thing Michael looks at the most in a game is a theme that’s rich and well integrated into the mechanics. When he’s not gaming, Michael enjoys spending time at his home in the mountains, as well as kayaking and hiking with his family.
Alan is a software engineer during his day job, that translates into a fascination with game mechanics and the algorithms that power his favorite board games. He has been a life long video gamer and fell in love with the board game renaissance 10 years ago. He enjoys many different board game genres, and a good mechanic above all is his focus.
Brett wasn't born loving board games like the rest of these nerds, but came to realize an affinity at a much older and saltier age. His appreciation for boardgames was born from a long history of video gaming. He may not be able to tell you the difference between an area-impulse euro and a modular board deck builder, but he brings a unique, somewhat outsider perspective to Side Room Games.

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! Just wanted to reach out to folks on where we're at for shipping. As far as we know all games have gone out to folks across the world. However, we know some people are still waiting for their deliveries. We would have expected folks to receive their copies by now so it's a high likelihood that if you haven't received anything yet it's either on its way back to Collext or it's lost... :(
But, we're Side Room Games and we don't do losses! We will make it right one way or another. So, if you're still waiting please reach out to us (message on Kickstarter works great, or email at support@sideroomgames.com) and we can go through the options we have. No matter what we want to make sure everyone is happy with their backing/purchase as we know we wouldn't be where we are without you!

Hey everyone! Just wanted to give our backers in Europe the good news that all of the packages have been relabeled and are on their way! Collext was able to identify the problem with their courier integration and had to revert to some older methods to get all of the labels printed correctly. Based on their previous estimate, I'd expect 1-2 weeks for delivery to most folks.
As I've mentioned before, we can't thank you enough for all of your patience going through this. There's nothing more frustrating to a publisher than having games ready to get to backers & customers and once things are out of our hands things run into snags. While we hated to be the one that found the issue, I'm glad we helped identify the problem and things are moving again.

Hey everyone! We finally have resolution on what the problem was with the non-UK game deliveries. Collext was able to track down that there was an error in the label printing / API integration to their shipping service. So the games are sitting at Heathrow airport and need to be reprocessed and relabeled. Collext is working with their courier to go through and get this taken care of so the games can go out as soon as possible. Luckily all of the packages are consolidated on a couple of pallets and aren't loose so that should help speed things up. I'll post another short update once I hear back from Collext that the relabeling is complete and things are moving again - hopefully in the next day or so.

Hey everyone! Super quick update for our EU backers. The games did finally make it to Collext on Tuesday! If you hadn't seen any of the comments, for some reason the unloading process at the port took way longer than expected; the ship arrived 7 October, so almost 3 weeks! :( It sounded like the port is really busy right now (Brexit panic!?!? :-/ ).
I talked to Craig with Collext this morning and they're working to get them out as soon as possible. I'm guessing some will get out today & tomorrow and the rest early next week (lots of other fulfillments on their plates too). So, while we're a little behind where we hoped to be, the games are heading out! We really do appreciate all of your patience and support - rest assured we'll get you taken care of!

campaign.story:
Welcome to an all-new season of the Dice Tower! We are raising funds to continue our coverage of board games and the people who play them.
We are a group of gamers dedicated to growing and promoting the board game hobby and those who enjoy it. Tom Vasel, Zee Garcia, Roy Cannaday, Mike Dilisio, and many others produce weekly videos covering hundreds of different games both new and classic. Additionally, Eric Summerer, Suzanne Sheldon, Mandi Hutchinson, and Tom produce a weekly podcast all about games and the people who play them.
But that's not all! We also provide you with news, variety shows (such as Board Game Breakfast), a series of popular "Top Ten" videos, shopping guides, and more! All of this can be found at our website - www.dicetower.com.
Our show gets a majority of its funding from our Kickstarter campaign each year. We have six full-time employees and two part-time employees. Last year our focus was on producing more live content and increasing our convention coverage.  This year our goals are:
 Continue to produce regular live content on a set schedule 
Increase interaction with our listeners
Continue to increase the quality of our current YouTube shows
 Start a regular newsletter 
Lots of top ten lists with special guests
 Upgrade our equipment 
We're asking for your help as we pursue our goal of covering the entire world of board games. updates.update_content:
Well, it's a wrap!  Well, mostly.

Everything should be in the mail at this point.  Likely some folks still haven't gotten their packages yet, but we ask those in the US to wait for a few weeks, just in case, and those overseas to wait until February at least before worrying.  If you don't get your package by that point, please email kenny@dicetower.com, and we'll get on it.

Well, that made my day to see that a few people have already gotten their stuff!  Huzzah and hooray!  I hope you enjoy them and have a great time using them in games!
A few notes
- Shipping is a very lengthy process, so realize that some people may have to wait as stuff is shipped out each day.  I ask your patience as it might take weeks (especially overseas) to get the promos.
- A few promo Discoverer packs were accidentally sent out with one Reavers of Midgard promo instead of a pack of six.  This was caught, and replacements will be sent out.  You don't even need to notify us, shipping knows which addresses had the mistakes.

Right now, address verification notifications are going out to everyone!  You should get it by the end of the week - if you don't get one by Saturday, check your spam folders!   If you still can't find it, email kenny@dicetower.com

What does this mean?  It means everything is finally in the warehouse and packages are being assembled.  Once shipping starts (hopefully within 10 days), we'll be shipping international first and then US afterwards (that way everyone gets it closer together).

I've been getting a lot of emails asking about fulfillment, and I wish I could give you more information, but the stuff is being shipped to QML and is in queue.  Unfortunately, so is a lot of other stuff due to the Christmas season.  So we'll let you know as soon as stuff starts shipping.
But good news!  The Gloomhaven scenario is done and should be available to everyone who picked it in the Backer Kit.   I want to give a huge shout out to Bryan Drake, who helped put the scenario together (with Isaac, of course!).  I hope you all enjoy it!  If you backed for the scenario, you can download it from your Backer Kit account.  If you don't see it for some reason, please email kenny@dicetower.com and he'll help.

Just a quick note here, folks, to let you know what's going on.
- As far as we know, everything is in the air, heading towards QML for deployment (this still might be a week or so.)
- Labels are being generated to save time on turnaround for when the stuff gets to QML
- Last week I said there would not be Village Attacks promos, I meant The Everrain (same company, my apologies for the misspeaking)

Folks, I am beyond frustrated that I have to write this update.  Due to circumstances out of our control, the entire Kickstarter has been delayed.  There are several factors, but here are the main ones.
- We've been waiting for the promo for Village Attacks, and we've finally found out it just isn't coming.
- We wanted to get the Gloomhaven scenario done, but Frosthaven has really slowed down all related Gloomhaven stuff.  I'm working hard to get this one finished, and it will be sent out the moment we get an okay from Cephalofair.
First of all, I'll have a detailed update this coming Monday with shipping status, etc.  Thanks!  Meanwhile, here's some more pictures!
We have some more pictures of promos!

Kenny went to the warehouse and started the long process of sorting things out and getting them ready.  There's still a lot of process ahead!
But in the meantime, I figured we could show you some of the promos - some of which I saw for the very first time!   In a few days, I'll show you more!

updates.update_userinfo: Major Update: Shipping, Missing Promos, Pictures, and more.
updates.update_content:
The Hello everyone!  I hope you are having a safe, fantastic week!
So here we go...
1.) I cannot tell you how I went out of my way to make shipping LATE, in September, so that we would deliver everything early and be heroes!  At the time, we had no idea about Covid, and yes - I know every Kickstarter on earth is using that excuse - but it's real, and it's caused delays.   So at this point, our shipping timeline is thus.  October we will be prepping everything for shipping, sending it to the EU hub and getting it all prepared.  The likely shipping date for everything is the first week of November.  I HATE that it's late, but there simply isn't anything else I can do at this point.  The channel content isn't late, if that helps at all!

updates.update_content:
We're Nearly There
The remaining shipment of games is through Customer and arriving at the distributor this week. He will ship them out to you immediately upon arrival.
I apologize that it has taken so long to get you your rewards, but finally, you will have the opportunity to play Red Outpost. I hope you, your friends and family enjoy the game.

Here is the link to the pending EU shipments.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1JiXyp0s337rUNkHszvIuVZ4OVKoc1DQfZu4O2zCeiWk/edit?usp=sharing

Or, click here.

I put off sending any updates until I had something concrete to say. Still, all I have is an estimate due to delay followed by delay.
Shipping out of China is very difficult right now with Christmas and most of the world fighting continued COVID restrictions. Most ports in the world are congested due to high shipping and missing workers. The ship with the games on it is running a couple of weeks behind and is currently scheduled to unload in Greece late next week. Our last shipment arriving there took more than a week to get through Customs due to COVID reduced staffing. The distributor has committed that he will send them out within a day of receiving the shipment in his warehouse. Based on recent experiences I've had shipping product this last month and a half, I've started adding a week or more to all estimates that I'm receiving from the freight companies. My best estimate at this point is that the remaining games will arrive around New Year's Day.

The additional games are on their way and will arrive at the warehouse in about a month. Once I have that list, I will create a list of just the backer numbers and put it in a Google sheet for people to check and verify if they are one that is waiting.

campaign.story:
Ski Tour : Biathlon brings a previously unrepresented sport to the gaming table, providing a game of skill, tactics and friendly competition. Play as one of five nations and race one a highly customizable track, providing a great experience over and over again
  "The chase is on, you have enough stamina to make a long sprint for the finish line, but will it be enough to grab the gold?"
Welcome to Ski Tour: Biathlon
As a skier representing your nation, do you have the stamina and marksmanship to make it onto the podium? Wax your skies, roll your dice, strategize, hit those targets at the shooting range and be the first to cross that finish line in this heart pumping game of skill, stamina and marksmanship! 
What makes Ski Tour: Biathlon a great game?
 Low downtime. The game plays in two phases where all players act simultaneously in phase one and then in turn order in phase two. However you will be able to react to other players actions during phase two, even when it's not your turn.
 High player interaction - Your every move is of uttermost importance for the other players. How do you position yourself? How can you prosper from other players actions?
 High replay value - Each nation has small variations to the others. How can you use your nation in the best way? Furthermore the modular board lets you build a new ski course each time you play. Build it as challenging as possible or easy and quick or make it resemble a course from the world cup!

 More reviews will be added during the campaign!
PLAY

 Spielkult.de review of the game 8/10 (In german) 
 BoardGameMonkeys article about the game (In german) 
Download the rulebook using the link below:
Klick to download rulebook
In Ski Tour: Biathlon you play as a biathlete representing your nation. The goal is to be the first one to cross the finish line. 
Your resources - Stamina and Strength
Your main resource is stamina which is represented by wooden hearts. Stamina can be spent to either increase your speed or to make bold moves to pass opponents. In other words, stamina is what drives your skier forward at a higher pace. At the same time stamina is also the resource that determines the chance your biathlete has to hit the targets at the shooting range. Higher stamina equals a higher chance to hit the five targets. Misses at the range means laps in the penalty lane. A really low stamina also affects your chances of making sprints or building up really high speeds. 
Each round, players will simultaneously roll dice to determine their available strength in the preparation phase. Then in turn order they will perform actions to move their biathlete forward along the track in the race phase. 
When all have performed their actions the first player marker is moved one step and again players determine available strength. The game is played in two phases.
Outsmart your opponents
During the race you must position yourself carefully to take advantage of other players while not providing advantages to anyone else. Players may draft behind opponents to get extra steps or sprint to prevent drafting. You can also position yourself well in downhills so that your opponents cannot take advantage and draft behind your slipstream. You must also save up energy to be able to push the uphills so you dont get lactic acid and take to many turns to get up. Also plan your race so that you have good chances to hit the targets at the shooting range and maybe even in one single turn. 
How will you plan your race? 
Setup for success
Each player controls their nations basecamp. This is their player board. During setup, each player place five stamina markers on their player board - wooden hearts of the same color as the nation. 
They also wax their skies on the bottom of the player board with each nations set of unique wax tokens, a total of 30 tokens.
Each player will also recieve ten dice colored in their nations color as well as a skeeple (wooden skiing meeple) and five hit or miss markers. 
The game has 20 terrain tiles that are used to build the course. There are start and finish tiles, uphills, downhills, shooting ranges, straights and two types of turns. 
Also there is a first player marker and 4 shooting dice in 4 different colors matching the levels of stamina on each players player board.

Risks and challenges
All projects have certain amount of risk attached to them, but we have done everything possible to avoid as much as we could. Since this is not our first time around Kickstarter, we know what to avoid and what might delay. 

We have done two successful projects prior in "Tribes : Early Civilization" and "WordPress the card game" and have learnt many of the lessons. Working with the right partners and preparing well is key to being able to move quickly after campaigns end. 

We have chosen well known factories for production, factories that we have worked with in the past. We have strong relationships with both fulfillment partners and our community, and we strongly believe that our plan for a short and effective after campaign is sound. 

We will, as always, be extremely transparent with potential problems or risks, so that all of you can follow the process tightly. Let’s make this a campaign to remember!

campaign.story:
The Paladin is back for the fourth time! Protecting your great gamer treasures has never been so easy! With a project guided by you - the Backers! - through regular new product votes, we can make sure that you will receive the protection you need. We are proud to present Paladin Card Protection Season 4!
Paladin comes in 30 sizes of clear sleeves, with 3 of the most popular sizes as double matte, anti-glare transparent protectors, and topped by 8 types of colored-back double matte CCG-size sleeves!
Designed to fit your gaming needs, and with free shipping to all supported locations, Paladin Card Protectors make a glorious return to shield your cards from wear and tear!
Important: All our sleeves are available by default as clear gloss. All our solid back sleeves are matte.
A new technology unlocked by our factory allowed us to create a sleeve of unparalleled thickness and the superior strength of binding. A smaller clearance of 0.5 mm seals the card inside perfectly. The Titan is the toughest and thickest card protector out there - for the true collectors in need of absolute card protection.
We have been gathering suggestions of sleeve sizes from our backers to create a list of new sleeves you may need. Four of those suggestions become the contents of the first poll (voted on via comments in an update) . After we close the poll, the highest voted type becomes the newest Stretch Goal on its way to join the ranks of Paladin Protectors forever.
While the sleeve size with most votes automatically becomes the next stretch goal, the runner-up together with the third place get thrown back in the shuffle and may reappear at a later time, while the fourth place will be discarded.
Paladin Card Protection is made by people who have been active in the hobby industry for a combined duration of over half a century. We play games and we make games! That gives us a unique perspective, allowing us to set a new industry standard for sleeve packs!
Cards for most modern board games are printed on sheets of 110 cards each (which can be easily divided into two 55-card decks). This is why so many designer board games come with a number of cards that is a multiple of 55 – and this is also the reason why Paladin Card Protectors also come in packs of 55.
We know how precious your games are to you - after all, we are gamers just like you! There are many great reasons you should choose Paladin Card Protection - here are just three of the most important ones:
1. Our protectors are extremely durable. With a thickness of 90 microns, our sleeves will prevail in the harshest gaming conditions, while still keeping the combined height of sleeved decks reasonable.
2. Paladin Card Protectors are clear, safe to use (no acid, no PVC), and they come in packs of 55, because we know you will need more than 50 with each packet. Why? Because most standard card decks in the industry are made of 55 or 110 cards.
3. We are gamers, and we listen to gamers! For Season 4 that means YOU get to vote on each stretch goal, effectively choosing every new sleeve size that joins the proud Paladin ranks!
Choosing Paladin as your personal card protector also means, that you will pay no shipping fee. Let us say this again: shipping is free, wherever you order from!

Paladin Card Protectors will be manufactured in China by the same company which has been producing for us gaming sleeves during the past two years. They are one of the leading companies making card sleeves, and they have proven capable of manufacturing the highest quality product, as evidenced by our happy fans and backers around the globe.
More than ever, we want to ensure that Paladin Card Protectors meet the highest quality standards. Thus, production will take place under our direct supervision, and we will have a person present at the factory as Paladin sleeves are coming out of the assembly line. We will check for clarity, binding, durability and size consistency.
As a new thing for Season 4, we will add another layer of quality control: we will ask the factory to assign a person to supervise the production process and the assembly process, and to check at random a significant number of sleeve packs for any damage. This way we hope to raise our standard even higher.
We have learned from the delays of first season, understanding that sleeve manufacturing will take longer due to the increased quality control measures. Also, we need to allow more time for packing, as manually selecting hundreds of thousands of sleeve packs is an error-prone process which is also very time consuming.
Paladin Card Protection was created by a team of passionate gamers and game design and publishing specialists, working (and playing games together!) for NSKN Games (now merged and working under the name of Board and Dice). As gamers, we wanted to create the perfect type of sleeve: offering high level of protection, while having an as small as possible influence on your gaming experience.
Most Paladin Card Protectors are 90 microns thick. This means, that they are thicker than most of the popular brands of Premium sleeves. We offer extremely high durability, and a level of protection that keeps your cards away from harm in any gaming situation.
We chose the thickness of 90 microns to maximize binding, making Paladin Card protectors almost unbreakable, while your cards stay well protected, for an affordable price.
However, for the first time in Paladin's history, we are offering a 120-micron sleeve. What has changed? The factory we are working with has developed new technology that allows them to strentghen the binding on sleeves thicker than 100 microns, allowing us to test the new type of super-durable sleeve. While this level of protection may not be needed by most board gamers, it is a superior way to protect collectible items, as well as cards included in out-of-production or rare games.
Finally, we wanted sleeves that are clear and safe to use. No PVC or acid is an industry standard which we adhere to. We have personally made sure that the materials used guarantee the highest level of clarity, so that you can enjoy the cards you choose to protect the way they you want to enjoy them: in full, vivid and unmodified colour and sharpness.
Please read carefully before pledging for this project!
The Pledge Manager
We will be using a pledge manager after the campaign. Access to the Paladin Season 4 pledge manager will be granted based on having pledged any amount for this project. By pledging for this campaign, you agree to provide us the information needed for us to fulfill your pledge (including an address valid at the time of delivery) using the pledge manager within the time frame (of no less than 21 consecutive days) made public by us via updates on the project page. By pledging, you understand and acknowledge the fact that failure to comply with these requirements within the time established may result in partial or complete forfeiture of your pledge, with any refunds being solely the discretion of the creator.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Paladin Card Protection Season 4 is the fourth sleeves project for NSKN Games (now merged with Board and Dice, and working under the Board and Dice name). We have experienced success as we all as failure, which allowed us to to gain experience in the fields of manufacturing, worldwide shipping, packing and fulfillment.

With each project, we are putting new measures in place to maximize the quality of our product and of the delivery. In the case of Paladin sleeves, we learned from our two previous campaign that more conservative deadlines will allow us to better check quality and deliver on time without cutting corners.

To ensure the highest quality of our product and a smooth delivery, we have personally visited the production facilities in China (with more details coming up in the updates), which allowed us to realistically assess the time and effort needed to manufacture and deliver Paladin Card Protectors to our backers.

Knowing that the unexpected may still happen, we are accounting for possible delays at every step of production and fulfillment, and working only with partners that have not failed us in the past, making sure that if something does no go exactly as planned, we will have enough spare time to still stay within the project deadlines.

We will continue to communicate openly and sincerely with you - our backers - whether the projects moves along according to the plan or if anything unexpected happens. Our aim is to deliver the best possible products in a timely manner, but more than that, it is our goal to make Paladin Season 4 an enjoyable journey for everyone on board.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
2018 witnessed the debut and culmination of our extremely successful TERA Dice Kickstarter project. That dice set design was inspired by traditional Japanese architecture with a very elegant and creative aesthetic, and the completed set was very well received by our supporters.
We are eager to build on the enthusiasm of our supporters and deliver another dice set that is inspired by our passion and creativity. The TURRIM Dice Tower Set is a completely new and unique way to roll!
The TURRIM Dice Tower Set carefully integrates a gorgeous wizard's tower aesthetic into the design, resulting in an enchanting element of décor and functionality that adds playability, convenience and atmosphere to your game events. This is a must-have dice set for gamers and dice collectors.
The TURRIM Dice Tower Set is a seven-level polyhedral dice set that contains a separate die within each layer: D4, D6, D8, D10/D00, D12 and D20, along with a base to hold them upright. Disassemble and roll when needed to conduct rituals of prophecy and the arcane for your favorite role playing and board games.
Conjure forth results for to-hit rolls, damage, random encounters, movement and much more. Ideal for avid gamers and collectors, the mystical appearance of these dice conjures a wonderfully unique and wizardly aura that helps set the stage for an immersive gaming session.
Some of the dice are rolled to generate a result, others are spun. All of our dice designs are thoroughly tested and verified to output random results. When not in use, stack the dice to reforge the wizard's tower and create a focal point of sorcerous authority at your gaming table.
TURRIM base can hold an extra set of dice for gaming
Each die and component is named in Latin for an element of potency and fidelity that it brings to your gaming table:
Our TURRIM Dice Tower Set is available in two color options:
Orange-on-black NIGHT Tower Set
Blue-on-clear ICE Tower Set (only be available via this Kickstarter campaign)
Orange-on-black NIGHT Tower Set
Blue-on-clear ICE Tower Set (guaranteed to be a limited edition product: the ICE Tower Set will only be available via this Kickstarter campaign) 

Specifications
The TURRIM Dice Tower Set will be made with only high-quality materials and non-toxic plastic, carefully sourced for longevity, robustness and safety. All dice will be produced by a qualified and experienced professional dice manufacturer.
Dimension: 77mm x 77mm x 135mm (width x length x height) 
Weight: 90g / 3.1oz 
We are putting a tremendous amount of passion, care and effort into the design of the TURRIM Dice Tower Set, including special attention to ensure it's as functional as it is attractive. That's why we're confident you will love this dice set and it will be a beloved addition to your gaming sessions.

Stretch Goal
We are commencing this project with the following stretch goals for the TURRIM Dice Tower Set. Our supporters may create opportunities for additional stretch goals and we will notify our community of additional stretch goal benefits.

Rewards

Shipping & Duties
Please note that the shipping fee includes all the packaging and any postal charges we pay to deliver the item to your hand. However, the shipping fee does not include any custom or duties that may be charged by any local customs of your country. Backers is responsible for paying their own duties charges if they exist at all.

Dice Balance & Quality of Results
Our commitment to delivering a quality dice product includes meticulous testing to ensure our dice generate results that are as truly random as possible.

campaign.story:
Motivation
The lithium-ion batteries in all of our portable devices require careful attention to ensure that they reach their potential lifetime. To achieve this, most manufacturers advise against elevated temperatures and high states of charge for prolonged periods of time, yet many of us leave our devices on charge all night. Charging all night causes the batteries in our devices to spend a significant proportion of their lifetime at full capacity and raised temperatures, highly detrimental to their health.
Charging all night means we wake up to a fully charged device, but in a world where our environmental impact is an ever-growing concern, maximising the lifetime of our device is imperative. As manufacturers move to designs where battery replacement becomes harder, batteries become the first point of failure for many devices. ProCharge delays your device's charge, to maximise its battery's lifetime.
Solution
ProCharge is compatible with any device that charges using USB (Type A). It sits between your current USB outlet and charging cable to control your device's charge cycle.
With ProCharge's default settings, your device will start charging after 6 hours, and stop charging after 2 hours. This significantly reduces the time your device's battery spends fully charged, and at raised temperatures. ProCharge also prevents your device from fast-charging, a technology that should only be used when necessary, due to the increased stress it puts on the battery. With ProCharge's built-in mode button and status LED, you can adjust the delay and charge time to suit your needs.
ProCharge
Features
ProCharge's compact form-factor includes a reversible Type-A USB plug, standard Type-A USB socket, status LED and mode button.
The reversible USB input optimises compatibility with USB outlets.
Reversible USB Plug
The top and side visibility ensures that the status LED is always visible. Its minimal brightness prevents ProCharge keeping you awake at night.
Top and Side LED Visibility
The raised profile and tactile feel of the mode button allows for easy use, even in the dark.
Raised Profile and Tactile Feel Mode Button
The mode button and status LEDs are used to programme and start the timer. Delay and charge timers can be set, started and skipped.
The  disconnected USB data lines enable secure charging from any public USB port, protecting your personal data. Additionally, this disables fast-charging modes.
The low power standby mode consumes the same power in a year, that a 50W light bulb consumes in under 20 seconds!
Specifications
 Current rating:          2A
 Voltage rating:          5.5V
 Dimensions:              39x16x10mm
 Case material:          3D printed white PA2200 Nylon
 Timing accuracy:     ±1s per hour
 Standby power:        30uW (0.00003W)
 Insertion lifetime:    >10,000 insertons
 Button lifetime:        >30,000 presses
ProCharge Internal Hardware
Operation
For safety reasons, ProCharge MUST be used in conjunction with USB outlets and charging cables from reputable suppliers.
PLAY

Status LEDs:
 Off - Standby: device will never charge.
 Amber - Delay: device will charge after set delay.
 Red - Charge: device will charge for set time.
Modes: Cycle modes in the above order by pressing button. Delay/charge time flashed in hours between standby/delay.
Setting Delay: Press button until status LED is off, then hold button for number of yellow flashes (hours) required.
Setting Charge: Press button until status LED is fading amber, then hold button for number of red flashes (hours) required.
Default: Delay 6 hours and charge 2 hours. Delay and charge will return to default if ProCharge is unplugged.
Rewards
Receive a prototype PCB as a keyring. These come in various shapes and sizes from one of the seven prototype PCB designs.
Receive one, two, three, four, five or ten ProCharge devices complete with getting started guides.
Receive fifty ProCharge devices engraved with a logo of your choice and complete with getting started guides. Due to the manufacturing process, not all logos will be suitable, please contact us to find a solution for your custom ProCharge.
Timeline
We plan to deliver ProCharge to the following timeline:
Manufacturing
Other than the PCB and casing, ProCharge will be manufactured completely in-house. We have already tested the assembly process to ensure that the design is suitable for manufacture. Manufacturing in-house will enable us to maintain strict quality control and keep to our timeline as closely as possible.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a project that has already been through the design and prototype stages of its development, ProCharge has already encountered and overcome many challenges. Challenges that we must still overcome to deliver your ProCharge to you are mainly logistical. This means in a worst case scenario, you might have to wait a little longer for your ProCharge to arrive than expected.

Firmware: All of the ProCharge's basic functionality is already implemented and fully functional.

Procurement: With the volumes we are expecting to be producing, this should not present any major challenges.

Assembly, programming and testing: We already have a good idea of how this will work, although final production equipment for assembly and testing is still to be produced. If pledges significantly exceed the goal, it is possible delays may occur.

Packaging and shipping: Fortunately ProCharge is light and small making this part a little easier. We already have experience shipping rewards to backers, so no problems here.

Like all hardware projects things can go wrong, but we are committed to getting the finished ProCharges to you as close to the expected date as possible.
