campaign.story:
Jump on board the good ship Tranquility and set sail for paradise. Take care though; in a land where the day blends into night it’s easy to lose track of time and you still need to find that special little island to call home. 
Tranquility is a co-operative strategy game for 1-5 players suitable for players aged 8-100 and games last around 15-20 minutes. Players must fill the sea with islands and guide the ship home before any player runs out of cards. In the world of Tranquility though, the only way to play is in silence. 
Tranquility is the first game by talented designer James Emmerson and features stunning artwork by Tristam Rossin.
Pledges cost £12 (plus shipping charged afterwards in our pledge manager; see shipping estimates below)
Please read the following overview to get a flavour of the game or refer to the current full rules here. Alternatively please take a look at one or more of the excellent preview videos below.
The goal of the game is for the team to complete the grid before any player runs out of available actions. Cards must be placed so that the grid ascends in numerical order from bottom left to top right. All the players win if they manage to complete the grid and have placed a Start and Finish card. All players lose if a single player can no longer play or discard any cards legally following the instructions given below. The players may not, however, communicate.  
Demo game in progress at The Great Indoors 2019
 Play is taken in turns moving clockwise with the quietest player going first. On a player’s turn they must do one of the following: 1. Play a card or 2. Discard two cards. Then they must draw back up to a hand of five cards. 
Playing a card
The active player must select an Island card from their hand and may place it anywhere in the grid providing it adheres to the following rules:
1. Cards must be placed so that the grid ascends in numerical order from bottom left to top right.
2. If the card is placed next to an existing card then they must discard cards from their hand equal to the difference between the numbers face down in front of them e.g. placing a 5 next to a 3 will require two cards to be discarded from their hand.  
Card no.63
Discarding two cards
A player may be forced (or may choose) to discard cards rather than playing a card. In this case they must discard two cards face down in front of them e.g. towards the end of the game, when the grid is nearly full, it is possible that players will be legally unable to play any of the cards in their hand. This would force them to discard two cards instead.
Start and Finish cards
A player must use their turn to play a Start card if they have one in their hand at the start of their turn and one has not yet been played. As a group, the players must discard a total of eight cards between them. They may discuss how many cards each player is willing to discard but not specifics about what is in their hand or where they might wish to play.
A player may only play a Finish card once the rest of the grid (plus Start card) has been completed. Finish cards may be discarded using the normal rules but beware: there are only five!  
Island, Start and Finish card artwork
 The players win if a player successfully plays a Finish card after the grid is complete before any single player is unable to play. The players lose if any player cannot make a legal move because either: 1. they have only one card left in their hand at the start of their turn which cannot be played to the grid or 2. they have no cards left in their hand at the start of their turn. 
 Included with the standard game are three mini-expansions that significantly change the level of difficulty as well as introducing a nice variety of rule changes that make the game even more replayable.
1. Jagged Rocks: The game begins with the Jagged Rocks card placed randomly on one of the six border cards on the left-hand side of the grid; this row is considered as temporarily impenetrable so no cards may be placed into it.  
Jagged Rocks
 2. Sea Monsters: The game begins with three, four or five Sea Monster cards shuffled into the deck before it is dealt out to players (depending on the level of difficulty the players wish to add). On their turn the player may play their Sea Monster card into the grid by placing it on top of any previously played card. The Sea Monster destroys the card and then both cards are removed from the game.   
Sea Monster
 3. Storm & Compass: The game begins with six Storm cards shuffled into the deck. The six Compass cards are placed to the side of the playing area. A player resolves a Storm card as soon as it is drawn. 
Yellow Storm: The player places the Yellow Storm card face up in front of them and immediately discards down to three cards which is their new hand limit until the Storm card is removed.
Purple Storm: The player places the Purple Storm on one of the six border cards on the left-hand side of the grid on a row with at least one empty space. This marks the entire row as temporarily impenetrable so no cards may be placed into it. 
Orange Storm: The player places the Orange Storm card face up in front of them. For all future turns the player may now only 1. Play next to an existing card, discarding the appropriate number of cards as per the usual rules or 2. Discard two cards. 
Orange Storm
 Compass: Compass cards may be played to help the players navigate the Storms and remove playing restrictions. Compass cards may be acquired in three different ways: 1. When the start card is played, the players earn one Compass card to use. 2. By filling an entire row with consecutive cards (e.g. 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17) and 3. If a player chooses to discard their whole hand. 
Compass
 Every copy of Tranquility includes:
80 Island Cards, 5 Start cards, 5 Finish cards, 3+ Reference cards, 25 Border cards, 18 Stormy Seas expansion cards and rule sheet.
 The cards are 400 gsm matte laminate. They feel fantastic and don't need to be sleeved.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first project and, as such, could seem to be a riskier campaign to back from the point of view of potential customers. I can only try to reassure anyone with concerns that although we haven't run a Kickstarter campaign before, we have been advised by a number of publishers with much greater experience than us and so (hopefully) will not suffer any of the pitfalls that first-time publishers sometimes experience.

The budget is solid and if we reach our funding level we guarantee that we won't be cancelling the campaign. Some companies seem to set artificially low targets so as to achieve 100% funding early, which is attractive to backers. If they don't significantly surpass this and hit their actual target then they will sometimes cancel a campaign. This will not happen with Board Game Hub.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear all,
It's been great to see some of the last batch of copies finally making their way into the hands of backers all over the world. Can I please make you aware, if you're not already, that the campaign for out lovely little print-and-play game Lilypads is drawing to a close. The files have been lovingly made to mean that even the most useful person at working with their hands (that's me) can make a copy.

Dear all,
It's been a long road and steep learning curve, we've taken on board many things that we will look to improve in future, but that's a discussion for another day. Royal Mail had the last laugh with us this week and decided that we didn't need the final copy + playmat orders (for US and rest-of-world) collected yesterday, as was booked, but did arrive earlier this afternoon. That means I can finally say that all Kickstarter orders are on their way. Thank you so much for your patience- we are sorry it's been a long wait for so many backers but want to make it clear that we'll be using fulfillment companies in future!!- and hopefully the wait will have been worth it.

Hi folks,
Just a quick one to let you know that all rest-of-world (that's everywhere but UK and EU countries) courier orders (those too heavy to go with Royal Mail) have been sent or are being collected on Monday (US orders). This means that all we're waiting for now is to finally send the last ~200 orders to our US 1 or 2 copy + playmat orders. campaign.story:
Automate any curtain (rod and rail type), with App, Schedule, and Sun light sensor.
 Install in 30 seconds without any screws, nuts or bolts.
 The most affordable motorized curtain solution. Don't waste your curtain, retrofit it.
 Voice control your curtain with Alexa, Google Home, and Siri, with Hub Mini.
 Open and connected with API, IFTTT, and SmartThings support with Hub Mini.
 Smart, automated and healthy lifestyle, enabled.
 Practical and useful for high ceiling curtains, elderly, and disabled people.
Seeing is Believing
Rods and Rails, Retrofitted.
Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple Siri, SmartThings, HomeBridge and IFTTT with the Hub
Energy saving
Even the most eco-friendly air-conditioning consumes energy to cool your room. We can reduce energy consumption by minimizing temperature fluctuations in your room. Close the curtains to block out sunlight to keep your room cool.
Sun light sensor for keeping the room cool
The SwitchBot Curtain has a built-in sun light sensor to detect sunlight. This can help save energy by reducing the workload on your air-conditioning and heating. It can be set to automatically close during the day time in summer to block out the sunlight and keep your room cool. You can also have it automatically open during the day in winter to warm your room with sunlight.
Save energy with the solar panel strip add-on
You can also install the solar power strip add-on to charge the SwitchBot Curtain’s battery using sunlight, thus eliminating the need to recharge the battery. Don't worry about "charging anxiety" on the SwitchBot Curtain. Install and forget!

Smart living
Leverage technology to take care of the daily routines through automation and voice control. A "Lights Off" scene turns off the light and draws the curtains brighten the room naturally with sunlight. Or you can just say it  "Alexa/Ok Google/Hey Siri, give me sunlight".
Lifestyle automated with the Schedule feature
Healthy lifestyle
Maintain a regular light-dark cycle in your bedroom to keep your sleep-wake rhythm in sync with your circadian rhythm. The SwitchBot Curtain can be set to close at night and open when it senses daylight. Get better sleep and wake naturally to sunshine. 
Wake up naturally to sunlight
Anti-theft
Set your curtains to close automatically when you’re out of the house to hide your valuables from prying eyes. Can’t remember if you closed the window? Check via our app and remotely close the curtains where necessary. Or set them to automatically open at regular intervals to give the impression that someone's home.
Your curtain keeps the bad guy away.
Adapt your existing curtains instead of replacing them. We at SwitchBot are firm believers in retrofitting your home to create a smart home instead of replacing trusty old appliances or furniture that are still in work well.
Retrofitting is simple with SwitchBot Curtain. It only takes a few seconds to make your existing curtains smart. You have to see it to believe it. 
Seeing is believing
The average price of a set of smart curtains is USD 1,000. The SwitchBot Curtain is way more cost-effective at a fraction of that price. You don’t just save money with the SwitchBot Curtain, you do your part for the environment by retaining your existing curtains instead of throwing it away.

We support 99% curtains
Some smart curtain solutions only support a single type of curtains. Others are too bulky or require tedious modifications to provide a power source.
The SwitchBot Curtain supports different track types such as U-rail and I-rail, and also rod types. It is also wireless. Just clip it on and you're ready to go. It is that simple. 
We even handle that "BUMP" for extendable rods and rails
 Rods, retrofitted
The round rails allow the SwitchBot Curtain to glide smoothly along the rod. Just clip on the rails and you're all set.
For those of you who have a longer rod with a bump where the rod extends, we've got that figured out. The SwitchBot Curtain is not affected by such bumps.
Install in seconds
 U Rails, retrofitted
The SwitchBot Curtain has hooks for U-rail. It is simple to attach the respective hooks to the rails.  
Install in seconds
 I Rails, retrofitted
The SwitchBot Curtain has hooks for I-rail. It is simple to attach the respective hooks to the rails. 
Install in seconds
Open and close the curtain at your fingertip. We offer intuitive App control for iOS and Android, with weekly/bi-weekly updates following feedback from you. OTA firmware update is also available for better user experience.
Intuitive UI
Smart living is powered by your voice commands. Wouldn't it be great to just say it?
"Alexa/Ok Google/Hey Siri, close my curtain please" (Hub is required)
Even with SwitchBot Curtain, you'd probably still instinctively draw the curtains by hand some times. When it senses you drawing the curtain, the SwitchBot Curtain will kick in and do the work for you. We call this Touch & Go.
SwitchBot Curtain makes even the conventional way to draw a curtain smarter.

A wireless remote button add-on for you to place anywhere. 
Hold it or mount it. Your say.
Double-sided curtains are very common and we have been getting a lot of enquiries about how to use the SwitchBot Curtain with these. You could get two units and part the double-sided curtains from the middle. Or, you could try out this tip from the King of Retrofit! Attach the top curtains with a velcro strip or a strong clip so the curtains will move as one. Then install the SwitchBot Curtain on either ends to let it work its magic!
So your next question is probably where to find a velcro strip. Good news is, we believe so strongly in retrofitting that we will ship every SwitchBot Curtain with a velcro strip in the box as a standard accessory.
The SwitchBot Curtain is so small that it hides nicely behind your curtains. It will work in its own way without getting in your way.  Likewise, we keep the sophisticated mechanism within the body of the SwitchBot Curtain, giving you fast and easy installation so you can enjoy the benefits it brings.   
Size fits in your palm.
Instead of a wired system, the SwitchBot Curtain is a wireless solution. It uses a rechargeable battery that lasts 8 months depending on the usage. This means you only need to charge it once or twice a year! 
What's more, you can forget about having to charge it by getting the solar power strip add-on. Sunlight will ensure the SwitchBot Curtain is charged up for its daily work routine.
Our SwitchBot Curtain is very complicated from the inside so it is so SIMPLE for you on the outside.
Our SwitchBot Curtain is very complicated from the inside so it is so SIMPLE for you on the outside.
In the box, 2 types of hooks will be there for your preference.
SwitchBot Hub Mini
Hub for SwitchBot Curtain and a universal Infrared remote control (Recommended)
Why we need your support
We have finished the development of the SwitchBot Curtain and we are excited to get it into the market to you. However, we cannot bring this product to life without your support. We need to raise funds for the raw materials and components needed to start mass production of the SwitchBot Curtain.
Find us on GitHub: https://github.com/OpenWonderLabs/
A few years ago, we shared the possibility to control SwitchBot on their Raspberry Pi, OpenWRT board, or PC running Linux based system. It has been a fantastic journey since then with contributions by many users who love to DIY! 
Makers who don't want to use Bluetooth controls can now choose to use our RESTFUL APIs. Moreover, you can use Home Assistant!
Tap on the power of IFTTT + Webhook to create and trigger countless incredibly creative scenarios! 
Boost your creativity! 
Does the SwitchBot Curtain inspire you to use it in other ways? Yes, we thought it would. That's why we are sharing the STL files to build your hooks after the campaign!
Besides adapting the SwitchBot Curtain to work with any rods and rails, you can also use create hooks to extend the SwitchBot Curtain's function! We came up with wacky ideas such as using it to open and close the door,  and building a cam cable to mounting a small action camera or the OSMO Pocket. We are excited to see what creative ideas can you come up with!
Be creative with your cat.
PLAY

PLAY

It took us 2 years to have everything ready. We don't want a bad product for you.
Development and testing 
The SwitchBot Curtain is not possible before we develop, craft, and test tirelessly in the past 2 years. We tried and tested thousands of rods and rails, and found every possible way to stress test it. 
We listen. We fix. We iterate.
Validated thousands of rods and rails
The roller coaster test
SwitchBot Curtain is strong!
2017 to now

The words
Thank you SwitchBot community!
SwitchBot has grown since our last successful campaign. We now have offline retail presence globally.

Our Philosophy and Story
Our co-founder and CEO, Connery, has been the in IoT industry specializing in smart home for years. One night after reading before sleeping, he realized that he cannot even turn off his bedroom light and close his curtain on the bed. This led to the team evaluating all kinds of self-proclaimed smart switches and curtains in the market. Our first thought was to have a robot butler. Yet, the reality is that despite years of robots making the news, we have not seen a real robot that in our homes. Thus, we began our adventure to create a useful, simple and convenient bot. SwitchBot is the fruit of our labor. With this product philosophy in mind, we strive to create more products that will help our users save time, effort and money spent on hiring professionals for installation.

campaign.story:
Magnate: Render of final prototype pictured. All artwork may be subject to final changes.
In Magnate: The First City, you are a property developer trying to make as much money as you can in a city wide construction boom.
Magnate: Real final prototype imagery. All artwork may be subject to final changes.
You'll have to choose the land you're going to buy and decide what to build there from a range of realistic 3D buildings. You'll collect rent from the tenants you attract to your developments and then, when the time is right, sell your property for a massive profit.
Magnate: Real final prototype imagery. All artwork may be subject to final changes.
But beware, your actions will cause prices to rise. Eventually prices will climb too high and the boom will turn to bust in a game-ending market crash! Don't get caught out when it does.
All pledges contain the Magnate core game, which has the following components:
The game will come with an English rulebook. But the rulebook and the game's player aids will also be translated into German, Spanish and French and made freely available as a PDF before the campaign is fulfilled. As the vast majority of the game's components are language independent, we believe this will be sufficient for German Spanish and French speakers to learn and enjoy the game. 
We're very open to having it translated into other languages - if there is enough demand - so feel free to message us or leave a comment!
If you want to read the current draft rulebook, you can find it here. 
PLEASE NOTE:
This is a draft and hasn't yet been laid out in its final form
We expect the production rulebook to be quite a bit shorter and much more attractively laid out
While the rules are now stable, there are still improvements in wording and explanation for us to make
There's even more content in the Tycoon pledge!
The tycoon pledge contains three mini-expansion modules for Magnate that further enhance gameplay and provide entirely new options. If we hit our stretch goals, there will be unique component upgrades not available in the basic pledge.
All of these expansions came out of the same rigorous testing process of the core game, but couldn’t be practically incorporated into core product. We love playing with these expansions at Magnate HQ so rather than let them sit on a shelf, we wanted you to enjoy them too!
At present, we have no plans to bring these specific expansions to retail, so this Kickstarter may be your only chance to get them!


*Final name subject to approval.
*Final artwork subject to approval.


We'd love to make Magnate an even better product - and thanks to backers we already have! But with your help, we can make even further upgrade the game's components:


Lots of reviewers have already played Magnate. So don't take our word for it when we say we love it! See what they have to say:

Key features
Some of the things we're most excited about:
REALISTIC 3D MINATURES: Magnate comes with a beautiful set of 50+ lovingly sculpted, plastic building miniatures: all of which are inspired by real world buildings. By having these true-to-life buildings rather than just tokens or chits, the city really comes to life!
STRATEGIC GAMEPLAY WITH A SATISFYING GAME ARC: Magnate is a tight game with a very strong power curve. Every decision you make really matters and will subtly force your opponents to rethink their plans. You will start small - often with a single house - but you will end with a huge pile of cash and some very tough calls to make. 
DYNAMIC PROPERTY MARKET: The game's property market is genuinely responsive to what players do, just like a real market. If players sell too much, they'll make a huge market crash more likely. If they stop hyping-up the city with advertising, they'll cause the boom to slow down. If they overbuild and suck out all the tenants... you can guess! When these start colliding with the players aims, the end-game decisions get very tough indeed.
ADVANCED RULES: The core game includes a set of advanced tenants which you can pick from when attracting tenants (if you meet their requirements), hugely increasing your choices and allowing you to make entirely new combo moves with your property. 
All three mini expansions also greatly increase your options: the slow-burn but super powerful residential tower gives you a new way to use home tenants. The vast array of asymmetric powers you can gain from employees creates entirely new play styles and the blind bidding system makes bids more hair-raising and tense than ever. 
AI MODE: Magnate includes a ‘Cardboard AI’ that can be used at any player count in place of a human opponent - not just for solo play. The game's structure stays the same - the AI just operates within it (with a bit of cheating!). The AI has been designed to behave like a human player, so that even after you’ve played it against it many times, it remains unpredictable without feeling entirely random.
TUTORIAL MODE: We know that learning from a rulebook can be the toughest way to learn a game . While we've put huge effort into making the rulebook as good as it can be, we think nothing can beat a teach! That's why the game includes a guided tutorial deck which will teach the players all the core aspects of the game in bite sized chunks over two scripted turns. 
Why are we launching on Kickstarter?
Final prototype art pictured. All artwork may be subject to final changes.
It's been ambition to turn Magnate into a game you could one day buy at a store for a long time - ever since the very first version was created. After two years of hard work, playtesting and developing the game and its components, we are finally ready to bring it to market. 
But we can't do that without the substantial investment required to manufacture the very first print-run of the game. With its strong track record for making tabletop projects a reality, Kickstarter was the best place for us to raise those funds. 
About the team 
Designer & Publisher: James Naylor
Magnate was designed by James Naylor and will be published by his company, Naylor Games. James is London based board game designer and publisher who is passionate about product design and its role in game experience. His professional background is in product management where he has had multiple roles, including head of product and engineering for a multinational advertising technology company and independent product consultant on numerous startups. He is a passionate board game enthusiast who likes tension, drama and the potential for emergent strategy in his games.
Lead Developer: Jaya Baldwin 
Magnate's core gameplay and AI mode was refined, tested and developed by Jaya Baldwin, who also works with James on the many other tasks involved in publishing games.  Jaya is a game developer/designer and professional actor in immersive theatre. The shows Jaya has performed in and helped design have received multiple 5 star reviews from national newspapers and well reputed theatre publications. Jaya loves challenging games that take players on adventures and provide memorable experiences.
James and Jaya are supported by a huge network of professionals, friends and family who are helping bring this project to fruition.
Shipping
All shipping will be managed in the pledge manager after the campaign is completed. Please do not add shipping to your pledged amount during the campaign. 
The following are estimates for the costs to ship to different parts of the world:
UK/EU: US$10-15 (£8-12 / € 9-14)
US/CA: US$15-20 (CA$20-27)
AU/NZ: US$15-20 (AU:$25-$30)
CH/HK/MO: US$10-15
JP/PH/KR/SG/TH/VN/TW: US$15-25
ROW: US$15-35
Please note that for some countries in the 'Rest of World' category, there may be shipping surcharges due to location or additional items or upgrades. Prices will vary depending on location and changes in shipping cost at time of locking the pledge manager.
We are still evaluating the best fulfilment providers for this project but have several assessed quotes already. We expect to deliver before the end of 2020 so there should be no additional customs surcharges as a result of the UK's planned departure from the customs union at the end of the Brexit implementation period. 
Retailers welcome!
If we are successful enough, our goal is to eventually turn Magnate into a retail game product: This will only happen if we have substantial backer support now. But its familiar themes, high production values, moderate weight and intuitive gameplay make us believe it could be a good retail product. So if you’re a retailer we want to hear from you. 
We don’t have a retailer pledge level on this campaign but if you're interested in stocking Magnate,  drop us a quick note on this form and we’ll be in touch to work out an approach that works for you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although this our first Kickstarter we've put considerable effort to mitigate the risks inherent to any Kickstarter project:

*General precautions*

Because this is our first project, we have taken extra time to ensure every detail of the project is correct. The core game was an enjoyable, fun design almost two years ago. The remaining effort since then has been mainly focused on making it a good game *product* (art, testing, production). 

We have sought extensive guidance of numerous tabletop industry veterans during this time, and are ably supported by a strong industry network of experienced rulebook editors, manufacturers, other game designers and marketers with experience running complex Kickstarter projects.

*Game design & development*

The core's game design is 100% finished, and, according to reviews by well regarded critics is already a fun and engaging title. We've been demoing the game in a form very close to its final development for more than a year at multiple tradeshows and have only been making refinements and minor improvements in that time. This means we have strong validation that the game will be widely enjoyed. Only the expansion content and AI mode require further blind testing to make their rulebooks (not gameplay) the best they can be. We are confident we can execute this before they need to be manufactured given the timescales we have recommended. 

*Art and graphics*

The art and graphical elements of the game (including expansion content) are 90+% complete. We still have some refinement to do, but do not expect the visuals to change much - so there are few risks here.

*Manufacturing, shipping & financials*

We have put extensive effort into assessing the viability of the product. We have spent considerable time making careful component quality and material choices to make sure this is a product that can be produced for a good price that represents value for backers. We have secured detailed quotes from multiple manufacturers and completed due diligence on them to ensure estimates are not only competitive but realistic. This also includes estimation of potential stretch goal content. 

We have done our best to estimate shipping based on detailed manufacturing prices, and our own market research, allowing for costs of the fulfillment and shipping aspects of this part of the process. Though shipping can be a fluctuating aspect, we will endeavour to ship out any pledges both as efficiently and as carefully as we can.

Throughout, our detailed financial plan contains carefully planned contingency budgets to cover costs that we cannot yet precisely predict: such a increased tarrifs on Chinese manufactured goods or changes to customs rules. The campaign and legal entity we have created to run it prevents us being subject to any currency fluctuation problems as a result of the Brexit process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: More progress... but not quite there yet
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, 
This month's news is a mixture of good and slightly frustrating. I had hoped to be shipping the game to fulfilment right now, but we ran into some final teething problems on the production.  
Progress report

updates.update_userinfo: A short update: early production copies on their way to Naylor Games & more podcasts
updates.update_content:
If all goes to plan, Magnate will be shipping to fulfilment centres shortly. But before it does there's some final checks we need to do. There should be more news ahead of the next usual time for an update, so in the interests of staying in monthly contact but also protecting your inbox from excess fluff, I'm going to keep this one brief. 
Progress update
While things have not moved quite as quickly as I expected in the last update, I am glad to say that all Magnate's components have now been manufactured and are awaiting final packing.

It's update time again and we finally have some good news on our timeline! 
Progress update
Given the Chinese New Year shutdown, production has taken much longer than it normally would over the last few months. But I am now very happy to say that manufacturing is now expected to complete in mid-April! We had a few issues with getting all the add-on components together and the insert also delayed things. But I think you will be very pleased with the insert's third and final iteration: It should make an enormous difference to convenience.

updates.update_userinfo: Chinese New Year and something new from me
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
As I warned in the last progress update, this one was likely to be pretty short.
Progress update
In China, manufacturing shuts down almost completely for weeks either side of the Chinese New Year celebrations (Feb 12th this year). With the pandemic, this has been worse than usual, with workers leaving even earlier to see family and avoid travel restrictions.  So as expected, things have been pretty quiet on the Magnate front: we've been mostly using the time to develop other game titles. I am glad to report our production manager is back in the office now though and we eagerly await what - I hope - is the last revision to the insert. *Cross fingers*, this should also be the last major hurdle in the production process.

updates.update_userinfo: Magnate is into the final round for Most Anticipated Game of 2021! Can you help us win?
updates.update_content:
Thanks to your kind support Magnate made it into round two of the competition! It garnered more than 100 nominations in about 24 hours. 
This means we're in the running for the Economic game category of Most Anticipated Game of 2021. And while there was never a lot of chance we'd beat Frosthaven in the overall category 😉, I think we're in with a real chance with this one!
Can you lend us your vote again to make it count in the final round? It's just a bit of fun, but it's a good way to increase visibility too as we close on the end of the manufacturing process.

updates.update_userinfo: Magnate nominated for "Most Anticipated Game of 2021" on BGG - can you vote?
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, 
Just a little bit of news and a quick request for help.
One of our backers, John, just nominated us for this BGG competition. If we get enough thumbs we go to the next round.
I didn't realise this competition existed so we're really late to the party: as you can see from the number of thumbs we have so far (). It's just a bit of fun, but I think we have a real shot at winning the "Most Anticipated Economic Game" category - so, I thought why not give it a go?!

updates.update_userinfo: Happy new year: Insert preview & mass production underway!

Happy new year!
In the Christmas-NYE hinterland I got some great news: We are finally into full-scale mass production and I have an awesome new insert design to show you.
Progress update

Wallets and more

Progress update

campaign.story:
Relive the excitement of Sensible World of Soccer
Ever played Sensible World of Soccer? Remember the excitement? The tournaments? Mates joining in .. the cheers.. the sound of the ball being kicked…the whistle…the theme tune! A simple game that brings back memories.
Hours and hours spent directing your players around the pitch, doing battle to score those goals? Pick your country, pick your division, pick your team, be a top Manager.
Ranked best game of all time by Amiga Power, Sensible World of Soccer (known as SWOS) was listed as one of the ten most important video games of all time! Compulsive playing, no wonder it was so popular. Now you can re-live your youth.
 All pledgers will have their names in the opening credits of the app!
You’re a goal scoring superstar hero! Yes, you can be that hero once again with Horizon Retro, who is bringing back Sensible World of Soccer and many other retro games*
Horizon Retro is bringing back those nostalgic days of gaming to Android and other platforms. We have the golden opportunity to bring these games back to your devices and need your support to bring those action-packed hours back for generations to come.
Kicking off with SWOS, the game will be completely based on the original game with all the same features:
· Customise teams
· Save games
· Career mode
· Player only modes
· Manager only modes
· Player and manager modes
· Friendlies, Tournaments, Leagues, Careers
· Save highlights
· Club Teams from 65 nations
· National Teams
The team behind this campaign – Jordan and Franco - as well as being avid retro gamers, are experienced in growing businesses and have +30 years’ of programming experience: low level (6502, Z80, x86 assembly), C/C++, Java, PHP, Bash scripting and more. This includes creating the RetroX emulation frontend for Android, which has 50.000+ registered users, 27 systems supported, and five years of development with Java/ C/C++ code.
This Kickstarter project requires the team’s technical knowhow to bring SWOS to the modern day. For Android, it will be necessary to add in a keyboard for the game and overlay it. Bluetooth controller capability will be added in, and further down the line work will begin on creating a Multiplayer mode for SWOS.
There is a great deal of coding, re-coding and debugging required, in order for the game to be ported to other devices from its DOS version. Decompiling the game means that the team have to work with code and re-write everything to other languages.
Your Kickstarter investment will start the journey, bringing SWOS to Android initially, and on hitting our stretch goals, will be ported to other platforms** such as Steam, PS4, iOS and Switch.
Join us on a step back in time, kicking a ball around the pitch – help bring this dream into the future. Make SWOS on Android a reality and we can open the doors to bringing many more fun-filled hours of retro gaming.
*subject to license agreements with the rights holders.
** subject to license permissions
Opening Goal - £55,000 Port SWOS to Android
Stretch goal 1 - £80,000 iOS port to be worked on** (Completion estimated June 2020)
Stretch Goal 2 - 90,000 Steam port to be worked on** (Completion estimated June 2020)
Streth Goal 3 - ????

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Each Kickstarter is a bit of a learning curve for us. We had some bumps along the way the first go and new bumps the second time around. We've been backers before too, and we completely understand how frustrating that can be when campaigns run into unforeseen issues. We certainly don't plan on dropping the ball and we've planned our promo cards much more carefully this time around so fulfillment should be improved yet again this year. For instance, we have worked to plan promos that are on track to deliver in advance of the listed delivery date. However, manufacturing issues can arise. PLEASE understand that we will do everything we can to remedy any problems that may arise.

We are reliant on many different publishers to bring you the amazing promos we have listed in this campaign and campaigns past. We anticipate having all promos ready to deliver as planned, but as stated production schedules are always subject to delay. We will communicate these if they do occur, but please understand we are at the mercy of a giant industry that relies on a multitude of printers from many different countries.

Finally, and probably most importantly, we have done our best to estimate our needs for the various promos we have on offer. Some printing schedules require us to set quantities as our campaign is live. We've structured the pledge levels to provide you with the most flexibility when choosing the promos you want, but some quantities may require you to choose alternate promo(s) in the event that supplies run out. We recognize that this possibility is less than desirable, but please understand that we will try to make up for it with any excess quantities we might have.

campaign.story:
The Great Wall is a new major board game from Awaken Realms (creators of Nemesis, Tainted Grail, Etherfields, and many other acclaimed products) and our fresh take on Euro / Worker placement type of Board Games! 
Players will take the roles of generals of an ancient Chinese empire who lead the defense against ruthless hordes. You will need to gather allied advisors, manage your workers, recruit armies and, together with other players, raise and defend the Great Wall! As the game progresses, you will often need to negotiate and interact with other players, but make no mistake – there can be only one winner
 “Its an interesting game (…) I have to play some more, its pretty high for me! Theme is really strong.”-  Tom, Dice Tower
„Definitely quality! (…) Theme is super cool and the tension! The tension in this game is real. Very interesting game! “   - Rob, Rob’s Gaming Table 
“All of this comes together in a very unique way, in which players will continue to work together and against one another to earn they Honor points”- Jeremy, Man vs Meeple 
“The Great Wall has enough depth to continually enjoy each new play session as you customize your experience and have new interactions with other players.” - Michael, King of Average 
  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fkDst2rvGG4&t=  


This fresh worker (and soldier!) placement game for 1-4 players faces them with many difficult choices and often pushes them to interact with each other. You will be assigning your workers to eleven different locations, such as Tea House, Quarry, Messenger Post, or Barracks, using special Command cards that have additional effects. Production in locations activates ONLY when all their slots are filled with clerks, but filling them all by yourself can result in a penalty. On top of that, players can buy overseers who will give additional output every time a location becomes activated. This creates a lot of involving long- and short-term strategies.
 Each player starts with one unique General, characterized by their asymmetric power, as well as the production level. From there, you will further customize your economic engine and fine-tune your strategy by recruiting advisors who provide additional bonuses.
Eventually, a Wall Defence phase beings, where players place previously build armies on Horde Cards – earning Honor (Victory points) and looting resources from the defeated troops. This requires smart management of three types of units: Archers, Spearmen and Cavalry. Players place these soldiers one by one, playing the Tactics cards that create another layer of interaction.
Gain meditation by shooting with the Monk Archer, then spend meditation on a Cavalry Squad Leader to move your Cavalry around the battlefield faster, and – finally – finish off by getting extra Honor for each of the Cavalry’s engagements thanks to the Banner Holder. There are endless possibilities for great combos and memorable plays.
On top of that, your Advisors and General might give your troops extra abilities, such as shooting twice or looting twice the resources!
All of the above makes the Great Wall one of our most strategically involving designs that will be appreciated by many different groups of players:
                            - those who love euro-styled games with their intricate economies and engine-building,
                            - those who love over-the-table play,
                            - and finally, those who simply like to wage war on a beautiful map.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have currently successfully founded nine Kickstarter projects. We have successfully delivered so far:
The Edge miniature universe, Awakening project, This War of Mine the boardgame, Lords of Hellas (without 2nd wave of Lang), The Edge Dawnfall 1.0, Nemesis (without 2nd wave of LANG) and are currently in the process of delivering Tainted Grail 1st wave. 

We are confident about the delivery of the game and see no risk in that area - we have accumulated vast experience working on other titles and projects and big track record. The only risk factor, which can always happen, is a delay in delivery due to unforeseen circumstances.

Please note that this is not a pre-order and the final product might slightly change in the process or get delayed. We are fully devoted to creating an amazing experience and you can trust us that every choice we make will only be aimed at improving the standard of the final product.

Game and all components will be produced in China and will be up to the highest quality standards that we hold for our previous games.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
GoDice is the “Kindle” of board games - A slick, compact and cool (physical) connected dice set, with TONS of quality content for everyone: family games, bar games, educational games, fun games, and so much more.
The data from the GoDice syncs immediately to the app. Make your moves , tap your decisions, and watch the score rise in real time. Papers, score sheets and writing are replaced with a cool digital experience! Complex RPG calculations (multiple dice and battles) are done instantly and automatically -  So you can enjoy the fun, luck, and strategic elements of the games.
GoDice transforms screens into a fun and social "board" game!  It turns screen time into quality time.  Play with your friends online, or round up a group of friends and family to get started (when screens are involved, the younger generation will gladly join the party). GoDice brings people to play TOGETHER. 
The internal sensors enable accurate orientation measurements and real-time sync with the application. By that, more advanced and complex (polyhedral) dice shapes can be configured and tracked using the same GoDice's die.
Such dice are commonly used in many board games, Role Playing Games (DnD etc.), Math games etc. Now with GoDice (and its open API), creators can "dress up" the dice, configure it, and connect to their own applications.
PLAY

GoDice comes with customized designed shells of D20 and D24 (Dice with 20 and 24 faces)! These two generic shapes cover ALL common dice set.
Let your imagination run and let GoDice do the calculating. Focus on how to beat those monsters instead of trying to sum up 12+14+6+3+5+3 +...
PLAY



GoDice is the Kindle of board games, the Tesla of Role Playing Games. It’s a bundle of tons of quality content for everyone: family games, bar games, educational games, and Role Playing Games 
The app comes, out-of-the-box, with many games as well as an open API, so you can employ GoDice for any imaginable game, or even create any game you can imagine.   
GoDice app includes the most popular dice games. The app is what elevates the games from an out of touch old timey idea into the 2010’s, enticing the younger generation to participate and engage
Yatzy is one of the most popular dice games in the world. With more than 100 million players, it's guaranteed fun time with friends and family. GoDice takes Yatzy to the next level with interactive gameplay. It even gives you tips on how to become a better player.
The classic poker dice game is now connected. The 5 smart dice simulate a playing-card deck (top six cards). Each player strives to get the best hand, while GoDice keeps track of your scores. May the flop be with you!
Farkle, also known as 5,000, 10,000, Zilch, and many more names, is a well-loved dice game. It's fun, fast-paced and utilizes math and probability skills- making it a perfect game to play with friends and family. *Only available in 6-dice packs*
A game once played by kings, Ludo is 1500 years old game. It's a strategy board game that will now become a Game-Night favorite for you and your kids. *Only available in 6-dice packs*  

Get information like: trend score overtime, average score, games win and losses, game time, power of your toss and number of turns 
Get tips on how to optimize your gameplay. Which dice should you keep? Which dice should you throw? What category should you choose? How can you increase your chances of winning? GoDice will help you make smarter decisions!.  
Create as many groups as you’d like, and switch between them- the GoDice app will keep track of all your different stats. Whether you play a quick game of Yatzy at your oﬃce or enjoy a game night with your family, the app will track your stats for each group at any time.      
 The GoDice silky and compact carrying case doubles as a supercapacitor charging station. It weighs only 28 grams, and supports ultra-fast charging. 10 seconds charge time = 1 hour of gameplay
GoDice cup
The GoDice compact and versatile stand will conveniently prop up any phone or tablet (no matter the make or model) to make your game night even more enjoyable. Use the GoDice cup for easy rolling, you will quickly find out that the noise the dice make inside this cup is part of the fun and you will not be able to leave it behind…
We’re magic-obsessed problem-solvers who have been putting tiny computers inside tiny devices for quite some time.
In the last few years, we've developed, manufactured and sold a number of smart connected toys worldwide. Last year, we launched GoCube, and finished our crowdfunding campaign with over 11k happy backers and above $1.1M in funding.
After a successful campaign and great feedback from our backers, we've decided to take on a smaller cube: a dice.
We’ve spent the last few months testing and finalizing designs, and we’re thrilled to finally be able to share GoDice with you all :)
100,000,000 people play Yatzy every year, using over a billion papers a year. These are 60,000 trees that could be saved by using GoDice (and that's for Yatzy only). 60,000 TREES per year! GoDice, GoGreen!
PLAY

International Backers: We will ship GoCube worldwide via trackable post. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, handling, fees and taxes applicable to your region, for more info check the FAQ
GoDice is a product of tireless engineering and tweaking by Particula, a company focuses on developing Smart Toys and products, powered by sensors, processing capabilities, ultra-low power and wireless connectivity.
After many long months of trying different setups, finalizing designs, and endless testing, we can not be any prouder to make GoDice available to anyone, anywhere.
We surprised you before with an amazing product, the GoCube, that has earned raving reviews and amazing PR worldwide. We are here to provide you with the same amazing, unforgettable experience, this time with a smaller cube, the dice.

campaign.story:
Medici: The Dice Game is an exciting new design from acclaimed designer Reiner Knizia that dives back into the world of auctions and trade from the Medici board game. Players will have to roll with the whims of fate as they face a never before seen challenge in the Medici line, of games: dice!
Medici: The Dice Game is the third game in the Medici family of games, all designed by the world’s best known tabletop designer, Dr Reiner Knizia, and illustrated by the stunning Vincent Dutrait!
Grail Games has successfully Kickstarted Medici the board game twice (you can see these campaigns here and here), as well as Medici: The Card Game (see here). Both titles are well-respected and regarded.
The new Dice Game is a stand-alone sister game to the previous titles. It uses similar ideas, but is powered by dice-rolling and selecting mechanisms.
On a turn, players will select dice that depict various goods of different values to fill their ship, before going to market and scoring for both the value of their ship, and for collecting the different types of goods over three rounds (days).
Medici: The Dice Game is for 2-4 players aged 10 and up and takes about 30 minutes to play.
To watch David from Grail Games teach and play the game, please click on the link below.
And if you would like to read the rule book, please click the button below!
With your support, each copy of Medici: The Dice Game will include...
...and more will be added to the game should we meet the stretch goals listed below!
With your support we will not only fund the production of this great little game, but also, have the opportunity to make the game even better! Should we over-fund, we will use the extra to add the following to Medici: The Dice Game...
Woo hoo! Thank you!
16mm dice are nice, but 20mm are even better!
We will add artwork to the inside bottom of the box so you can roll your dice each round within the confines of your square ship hold!
After we reach this funding goal, we can afford to add a purple, velvet-like drawstring bag to the game to hold you 20mm dice! 
...and hopefully we can make the dice bag even fancier, by embroidering the famous Medici family crest on to the bag :) Note: Art not final.

This cardboard tile (approx 60x40x2mm) will help players keep track of whose turn it is to roll the dice. 

Cardboard is nice, but wood is even better!
AND: We also would like to say thank you for your support on social media. If our launch tweet gets 50 retweets, we will add 50 more score sheets to the game! Bonus!
Thanks to your love and support, we are pleased to announce that we will add 50 more score sheets again to Medici: The Dice Game!
If required, more stretch goals are planned to appear on this list during the campaign, however, we run streamlined KS campaigns where stretch goals are designed to make the quality of production better for backers, not to add extras that may blow out costs, timelines, and shipping prices. Backers can be confident that any additional game content that we may unlock during the campaign has been tested and budgeted and should not affect our production timetable.
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
But that's not all...!
In celebration of this all-new addition to the Medici family, Grail Games is proud and pleased to offer all backers the chance to purchase and add-on (via the post-campaign pledge-manager) many of our previously released games by Reiner Knizia. This campaign is a great opportunity for you to complete your collection at discounted prices!
Medici
Since its first release in 1995, Reiner Knizia's Medici has come to be considered a modern classic of board games. By one of the world's most respected designers, and with stunning artwork by award-winning illustrator Vincent Dutrait, Grail Games was pleased to release a new, English edition of this famous auction game in 2016. Medici has become our flagship title and shows better than any other game how we like to “remake it better!”
Medici is an auction game that takes place over three days (rounds). Players take turns presenting goods to be auctioned. Successful bidders will then load these goods onto the decks of their ships. Once all ships are full, or the deck of commodity cards is depleted, each day ends. Players then receive money for the value of the loads in their ships, and for how much of each commodity they have bought thus far. But be careful - the money you use to bid at auctions is also your end game points! After three days and three scorings, the player with the most money will win the game.
Medici is quick to learn, smooth to play and full of player interaction.
The game contains…
1 full-color rule book
1 game board (406 x 406mm)
36 commodity cards - 7 each depicting cloth, fur, grain, dye and spice & 1 gold card (44 x 67mm)
6 player aid cards
6 large ship mats (250 x 100mm)
2 smaller ship mats - to be used in the 2 player game (98 x 100mm)
36 wooden playing counters (6 per player)
5 commodity scoring counters
2 day tracking counters
1 start player token
...all contained within a sturdy two-piece box (305 x 223 x 43mm)
If you would like to see what reviewers have thought about Medici, click on the links below!
 Rahdo Runs Thru Medici: 
 Joel Eddy of Drive-Thru Reviews reviews Medici: 
 Zee Garcia of The Dice Tower reviews Medici: 

Medici: The Card Game
Medici: The Card Game shares the setting and feel of his classic Medici board game, without using that game's auction mechanisms.
Set in 15th century Florence, players will try to acquire the most valuable goods for their merchant ships by drawing cards from a common deck. It is a set-collection card game with some push-your-luck elements. It is very easy to teach, learn and play.
Medici: The Card Game is for 2-6 players ages 10 and up and takes 30 minutes, or so, to play.
After re-releasing Medici the board game, Grail Games was very pleased to bring this terrific card game to life - the first to be added to the Medici family of games since Strozzi, released in 2008!
The game contains...
110 commodity cards
6 player aid cards
50 shiny cardboard coins
1 rulebook
...All in a sturdy 2-piece box (150x150x43mm)
If you would like to see what reviewers have thought about Medici: The Card Game, click on the links below!
Rahdo’s Final Thoughts:
 Zee of The Dice Tower reviews Medici: The Card Game: 
 David of Grail Games shows you how to play: 
Want more...?!
If you would like to pledge for extra copies of Medici: The Dice Game, please add $29AUD for each extra copy you would like to your pledge total. You will also be able to add-on extra copies in our post-campaign pledge manager.
If you would like to pledge for a copy of Medici: The Card Game, please add $28AUD for each copy you would like to your pledge total. You will also be able to add-on extra copies in our post-campaign pledge manager.
If you would like to pledge for extra copies of Medici (the original board game), please add $50AUD for each copy you would like to your pledge total. You will also be able to add-on extra copies in our post-campaign pledge manager.
Also, as a thank you to backers of this campaign, we are happily offering some of our other Reiner Knizia titles at a cheaper-than-retail price! These games will be able to be added-on after the campaign through our pledge manager. Please note that quantities are limited, however, and first come, first served :)
You don't need to worry about pledging for these games now, it will all be sorted out after the campaign ends. Pledge now to be given access to our pledge manager and the following titles...!
YELLOW & YANGTZE
One of the big releases of last year, Yellow & Yangtze, the sister game to the highly acclaimed board game Tigris & Euphrates, invites you to replay this eventful period and to lead your dynasty to victory.
Y&Y is for 2-4 players, ages 14+ and plays in 90 minutes.
STEPHENSON’S ROCKET
Stephenson's Rocket does many things within its tight, intriguing rules set: it is a tile-laying game, a route-building game, a set-collection game, and a bidding game - all in one.
Stephenson’s Rocket is for 2-4 players, ages 12+ and plays in 90 minutes.
KING’S ROAD
In King's Road, the players are nobles who are attempting to gain power and influence within the king's many provinces. As the king travels along the road that connects all the major land-marks within his territory, he will allow the most influential noble in each region to govern in his stead. Over time, the most favored noble will win the game.
King’s Road is for 2-5 players, ages 10+ and plays in 45 minutes.
CRISS CROSS
Criss Cross is a new roll-and-write game from Reiner Knizia that is both simple to learn and great fun to play.
Criss Cross is for 1-6 players, ages 8+ and plays in 10 minutes.
To support our campaign and to help us fund Medici: The Dice Game is simple! Simply click the "Back this Project" button on your screen and select your reward. You pay nothing until after the campaign is finished (assuming we fund).
Please note that wherever you live, you will pledge in your home currency's equivalent of the listed $AUD pledge.
A few weeks after the close of the campaign, we will send you our Pledge Manager via email. It is then that we will collect your address and allow you to add-on extra titles and more copies of the Dice Game (if you would like to). We will keep you updated via emails and on the Updates tab of this page in regards to printing and fulfilment.
If you pledge but later wish to change your reward, simply click on the "Manage my Pledge" button.
We hope you may come along for the journey :)
By supporting Medici: The Dice Game on Kickstarter, not only are you helping us to produce the game in the first place, but if you back now, you will also receive these perks:
 PRICE! You will receive your copy of of the game at, or below, retail cost! (MSRP will be approximately $25USD/$35AUD.) TBC
 EARLY! You will receive your copy about two months prior to the game being made available to online and bricks & mortar game stores. We do not produce huge print runs - to be sure of acquiring the game, pledge during the KS campaign.
 NICE! Your support will make the game better! More stretch goals means more components and a better quality.
 AND! We are also providing copies of some other titles to backers of this campaign at a reduced price as a thank you to you!
  THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
Shipment of your games is planned to commence during (or before) August, 2020. Kickstarter will automatically add the following shipping costs to your pledge now. (Please note that the costs below are in AUD, but will be converted to your "home" currency.)
If you add-on extra Knizia games with our post-campaign pledge manager, the shipping cost for those games will be calculated at that time.
We have done our best to keep these shipping costs as low as possible. And, to reduce taxes and fees, games will ship to backers from within the USA, Canada, Europe, and Australia!
Grail Games: Remake it better!
Grail Games is a card and board game publishing studio located in Sydney, Australia.
Founded over five years ago, we have already run 13 successful Kickstarter campaigns. We focus on reprints, and producing English language versions of great games from Asia and Europe. Sometimes, a mid-weight game just proves itself to be so good that we must try to publish it - Medici: The Dice Game was one of these cases.
Grail Games’ aim is to produce board and card games that are:
Fast to teach: our games have clean, straight-forward rules sets to decrease the number of barriers to entry.
  Replayable: Games blossom when they offer a variety of pathways to explore. All of our games have a high Game Play Depth > Box Size ratio.
  If you would like to find out more about us or our games, please visit www.grailgames.com.au
CREDITS:
Designer: Reiner Knizia
Dr. Reiner Knizia is one of the world’s most successful and prolific game designers. More than 600 of his games and books have been published worldwide in over 50 languages and have won him numerous international awards.
Artist: Vincent Dutrait
Vincent Dutrait is currently one of the most highly regarded illustrators of board and card games in the world. His use of traditional illustration methods and media, as well as his bright style and attention to detail have earned him worldwide praise.
➼ Follow Grail Games on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook!
➼ Check out Medici: The Dice Game on the Grail Games website!
➼ Visit Medici: The Dice Game on BGG for videos, forums, photos and more!
THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Grail Games has already successfully funded thirteen games, all currently available in game stores around the world. Since our first Kickstarter campaign was received EARLY by backers in January 2015, we have continued to send high quality products to backers on time! We have our systems well in place and use a top manufacturer to produce and ship quality games around the world. Grail Games is beginning to forge a track record of delivering fun games with quality components… on time!

However, unforeseen circumstances can hold up a project. This can happen at the point of manufacture or during shipment. Grail Games has given a time-frame for delivery of Medici: The Dice Game that we believe is certainly achievable. If anything does affect the project, backers will be kept in the loop via regular backer updates at every step of the production and shipment process.

Note that the currency conversions in the pledge level blurbs are a guide only. Currency values may fluctuate during the campaign.

Also note: Backers will receive the game at the best possible price and will receive their games before retail stores, but Grail Games cannot guarantee that retailers will not sell Medici: The Dice Game at a cheaper price than Kickstarter supporters will “pay,” especially months or years in the future.

Finally, Grail Games will happily send replacement parts of any game damaged in shipment or due to manufacturing mishaps to backers, etc., but if backers fail to inform Grail Games of a change in shipping address or similar, backers may be asked to pay extra costs if they require a replacement copy of the game.

campaign.story:
Hey Robot is a party game where two teams compete to get their smart speaker to say a specific word. It's a bit like Codenames or Taboo, if the friend you were playing with had an encyclopedia and was also very, very drunk. It's a hilarious, smart and strategic game for people who own a Google Home or Amazon Alexa and have no idea what the heck to do with it.
Hey Robot is created by Everybody House Games — Hilary, Mara, Frank  and James Lantz. We're a family that's been making games for decades, including Universal Paperclips, Invisible Inc and Drop7. We've always been obsessed with board games and the funny ways we interact with technology in our day-to-day lives. Hey Robot is the intersection of those interests and the result of months of trying to invent fun things to do with our Alexa.
Hey Robot plays well with any group size, from 2 players up to as many people as you can fit around a flat surface. 
At the beginning of the game, you deal out a grid of cards with words on them. Then teams alternate trying to capture a word by asking The Robot a question that will get them to say that word in their response. (They can't say any form of the word in their question.)
For example, Team 1 might pick VAMPIRE.  
 After a brief huddle, they decide to ask: "Alexa, what is a creature that is scared of sunlight?" hoping Alexa will say the word "vampire" in her response. Instead, she'll tell you about heliophobia — the fear of going out into the sun. Groan. Because they missed with their question,  Team 1 puts a bonus point token on the VAMPIRE card, increasing its value.
Now it's Team 2's turn. After some deliberation, they choose VAMPIRE as well. They ask:  "Alexa, who is Dracula?" Alexa answers, 
Boom! Everyone cheers because Alexa said the word "vampire" in her response. Team 2 gets three points -- the two points printed on the card, plus the additional bonus point token. Now they must add a bonus point to one of the four cards touching the card they just captured. 
They might choose GLASS because they think it's the hardest word to get, or they might choose MARSHMALLOW because they have an idea for how to capture it themselves. Now it's Team 1's turn again, and the game continues in this way until one team has earned 16 or more points and reigns victorious. 
The game is really that simple. But while the rules are easy to understand, achieving a mind meld with your Robot can take a lifetime. Alexa and Google are both the smartest and stupidest people in the room, so asking the right question in the right way requires knowledge, cleverness and strategy. When you get it right there's cheering. When you get it wrong there's laughter, because the answer is usually hilarious.
 400 word cards: The main event!  Each card is double-sided for a total of 800 words, painstakingly selected by our highly scientific methodology.* We've also assigned each word a point value in relation to its difficulty to make sure every game of Hey Robot has those dynamic highs and lows. 
 25 bonus point tokens: Stylish cardboard tokens.
 Scoring track: For keeping track of who's winning.
 2 game pawns: For you to "accidentally" knock over when the winning team isn't looking. One black, one white. 
 Hourglass timer: 30 seconds worth of sand. You won't have to use this every turn, but it's useful from time to time to keep the game moving along at a steady pace.
 Rule booklet: Tells you and your friends how to play the game. 
*Basically, we started with the entire English language and then narrowed it down to the ones that made us laugh or feel clever and weren't absurdly hard or way too easy. 
Hey Robot does NOT include an Amazon Alexa or Google Home! You will need one of your own to play the game. 
Hey Robot is easy to set up and explain to your friends, so you can start having a great time right out of the box! You'll laugh, you'll cheer and you'll finally have a use for your Robot that isn't just setting timers. 
A NOTE ABOUT SHIPPING
Originally, we only were offering shipping to US and Canada. We realized there was demand for international shipping and were able to open up shipping to many European countries and Australian/NZ.  We know the cost of international shipping is high, but we've tried to get these numbers as low as possible. Believe it or not, the prices we are charging for international shipping are lower than our actual costs. 
WHO ARE WE? 
Everybody House Games is a family company. Frank and James are professional video game developers, while Hilary and Mara chose to become actual productive members of society. But that means they don't get a hyperlink on their names in this Kickstarter, so who's laughing now? 
Our favorite board games have always been simple, fun and social — games like Hanabi, Codenames and Skull. We made Hey Robot in that tradition--it's the kind of game we always want to have around when we're hanging out.
Hey Robot is our company's first professional board game. Board games have been such an incredible and positive influence in all our lives and we're so pumped that we might get to add one of ours to the world. We're really grateful to be able to share this moment with you guys through this Kickstarter.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been testing this game for over a year, so we've fine-tuned the design and know that playing the game is super fun. 

We've also spent months working on the physical design of the box and the cards and are confident that we're going to be able to deliver a final product that looks great on your shelf and feels great to hold and play. 

This will be our first time producing a board game but we're looking at various very professional printing and fulfillment solutions including AdMagic and Blackbox who have manufactured and fulfilled huge games like Cards Against Humanity, so we're in good hands. We don't have any complex gimmicks or fragile pieces so our manufacturing process is pretty straightforward.

We have several lifetimes of experience delivering polished and fun video games. Board games are a different beast, of course, but we are confident that we will able to give backers a high-quality product in a reasonable timeframe.

campaign.story:
Get ready to browse Kickstarter in a new way
Welcome to the 2019 Tabletop Games Kickstarter Report.
The report brings together all this years successful projects and rearranges them to bring similar projects together. It also orders these by backers so we can see who's leading the way in their particular niche and who's up and coming.
Projects from the same creator are grouped together so we can see how they've done through the year and the top 10% most backed projects include details of the top 3 reward levels.
For backers this makes Kickstarter much more browseable. Kickstarters search page is like an endless hotel corridor, this report is more like a shopping mall. By grouping projects within meaningful categories like Games Accessories - Dice we get fewer and more relevant recent projects with sufficient information to get a flavour for each one. With around 2000 projects this year it's easy to miss some, this report will help you find what you're interested in and possibly stuff you didn't even know existed.
For Creators it provides a useful insight into who your peers are. It's something like aerial photography, it gives you a clearer overview of how you fit within your chosen area. You can see what others are doing and how it's working out for them. It might even help you to explore other areas of the hobby and maybe find collaborators for your next project.
The aim of the report is to build a kind of road map of Kickstarter, or at least the little section of Tabletop Games so that projects go into an easily accessible archive and may get a little more exposure after the event itself. Just do a search on dice now, you'll get 1600 odd results, my report contains 61! You can see my Case in Point in the updates section
The report is designed to be clear and easy to follow, I only include the most useful information and images to keep the report clear and simple and use different font sizes and colours to make things easy to follow.
If you are wondering what's the point, these projects have all ended now?, that's a good point and one of the things that nearly made me not do this, but the simple fact is that most of these creators will be back next year with something new and improved. If any of these projects catch your eye, you can look them up and you'll find a link to their store or website, or their next project. Just because the project has ended, doesn't mean the project has ended, if you follow me.
2019 is not yet done, so the book is due to release around the 15th January 2020, to give me a chance to compile all the data. The PDF file will be released around this date for which you will be sent a download link. 
I have compiled a sample of the report so you can get a feel for it and how interesting and useful it could be for you. Please do check it out, because you will see what I mean better than I could explain it.
You can view or download the Game Accessories - Dice sample here
Sample Report PDF File
The book will be A4 format, approximately 250 pages and will include all successful Kickstarter projects in the Tabletop Games category which ended in 2019, I'm expecting this to be over 2000 projects.
****PLEASE HELP ME  TO MAKE THIS A THING****

After our smash-hit campaign for Ragusa last year, we're proud to bring you Venice, a thrilling medium-weight Euro set in the titular 16th century city, that serves as a 'spiritual' sequel to Ragusa.
Venice lets players take the role of wealthy, influential merchants as they ride their gondolas up and down the city's canals, train their assistants, complete contracts, and leverage their influence to gain political power. But business is anything but usual. As they broker contracts and flirt with crime, merchants must avoid arousing the suspicion of the Venetian Inquisition, lest they find themselves arrested and their businesses shut down.

Ragusa is Braincrack Games' sixth release on Kickstarter, and whilst every project presents its own unique challenges, we have a great working knowledge of production, fulfilment, and post-campaign support.

We've had great reactions from all our releases on Kickstarter so far, and have successfully delivered customs-free to all our backers.

One worry for UK backers is the looming impact of Brexit. campaign.story:
Tiny Footprint is a cooperative board game for 1-6 players where you aim to reduce your carbon foot print to meet the climate target of two tonnes C02 per person and year.
With multiple set up scenarios and characters with unique characteristics and capabilities the game offers lots of replayability. 
In the game you play as a household or a group of friends trying to complete various environmental missions that reduce your carbon footprint. You need to reduce your carbon footprint to the climate target of two tonnes per person before time runs out.
You start by selecting where you live which impacts your starting emissions:
Then you select your lifestyle. This may not only change the starting emissions of the game but it is also a way of setting the difficulty level of the game. You can play at four different levels of difficulty; Normal, Tricky, Hard and Epic!
Then you choose your characters. There are 16 different characters to play in the game, divided in to two categories; 12 regular Characters and 4 Gamers:
More characters will be unlocked if we hit the stretch goals
You can play as a group of friends or a family, even a single household. Each character has different abilities and resources that help them to beat the climate target.
There are three types of resources that help you reduce your carbon emissions; discipline, environmental commitment and finances. 
 By using the resource cards you will try to complete climate missions. They come in four categories; transport, food, housing and other consumption:
 There are also external factors that influence us when we try to live more sustainably. For instance, there are political and financial instruments that try to nudge us in the right direction and help us change our lifestyle choices. And there are mechanisms that make it harder; like advertising, habits and social norms. These external factors are represented in the game by the Encouragement/Resistance cards which are activated during the more challenging climate missions:
When you successfully complete a climate mission you get to reduce the carbon emissions on the board. When you have managed to reduce all emission categories to zero you have won the game. So you compete against the game and not the other players who you instead need to collaborate with to win the game.
 Tiny Footprint offers a great opportunity to have fun together and to cooperate to win the game, at the same time as you get to learn about which actions have the biggest impact on reducing your carbon emissions
Game set up for a 4-player game
Tiny Footprint comes with an innate solo mode. There is no need for an AI, separate Automa deck or anything like that. You just follow the player count rules in the rule book and gain access to more action pawns and mission cards and play just like you would in a game with multiple players.
Furthermore, to give the game high replayability there are, alongside the multiple characters to play that all have unique abilities, four levels of difficulty to play; Normal, Tricky, Hard and Epic. This will allow you to replay the game and get a harder challenge each time you play.
Both social goals have been reached and the cards will be included in the game

Since making and shipping a board game to lots of different countries is expensive I need the funds to be able to do it and also to ensure that there are enough people who want to play this game. That is why I use Kickstarter to try to raise the funds necessary to make this game a reality.
A Kickstarter campaign is an all or nothing campaign. This means that the money you back this project with will only be charged in the event the campaign reaches its target. If it does not reach its target no money will be drawn from your card account. 
 As I am making a board game about sustainable lifestyles and choices I want to address the sustainability aspect of the product I am trying to make a reality.
And if your question is; Isn't it more sustainable not to buy this board game? And the answer is yes. From a strict resource perspective it would be better not to buy this game. Having said that, I still want to make this game a reality and here are the reasons why:
First and foremost, it is a board game and not a sustainability product. And although this hobby does produce thousands of games every year, the footprint of one board game for one household is extremely small compared to the other lifestyle choices we make when it comes to our diet, how we travel and where we travel. The difference the choices we make is the core take-away from playing this game
Secondly, my hope is that when people play this game it will generate interesting discussions around the choices we make and how they impact our climate. Hopefully it can inform and help some of the players to make more sustainable choices in the future. That is the real sustainability impact of the game
Why the focus on individual lifestyle choices and not governments and corporations? This game focuses on a household and our individual choices. Clearly we need government and corporate commitments alongside technological innovation to meet the climate target. But our individual lifestyle choices will also play a key role in a more sustainable future.
We have tried to produce this in the most sustainable way possible but still with an eye on cost. So this means that it is produced with recycled paper and cardboard and almost no plastic. But it is produced in China due to the cost-prohibitive nature of producing it locally in Sweden (where we are based)
In conclusion, this product can help people with having conversations around living sustainably but it is a board game and not a sustainability product.
