campaign.story:
Welcome to the Button Shy reprint campaign! We have recently published our 55th Wallet Game and wanted to revisit some favorites that have run low or out of stock. This campaign will work a little differently than our usual campaigns. Here we will start with 3 fan favorites and as stretch goals are hit, we will add more games to the print run. With each stretch goal, we will invite you to help vote for the next game that we add. With each new game, we will add a new reward level allowing backers to get all of the games at these Kickstarter discounted prices. 
THE FOLLOWING GAMES ARE AVAILABLE AS OF NOW:
 Mint Julep by Dan Letzring
 Pentaquark by Mike Mullins
 Pickpockets by Isaac Shalev & Matt Loomis
 Avignon: A Clash of Popes by John Du Bois
 Avignon: Pilgrimage by John Du Bois
 Stew by Jason Glover
 Twin Stars: Adventure Series I by Jason Tagmire & Mike Mullins
 Twin Stars: Adventure Series II by Jason Tagmire & Mike Mullins
 Turbo Drift by Rob Cramer
 The Maiden In The Forest by Todd Sanders
  Cunning Folk by Jay Treat
  Banned Books by Jason Tagmire
Plus a bunch of expansions! See the latest updates for details on how to add the expansions. 
Let's jump into the available games!
You are in attendance of an amazing horse race and your goal is to end up with the most points by the end of the race. In Mint Julep,  players draft cards, place bets and then manipulate the race in order  to ensure the horse that they want to win ends up finishing the race in a  top spot. Be careful where you place your bet because the odds might be against you!
Each game is played in 3 Rounds that each consist of three phases: drafting cards for your hand, betting on which horse you think will win, playing movement cards to adjust the order of the horses in the race.
Final scoring is based on where horses start in the race (horses  starting in lower positions are worth more points), where horses end in  the race (more points earned for higher place finishers), and when a bet  was played (with later bets being worth less than earlier bets). Score the highest points with your bet and you win!
Some of the biggest questions in the world of science may be answered by  studying quarks, the smallest of particles. The problem with trying to study quarks is that you can’t find just one quark; you need to find them in groups called hadrons, or some other exotic particles, like the Pentaquark.
In Pentaquark, you are trying to give  science a little helping hand by collecting the five quarks that form  this particle at the detector of a massive particle collider. Move cards  you need to the detector, discard others so they may come back as  anti-quarks, and try to minimize the number of quarks scattered and  lost. If too many cards are removed from the game, the Pentaquark has  slipped through undetected once again!
All  players play as thieves who are pulling bills out of a wallet stuffed with cash. What none of them know, is any player may be an undercover cop, trying to catch as many thieves as possible.
In Pickpockets, players will take turns  either drawing or manipulating money cards in a wallet until a player  reveals themselves as an undercover cop, yelling “Hands up”. All other  players will reveal their cards.
The Undercover Cop Wins if at least one other player has two or more marked bills in their possession. Otherwise the Pickpocket with the most money wins. Alternatively a player can skip town if they have enough unmarked money in their possession.
Avignon is a quick influence manipulation card  game in which the two players  are rival candidates for Pope in the 14th  century. Players gain  influence by petitioning members of the medieval  Church, such as  Cardinals, Nobles, and Knights, and using the  characters' unique powers  to pull the character cards over to their side  of the table (their  congregation), or force an opponent to push cards  towards them. The  first player to get three characters into their  congregation wins.
Stew is a press-your-luck, partial knowledge game. You and your fellow players take on the role of a farmer collecting items from the garden to make a stew. There are six vermin that want to eat your stew before you do. Draw a card and add it to your stew or feed some of the vermin to protect your pot. Make sure you do not wait too long, or your  fellow farmers might eat your stew.
Two cosmic adventurers are in a tricky scenario and must work  together. By rolling and manipulating dice for special abilities and  combos, you can be the one that guides them to victory.
Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. A session uses just 3 cards and players provide their own dice and  coins/tokens. Scenarios and characters can be  interchanged  with others for a very different gaming experience. Twin Stars: Adventure Series I is a collection of 6 Twin Stars scenarios and 12 characters, making for 396 unique combinations and tons of solo replayability.
R-R-R-R-Race toward the finish line at ludicrous speed! In Turbo Drift,  you must make your way through an analog racecourse full of obstacles by drafting movement cards from columns or rows or even pushing-your-luck and try to use all the movement cards. Turbo Drift will make a big presence on your gaming table with obstacle cards and  nitro-infused gameplay, yet small enough to put in your pocket for some  lunchtime gaming.
Turbo Drift is a real-space racing game for 2-4 players that takes  30 minutes to play. Players will take turns picking 1,2,or 3 path cards from a grid to navigate their cars closer to  the goal card. Once per  game, they can go turbo, using all of the cards in the grid to drive. The first player to cross the finish line wins!
Long ago, a maiden mage was trapped in an  enchanted forest ring. Through her cunning, and with the help of four magic objects, she attempts to escape her fate.
The Maiden in the Forest is an 18-card  solitaire game using only cards. The rules are contained  within the 18 cards. The object of the game is to rotate, then turn  over, each of the  twelve tree cards from their blooming to dormant side. If you can do  this before the end of the twelve clock cycles of  day and night, you win  your freedom.
Rival witch covens have been warring for the souls of Ipswich's townsfolk for years, but it ends now. You’ve been tasked to search home by home to find the witches and end this feud.
Cunning Folk is a micro game of bluffing  and deduction. You are townsfolk, investigating the houses of Ipswich for witches, good and evil. Look at a card and tell your friends  which character you see to use its ability. Of course, you could lie.  Your opponents might call you out, but everyone should tread carefully: Wrong  once, and the town suspects you of witchcraft. Twice, and you  are ostracized! Keep your wits about you and—if you lie, do it well.
It is the hope of every literary character that their tale will inspire people for generations to come. But how can people be inspired by your story if it’s on the banned books list? Your story MUST be told, and it's time for you to take matters into  your own hands!
Banned Books is a solo game featuring ousted literary characters  fighting back against the Powers-That-Be to restore their books to the shelves. Each turn you will select actions that will progress your agenda track, hamper the agenda tracks of the Powers, utilize your characters unique abilities or manipulate your tableau. If you can   advance your progress token quickly enough to convince 2 of the Powers-That-Be to remove your book from the banned list, you win. But if the majority of the Powers advance their tokens and make up their minds first, or drain your characters stamina, you will be banished from shelves forever!
We normally don't do stretch goals, but it's the entire point of this campaign! Each stretch goal will unlock a new game, which backers will vote for in the comments. When a new game is unlocked it becomes part of the pool of games you can choose from at the end of the campaign. Keep an eye on the updates to vote for your favorites! Here are some potential stretch goal games (and even more that aren't shown here). 
We will pick about 3 at a time and ask you to vote for your favorite through the updates here. But feel free to start discussing your favorite games in the comments.

Please contact us directly to arrange payment for the additional shipping charge. 
With monthly Wallet Game releases and a following of repeat customers, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club.
It's a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames, promo cards, expansion content, and Kickstarter discounts.... every month. Supporters will receive from $1, $2, $5 to $10 off of EVERY WALLET GAME THAT WE MAKE. (See the $1 level here, that's where the members back the projects).
In 2019 supporters received Chain Mail (a solo and co-operative dungeon crawl system), Tempus Quest (a not quite roll and write), as well as 9 card micro games, expansion / promo cards for our existing games, and at $20 a month, supporters receive all of the above and a copy of the featured wallet game (or the wallet game of your choice). 
But we're getting close to 2020 where we shift things a bit.  There are a few new monthly games that will be revealed on December 1st, as well as some of the additional content to expect. I can only say that we have a big long awaited expansion planned for one game, and 4(!) expansions planned for another game. There's also a new line of extra tiny games in the works, which will work their way into the club next year. 
If that sounds cool to you, check out the Board Game of the Month Club on Patreon!
http://www.patreon.com/buttonshy

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
We are down to the last big push here. This has been tough, with a couple of layers of tough right on top of that. I know I've explained why in the past, but I'll briefly explain again. 
With most Kickstarter campaigns we pull out the 10% that ordered extras on the site, and everyone else gets sent in bulk. Bulk is when we assemble a ton of packages that are exactly the same, print a ton of labels and place them on top. It doesn't matter which label goes on a package, as they are all the same. With these, one person can do about 50-100 an hour. We have a 5 person team, usually 2 per day. So we could get through 300 in a day. Then we have the complicated custom orders that take about 5-10 minutes each. With the team, we can get through about 50 in a day, but it's a lot of double and triple checking to make sure everything is right.

campaign.story:
OVERVIEW OF THE GAME
Watch the city grow upwards and outwards as you and your fellow planners expand from downtown, building residential, commercial, and industrial buildings to satisfy the needs of the citizens. Cover parking lots and abandoned buildings with parks and museums and make sure you have offices in the prestigious skyscrapers at the heart of the Zoned Out metropolis. This light strategy game by Keith Rentz provides a unique gaming experience that is as beautiful to look at as it is fun to play.
STRETCH GOALS
We've decided to try something a bit different with this campaign.  Due to the nature of the game, there isn't much to be done for stretch goals.  Instead, we have opted to offer the game at a significant discount off of the retail of $39.99.  In addition, we are giving all the exclusive content we have for the game up front.
The 6 promotional Secret Goal cards that come with your Kickstarter edition of Zoned Out will not be available in retail.
Cost:  While we would love to offer free shipping, there really is no such thing. Shipping is really expensive and we have tried to come up with pricing that accurately reflects our cost to get the game into your hands without creating a logistical nightmare on our side. There's a lot of plastic pieces and awesome game to pack up here, and that doesn't make it any cheaper. Your shipping will be added in the pledge manager.  We expect that we'll have to come out of pocket a bit based on what we are charging and we are ok with that.
Tracking: We will also be using non-trackable shipments in some cases in order to save on cost as tracking can add 30-50% or more in some cases. So please understand if we do not have tracking with your package we did so knowingly. Rest assured, that we will get you your game and any risk associated with a package not being trackable is on us.
Delivery time: While we would love to get everyone their games at the same time, it is just not possible. There is a high likelihood that some areas of the world will get their games before others. Our commitment is to get the games ready and printed as fast as possible (we've already done a ton of the prep work). 
The fine print stuff:
What does "Exclusive" mean? You've probably noticed we do not say Kickstarter Exclusive but rather show a logo with our image (or another company image) and the word exclusive.  What this means is that these items will never be available in retail and only through us or the company depicted on the logo.  However, while they may be available from us in the future, they will most certainly not be given away for free.  In most cases, the cost of putting together the same package you might back in our campaign is 50% more or higher afterward.
Other: Lastly, we will be using fulfillment companies in different parts of the world and while we have done our best to ensure we pick good ones, ultimately, once the games get into their warehouses there is little control we have at that point. We have always done our best to bend over backwards for our customers and if for some reason there are any issues with damages, missing components or missing shipments we will make it right. It just might require some patience.
Why back this campaign? While we have had great success with other games like Deception: Murder in Hong Kong and Champions of Midgard, we are still a relatively small company and we just do not have the funds needed to fund every project we do without some help. Your pledge gets you all the exclusive unlocked content which will not be available in retail... only through us.  Plus, if you live in the U.S the game will be in your hands before someone can get it from an online retailer.  Lastly, we expect the standard retail version of the game to be $40 MSRP, which won't get any of the cool exclusives that you'll get on this campaign.  If you live outside the U.S, we will do our best to get it into your hands first. Also, pledging helps get us closer to buying our company "team building" yacht.
campaign.risks:

As a publisher that has brought more than a dozen games to market thus far, we feel confident in our ability to get this done. The gameplay for this game is 95% complete. In addition, our intention is to not release this game to standard retail until all U.S backers orders have been shipped. Our goal is to have it in our backers hands 1-3 weeks before someone can buy it on Amazon.

campaign.story:
We are thrilled to bring back this classic card game of building trains and managing passengers!   Originally published by Mayfair Games in 2004, Station Master has long been favored for its high player interaction, clever decisions, and fun gameplay.  We couldn’t think of a better way to continue Calliope Games' 10 year anniversary celebration than by refreshing and publishing one of our favorite games - so we welcome you to the launch of the new and improved Station Master!  
Station Master is a train-themed card game for 2-6 players.  In the game, players are working at the station, attaching railcars to Locomotives and boarding passengers on trains, trying to score the most Efficiency Points to win!
We have restored this timeless train game, creating stunning all-new artwork based on classic locomotives, railcars, and railroad history.  In addition, we have refined and streamlined the rules for modern audiences, as well as adding in upgrades and new material to create the greatest possible Station Master experience!
PLAY

Calliope Games has used Kickstarter ever since 2012, bringing to life a library of amazing games: Tsuro of the Seas, Roll For It!, Dicey Peaks, The Mansky Caper, Running With The Bulls, Hive Mind, Menu Masters, Ancestree, ShutterBug, Capital City, ShipShape, Everyone Loves A Parade, SpyMaster, and Tsuro: Phoenix Rising!  We love this community and this platform!
Exclusive Deluxe Box and Alternate Passenger Pawns Not Available In Retail Version After The Campaign!
We invite you to be the first to board the train and take a ride! Station Master will be available after release through distribution to retailers, but through this Kickstarter campaign, you can pledge for the Executive Class edition of the game, featuring improvements and exclusives not found in the retail version of the game.  The 36 exclusive Passenger pawn shapes and flip-top magnetic-close box in the Executive Class edition of the game will not be available through distribution after this campaign. 
Every Tuesday and Thursday as we ride the rails through the campaign, we will reveal a FEATURED LOCOMOTIVE POSTCARD that will packaged in with the Executive Class version of the game! These are actual postcards that can be collected or mailed to a train enthusiast you know!  While not a gameplay element, each set of nine postcards is a wonderful free add-on for this beautiful game!
Man vs Meeple
Never Bored Gamers
SAHM Reviews
The Dice Tower with Mark & Randy
We are offering subsidized shipping costs in order to strike the best balance of value for our backers and actual cost to us. We have strategically partnered with trusted fulfillment partners around the world experienced in shipping Kickstarter rewards.
10 years ago, Calliope Games began as a collaboration between Dawne Weisman, Jordan Weisman, and Ray Wehrs. All of us are experienced game industry professionals who have worked together since 1999 when we collectively launched WizKids. Calliope Games has been producing and selling quality tabletop games since 2009. Our products are inspired by family for families. To date we have released 24 titles, many of which were brought to life here on Kickstarter!
At Calliope Games, we publish fun, affordable, family-style tabletop games for all to enjoy.
With gamers in mind, our games make the perfect "gateway" or "filler" game. They allow you to easily draft your non-gamer friends into your favorite hobby. Calliope games are excellent for starting out game night and are easily played between heavier games. It’s important to point out to our non-gamer friends that we do take a slightly different approach to the games we produce. At Calliope, we focus on entertaining adults; however, the games we produce allow children to compete with their parents without the parents “throwing” the game. It’s a really a pretty simple concept; instead of having the parents step down into the child’s world, we are inviting the child to step up into the parents' world.
For gamers and non-gamers alike, the results of our efforts are games that are accessible by all players regardless of skill level or age, play in under 60 minutes, are affordably priced, and most of all… are a blast to play!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any venture, there are risks... those that are seen, and those that are unseen. The biggest foreseeable risks we currently face are manufacturing in China and shipping issues from China to our warehouse here in the US.

Each of these risks is greatly minimized with Calliope Games. Our factories have been with us for many years. They know how we work and the quality we expect. In addition, our freight forwarder and fulfillment teams are world class and have over 30 years of expertise to rely upon. If any issues arise, we will know of them far in advance and will be able to overcome them.

New tariffs may influence costs as well. Typically these are 10%-25% of our total manufacturing cost. Should tariffs affect prices, these will be reflected in the post-campaign shipping and fulfillment cost.

As far as the unseen risks... we know they are there and we have built a safety margin into our costs of goods sold to prepare us for the unforeseen. To date we've launched more than 20 games under the Calliope brand, many with a good number of reprints, and we have overcome all major production issues in providing our players quality entertainment experiences.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The One80 Pouches use no magnet, no velcro and no zipper. They require no pocket or belt to provide you with an easy and safe solution for carrying your cards, phone or passport.  
We've taken the idea of a running belt and transformed the concept into something completely new and different; then expanded on the idea from a way to carry a phone while running to wallets and passport holders. 
The One80 Pouch is the first stand alone pouch that can be added to a waistline (with or without a belt) with no need for a belt, pocket, magnets or velcro. This pouch makes it possible for you to carry those day to day necessities with ease. Each pouch lays discretely against your waist with little to no show. 
 Compare the old way to the newly reinvented One80 Pouch way!
Carrying your cell phone, cards or passport has never been so easy. 
In developing the One80 Pouches we poured over reviews to figure out the good and bad of all comparable items. Zippers are the number one breaking point of running belt and fanny packs. Magnets are potentially dangerous to cell phones and velcro often loses its stick after time. So, we set out to find a way to develop the pouches without any of these to improve user experience and convenience. 
 No one likes sitting on a wallet. It's uncomfortable and annoying. 
Minimal wallet are great. Better than a large traditional wallet. Yet the problem remains.  You have have to keep in a pocket. Do you deal with having it in a back pocket and the bother of sitting on it? Or keep it in a front pocket and contend with the front pocket bulge? 
Dave, who has been testing testing the card holder wallet prototype said,
"I went to using a minimal wallet a year ago. From there I started keeping it in my front pocket to avoid having to sit on it. That was better than a back pocket.                                             But THIS wallet is a GAME CHANGER." 
Fanny packs and running belts are great; but what if you don't want to carry that bulky thing? Or just want something more discrete? One80 Pouch is for you. Perfect to carry your phone on a run and inconspicuous enough to wear with almost anything out to a movies or dinner. Wearing leggings or jeans? With or without a belt? You can comfortably wear any of these with the One80 Pouches.   

In front, in back, on the side? Or maybe partially on the side or somewhere in between. Wear your pouch how you like.  
Even if you're not wearing it on you waist it's perfect for the inner pocket of your backpack or purse. Have you ever lost your wallet to bottom depths of a bag? Use your pouch to keep it attached inside the bag exactly where you need it. 
 Inconspicuously wear your One80 Pouch wherever life takes you. 
True functionality happens so easily you don't have to think about it. Carrying items can be cumbersome and an obstruction. The One80 Pouch is truly functional. You can wear it to the gym and it won't get in the way of your workout. Wear it running and it will disappear into your running experience. It's time to leave those bulky phone holders that demand continual adjustment behind. 
The easy attached clips make putting on your One80 Pouch super easy. The clips are smooth and super low profile so they won't bother or annoy you while wearing your pouch. The design was tested over and over to ensure easy attachment and removal, yet tight enough grip and hold securely.
Less is better, especially when talking about comfort. And that's exactly what your going to get with your One80 Pouch; comfort. So much less to worry about and be bothered by. 
No belt. No bulky over-sized  bag. No straps covered in velcro. No magnets to hold it on. No zipper to fuss with. Pure and simple comfort.
What makes these pouches so different from every other wallet, phone or passport holder? The easy on easy off propriety clips. So simple, yet made with precision to ensure your pouch will easily slip on to a waistline or belt, will hold secure, and then can be removed easily. 
Doesn't seem that difficult right? That's what we thought at first too.
We spent a year trying different ways of making this work and tested hundreds of clip variations. With each rendition removing or adding millimeters at a time and subtle shape modification before finally at what you see today. 
Attach under for extra secure connection
Additional backside sleeve can be used as belt sleeve


Cash Sleeve

Some of first steps were to figure out a pouch or bag system. We went through various types fabrics and materials. Tried velcro, zippers and magnets before ultimately deciding we wanted to simplify the pouch as much as possible and eliminate these different  materials; as most of them were leading causes for issues in other bags and belts. 
We knew the key to make this concept work would be and effective clip. This proved to be the most difficult part of the building process. After various concepts and the slightest adjustment of 1/2 mm at a time we arrived at the clip we felt accomplished what we had set out to do.
 Lots and lots of 3D printing and design lead us to the clips we came to today. Testing each along the way for it's capabilities and function. Our industrial sewing machine and 3D printer got a lot of use during those months.

campaign.story:
On the Origin of Species is a 2-4 player strategy board game in which each player will step into the adventure of young Charles Darwin on the HMS Beagle’s expedition through the Galapagos Islands, examining the local species and uncovering their natural history.  Trace connections between the flora and fauna you discover as the Beagle journeys through the islands. Find help from the ship’s crew and uses for the tools in your luggage.  Excel in your research and lead the way among your naturalist colleagues. 
On the Origin of the Species is a tile laying game that’s simple to learn but driven by deep decisions. Players will take the role of scientist naturalists on the HMS Beagle as it journeys through the Galapagos Islands. On each player’s turn, they may either research the surrounding species in their habitats or discover the natural history of a new species.
To Research: a player will place two of their observation cubes on different species found among the islands. These observations contribute to their understanding of how the species relate to their habitats.
To Discover: a player must spend observation cubes in play to place a new species tile on an adjacent spot on the board.  The previously observed species help the scientist understand the new one.  The discovering player will receive victory points and the community of scientists gain new research possibilities.
The players’ discoveries will also grant them cards that provide extra abilities or scoring opportunities, as they gain help from the crew of the Beagle or their array of naturalist tools on board.

Each newly discovered species causes the Beagle to leave one island for another. The Beagle’s progress will trigger scoring opportunities and, eventually, the end of the game.  






After production is complete, we'll be shipping the game worldwide through several fulfillment centers, ensuring that we have "Friendly Shipping" (no import taxes) to the US, EU, Canada, and Australia. We'll also be subsidizing a portion of the shipping cost for all pledges to keep your costs down. 
Shipping Costs for 1 Copy
For shipping outside of these areas, or for multiple copies, you can select the pledge level you're considering, and your country, to see your shipping cost. 
Ferran Renalias and Gerard Ascensi, two gamers based in Manresa and London respectively, are mathematicians who love to play games. Ferran and Gerard are both hold doctorates in mathematics and work in finances.  They have formed a strong creative team, despite the physical distances, through their shared passion for math and games.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 950+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $400M raised between them.

campaign.story:
Goblin Teeth is a dice game for all ages - use your dice to claim treasures, play cheat cards to gain advantages over the other goblins, and win by being the first to collect all the best shiny bits!
 Playthrough Video: 
UNLOCKED - $7k - FUNDED! Goblin Teeth is going to be a real, actual game that you can play and/or rub on your face! It's happening!!
UNLOCKED - FIRST DAY FUNDING - Funding on the first day unlocked a new Promo card: Speedy!!
UNLOCKED - $11k - NEW PROMO CARD! Hitting 11k unlocked, appropriately enough, Up To Eleven!
UNLOCKED - $14k - UPGRADED BOX AND CARDS! When we hit 200% funded, we upgraded the size and quality of the box, and the thickness and finish of the cards!
UNLOCKED - $16k - THREE NEW CHEAT CARDS! At $16k, we added THREE new cheat cards to the game! This brought the cheat cards in the game up to 33 unique cards.
UNLOCKED - $18k - NEW PROMO CARD! We added another card to the promo pack - Dentist!
UNLOCKED - $20k - FOUR NEW CHEAT CARDS! When we reached $20k, we added FOUR new cards to the game, bringing the total up to 37 unique cards.
UNLOCKED - $22k - UNIQUE ART ON EACH CARD! Our artist Derrick will add a unique goblin sketch to every Cheat card in the game...all 37, plus the 4 cards in the promo pack! That's a lot of goblins!
UNLOCKED - $25k - FIVE NEW CHEAT CARDS! We've added another five cards to the game, bringing the total to that magic number - 42!
$27k - NEW PROMO CARD! At $27k, we'll include our final promo card - Unique! It will have, as is befitting to the name, its own unique art, too!
$30k - SIX NEW CHEAT CARDS! At $30k raised towards the game, we'll add yet another six cards to the game; that's 48 completely unique Cheat cards in the base set, each of which with their own unique art. What a bargain!
Each round, roll your dice, and add new cards to the display. Then, players take turns until all dice have been played.
On your turn, play cheat cards, then one of your dice. Dice can be played in one of two ways:
 On an item card. The player with the highest total on each item at the end of the round will claim it
 To the Altar, to draw a cheat card
There are two rules for playing dice onto items:
1) You can't play a die if your total on that item would be more than 10 (goblins can’t count that high)
2) You can't play a die if it would cause a tie on that card (goblins are bad at sharing)
At the end of the round, everyone collects their items and a new round begins! As soon as a player has everything needed to make an offering the Big Boss will like, they win, proving themselves to be the best, cleverest, cheatiest goblin of them all.
For a thorough explanation of how to play, check out The Chubby Meeple's playthrough video!
The game comes with 30 unique cheat cards, in two types: Action cheat cards are discarded after use, and have sneaky one-use effects. Ongoing cards can be played in front of any player (including yourself) and can be a huge boon or blight.
When you play a die to the altar, instead of drawing a cheat card, you can discard all ongoing cards in front of another player (including yourself).
By backing the game on Kickstarter, you’ll get the promo pack, a collection of 4 ongoing cards that won't be available in retail!
As well as all extra promos unlocked through stretch goals!

$19 - GOBLIN: Get a copy of Goblin Teeth, plus all promo cards and unlocked stretch goals!
$54 - ZIGGY LONGSNOUT’S GOBLIN PARTY PACK: Get THREE copies of Goblin Teeth, all promo cards and unlocked stretch goals! Make Ziggy Longsnout proud.
$57 - GOBLIN ALE: Get a copy of Goblin Teeth, all promo cards and unlocked stretch goals, and a copy of the designer’s first game, Alestone (sold out!)   
$100 - BIG BOSS: Get a copy of Goblin Teeth, all promo cards and unlocked stretch goals, AND we’ll include the goblin version of your name (or a name of your choice) in the flavor text of a card! 
$200 - BEST GOBLIN: Get a copy of Goblin Teeth, all promo cards and unlocked stretch goals, AND we’ll include a sketch of you as a goblin on one of the cards! Make your parents proud: be immortalized for all time as a thieving cheating goblin.
We’re a growing company, and thanks to the support backers have given us on previous projects, we’ve managed to pay for all the great art in the game. But printing a game is expensive, and we don’t yet have the cashflow to do this without your help!
We put a lot of money into art, a lot of time into playtesting, and a lot of effort into every project we make, and with your support, we can print Goblin Teeth and make it a real game that you can play, rub on your face, and/or eat*.
*please don’t eat the game
By supporting us on Kickstarter, you can help us create this great game, you’ll get the game before anyone else, and you’ll get promo cards that won’t be available through retail!
Thanks so much for your support!

campaign.story:
Beyond Humanity: Colonies is a hybrid, semi-cooperative board game for 1 to 5 players. You will be building and expanding a human colony on an alien planet. You will experience a new milestone in the fusion of classic board game design, inventive electronic modules, and its companion app.
New components in the box - click here!
In Beyond Humanity: Colonies, players take on the roles of managers of a new settlement built on a distant exoplanet by refugees from a future Earth that is polluted and overpopulated. As a manager, you will propose and vote on new modules to be built, introduce decrees to define the culture and functionality of the colony, carry out planetary exploration and research to obtain valuable artifacts, gather resources, and gain public support from the colonists.
This is a semi-cooperative game, which means you will have to cooperate to keep the colony operational and self-sufficient, while at the same time competing to gain influence and make decisions on the direction of the colony's development based on your individual victory goals. If the colony fails, you all lose, but if it succeeds, there will only be one true winner.
Beyond Humanity: Colonies is a hybrid board game like you've never seen before: it is an unprecedented combination of a traditional board game combined with electronic miniatures that are supported by a linked app.
As board game enthusiasts, our team believes that an app should never take the player's attention away from the board. As engineers and designers, we fought to change the way software is used and can be a part of an exciting tabletop experience.
During the game, the app serves as a self-operating data slate that enhances the classic and traditional board game experience. It displays the status of the colony and its citizens and does not require any interaction asides from clicking “next” at the end of turn. Instead, the game gathers information about your actions on its own! Thanks to the CPU built into the central piece of the game, the app recognizes when the new buildings are connected to it and it can recognize smart cards with the RFID technology built into modules. The miniature buildings will communicate their status with you by flashing lights of different colors. The application on your smartphone or tablet is connected wirelessly to the colony itself and will display all the important information like the current resource statuses and the status of the residents.
On top of it all, hidden behind the scenes, there is a neural network implemented that simulates moods, opinions, and the current feelings of thousands of virtual citizens.
The purpose of putting all this tech into this board game is that it does the complex calculations for you, so you can fully focus on what happens above the table - convincing other players to assist your vision of the colonies future and the race for the upcoming presidential election of this newly born colony!
Thanks to many suggestions and feedback, all the cards and module tiles will be made color-blind-friendly by adding special icons, so any part of the game will no longer be color coded only.
More videos will be added soon!
There are three important aspects you will be able to experience:
Multiple modes:
Endless replayability:
5 difficulty levels
9 unique Managers to choose from
34 private and common goals
Over 500 monthly occurrences
700 000 exoplanets to visit
Branching Metagame:
Search for new planets between your games
After winning a game, gain Auxiliary Fleets that can be used to colonize more challenging planets
Outcome of your game is a part of global supply market, that affects the prices of the resources imported in forthcoming games
Planned after release: your actions affect every player, not just those sitting around your table!
The game design is complex enough, so there is no need to complicate the campaign. We decided not to cut the game into pieces in order to make expansions or partial pledges. There is only one basic pledge with one game box, and there is only one game box configuration that you can get.
You will then get the core box, which is the complete game - and this is what you will receive:
In Beyond Humanity: Colonies we've strived to make the game feel like a regular board game, where players focus on the gameplay:
Collecting goods and using various effect cards
Negotiating and making votes
Planning future decisions
Choosing whether to focus on the Colony or personal goals
Forming and breaking alliances
Searching for artifacts
At the same time, the game CPU along with the companion app will calculate different variables and run the colony simulation, including up to 15,000 individual citizens. Players won't need to worry about this aspect, as the current status of the colony, resources, and population will always be visible on the screen. Other than that, the only time players must interact with an app - is when they press the 'next' button at the end of turn.
If you manage to survive long enough, or your Colony will grow over required limits, the game ends successfully and you will feel like winners. Then compare your victory points and you will discover who has won the game individually.
The main semi-coop mode is completed, but there will also be a fully cooperative mode, as well as a solo mode. A semi-coop (“campaign mode” as we call it) is already balanced and tested. For more info on other modes, please visit our social media and sign up for our newsletter on our website.
When making pledge, you add the proper amount of money for the add-ons of your choice to the pledge. Then you will choose it in the pledge manager, after the campaign closes.
Beyond Humanity is about leaving a dying earth, but it doesn’t mean we want to see it that way anytime soon. Actually we hope that space exploration will be an open-minded path of curiosity, not a necessity to survive.
Therefore, our team decided to carefully design the product in a way that would have minimal possible environmental impact. Electronics are made according to the RoHS standards, are lead-free, and recyclable. Plastic modules are made with ABS and polycarbonate, which are also recyclable. If after 10 or more years you will decide to throw our game away (although we hope you will not), please put it in the proper recycling bins to give it another life, maybe even as parts for future space colonization.
Secondly, we decided to keep all production and suppliers in Europe and in the USA. It would affect the price but there are things more important that simple economy. We decided to keep away from producing in and importing from China, because we believe in the value of human work paid with fair wages and that things we buy should be made in a fair work environment.
Furthermore, European and American manufacturers can give a better guarantee of planet-friendly production process and geographical shortening of the supply line would decrease the carbon footprint.
All module minis are to be manufactured and delivered paint ready. You will be able to disassemble the buildings, take out the electronics and the optical fiber, and paint it anyway you wish or ask your favourite artist to do so. 
It is strongly recommended to express your vision on the colony look and get your minis painted that way, as future galleries on the game website and awarded contests are expected. 
"Under construction" - two modules (Cryogenics and Spaceport) which are going to be designed and sculpted during or after the campaign.
The players' characters in the game are the Managers of the colony. Each of them has a different approach, with a personal history, individual goals, and unique directives to match their strategies and affect the colony development -  your choice of manager will significantly change your game experience every time.
There are currently 4 Managers, fully introduced and balanced. In the final game, there will be 9 of them (or 10 if one of you decide to join by backing the highest pledge).
Click here to read about Beyond Humanity story and lore.
To give you a well-balanced game our team has spent the last two years testing this game. There were hundreds of internal tests performed, but most important and valuable were the tests with multiple gaming groups. We have been at Gen Con twice, visited countless players in Poland, spend many evenings with fellow friends which gave us an awesome and invaluable feedback.
THANK YOU!
From mid-2018, subsequent Alpha, Beta and Gamma versions were tested intensively. There were literally hundreds of internal tests and way over 100 full-length games with our supporters. Thanks to that, the game was improved by many gameplay changes and multiple bugfixes. Finally, the game has been balanced - for example, the winning ratio for managers is shown below:
Currently we are working on two companion apps: one for Android system and second one for Apple iOS. First one is going to be available in Google Play Store (and also as a standalone APK, see below), the second one in Apple AppStore. We are aiming at giving you comfortable experience with smartphones and tablets - low end to high tech ones.
Internet isn’t needed to play this game. It is required for updating and using metagame functions, downloading new scenarios, taking part in player-to-player marketplace and community goals. But to play a game you don’t need to use the internet!
The short video below will show you how easy it is to start a new colony on an alien exoplanet.
As we know that the lack of mandatory companion app will render this game useless we have prepared for unforeseen adversities:
We are planning additional version of Companion App (beside of iOS / Android) on Steam for PC platform.
   APK (Android executable file) will be available for manual download and redistribution from first day of deliveries, and we will keep updating it with new versions.
  We are planning giving our full description of our API (Application Protocol Interface) responsible for “talking” with our hardware via Bluetooth, so creation of third party apps will be possible.
  Thanks to open-minded approach we all should feel secure that Beyond Humanity: Colonies won’t become abandonware in future!
To fully enjoy our game and not feel as though you’ll risk your money on a next-generation electronic hybrid board game, you need to feel safe about any possible malfunctions. Although we will do our best in choosing the best quality components, we don’t want you to worry that any misfortune would keep you from exploring new worlds with us.
The game will be covered by a two year warranty, according to European Union law. 
We will also provide you with long-term support, including software updates, app updates for new versions of iOS and Android, spare parts delivery, and a helpdesk.
Our team members have many years of experience in providing the same support in highly specialized hardware production, so we are confident that you will be served properly.
For the pledge fulfillment and game delivery, you will be served by trusted partners that have worked with many big titles and already gained their experience and professional reputation:
Pledge manager
 Game On Tabletop (http://www.gameontabletop.com) the team has been making games possible through crowdfunding since 2013 and have fulfilled/founded over 170 projects to date, with over 50,000 backers satisfied. With their professional care, you can feel safe that everything will go smooth after the project is over.
Fulfillment center
 Green Logistics (http://green-logistics.pl/eng/) known for delivery of such titles as: This War Of Mine: The Board Game,  Lords of Hellas, Tainted Grail, and many other games produced and shipped from Poland and Europe.
Shipping will be charged after the Kickstarter finishes based on actual costs incurred to ship and is collected via a pledge manager system. This allows us to charge each backer fairly and avoid a 'one size fits all' mentality to shipping.
Below are our initial rough estimates for shipping the core game (4kg volumetric weight). Please note that these are just estimates - costs may rise due to weight increase as more items are unlocked via stretch goals and add-on purchases you choose. We will be charging these costs based on the actual cost of shipping, and collect it through the pledge manager after the campaign ends.

If you are in a country that is not on our available shipping list, please contact us so you can inform us of your country and we can check with our fulfillment manager Green Logistics, on a case by case basis, if we have a suitable delivery system to ensure you receive your package.
We are 'Three Headed Monster', a small self-publishing venture of people that we were not game developers before, but a group of gamers with different professional skills: coders, designers, hardware engineers and entrepreneurs. This project is a love child of the entire team. A long and rocky road has lead to this moment when a dream became the real product and happy bunch of friends became a company.
There’s more of us!
More than a dozen of experts and problem solvers are involved in our project: electronics designers, testers, consultants, graphic designers… This project is swallowing manhours like a whale chewing through krill!
We want to make strong and solid statement that all employees and coworkers are EU or USA citizens.
The refund would be possible within 14 days after the campaign’s end, fees included. After this time, refunds could be paid minus the Kickstarter fee and payment processing fees, as we cannot claim them back.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We know that we are a small company and this is our first product. But we can assure you that we are a group of experienced professionals in different fields and many of us have already successfully finalized Kickstarter campaigns in other areas, such as specialized hardware.

We are perfectly aware of the challenges that might occur in the process.
Most crucial areas are:

1. Production - our game is a much more complicated product that traditional board games, many things can happen on the electronics parts market, prices can change or CPUs surplus may get depleted. But we know the market, we have chosen a reliable European and American manufacturers and suppliers, and we are as sure as possible that the production will be done as expected. We have experience in specialized product campaigns - for example, part of our team successfully delivered a BeSteady hardware campaign on Kickstarter in 2013.

2. Supplies - Shipping a complicated fragile product to the entire world is not an easy task. Therefore we are not even trying to do it by ourselves - we have chosen experienced and renowned partners as the pledge manager and shipping/fulfillment center. They already made it multiple times successfully, so they will do it again with our game.

3. Manpower failure - we are a small company, more a group of gamers and passionate enthusiasts, driven by a common vision. We have to always remember that we are only humans and our endurance is not infinite. Therefore, we solemnly swear not to overwork ourselves, not to overdose the coffee and to stay reasonably healthy.

4. Over-creativity - we love our game and we want it to be perfect. Every day we have hundreds of new ideas about new features and enhancements. But we consider this offer binding to the point where we have chosen some of our team members to keep us on the tracks and not overcomplicate anything, but to deliver exactly the product that we promise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Today's update serves a short-term special need, and your long-term desire to stay up-to-date on production-related news! We got some really fun updates for you, so please read through the full update!

updates.update_userinfo: How much are you excited for your Beyond Humanity Colonies?
December update - Farewell 2020, we won’t soon forget you
updates.update_content:
This update is full of exciting videos and news, don’t miss it!
This has been an endless and frustrating year for all of us, and we could not be happier to have spent it with you. Through all of the ups and downs personally and professionally, globally and locally, we could have faltered easily without the love, encouragement, and support from you and the rest of the "Beyond Humanity: Colonies" backers. We are building a community of amazing people whose daily presence and contributions brought a spark of life to our labors. So thank you yet again from the bottom of our hearts and from the ends of the universe. The ever growing colony of backers on our Discord group and Facebook groups are hives of amazing people sharing their suggestions, ideas, and support. We hope you will add your voice there as well. You will meet great people with similar tastes and interests.

updates.update_userinfo: November Update: new delivery date, regular AMA sessions and a bonus gift
updates.update_content:
Greetings!
This update we wanted to tell you about the solutions to our recent setbacks and our new timeline for delivery, updates to the online metagame Exogen (that you can and should be playing right now at: www.exogen.space), live broadcast AMA details, FREE goodies for you, and some neat news that will only get bigger over time. We hope you make time to read it all.

updates.update_userinfo: October Update II: DELAY! ...and some good news & upcoming AMA session.
updates.update_content:
Too long, didn't read: 
We have been gut-punched by a serious delay and are hoping we can make it up to you. But there is some good news.

updates.update_userinfo: October Update: Instruction manual, components production and Exogen community missions
updates.update_content:
Instruction Manual
The Beyond Humanity: Colonies instruction manual books are ready! The Rulebook and the Annex have been completed in all language versions!
We owe a massive shout out and thank you to the dozens of backers that help us go to the rough draft to help make it clear, concise, and readable! We would say that’s probably a fair bit easier to create a game than to create the instruction manual for it! It’s hard to say how many hundreds of hours went into bringing the new rulebook to life, but hopefully, it shows once you receive it. It’s a big book, but it will be easy to use and an asset for new players with all of the photos and illustrations.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Clash of Minds: Holmes vs Moriarty is our fifth campaign here on Kickstarter. The previous four were successful, three of them had already reached our backers and one is in production. 

We learned a lot from previous campaigns and we took some steps to prepare for this one. We had almost all graphic arts ready. We already spoke with trusted, experienced manufacturing partner in China, so we know that the quality of our game will be the best. We know all the processes of production and their timelines. We also chosen a fulfillment company we already worked with. We want to avoid as many mistakes and delays as possible. We will provide regular updates and do our best to communicate with our backers!

But you have to remember that publication of a board game is a complicated process and some delays may occur.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Welcome. 
I am back to you with some good news. 
The tablecloths have arrived to our game producer and finally we have everything to prepare pakages for the shipments. 
At this moment I'm at the stage of setting up the labels for the game boxes and the labels to be placed on the cartons. After this stage the games will be packed and prepared for delivery to our courier.

Hello.
At the start, I would like to apologize for unanswered messages and comments. As I wrote earlier, the CREATIVEMAKER team has broke and at the moment I am the only person who is taking care of the projects at CREATIVEMAKER. Entering the project and all correspondence required many hours of work to understand all the threads. The good news is that it is very close to happy ending. I will do my best to expedite the process and get you the games as soon as possible.

Hello after a long break.

I would like to apologize for the time when you did not receive any sign of life on our part.
Our CREATIVEMAKER team broke up at this difficult time and there was no one who could reply to all comments and messages. At the moment, the company is operated by one person who gets acquainted with the current state of the project. Within the next week and examining all the tasks remaining to complete the project, I will give you information on what stage we are at and when we expect to deliver the rewards.

updates.update_userinfo: One more week to finish your order in pledge manager
updates.update_content:
Dear Detectives

We have to extend closing the gamefound until the end of the week due to a few retail orders that are pending.

So until January 18, if someone has not finished yet, they can do it. In case of any problems or uncertainties regarding the order, please contact Mateusz at

Dear detectives,
Finishing the final production is a bit longer for which we can only apologize to you. Unfortunately, we have no influence on it because it is a matter of the factory that the game produces.

However, as you have seen, everything has been prepared and approved and we are just waiting for a signal that the games are ready to be handed over to the shipping company. The company that will deliver the game will be Quartermaster Logistics. Due to the period we have (December, Christmas, New Year), it will, unfortunately, be in January, unless we will have a Christmas miracle.

Dear detectives,

We have received a production proof of the Royal version. Unfortunately, it was delayed compared to what you saw in the film because it turned out that the paint on the box looked nice, but it smelled terrible :). So the production proof that you saw in the previous update had to be corrected.

Dear detectives,

In today's update, we want to show you the movie we got from China. In the video, you will see what the last components look like. To be sure of the quality, we should get the finished game in the Royal edition version for final approval next week. As soon as it arrives, you can expect another update with photos and of course information if everything is ok with it,

Dear detectives,

The work-related to production is progressing. Maybe a bit slower than expected, but they are still moving forward.

First, we want to present to you - First Player Token

Hello detectives,

We finally have some good news for you. As we wrote recently, we were waiting for the Clash of Minds production date to be set. Something went wrong (but in the right direction) and we have just received information that preparations for our partner in China for production have started.

Hello,
First of all, we want to apologize to you for not being in touch for so long. Unfortunately, due to the virus and changes in the company (one of our crew member who's was responsible for the production quit his job at Creative), everything fell apart. There have only been two people at Creative for the last few months and we are trying to fix the situation. Unfortunately, this caused the production deadlines for our games to be postponed :(.

campaign.story:
What's New
Last year we launched our Dual Suction Cup mount design which brought the ability to mount tablets and smartphones to walls, windows and virtually any flat surface.
Piggy backing off of the original design, we are back with our new Mic Stand Clamp design, which offers the same great mounting solution but for Professional Musicians (and non-pros).

Never before have you been able to mount tablets, smartphones, keyboards, small mixers, plus more (who knows what you’ll mount!) with only one product to a single microphone stand.
Existing mic stand mounts currently on the market only enable you to mount 1 specific thing, being a specific tablet/smartphone size or model and that’s it!
But the NKMOS system is different...
The genius is in our magnetic ball joints and suctions cups. Together, they have a holding force of over 40lbs a piece and can comfortably hold 3lbs at almost any angle, giving you the freedom to rotate the mount to almost any shape and any angle you desire.
We had a blast testing just what our modular mounting system could handle and with so many options and ideas of where we could go next, we thought we'd ask our audience. Our musician friends were especially vocal, and their feedback was tremendous, which ultimately led us to develop our mic stand clip. 
Magnetic Ball Joints
The system's magic is in it's aluminium rod featuring extremely high quality and high strength magnetic ball joints at either end, allowing the freedom to rotate the mount to almost any shape and any angle you desire, plus detach and reattach modules to customise the exact way you want.
Industrial Grade Suctions Cups
Extremely high quality and versatile, our suction cups will not only hold up to hundreds of uses, but will also suction to many different surfaces such as glass, aluminium, and household walls! They are also user replaceable, even though you will probably never need to.
Hold Strength Test
PLAY

Easily Remove Modules Using Leverage
You may be wondering what the chrome looking little cylinder is or maybe you even figured it out. It has 2 purposes, to enable maximum angle adjustability and also to give clearing and leverage for easy module removal as show in the below video.

Made mostly out of aluminium, with some steel, and of course the suction cup being rubber/plastic. But basically, entirely metal.

campaign.story:
At GeekOn! we take pride in engineering the most innovative, stylish, durable and functional boardgame bags and accessories on the planet.
Sure you can get boardgame bags that are cheaper or re-purpose Swedish furniture store totes or drumbags but are they as comfortable, with as much padded protection, water-resistant, reinforced to hold 50 lbs, damn sexy looking and come with a Lifetime Guarantee? 
Didn't think so..       
 The GeekOn! Goal & Guarantee 
PLAY

We also sent out some samples to some of our previous backers that had youtube channels so we could get some early feedback. Check out their initial thoughts!
PLAY

PLAY

Sure you can find game bags on the market for under $50 but in this case, as in most cases, you really get what you pay for! We believe that your expensive games deserve the most protected and comfortable bags and don't cut corners when it comes to quality as you'll see below. 
The main objective of any game bag is to be able to carry a decent amount of games, card binders, figures, etc so we've designed our SPACEPAK with 47L of gaming space! That's enough space for 7 Chihuahua's or 48 cans of beer or ... well you get the point, it's a heck of a lot of space!  
#toxictechno
Need room for additional smaller games, cards or your favorite hot sauce because game night is at Peter's house and his snacks are always so bland and boring? We've added two extra large capacity side zippered pockets to handle all of these with ease! 
#toxictechno
No need to walk around with bulging pockets when you have the SPACEPAK due to the conveniently located easy access top zippered pocket large enough to hold all your EDC (everyday carry) items such as your phone, keys, wallet etc. This means your phone will be within reach for a quick post-game tweet about how awesome you played and finally lived up to your Game Demon shoulder tattoo. 

My Grandma always said that "organization is key" so we've included a set of mesh zippered pockets and pen loops inside the main flap. That ought to keep Grandma quiet for a bit. 

You're game and card load can be worth hundreds of dollars in a single haul so we've added thick foam padding on all sides of the SPACEPAK to keep your game boxes from dents with extra material covering the zippers from the inside to protect your boxes from scratches! This also creates a safe environment for a wrestling match between your two cats just be careful when you unzip the front panel.
Internal trim protects your game boxes from the zippers!
Our bags are coated with a DWR (Durable Water resistant) coating enabling water to form droplets and bead off the fabric instead of soaking through to your games inside. This bag is the perfect gift to a friend who loses a lot, the tears they shed after your game will roll right off this waterproof casing. 

Nothing helps carry around a heavy load of games like having wheels so rather than making a bag that is extremely heavy and expensive with included wheels, we've opted to include a sturdy luggage pass-through section enabling the SPACEPAK to function with any wheeled carrier which are readily available online ranging anywhere from $15+ depending on durability. Another great way to get your SPACEPAK rolling is to just wear it on your back and slide on a pair of rollerblades! - If you decide to try the latter recommendation at a game con please don't tell anyone we gave you the idea!

Most game bags are just huge and a pain to store when not being used so we've designed the SPACEPAK to easily fold up very flat for easy storage or to easily pack in your suitcase to bring empty to a game con where you can pop it open and fill it will all your new game purchases (or the 800 pins you picked up at the Pin Bazaar!)

Arriving at game night with sweat stains around your shoulders isn't a pretty sight so we've got extra padding with a moisture-wicking mesh underlining to keep circulating the air keeping you comfy and dry to take on your game-playing opponents with confidence!
Who needs a sternum strap you might ask? Well, there's a reason they're included in all camping and military backpacks and that's because they significantly reduce the strain on your neck and back by helping to keep your backpack secured at the highest point of your back instead of it dangling behind you and pulling you down with the added weight on every step. Have I ever told you my nickname in college was Sternum Strap? We'll save that story for another time...

The ShuttleTote is the perfect bag for those looking for a way to protect and easily carry many games but don't need to travel too far. It's also the ideal bag for those whose needs change from carrying a bunch of games to just a few including most of the above-average sized games.
 We designed the SHUTTLETOTE to have more flexibility in terms of sizing making it the perfect bag to use as a large tote with 59L of available space where the sides can roll down to morph into a duffel bag. (I'm not mentioning any names.. but Steve actually uses the SHUTTLETOTE as his daily lunchbox.)...or you can opt to use it for just a few games or as a way to comfortable carry one massive game like Gloomhaven or Kingdom Death Monster 1.5!
We've added a zippered accessory section with extra mesh zippered pockets including a dedicated key pocket with an included carabiner that easily attaches to your keys. 
Our bags are coated with a DWR (Durable Water resistant) coating enabling water to form droplets and bead off the fabric instead of soaking through to your games inside. I guess you could always get the same waterproof protection by carrying your games in a heavy duty garbage bag but it definitely won't look as cool. 
PLAY

The SHUTTLETOTE can easily fold up very flat for easy storage or to easily pack in your suitcase to bring empty to a game con where you can pop it open and fill it will all your new game purchases! The ability to fold flat also allows for you to hide it much easier so your significant other won't find it and get angry that you bought yet another bag for hauling your games around - if they happen to look behind the books on your bookshelf and find it, just remind them that these babies are built to last and come with a lifetime guarantee so it'll be the last one you'll ever need!
 The carrying handle has a snap wrap-around to keep your two handles together so the SHUTTLETOTE can be carried with your arm in the handles like a tote or carried by the handles like a duffel bag. 

SHIPPING: 
For The regions listed below with icons (U.S., EU, Canada, Australia, China) we will have these rewards fulfilled by a local fulfillment hub in your region so you will not be charged additional customs/VAT!
Shipping will be charged through the Backerkit pledge manager after the campaign ends and we send out the surveys to collect your shipping information and order specifics.
In the case of the UK leaving the EU we’ll try our best to find a UK fulfillment hub so that no additional customs/VAT charges will be added to your shipment. Since we will be sending quantities to each fulfillment hub based on the survey responses it is imperative that you complete your surveys on time so we send the correct amount. Failure to complete your survey by the Backerkit deadline may incur additional shipping charges and if the hub runs out of inventory we will ship your rewards from the U.S. and you will be responsible for the duties/VAT. 
Shipping estimates are based on reward levels but if you add additional items to your pledge it does not mean that you will be charged for the shipping costs of each item added together because we can bundle the shipping of your entire order and the total will be significantly less than the sum of each item added separately! For example if you are in the U.S. and order a bundle ($13 shipping) and an added bag ($11 shipping alone) the total shipping cost wouldn’t be $24 but would rather be apx $19 for your entire order!

Above are some of our earlier design ideas and the progression of prototypes until we got to the final folding dice tower design which was quite tricky to say the least!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Life is full of risks but backing a Kickstarter campaign shouldn't be one of them!

We've all heard the stories or had personal experiences where we back Kickstarter campaigns which don't deliver what or when they promised. Will we deliver on time? Will our products even resemble what we're displaying on our campaign page?

We launched our first GeekOn! campaign last year and fulfilled over 5000 Kickstarter orders all over the world with most backers receiving their rewards on time or only slightly delayed by a couple of weeks!

For this campaign we will be using the same factory for our backpacks located in Vietnam with an exceptional history of top quality workmanship with painstaking attention to every last stitch!

Customer service and satisfaction is our top priority and our backers were very vocal about their positive experience with our campaign, fulfillment and final products. We've learned a ton from our first campaign from campaign structure all the way through choosing the best international fulfillment partners and feel like we're up to the challenge to live up to our currently stellar reputation.

WHAT IS THIS CAMPAIGN AND WHAT IS BARRAGE?
Barrage is a heavy euro-game, designed by Tommaso Battista and Simone Luciani, produced and funded with a very successful Kickstarter campaign last year. If you are new to the game, you can check it out on its Boardgamegeek page! 
English preview by Man vs. Meeple:
English review by the Dice Tower, with Tom Vasel:
French review by Vin d'jeu (here you can find the extensive written review):
 German written review by Spielkult and videoreview by Die Brettspieltester:
 Italian review by Il Meeple con la Camicia:
During and after the original campaign, a lot of backers and gamers asked us to implement a 5-player mode - since the game already featured 5 different factions. We listened to them and, now, we are proud to introduce you to the brand new Barrage 5th Player Expansion!
You'll also discover that the backers from the original campaign will have a lot of great advantages and the possibility to purchase a wide selection of gameplay-improving add ons and goodies at a special price. Let's dive in!
OUR MISSION
Make your Barrage even greater!
Pledge now to enrich your game with a brand new 5th Player Expansion. It includes a completely new map, specifically designed for 5 players, and also usable as an alternative map for 4 players, to add more variety to your game.
PLAY

New connections have been studied to create original production networks and to allow new placement strategies without altering the game flow.
For a 5-player game, there will be additional worker spaces in the new management board; therefore the scalability is still optimal and the competition is not too tight in the common actions.
Also, if you are an original backer of the first Barrage Campaign, you will get a full set of redesigned wheels and wooden drops to replace the ones you received in your box, the printed version of the Automa rulebook and 2 new Executive Officers!
Do you want to try out the 5th Player Expansion? Come visit us in Essen 2019! You'll find us in booth 4A117, Halle 4!
We strongly believe that Barrage is one of our best games so far, and we want you to have the best experience playing it.
 Access to Add-Ons
If you want the new redesigned wheels and/or wooden drops, pledge here. With this pledge you will gain access to all the available Add-Ons. 
As an Add-On, you can choose the "new drops" and/or "new wheels”, which will be completely free, with no shipping fees, for verified Barrage backers only.
Please consider that sending out new wheels for free represents a sensible cost for us, so we kindly ask you to pledge for substitution only if you feel like you received a low quality product and you are unsatisfied.
With this pledge you will of course be able to add the other free or purchasable Add-Ons - scroll down for all the details! 
5th Player Expansion (discounted for previous Barrage backers)
Oh yes! Our designers have developed a 5th Player Expansion for Barrage!
Invite new friends to your table and play an even more challenging game of Barrage.
This expansion requires both the Core Game and the Leeghwater Project Expansion. It is fully compatible both with the Kickstarter edition and the retail version of Barrage!
The expansion contains: 
1 new mapboard;
1 additional new design wheel;
1 turn order overlay;
1 small management board with additional actions;
new contracts;
additional wooden Machineries.
Are you in love with Barrage? Expand it already with new exciting materials and a brand new expansion!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the components may be subject to changes up to the date of production.

Cranio Creations is a top board games publisher based in Milan, Italy, active since 2009, with over 20 proprietary games in its catalogue, including the BGG Top-100 Lorenzo il Magnifico, Barrage, Unusual Suspects and Newton, with partnerships all over the world.

There are risks that we must take into consideration: unexpected events may lead to delays and production problems. 
This includes production, shipping and delivery delays - and we can not exclude strikes, natural calamity or alien invasions. 

Cranio Creations will use all the experience gained in its first Kickstarter campaign to avoid all these issues. 

In fact, the entire production will be entrusted to external companies located outside the EU, while the shipping will be handled by a single fulfillment center located in Europe.
There may be custom fees when shipping from Europe, that will have to be paid by backers.

For our part, we take the responsibility to follow the production until the end and to perform all the appropriate material and production tests, in order to deliver a product of the best possible quality.
