campaign.story:
RGB CRITTER is a lighting tool designed for everyone who likes to glow in the dark including performance artists, light painters, and high-tech fashion designers.
"The Critter is a great evolution from the last generation, especially for wearables.  The battery life is much longer, and the interactive features are exciting additions."
-Natalie Walsh, Designer
"I'm really excited to explore the potential of the RGB CRITTER. The three button system allows you to have a massive amount of control over the sensitivities of the various functions like the audio response and accelerometer...Combined with all the color and pattern combinations I think it will be a game changer in having your props look great whether at a small jam with friends or on stage for a huge concert."
-Tyler Spades, Professional Performer
The RGB Critter is a color changing flashlight (or torch) threaded at the lens allowing for a number of twist-on accessories that light up when connected to the RGB Critter. 
Packed with exclusive and spectacular features and functions, the RGB Critter opens the door to a new world of possibility. This new creative device has a very fresh look and feel. We want you to let your creativity run wild! 
PROGRAMMING FEATURES
 PRE-SET COLOR MODES: The RGB Critter comes with 8 pre-set color modes (solid color options, fade, strobe, and combinations).
 24 COLOR SLOTS: Each pre-set color mode can be customized with up to 24 unique colors.
 CHOOSE YOUR COLORS: You can choose from a palette of 33 unique color options (including black).
 SELECT YOUR SPEED: Once you have your colors chosen, you can select your speed (1%-100%). 
 SAVE YOUR CUSTOM MODE: When your speed is locked-in, the mode is saved and will remain until you delete it or execute a factory reset. 
ADDITIONAL FEATURES
 FAVORITE MODE LIST: If you really like the customized mode, you can also send it to your list of 20 favorite customized modes. 
 CUSTOMIZED MEMORY SLOTS: There are 52 memory slots available for your customized modes.
 RESUMES SAME COLOR MODE: The Critter will always turn on within the last mode it was turned off- The mode will pause, then resume in the exact spot you turned it off in.
 BRIGHTNESS CONTROL: Choose from 10 different brightness levels.
 BATTERY LIFE INDICATOR: When the RGB Critter is turned off, you can check the battery level by holding the top button for 3 seconds. The RGB LED will display different colors to indicate remaining battery life.
The RGB Critter comes packed with 33 unique color choices.
SOUND REACTIVITY
First of it's kind, the RGB Critter features a sound reactivity system that allows you to adjust the sensitivity to match the sound intensity of your environment. 
Sound Reactivity Feature can be turned on at any point, including on top of other features.
MOVEMENT REACTIVE (accelerometer)
We went even further and added a movement sensor, making the Critter an extension of your body controlled by your movements. You will have the option to either change the brightness of the RGB LED depending on the speed of your movements, or to have the Critter show light when you move.

3 BUTTON TECHNOLOGY
Tired of navigating old lighting tools and toys with only 1 button? Us too! The RGB Critter has 3 illuminated buttons for you to easily navigate all features and functions. 
Light Painters: There is also an option to turn the Critter on with the button lights off (phew!).
LOCK BUTTONS
Hold the top and bottom buttons for 3 seconds to lock the RGB Critter when on or off.
CONVENIENT RE-CHARGING
The built-in 18650 battery is micro-USB rechargeable. When plugged into a power source, the RGB Critter's battery will fully charge then switch to direct power for continuous use.
LIGHT PAINTER'S DELIGHT
The RGB Critter's Momentary Function allows light painters to turn off the Critter by simply holding a button. When the button is released, the light turns on. When you hold the button (light off), the Critter will pause your current preset or customized mode  and resume the mode once you release the button (light on). You can use the Momentary Function at any point the Critter is on (solid colors, color modes, any other special feature).
An example of the slow fade color mode in a light painting.
To add to these amazing features, we’ve designed a series of twist-on accessories that you can add to give the RGB Critter even more unique effects:
Perfect for performance art, the Orbit BitWhip accessory is a 5.5-foot long fiber optic whip with incredible flow and durability. With a low profile and a light weight, the Orbit BitWhip will feel like an extension of your body. Each of the fibers is cut into layered lengths of up to 5.5 ft. with sparkling tips at each end.
End glow fiber optics (tips glow)
140 fibers
Fiber length varies - Max length 5.5 feet
Built-in bearing for 360 degree rotation
 The layering of the fibers makes for a dazzling light display, and the built-in bearing allows the Orbit BitWhip to flow around your body as you dance.
 We recently caught up with one of the top Light Whippers, Firecat (@firecat_flow), at Quasar Festival. Check out the video below to see her performing with the RGB Critter and Orbit BitWhip accessory.
 Dave Lopes (@ropedartist) is an insanely talented Rope Dart Performance Artist. We put the RGB Critter and Orbit BitWhip accessory in his hands to see how he would interpret the product. The video below showcases some of his incredible performance moves.
The Fyber Kit is a fiber optic kit that is perfect for any DIY costume or creative project. It's made up of 360 end-glow fiber optic fibers that are all 6 feet long. You can cut the fibers to your desired length and they will have the same lighting effect where cut.
Plug the Critter into a wall outlet for continuous use.
End glow fibers (tips glow)
360 fibers
All fibers 6 feet long
Can be cut to desired length
 The Fyber Kit is similar to the Orbit BitWhip, but it has more fibers (360 vs 140), all of the fibers are 6 feet in length, and the fibers do not rotate.
The fiber optics are made of high-grade durable material, so they’ll hold up to all kinds of wear and tear. If you’re a costumer or prop-maker, you’ll love the infinite possibilities of the Fyber Kit. 
The Sol Saber 2.0 is an incredibly bright 24-inch long saber attachment that’s perfect for both light painting and light saber battles. Lightweight and durable, the Sol Saber emits a smooth and evenly distributed light that will give you an epic look.
24 inches long 
Light weight at 5 ounces
Super durable and designed for full contact
Contact us for any custom length
The Sol Saber is made of an impact resistant polycarbonate tube. They are designed for combat and can be hit hard. We have been making light sabers for over 6 years and have gotten wonderful feedback on the durability.
We are happy to customize your to needs- Custom length, or weighted end cap, let us know and we’ll take care of it!
The Jupiter Rope is a 6-foot long side glow cable housed within a rotating bearing. By directing the light out of the sides of the fiber rather than just through the end, you’ll get a rope that can be used for all sorts of purposes from bicycle lighting to light painting.
Side glow cable
6 feet long
Flexible rubber protective coating
Built-in bearing for 360 degree rotation
Can be cut to desired length
 The Jupiter Rope is extremely durable, protected by a rubber sleeve resistant to scratching and water damage. It’s also very flexible and can be used as a performance prop.

The Orb is an incredibly useful tool and prop for a variety of situations, including mood lighting and light painting.  Its made up of a diffused plastic ball that evenly emits light when attached to the RGB Critter.
 The Orb can be used to help you choose colors for your custom modes, as its diffused glow allows you to clearly view the differences between the color blends. 
Double up any of these effects with the Critter Connector, an attachment that allows you to connect two Critters back-to-back. It screws easily into the back end of the RGB Critter, giving you the ability to mix and match multiple accessories.
 With the Critter Connector, you can turn your one Sol Saber attachment into a Sol Saber staff. You can even connect two Orbit BitWhips together for a dazzling light show that will be sure to blow away your audience. Any color combination you can imagine is possible with the Critter Connector.
Double Sided Sol Sabers and BitWhips are customer favorites, but feel free to mix-and-match any 2 accessories with Critters back-to-back!
 The video below demonstrates some of the ways you can use the RGB Critter on your bike. The Critter has an IP54 rating, meaning it is dust and water resistant and you can safely use it on the Playa or in the rain.

Ants on a Melon was established in 2012, and we have been manufacturing and selling color changing flashlights through our website world-wide ever since. It has always been our top priority to deliver the highest quality product as quickly as possible.

UPDATE: Now that we've funded be sure to keep sharing! If you would like to possibly name a planet in This IS Rocket Science leave your suggestions in the comments of the campaign! Remember, nothing vulgar and if you want to make a reference go a little less direct! (Endand vs Endor for example)
Welcome to the campaign! We have another set of three fun and engaging pocket-sized games for you, each with all the rules printed on a folding box to allow you to bring game night with you almost anywhere! All three games make up the third wave in our F.L.O.A.T. series. It is our goal to release card games that are Fun, Lively, Original, Approachable, and Tiny. These games could find a home on a lunch table or gaming table, at game night or at date night (maybe check with your partner first on that one).
Each game contains 18 cards and a folding "hook box" that has the rules printed directly on the inside. The cards and boxes are made of 320 gsm black-core card stock (sturdier than stock for Magic: The Gathering) with a protective UV coating as well. Keep scrolling for info on each game, reviews, how to play videos and more. We hope you join us on this campaign and look forward to making these titles a reality!
Click the image above to read the full rules!
 We start off with the Winner of The Game Crafters' Hook Box Game Challenge, Cards of Olympus! 
Cards of Olympus is an 18 card deck builder/manipulator; that's right deck building in just 18 cards! Players take on the role of Gods looking to take the charge of the throne of Olympus by building a powerful alliance of Gods and Heroes. Cards are double sided and split top and bottom with each card featuring a Mortal, Hero, God, and Monster. All cards are shared, with players gaining resources and abilities from the half of the cards that faces them. Acquire Tribute and Drachma to use special powers, guide your mortals and heroes to godhood, or add new cards to the deck an insure you gaining an additional leg up on the competition. Any upgrade in your characters helps your future hands but negatively impacts your opponent's; keep a close eye on each others' moves to make sure you come out on top!
With amazing artwork by the immensely talented Beth Sobel, this game begs to be played anywhere you take it!
"...a clever way to make a small, deck builder card game. Hopefully you can check it out and get it to your table."- Brody Sheard, Meeple Mountain
Click the image to view the Rules and Free B&W PnP
In A Wizard's Shelf, players seek to prove they are the most esteemed wizard in the land by filling their shelves with similar types of ingredients and completing spells. Players draft cards from center stacks in an attempt to build out their shelf tableau and unlock new scoring mechanics. Players can also use abilities from spells to change up the game and their collection of ingredients.
When all the cards are drafted players tally up points based on their unlocked scoring and adjacent similar ingredients. Players also lose points if they match up items of the same color.
"All in all, I think this is another solid entry in the wallet [hook box] game line, and if you’re looking for a title that will challenge you a bit spatially and you’re into a bit of magic, you might want to check out A Wizard’s Shelf! I’ve had fun with it." - Eric Yurko, What's Eric Playing?
Click the image to view the Rules and free B&W PnP!
In This IS Rocket Science, players look to become the most prolific space explorer by landing on or orbiting planets. All game cards serve a dual purpose, acting as both the planets for scoring and the rocket fuel used to reach the planets.
On a turn players will draft cards from a central tableau or combine cards from their hands to reach exact target rocket fuel numbers to either land on or orbit a planet in the tableau. To score a planet, a player will discard cards from their hand and multiply the rocket fuel values together to hit the aforementioned target number. Some cards can also be discarded in order to add or subtract from the fuel value.
"I thought this was cool. Its basically an 18-card SciFi Point Salad. You're trying to land on a planet (or orbit it) for varying scores & cards double as both rocket fuel and victory points." Glenn Flaherty, Boardgames and Bourbon (Via Twitter)
A Note on Stretch Goals: In previous campaigns we've had a few promo cards that could be unlocked via stretch goals. This time around we wanted to backers to know exactly what they are getting when they back the game and be sure they are receiving the 100% intended experience of each pocket sized adventure. Anything added in or adjusted with the games will be done so organically and because it is for the betterment of the base game experience.
 Below are some quick overview GIFs of the gameplay for each game. Click the logo for each game to get the complete rulebook as it will be printed in the folding box and a black and white, print and play copy of the game! If you have a few minutes, you can also check out this awesome Overview video done by Cassie from The Indie Game Report!
Click to Download a Free Version of the Print and Play!
 Currently resolving an issue with the rules file. Will be updated shortly.
Click to Download a Free Version of the Print and Play!
Click to Download a Free Version of the Print and Play!
 INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING NOTE: Shipping outside the US is an extra $6 for the One Game, Two Games, and All Three Games Pledges. While there is no set "friendly" shipping for international orders, the games are small enough that no additional customs fees, etc. were encountered for the vast majority of international backers. Depending on your countries policies there is a possibility of some additional charges, though this is unlikely from our Wave 1&2 experience. Please keep in mind this was also based on ordering 3 or less copies and as the package gets heavier, the chances of a customs fee may possibly increase. We only encountered one backer over two campaigns with this issue so any questions or concerns please let us know.
 Still more reviews incoming! Keep checking back!
What's Eric Playing? Previews A Wizard's Shelf
Girl's Game Shelf Reviews A Wizard's Shelf!

 Concrete Canoe Games, LLC
Concrete Canoe Games was founded in 2012 by Daniel Grek with the goal of sounding cooler when he talked to other game people. Since then, Concrete Canoe Games has moved into the realm of publishing pocket sized games with big fun. Follow Concrete Canoe Games and the F.L.O.A.T. series of games on Facebook, Twitter (@conccanoegames), Instagram (conccanoegames), and concretecanoegames.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Concrete Canoe Games third Kickstarter in our F.L.O.A.T. series of hook box games. We aim for small boxes that have bigger fun inside so we can make sure you get a quality game without a lot of delays and headaches. We operate with a smaller, US based printer that uses standardized sizes of certain components to make sure we have a consistent quality and faster production times. Our first campaign ended in May of 2018 and fulfillment began August of that same year. Our second campaign ended April of 2019 and started fulfilling towards the end of June/beginning of July. We hope for a similar 3 to 4 month turnaround time, though, it may take longer given this printing will run into the holiday season. Our first two campaigns gave us some solid information on things like fulfillment to help with this next campaign.

Risks and Delays are still possible. We could run into production or shipping hiccups that are unpredictable. We also may have a longer lead time with some of the promo cards we could possibly unlock. With these things in mind I have added just a small amount of time to our delivery dates with the hope of delivering sooner. As mentioned in an earlier section, one international backer in a previous campaign did have an additional customs fee their country charged them. I have not heard from any other backers with this problem.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Folx,
I've received word from a few of you (and from our printer) that shipping notifications are starting to go out. You will receive an email from The Game Crafter when the order has a shipping label created and your copy is printed and packed. The email should go to whichever address you gave in the pledge manager. The status of all the orders are "shipped" so if you did not get an email it means you may not have filled out the pledge manager. If this is the case send me a message at your convenience and I will fulfill your pledge from our supplies when they come in.

Hey Folks,
Still no set date from the printer as they get back online but our orders are moving significantly through the production queue. When date estimates go up again, or if I start getting shipping notices I will let you all know. I will let you know once either of those happens.
Happy Gaming,
Dan

Hi folks,
I just wanted to let you know that our printer has been granted permission to open back up again for printing.  They will be taking every precaution to continue to protect those that choose to come back in a work at the time and will still have folks working from home where able (such as online support). They won't be able to give solid estimates for shipping over the next 2-3 weeks but that means we are getting closer to seeing our games! Below is the link for more information on the permissions, printing plan, and safety measures.

Hello Folks,
I went to KS to right a review and just learned apparently there is a feature now where backers can request updates? First I noticed of it but for anyone that didn't know that looks to be a thing.
So down to business: Our printer is located in Wisconsin and had been planning (following state guidelines) to open back up for limited production around this time. I just saw an update from them on their website (missed it by about a week or so, sorry for that) that Wisconsin has extended the stay at home order to May 26th. What this means for them is they cannot print anything for orders until May 27th now. What that means for us is it extends our timetable by at least another month depending on how fighting the virus continues to go.

Howdy Backers,
I just wanted to share the new official statement from our manufacturer, sharing information about reduced hours and other requirements from their state amid the COVID 19 pandemic. Mainly there will be some slowdown due to limited amount of workers allowed in and priority being given to specific projects in order to maintain "essential" status in Wisconsin and stay open. For anyone that had questions on how we could have such a delay occur I hope this clears things up more.

Howdy Folks,
I hope you are all staying safe with everything going on right now. Just wanted to do a quick update on our campaign status. 
Previously a lot of campaigns were experiencing delays due to the threat of coronavirus in China. Because we are printing in the US we had avoided those delays. Now, however, with the virus growing in the US, we're getting hit with some delays. Our games had been back on track to ship in March but right now I have some conservative estimates from the printer that they will ship in May. This is very dependent on the state of the virus and people avoiding exposure as best as possible early but it is still very up in the air when things will start moving again at full speed. I will keep you all posted as I have more definitive updates.

Howdy Backers,
Just wanted to get an update in with some schedule changes. I took some extra time to go through our materials and make some tweaks to the games where necessary.  This has lead to me ordering from our manufacturer a couple of weeks later than originally planned.
Right now, based on our manufacturer estimate, the production is looking like it will finish up in early April instead of late March. Our manufacturer does a lot of print on demand but has a separate bulk queue for orders like ours. During the extra weeks I waited it seems a couple of unanticipated (on my end) large orders snuck in before us.

Hello Folks,
A little later than planned but I have sent messages containing links and passwords for the appropriate PnP files. If you are missing a password, want to get any other PnP's or come across any issues with files just let me know in the messages. 
If you did not fill out your survey I have not yet sent the files to make sure that everyone is getting only the correct passwords and links. Fill those out soon or it could also slightly delay shipping of your rewards (just yours) when printing is done.

Hello Backers,

campaign.story:
WELCOME TO KÖNIGSBERG!
SEVEN BRIDGES is a “roll-and-write” dice drafting game in which you will explore the historic city of Königsberg, coloring in its streets on your map. Points are earned by visiting different parts of the city, but the various ways of earning them are only unlocked by crossing the city’s seven bridges. The player who tallies the most points at the end of five rounds wins!
SEVEN BRIDGES stands out from other roll-and-write games because it includes a map of a real-world city created by a professional cartographer!
BOX AND SHEET SIZE COMPARISON 
The above graphic shows the size of the Seven Bridges box and sheets compared with other popular roll-and-write games.
HOW TO PLAY
Download the rulebook (PDF)
You perform two kinds of drafting in Seven Bridges: dice drafting and map drafting. First you draft (choose) a die, then you draft (draw) its lines onto your map!
VISITING LANDMARKS
In addition to the aforementioned seven bridges, there are eleven landmarks on the map. Whenever you identify a landmark – by drawing a line that passes in front of its letter – you get to select a bonus from either the IMMEDIATE USE or RESERVED USE column to the left of the map.
SCORING
There are seven different ways to score points, one for each item in the map’s legend.
1) Street; footpath - If you drew any closed loops on your map, find the one that will score you the most points: multiply the number of corners (right angles) that it has by the number of bridges that it crosses.
2) Bridge; river - For each bridge that you completely cross, fill in one segment in the bridges crossed scale bar and score the indicated value.
3) Landmark - For each landmark that you visit, fill in one segment in the landmarks visited scale bar and score the indicated value.
4) Building - Color in all the buildings that you saw, scoring one point for each.
5) Trees - Color in all the trees that you passed in front of, and score one point for each.
6) Grid squares - Look for all the places where you drew lines to the edge of the map, and sum the value of the coordinates written beside them.
7) Drafting - Sum the value of all of the bonuses that you used in both the IMMEDIATE USE and RESERVED USE columns.
TOTAL SCORE
For each of the seven bridges that you were able to cross, you earn the points from one of the seven items in the map legend. For example, if you crossed five bridges, you score the five highest values and ignore the two lowest.
Our player was able to cross six of the seven bridges on the map. Excluding their lowest scoring legend item, their total score was a very respectable 208 points!
SOLO MODE
With nine difficulty levels, the solo player version of SEVEN BRIDGES is an entertaining challenge that is often won or lost on the last turn! The rules are exactly the same as a two-player game, except now you will be competing against an AI opponent named Euler, and he will score points for all the parts of Königsberg that you don't visit!
At the end of five rounds, calculate your total score exactly as you would in a multiplayer game. Then calculate Euler’s score:
1) Street; footpath – Euler scores 0 points; he doesn’t make any closed loops.
2) Bridge; river – Euler crosses all the bridges that you did not. Determine his score using the bridges crossed scale bar: if he had to cross two of the seven bridges, he would score 4 points.
3) Landmark – Euler visits all the landmarks that you did not. Determine his score using the landmarks visited scale bar: if he had to visit four of the eleven landmarks, he would score 10 points.
4) Building – Euler passes by all the buildings that you did not. There are exactly 100 buildings on the map: if you passed by 55 buildings, Euler would score 45 points.
5) Trees – Euler passes by all of the trees that you did not. There are exactly 100 trees on the map as well: if you only saw 30 trees, Euler would score 70 points.
6) Grid squares – Euler visits all the edges of the map that you did not. There are 80 points available: if you scored 35, Euler would score 45.
7) Drafting – Euler earns all the drafting bonuses that you did not. There are 40 points available: if you scored 20 points, Euler would also score 20 points.
Euler’s total score is the sum of items two through seven, regardless of how many bridges you crossed!
If our player had been competing against Euler in a solo game, they would have eked out a win by just two points, 208 to 206!
 SOLO GAME PLAY REVIEW
WHAT'S INCLUDED
A prototype spotted in the wild! Final product will be slightly different.*
 Game box - approximately 8.8" x 6.5" x 1.6"  / 1.5mm thickness / linen finish
 Player map/score pad - 200 maps on 100 dual-sided sheets / approximately 8.25" x 5.85"
 6 wooden dice - 16mm / custom engraved
 6 colored pencils - golf-size / natural wood body / 6 different colors (black, red, yellow, green, brown, blue)

 First-player marker - red wooden meeple
 Rulebook - glossy / saddle stitched
*Components may vary slightly. We will post an update if major component changes occur.
In our online challenge mode, players from all over the world will compete to see who can score the most points in a special solo-mode variant, in which everyone will be provided with the same starting location and a set of predetermined dice rolls. Competitors will post their maps to our Facebook page or the BoardGameGeek forum, and the winner will receive an exclusive BoardGameGeek microbadge!
There are three social goals to unlock:

For each social goal that we reach, the frequency of the contests will increase: from bimonthly to monthly to biweekly!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're thrilled that you've taken time out of your busy schedule to view our campaign. We hope that you walk away with a sense of confidence that you will be receiving a quality product and that we know what we are doing. We don't know everything, not even close. We know that there are always things to learn from others. That being said, from the publisher's perspective, we've been here before. We've created campaigns that were successful and ones that were not. 

From the designer's perspective, Ron is an experienced designer with game nominations under his belt. Ron's detailed and meticulous nature ensures that all his i's are dotted and t's are crossed.

We want to raise the possibility of potential component changes. This is a disclaimer that some minor variations in components are possible. This should be minimal, if at all. On that note, we are also having product testing done to we can have the game marketed to people as young as 10. We are not concerned that there will be any issues in this regard but we are putting the disclaimer here, if something on that front arises, we would have to bump the minimum age up to 13 or 14. For most of you that are old enough to back a Kickstarter, this is not a problem.

Of course with anything in life, there is risk. There's risks we can plan for, such as government tariffs and risks that sneak up on us. Our promise to you is with a funded campaign, our priority is to deliver a quality game and the rewards we promised. We promise superb customer service and we hope to have a long-lasting relationship with you, our backers. Will you take this ride with us? Thank you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I wanted to provide another update for the international fulfillment of Seven Bridges. I talked to QML and received the following:
 UK - Cargo is in the warehouse - UK fulfillment is expected the week of Jan 17.

Hi, Seven Bridges backers,
I hope everyone is enjoying their holidays. I want to post another fulfillment update for our backers across the world. Your rewards should be arriving soon. I apologize for the delays on the cargo. I think there is a bottleneck due to COVID and the holidays. It's a bad, bad, time to be shipping things. To give an example of how slow some packages are moving here in the US - I had some packages take a week to move an hour and a half away! That being said, we are still moving along and we are getting closer to fulfillment internationally.

Hey, Seven Bridges backers!
I hope many of you are getting your games by now or soon. 
I want to provide a more granular update on timing for those of you that are not in the US/Brazil.

Hey backers,

campaign.story:
Isn't it annoying that making your own meals always involve having to deal with tons of dirty dishes, cookware, and plates piling up in the sink?
Designed for lazy people, BesoVida is here to redefine what a container is capable of. 

Food safe, heat safe, super safe. BesoVida does it all with food-grade silicone material. Prepare, cook and serve your food all in one container. Bowl in a bowl design offers minimal footprint, maximal capacity.

BesoVida vs Everyday Kitchenware
We've picked some of the most used kitchenware in everyday household and put them head to head with BesoVida to see how they fare, and here's the result.
Ultimately, buying less stuff is saving more. That's why we created BesoVida, to help you take on several roles in the kitchen with just one set of utensil.
Living That Plastic Free Life
Made entirely out of silicone and nothing else. Silicone is recyclable, once it reaches the end of its life cycle, silicone can simply be incinerated and converted into harmless ingredients like silica, carbon dioxide, and water vapor.

Hasta La Vista, Takeout Containers
Every year, more than 100 million tons of container and packaging waste are generated in the U.S alone.
Saving planet Earth ain’t gonna be easy, but bringing your own food container is. Together, let’s minimize the use of plastic material and make Earth healthy again. 
Thanks to the versatility of the silicone material, BesoVida can withstand the most critical conditions, we’re talking -22°F (-30°C) to 392°F (200°C). So you can go ahead and heat it, freeze it, cook it and serve with it.
Oven Safe
Withstand up to 392°F (200°C), BesoVida can really take a heat. But don’t grill it though(or making direct contact with fire or heat source), it’s not Adamantium.
Microwave Safe
BesoVida contains no metal, hence it's entirely safe to use in the microwave. Simply remove the lid and you're all set. Making office snacks has never been easier.
Freezer Safe
BesoVida can survive under the most extreme temperature, -22°F (-30°C) to be exact. You can count on it to preserve your favorite dishes.
Dishwasher / Dryer Safe
BesoVida is heat and impact resistant. Just throw 'em into the dishwasher / dryer after use, they'll come out just as new.
Food Grade Silicone
It’s free of BPA / BPS / Lead / PVC and other harmful chemicals, so rest assured that your food is gonna be alright with our container.
Click here to see the material test reports.
Acid / Alkaline Resistant 
One of the perks of silicone is its low reaction to chemicals. Fill in whatever food you desire, BesoVida can shake it off with a swipe of a cloth.
Antimicrobial Mixture
Forget to clean your bowl? Worry not, the silicone material is mixed with Japanese ionic silver particle to provide superior antimicrobial property, reducing 99.99% of bacterial growth.
Watertight Leak Proof Lid
Once the lid is fully closed, shake it all you want, nothing’s coming out. 
Steam Vent Hole
We made a tiny vent hole on the lid to allow hot air to escape, preventing food from softening and keep hot liquid from splashing.
Heat Insulated Base
We've thickened the wall of the bowl to provide better heat insulation. You can pour in hot liquid without having to worry about getting scalded.
Non-Stick Surface
Your regular rubber / silicone containers are prone to sticking hair and tiny debris. With the antistatic treatment in the production process, cleaning can be spotless. Water droplets would roll like it's been repelled by the surface.

Perfect Curvature
Not just for aesthetic purposes, the bowl's ergonomic curvature fits in your palm like it’s meant to be there. The rubbery texture offers a secure grip.
Easy Scooping / Just Swipe To Clean
No escape for food residue, no corners are left out. The inward curvature makes it effortless to reach content anywhere in the bowl.
Bowl In A Bowl
Purposely designed to fit into one another like a Матрёшка, Russian doll, BesoVida takes up minimal space while offering maximum capacity.
Multiply The Fun
Food tastes better when it's shared together. Invite friends over and enjoy the meal with BesoVida the container.
The Cutlery
For those who want to go an extra mile with silicone, we offer add-on silicone cutlery including a spoon and fork. The weighted tableware provides a balanced feel, the fat handle offers outstanding grip and comfort.
Minimalist At Its Finest 
From its color scheme, design to functionality, everything about BesoVida screams minimalist. It’s made to complement all styles of interior design, breaking the stereotypes of what a food container is supposed to look like. It's the perfect utensil for any scenario. 
Color Options
Add On Menu
Known for high consistency and accuracy with our production, we had been mass producing silicone / rubber based products for many prominent brands on the market since 1973. updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
It seemed that many friends liked our stay-at-home cooking ideas, but some of you requested us to provide complete recipes. Frankly, we’re not the professional chef, but just love to cook and try to make more variety of foods for our picky kids :P  So, we have made again these two dishes and noted down every step over the weekend. Let us share a simple instruction for your reference (we want to emphasize that it’s only an “amateur” recipe though).

Dear Backers,
We hope you and your family are healthy and safe during these uncertain and unprecedented times.
Many people might be working from home now, and has started cooking at home. So do we! (please rest assured our customer service is nonstop.) We believe cooking is one way we can bring a little pleasures into our lives, but thinking of what you’re cooking and making preparations could be a trouble. Let us share how we cook with Besovida, then you’ll find everything is not too difficult. We’ll get you inspired with some simple recipes that you can easily make at home.

Dear Backers,
We were knee-deep in sorting and packaging KS orders over the past three weeks. And now, we’re pleased to update that we have shipped all your rewards out. More precisely, 95% orders had been sent, only a very few ones are the exceptions because we didn’t get their survey response, or the mailing service was temporarily shut down in certain countries.

Dear Backers,
We’re very excited to announce that we have begun shipping your rewards from today (by batches). It will take us nearly three weeks to complete entire shipments due the limitation of post office’s capacity, thus we aim to send out 2800+ KS orders by the first week of March.
We ship all parcels via registered mail from Taiwan, so each one has its own tracking number. Please give them some time to travel, possibly all your rewards can be delivered before the end of March. Besides, please note that it requires a recipient’s signature, if you’re going out of town next month, kindly ask someone to help receive it at your address.

Dear Backers,
As our previous update, we’ll start making shipping labels and packing your orders next week. Supposedly you have received another email sent from Kickstarter saying that it's the last chance to change your address within 48 hours, and then you’ll be unable to edit it any more. The shipment will begin from February 20 by batches, if you happen to have a long trip or plan to move, you can request us to postpone delivery until you’re available.

campaign.story:
Ezl will make life with your phone better.
Unfortunately, this time I have JUST missed the wave of hysteria this design deserves - so I shall return!
Three products, 2mm thin.
 What is Ezl?
 I have been working for over a year on an idea for a tiny device which makes holding, seeing and connecting our phones better.
The result is ‘Ezl’, a 2mm thin sliver of material which attaches to your phone case (or direct to your phone). It slides open to provide three really useful functions:
A stand, so you can keep an eye on your phone without picking it up.
A secure and comfortable holder, which makes holding your phone easier and more secure.
Features to enable easy mounting of your phone to accessories like desk chargers, car mounts etc.
Particularly for people with arthritis or mobility problems with their hands, Ezl provides a perfect solution for comfortable holding your phone.
It uses no metals or magnets, so does not interfere with wireless charging. It is thin enough to allow wireless charging through both most cases AND the Ezl.
What problems does it solve?
As a stand, it allows you to clearly see an incoming text, call or message WITHOUT interrupting your workflow, putting you in control of whether you interact or not.
On most phones, it also works in landscape mode, allowing you to watch a movie on your way home from work.
Even better, it makes holding your phone more secure and comfortable. Now that so many of us check our phones whilst walking, Ezl adds safety to prevent your phone being knocked or snatched from your hand.  This video says it all!
PLAY

Anything else?
Yes. Ezl has features so that it can easily be clipped to companion accessories (available soon) such as desk chargers and car mounts.
Ezl also has moulded rubber feet so your phone won't slip around on your desk, both when lying flat and standing up.
I'm also planning to put together a range of colours and designs to appeal to all tastes - I'd love to know what you'd like to see on your Ezl!

You may add more Ezls and Plinth tablet stands (myplinth.co.uk for info) to your pledge by adding £6 per Ezl and £11 per Plinth, plus £1 for additional postage. You can list and explain exactly what you'd like when I send out the surveys at the end of the campaign.
Designed on an iPad Pro!
I am really excited that Ezl is the first product I have designed from start to finish on my iPad Pro. Whilst I have been using apps like Procreate and Concepts for years to sketch and details designs, I have never had proper 3D CAD for engineering and detailing designs.
Now there's a new kid on the block - called Shapr3D, and it has changed the game. For those of you interested in design, take a look on Youtube where you'll find some awesome videos showing what Shapr3D can do. It's a joy to work with.
Where will Ezl be made?
I have chosen an extremely experienced and talented injection-mould toolmaker to build the tooling for Ezl. He will be doing the actual production too, ensuring that the entire process will be monitored and maintained under one roof.
His factory is based in a little unit hidden away in the Devon countryside, and which is completely powered by solar panels.


The Plinth Tablet stand
In 2014 I raised over £32,000 on Kickstarter to help get my idea for a universal, stable, pocket tablet stand into manufacture. 5 years later, and Plinth is still selling strongly, both on Amazon and my website (myplinth.co.uk).
 In 2016 plinth was featured on the BBC programme Dragons’ Den (called shark tank in the USA). The program has recently been released on the Dragons’ Den YouTube channel, and I attach a link to it here. 
Why crowdfunding?
Having lived with this design for over a year now, I am convinced that it genuinely makes life with our phones better - it’s not a gimmick or a gadget, it is a well designed, durable accessory to perform a serious job.
Unfortunately, I don’t have the capital to afford either the manufacturing tools, or expensive agencies to promote and advertise Ezl (see my 1st update for more on this topic). I’m therefore hoping to reach a crowd of people through kickstarter - if we all chip in a drop or two, we become an ocean.
I don’t have the resources or available time to commission marketing agencies.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although Ezl is a very simple product, it is actually quite a complex injection moulding, and poses quite a few technical challenges from a moulding point of view.

However, I have many years experience in product design, and am working with an absolute genius of a tool maker, so I'm confident that Ezl will, when finished, perform much better than the 3D printed prototypes I have been testing for months now.

Perhaps my biggest challenge is financial - now that Kickstarter has become the domain of sophisticated marketing agencies, all of whom charge fees which I can't afford (which is why I'm here on kickstarter!).

This makes getting seen a real challenge.

campaign.story:
Wolves of Mercia is a game of deception and strategy, set in the dark fantasy village of Mercia. But in this town, the villagers don't wait helplessly to be slaughtered by the werewolf. Each must deploy their unique abilities in order to fulfill their own hidden agenda! Whether torching the village, tracking the werewolf by night, or completing a fearful eldritch ritual, 5-16 players will lie, bluff, and kill to seize the night.
During the day, you pretend to be ordinary. Trading goods as a merchant, studying ancient lore as a scholar, or taking confession as a priest. But when night falls, you drop the facade and work toward your own secret agenda. Perhaps you are an initiate of a sinister cult, working with your fellows to usher untold destruction. Or perhaps you prefer the arsonist's insane fantasy of torching half the village...
Put plainly, Wolves of Mercia features:
A refreshing reinterpretation of the social deduction genre
A small footprint with a tight 30-45 minute run time
Unique, asymmetric win conditions for every player
No player elimination!
 For those who would like to read the rules for themselves, click here (PDF).
We originally planned Wolves of Mercia as a small boutique release. A lean and lightweight project between major releases. But then we took the game to Gen Con.
Situated in a game store just a block off the main Gen Con drag, we played dozens upon dozens of games of Wolves of Mercia with groups of five to sixteen eager players, and we felt something special brewing...
The game was infectious. So infectious that players wanted to run it back and immediately play another game. So infectious that players came back day after day to play again because they hadn't stopped thinking about it overnight. So infectious indeed that by the final day we had players from the first day running extra game tables for us!
After a wild couple days at Gen Con, what was going to be a small release for us was suddenly getting retailer attention. With the realization that we have something special on our hands, we're turning to Kickstarter to expose our game to a larger audience and raise funds for a larger print run.
What's great about this campaign is that Wolves of Mercia is in an advanced stage of development slated for a late October/early November release. We've prototyped, play tested, and have final assets in place for all components. There will be much less waiting than a typical Kickstarter. We'll need a few weeks for production, and a further few weeks for fulfillment, that's it!
Each set of of Wolves of Mercia contains:
A full deck of tarot-sized cards with hand-illustrated artwork
17 character roles, 18 secret roles, 4 phantoms, and special character action cards including eldritch cultist rituals
A hand-illustrated, small footprint gameboard with a premium light-diffusing linen finish
Hardy punchboard skill tokens and red wooden counters
A robust, story-rich 35-page instruction manual
As a bonus to all Kickstarter backers, every copy of Wolves of Mercia will ship with a small thank you note that includes a code to download the exclusive Print & Play Character The Emissary. A newcomer to Mercia, he's here to make some dirty deals on behalf of an unknown master.
Update: Every copy of Wolves of Mercia will ship with a professionally printed bonus character The Emissary--no more need to print it yourself!

campaign.story:
What is Ultra-Tiny Epic Galaxies?
A game of intergalactic conquest for 1-5 players... in a card box!
Ultra-Tiny Epic Galaxies (UTEG) is EVERYTHING Tiny Epic Galaxies (TEG) is... but much smaller, and it even includes the Satellites & Super Weapons Mini Expansion!! 
Ultra-Tiny Epic Galaxies also features 5 new Rogue Galaxies for Solo Play!
For those of you who have played Tiny Epic Galaxies, you'll be pleased to know that Ultra-Tiny Epic Galaxies plays the same way. It is the complete game, unabridged. 
For those who haven't played Tiny Epic Galaxies, here's a brief overview:
In Tiny Epic Galaxies, and therefore Ultra-Tiny Epic Galaxies, each player controls their very own galaxy! In the game, they will be developing their own empire by managing resources, expanding their fleet, colonizing planets, and exploiting their enemies' position. 
The game runs on a clever dice combo-ing mechanic; players roll for their actions and choose the order in which to take them. This can lead to big "pay-off" turns, especially when combo-ed with planet abilities!
Throughout the game, players spend resources to upgrade their empires, re-roll unwanted dice, and even follow the actions of other players' dice! The follow mechanic keeps all players engaged throughout the game for virtually zero down time.
Players will accumulate power (victory points) based on the level of their empire, as well as for successfully colonizing planets. When a player has reached a power of 21 or higher, the end of the game is triggered.
Find out more about Tiny Epic Galaxies on our website and join discussions about Ultra-Tiny Epic Galaxies HERE on BGG.   
Tiny Epic Galaxies was featured on TableTop Season 4 in a full playthrough with Wil Wheaton, Mayim Bialik, Andy Weir and Tim Schafer! It's a fantastic episode and a must see!
Learn to play the game by the magnificent Rodney Smith on Watch It Played!
You've seen how great the game looks, but now let us prove it to you!
Follow the links below to find a FREE Print & Play of Tiny Epic Galaxies and keep in mind that Ultra-Tiny Epic Galaxies will play the same way.
Note: the rule book is also a separate download.  
Click HERE for the Print 'N Play Games Files  
Click HERE for the Print 'N Play Rulebook 
NOTE: Additional pledge options will be available in PledgeManager after the project concludes. These options will include a single copy of Ultra-Tiny Epic Kingdoms, and 10 packs of either Ultra-Tiny Epic Galaxies or Ultra-Tiny Epic Kingdoms. Other Tiny Epic titles and accessories will also be available in PledgeManager.
Ultra-Tiny Epic Kingdoms is also a full game repackaging of its bigger sibling Tiny Epic Kingdoms. 
Tiny Epic Kingdoms is a Golden Geek award winning 4x game and the first entry in the Tiny Epic series. Check out the original Kickstarter project for UTEK HERE. 
In Ultra-Tiny Epic Kingdoms, you are a tiny kingdom with big ambitions. You want to expand your population throughout the realms, learn powerful magic, build grand towers, and have your neighbors quiver in fear at the mention of your name. The conflict? All of the other kingdoms want the same thing and there's not enough room for everyone to succeed...
Pick up a copy of Ultra-Tiny Epic Kingdoms either in the bundle pledge or after the project in the PledgeManager.
NOTE: Ultra-Tiny Epic Kingdoms plays 1-5 players. A 12 sided die (not included in the game) will be needed for solo play. You may also use this random number generator offered on our website instead of supplying a 12 sided die: UTEK Random Number Generator 
To keep shipping costs affordable, all rewards for this project will be shipped from the US. However, this campaign will be US-Customs Friendly, CA-Customs Friendly, UK-Customs Friendly, EU-Customs Friendly, AU-Customs Friendly, and NZ-Customs Friendly.
Therefore if you live in any of these regions and have any additional charges for receiving your package, simply email info@gamelyngames.com with a copy of your customs receipt and we will reimburse you via PayPal. A small PayPal fee will apply and will not be reimbursed. 
Shipping Costs 
Every backer is important to us, regardless of location, but the reality is that shipping is very expensive and is a cost we all need to share. To offset this, while remaining fiscally responsible, we have included a small discount for ALL shipping, but no shipping is free.

Bundle • USA = $7, CANADA = $10, EU = $10, Rest of World = $13
10 Pack Bundle = $15, CANADA = $25, EU = $25, Rest of World* = $35
*We experience high rates of delivery failure for South Africa, South and Central America, and Russia. A higher shipping fee is required for delivery to these locations.

Do you know what's sucks about a regular tube of toothpaste? They always have wasted past in them at the end of there lifespand. This is why we create Zippi a toothpaste squeezer. 
It allows you to quickly and easily squeeze out the remaining toothpaste from a nearly emptied tube. Combining a sleek design with unparalleled efficiency, Zippi will make a great addition to any bathroom and simplify every early morning routine.
A Stunning design:
Zippi Squeezer was designed with simplicity in mind. 

Colors:
Zippi will be available in a multitude of colors including Green, Blue, Red, and black.
We are proud to announce to you that Zippi is fully designed and manufactured in our shop, this enables us to have better quality control over our product line to ensure that the product we deliver to you will be top notch.
Also we have spent countless hours in our labs testing different types of materials and making sure that Zippi is durable, but most importantly we tested different materials to make Zippi Eco-Friendly, this means that our squeezer is fully biodegradable.
We have worked hard over the last few months with the manufacturing partners to make sure every element of the design is well understood before production will begin so that the production phase of Zippi will be fast and efficient. This will enable us to get Zippi to your door as soon as possible.
We believe in minimizing our impact on the environment. Our materials are sourced from a trusted supplier, and Zippi will be manufactured in our  shop . Even our packaging is made from recycled and recyclable cardboard that is provided from a reliable paper factory.
Also, the squeezer is not only limited to tooth past it can be used on other products like cream or pesto.
Dimensions:
Zippi was designed to fit around all the common toothpaste tubes. Over the course of its development, our team experimented by differing the size of the gap but concluded that 1.8  millimeters is the optimal space for Zippi to effortlessly push the remaining paste out of the tube. Couple this with its compact form factor and you'll never need to ask yourself if you should leave Zippi behind on those long hall trips.      
This is the Zippi family. You will be able to purchase Zippi in 4 different colors.

How it works:
Our simplistic design is easy to understand and to use. You simply slip our squeezer on any old tube of toothpaste and gently slide up while Zippi  does  all the work for you.
 Shipping:     
As you may have read in our reward descriptions, the shipping for Zippi is completely free Worldwide, this will enable us to get Zippi to your door fast and free of charge.

 We're expecting deliveries to start towards early August but we're working very hard to speed up the process and ship your Zippi as soon as possible to your doorstep. 
Packaging:
Zippi will be shipping in a small, sleek and eco-friendly packaging. This box will protect zippi during the shipping phase but also provide you with a sleek way to protect your zippi when it is not in use.
 We need your support;
The zippi prototype is already completed, we just need your support, to help us fund the first production round that will start right after the Kickstarter campaign ends. 

Thank you for supporting our project!

campaign.story:
Please help us grow the LastSwab community and reduce plastic in our oceans. Click on a button below and spread some love for the planet.
The tips of LastSwab also have the resilience to be cleaned thoroughly, enabling long-term use.    
LastSwab comes in several colors, so you can pick the one that fits you best. Standard LastSwab colors to the left and Make-up colors to the right:   
The different colors make it easy for you to organize your swabs in your home so they don’t get mixed up!  
1.5 billion cotton swabs are produced every single day and the average American uses 415 cotton swabs every year. In the UK damage is evident: For every 100 feet of beach there are 9 cotton swabs.  Let's make single-use cotton swabs a thing of the past! 


To create LastSwab, we tested dozens of prototypes – we wanted to get it just right. 
Both our two innovative designs feature a soft-feel tip made of medical silicone. It is delicate enough to be suitable for sensitive body parts, and so precise that it’ll become a make-up essential. 


Paper, wood and hemp cotton swabs are bad too. The CO2 emissions from the production and transport of these single use cotton swabs can be avoided with LastSwab.
Even the case for LastSwab is biodegradable, and the packaging it comes in is made of eco-friendly cardboard. The real game changer is that the swab is designed to last for thousands of uses – and we really hope the one you buy from us will be the LAST Swab.  

LastSwab comes with a carry case so it's convenient to store and take with you on the go.
We have been through hundreds of iterations in order to find the right feel and look for LastSwab - and we're pretty sure we’ve nailed it. 
The Swab is made up of a stiff, compact nylon core with soft medical silicone on each end, and is both aesthetically pleasant and functional.

Change your habits for the good of the planet in a fuss-free way. Buy LastSwab once, cross cotton swabs off your shopping list forever, and do your bit for the environment. Easy.    
We're a small team dedicated to creating sustainable alternatives to everyday products. About one and a half years ago we read that 550 billion cotton swabs are produced every year, many of which are polluting, spoiling and killing our oceans and beaches, this is why we created LastSwab.
Kåre Frandsen is trained as a cabinetmaker. He is our hands on, built-a-set-in-a-day, i-can-use-all-tools, cleaning expert, never negative, real prototype and photo expert designer.
Nicolas Aagaard has created industrial design for a number of years. He is our the-big-picture, this-can-be-scaled, rendering expert, excel and business shark designer.
Isabel Aagaard has a background in designing medical equipment. She is our safety-and-quality-first, GIF fanatic, cafe brewing, scissor cutout, eco collaborative designer.   
We have wanted to launch this product for a long time, but we had to get it just right. What you see now is the result of a lot of trial and error - leading up to today’s finished LastSwab. 



Please help us grow the LastSwab community and reduce plastic in our oceans. Click on the button below and tag a friend, family or anyone else who cares about our planet! There Is No Planet B

campaign.story:
Designed using a custom blending algorithm, The Really Useful CMYK Colour Chart displays 1025 colour swatches and their 4-colour breakdowns, on 1 convenient poster. 
Designers know that traditional swatch books can be expensive. But The Really Useful CMYK Colour Chart is a low-cost alternative, giving you access to over 1000 vibrant colours you can use in your artwork - as well as something that looks great in your studio! 
Even if you’re not a Designer, The Really Useful CMYK Colour Chart is a great way to add a thousand splashes of colour to your wall! And we ship anywhere in the world, with free shipping options available, making it a great gift for you, or someone you love.
Design by numbers
When we first started designing the poster, we were choosing colours by eye. This was not only a long process, but once we’d almost finished the poster - we decided we just weren’t happy with it!
We knew we needed a different approach that would give us the 1025 beautiful and unique colour swatches we wanted, but that also displayed them in a uniform and attractive way. So we turned to Mathematics… 
Working with a very clever Engineer we developed an Excel program that can accept any 4-colour value, in one of 9 points on a grid (as shown above), and the program will interpolate between those values in the correct way. Every number needed to be a whole, positive number between 0 and 100. The Excel program also needed to check for duplicates (ensuring every one of the one thousand colours was unique), and export the results in a number of formats. 
Whilst the Mathematics behind the program was a little over our head, we loved the results! Once we had a pattern we were happy with, we employed someone else to write a custom InDesign script that would import the spreadsheet of values output by the Excel program, and change the colour of the 1025 squares on the grid accordingly. Both elements were a HUGE time-saver, and proof that there is more than one way to solve a problem!
Formats
The poster is available in a range of formats to suit different budgets and applications. We’ve got you (and your wall) covered.
Digital - Downloadable, printable PDF version of the poster. This will be sent out immediately after the campaign is over.
Folded - A1 size poster. Printed on 170gsm gloss paper. Folded down to A4 for easy shipping - which is how we can offer FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE. Comes with a FREE Digital copy of the poster as soon as the campaign is over.
Rolled - A1 size poster. Printed on 250gsm gloss paper. Comes rolled in a cardboard tube. This means there are no creases in your poster, but it does cost extra to ship. Comes with a FREE Digital copy of the poster as soon as the campaign is over.

Funding & Rewards
Funding
We've developed the product, designed the brand, built the website and produced the video. Now, all we need is the money to fund our first print-run, so we can get The Really Useful CMYK Colour Chart off the ground and into the hands of those who want it.
Rewards
We are offering ‘Digital’, ‘Folded’ and ‘Rolled’ versions of the poster as rewards.
Download links to the Digital version of the poster will be sent out as soon as you have given us your email address (by filling in your Backer Survey).
Assuming you fill in your Backer Survey in time, we will endeavour to ship your physical poster within 3 weeks of the campaign ending. 
Conclusion
This poster was designed out of a genuine need for an alternative to expensive swatch books. We are really happy with the end product, and genuinely believe it will help many people produce better artwork, as well as brighten up their studio! We love that thought, we love this product and we love our business. We hope you do too.
Packaging
Depending on which version of the poster you buy, it will be shipped in different packaging.
Folded - These A1 posters are folded down to A4 size (the same size as a sheet of office paper) and placed inside a mailing envelope. This means the overall package is very small and light, and therefore much cheaper to ship than the ‘Rolled’ version (which is how we can offer FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE).
Rolled - This version is the same size as the Folded version (A1), but it comes rolled rather than folded (meaning they arrive with you crease-free). They are shipped inside an A1-sized cardboard mailing-tube, which means they are more expensive to ship than the Folded version (which is why we charge extra for shipping).
Carriers & Transit Times
All versions (apart from Folded posters shipping to the UK) are sent via tracked and signed services, meaning you'll receive a tracking number for your order once it has been dispatched, and you'll be required to sign for the package once it reaches you.

Don't see what you need? If you’d like to purchase a copy of the KS Edition of the base game or the Thieves expansion only, head to playmonster.com where we have a few remaining copies from the second print run available while supplies last. These will ship immediately upon purchase.
The Island of El Dorado - Legend Edition includes every single upgrade that we could think of right from the start. We've pulled absolutely no punches and maxed out our components in every way possible, matching the quality of our previous campaigns from day one rather than using stretch goals to get back to where we’ve already been. Still, we’re always open to improvement and will consider every stretch goal idea you all post in the comments which doesn’t shatter our timeline or budget. Honestly, this is the version of the game we'll be personally using and we want it to be flippin' awesome. Let’s work together to make this thing absolutely insane.
*Update*: We've heard some great ideas in the comment section already! Here is our list of backer-idea stretch goals! You can help improving the game by sharing this project with your family and friends! Click here to share on Facebook.
The Island of El Dorado is defined by the beautiful artwork which makes up its tiles, resources, and characters. Each gameplay element brings a new life and a new application to these 16th century masterpieces which were created by some of the most iconic and gifted painters in the history of visual art. Graciously opened to the public domain by the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City, we consider it an honor and a privilege to apply these works of indescribable beauty, mystery, and majesty to the narrative of The Island of El Dorado.
This is the ONLY time The Island of El Dorado Legend Edition will be available. While the base game, Thieves expansion, and a small box version of the Revenge expansion will be available in retail going forward, the only time you’ll be able to secure a copy of the Legend Edition big box, game organizer trays, and the kickstarter exclusives from this and previous campaigns is RIGHT HERE, RIGHT NOW.
We want you on this journey with us. The feedback we received before, during, and after the first two campaigns from our families, friends, and backers is a huge part of what made the El Dorado universe what it is. We want to hear your ideas, see your islands, and know both the things you love and the areas you think we could improve. Now more than ever, we need your feedback to make the Legend Edition big box the coolest thing any of us have ever seen.
El Dorado Games started with three friends just trying to make a game we could play together at game night. With the success of the first and second Kickstarters and overwhelming positive reviews, our new goal is to bring all the fun and excitement we’ve had to friend groups around the world. We’re thankful for every single one of you and we’re excited you’re on this rollercoaster with us!
We initially created The Island of El Dorado to be a strategy game that we could play with our friends and family who don’t like strategy games. It was designed to be a tool to bring new people into the hobby; to be the kind of game you could play against your grandma (and she could beat you!). As the game and the community surrounding El Dorado grew, however, we’ve incorporated new rule sets and modes of play that allow you to tailor the gaming experience to the preferences of your group; everything from a casual dice-chucking story to an asymmetric brain-burning strategy showdown!
Casual Mode - For casual gamers. Thoughtfully incorporated elements of luck keep things balanced to the very end and allow players who may fall behind from inexperienced decision making to catch up - and win!
Hardcore Mode - For strategy veterans. Every action takes thought and could have lasting consequences as elements of luck are significantly reduced or removed altogether. It’s you against them. May the best player win!

campaign.story:
108 Qwarks and 1 box to hold them all.
QWARKS WANTED is a wacky, fast-paced, easy-to-understand and easy-to-play party game. You play a Qwark Hunter who will have to catch the most wanted specimens according to imposed criteria that change each turn. The more criteria you have on your card, the more points you will score. Be observant to spot the best cards and be quick to hit them with your hand before your opponents. Oh, and be careful not to catch any forbidden Qwarks.
Qwark hunter is not an easy job but YOU are the best! :) 
There is only one card which worth 3 points on this illustration. Have you seen it?
Board Game heaven
Unfiltered gamer
Board's Eye View
The Boardgame Society
Mister Zombi
Le carnet des Geekeries
Geek Test
Would you like to have your own Qwark in the game with your name on a card? Try your luck then! See Stretch Goals section below for more details.
There you go, you know how to play. Go through the rounds, be the first to score 10 points and you're done! QWARKS WANTED it's 15 minutes of fun to renew as much as you want.
In addition to the game QWARKS WANTED, you will find in the box a rule to play QWARKS WANTED JUNIOR which is a different game for children from 6 years old (but also for the older ones). To play it, you will only use Qwark cards and Score tokens.
Simply deal each player the same number of Qwark cards face down, keep the Score tokens within range and the hunt can begin!
At the end of the game, the player with the highest score is the winner. It's easy to play, dynamic and fun for the children and their parents (who have no chance against these formidable junior hunters ^_^).
Check out the following video or download the game rules below to learn more about how the game is played: 
Clic on the picture to download the rules of the game (English & French).
Clic on the picture to read the full review.

Cliquez sur l'image pour lire la revue complète.
Cliquez sur l'image pour lire la revue complète.

QWARKS was my first game successfully funded on the Kickstarter platform in 2017. These funny little particles created by Henri Kerrmarec pleased me so much (and at the backers too) that I decided to thematize my second party game with the same wacky theme.
There are common points between the 2 games such as the format of the box and the cards. As well as, in both cases, the objective is to score the most points by flattening Qwarks (don't worry, they love it ^_^) but similarities end there. 
QWARKS WANTED is a totally independent game and really different from its big brother. It is not played in the same way because it requires a good sense of observation and less haste from you. Nevertheless, I can always guarantee you frenetic moments. Furthermore, QWARKS WANTED can be played in 2 totally different ways to satisfy both adult gamers and very young players from 6 years old.
 Welcome to the world of Qwarks if you are a new backer or welcome back to the world of Qwarks for my backers of the first campaign. :)
QWARKS WANTED is more than just a speed game. It's also a game of concentration and memory that requires steel nerves not to act too fast.
This game definitively won't exist without your support because, as a one-person company, I can't publish it with just my personal funds. My first game, QWARKS, has been published thanks to the support of 457 awesome backers who trusted me. The game is a critical success and is sold in several French shops. 
For this new game, I hope to do even better and succeed in establishing myself in as many French and International stores as possible. To achieve this, I count on your support because the more successful the campaign is, the more likely I will be able to establish myself as a serious publisher with the shops. 
In return, I promise you an irreproachable quality of components (rigid box, poker cards with a linen finish,  3mm thick tokens) and at a reduced price (€13 / $15 instead of €15 / $17 MSRP). Furthermore, every backer will receive 2 new Kickstarter exclusive Qwarks cards and each new unlocked Qwark will be exclusive to this campaign too.
You may also have the opportunity to see your own Qwark integrated into the game with your full name or nickname on a card. The more stretch goals you unlock, the more new cards I will add in the box and the more chance you will have to see your creation into the game. Don't miss this opportunity and help me unlock all the stretch goals by supporting me and spreading the word.
All of this is my way of thanking you for your support, which I hope will allow me to finance this game and why not other games in the future. Once again, thank you very much. YOU are the best! :)
How about imagining and drawing your own Qwark and then seeing it in the game alongside all the other Qwarks? Like the idea? That's precisely what I propose you to unlock as a Kickstarter exclusive stretch goal.  
You can send me as many illustrations as you want by email (just draw on a sheet of paper for example, then scan it). I will regularly publish the creations received during the campaign.
Mail: editions.smile@gmail.com
Then, when the Kickstarter campaign is over, I will draw one or more lucky ones at random (depending on the number of stretch goals unlocked) who will have one of their drawings immortalized in the game.
Download the conditions of participation here.

You will receive 4 boxes of QWARKS WANTED Kickstarter exclusive edition + 4 x all unlocked stretch goals.  Hunting Qwarks in a group is so much more fun! :)

campaign.story:
Nothing…and I mean nothing is as frustrating as watching the freshly-cleaned vegetables and fruits you just rinsed fall into the sink AFTER you’ve rinsed them. Even worse, if you don’t have a good grip on your items, they can ALL fall back into the sink – taking your sanity with them.
The Equilibric colander reduces the amount of water needed to wash your fruits and vegetables by 60% - all while removing twice as many contaminants! You will never have to worry about items in the sink again because this design saves you time and frustration.
Its ergonomic design keeps the vegetables upright and safe as the water bowl drains the dirty water away, cleaning your foods and keeping your clean items safe from spillage.

The colander also serves as a great serving dish for you.  You don’t have to worry about using more dishes than necessary just because you need something to put them in afterwards.  Drain the excess water from your vegetables - and serve your fruits or salads in the same dish.
Trying to defrost something at room temperature turns into a huge problem for most cooks.  Water often winds up all over the counter creating an even bigger mess, and more work for you.
With typical colanders, lots of dirt and other contaminates can transfer to your clean serving dishes.  But with the Equilibric colander, its washing machine motion helps remove 90% of the dirt and bacteria from your foods – giving you a healthier, more nutrient rich meal!
As you can see, the Equilibric colander saves you time and energy.  It’s also incredibly efficient, sanitary, and environmentally conscious.  Moreover it saves extra money on your water bill.
Equilibric has a very well considered hole slots pattern that allows to drain the excess water fast and simple. Equilibric Bowl is made from a high quality polypropylene which is an unharmful material to dine from. Equilibric Bowl design has a special spin system which uses the force of gravity to speed up all kitchen tasks.





Story. Team. Development. Future.
My name is Ann and I’ve been working in design for eight years. I’ve graduated twice and worked my way from the position of a common designer to art director. My husband Tim is an engineer and likes inventing. Together we’ve come up with Equilibric.
Me and Tim were born in the countryside, and despite growing up in an urban area, we always preferred home food over fast food l, which bears no benefit or proper nutrients, often being harmful. So we cook home a lot and try to ease doing so process as much as possible.
Four years ago I had the idea to improve the typical colander design, after having bought all kinds of them in stores, inspired by design of various items and inventions, from spoons to airplanes. So I took a pencil and got to draw.

Thanks to Tim, my sketches and concepts came to life as working prototypes.


The most problematic part was talking to various China-based factories. We were sending the design and info over, but struggled with communication problems. But ultimately, we found a manufacturer and a manager that helped us on this stage after it had stretched on for a while.
Two years ago, Sabina joined us as a co-founder, responsible for communications and marketing. Without her, we wouldn’t have been able to make it to Kickstarter and organize everything.
We’re really grateful to Inpixel, the company that took care of the video material for us, delivering calmly great results despite my quite extensive list of requests.
Our future plans is to introduce a brand new type of colander for enthusiasts and kitchen professionals. I promise, you haven’t seen anything like it before, and we’ll be showcasing it on Kickstarter right from the concept stage! We’re also creating a USB-powered heating food container, which might possible have its own battery.
Our global goal is to create a brand of smart kitchen gadgets and food containers (both with and without heating) for carrying your dishes.
Please help us bring our plans to life, and become part of Equilibric!

campaign.story:
Welcome to Arzium,
land of ancient civilizations, bizarre creatures, unexplained wonders, and vibrant characters. A great sleeping sickness has spread across the land, sending every type of creature to wander for hundreds of miles in a dazed, incoherent march. It’s your job to seek them out and wake them from their sleep, recruiting them to help you find even more lost souls! 
Arzium is the setting of other games including Above and Below, Near and Far, Islebound, and City of Iron.
We will send a survey to the email associated with your Kickstarter account using the CrowdOx pledge manager system. You will be able to choose add-ons and provide your shipping information at that time. If you change addresses before we ship your rewards, you will be able to access your survey at this link (after we have launched the pledge manager): https://app.crowdox.com/retrieve/953146955/roam-0  
Search the land of Arzium and rescue lost adventurers
Use adventurers in your party to search in unique patterns.
Claim land cards and add rescued adventurers to your growing party.
Spend coins to purchase artifacts that grant unique abilities.
2-4 Players, 30-45 Min
Ages 8+
In Roam, you and up to three friends compete to find lost adventurers. Tarot-sized adventurer cards include characters from Near and Far, Above and Below, City of Iron, and Islebound. The opposite side of each card depicts a landscape split into six squares, and two rows of three of these cards are placed in the center of the playing area to make the board.
Each turn, you may activate one of the adventurer cards in your party by flipping the card face down. Activating an adventurer allows you to place search tokens on the board in the shape depicted on your adventurer card. When every square on a landscape card has been searched, the player who did the most claims the card, finding the lost adventurer and adding them to their party. Each adventurer you add to your party gives you points and a new search pattern that you can use.
When searching, you also claim coins, which can be spent to use special actions or purchase artifacts with useful powers. When one player has ten adventurers in their party, the game ends, and the player with the most points wins.
Read the full rule book here. (This rule book is not final.)
What special bonus do you get if you back?
If you back for a copy of the game, you'll also receive a special Animals promo pack with 5 additional cards!
 What are people saying about Roam?
-Rahdo Runs Through

"I’m very enthusiastic about Roam, so, I’d recommend it. If you enjoy that kind of spatial area-control or you like deckbuilding-esque games, I’ve really enjoyed this one..."
-What's Eric Playing

"We really enjoyed it. It's more than beautiful -- which of course it is -- it's very charming (we loved the flavor text for finding each wanderer) and it's the smoothest engine-builder imaginable." 
-Alf Seegert 

"Roam goes beyond a traditional area control game by adding the unique perspective layer. Having to not only anticipate and plan for an opponent’s next move, but to do so from a completely different perspective, is a nice twist on a pretty simple concept. Plus, finding and saving familiar characters from their bizarre behavior is an enjoyable, thematic element that brings Arzium to life!” 
-Spencer Williams
Each of these add-ons will be available separately in the pledge manager after the campaign funding period ends.
What are people saying about Haven?
"It’s about the joy of peeling back layers of mastery and discovering that there’s more beneath the skin than first met the eye.
It is, in other words, Alf Seegert at his absolute best."
-Dan Turot, SPACE-BIFF!
Read the full review!

"If you are on the lookout for a great 2-player game, this is definitely one to consider and is among the best games released in 2018."
-David Wiley, Cardboard Clash

Stretch goals complete!

Estimated shipping costs are for the base game only. Combo-packs and add-ons will increase the cost of shipping, usually by a few dollars.

Retail Version: The standard retail version of Roam will have an MSRP of $29.99. It will not include the Animals promo pack.
